Builds community-driven programs connecting scientists and early founders (Boom’s Collectives, Curiosity Camp) and serves on the Goldhirsh Foundation investment committee and other advisory roles.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage deeptech (biotech/synthetic biology, genomics, machine intelligence) and aerospace; founder-first academic spinouts

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and operator with experience in urban tech and education ventures. Former Senior Associate at Urban Innovation Fund and Director at Tumml; has held leadership roles at High Resolves and is founder of Human Leadership Lab. Background includes corporate law and public policy (Harvard Kennedy School).
enrichment.career_background: May Samali trained as a corporate lawyer in Sydney and earned an MPP from Harvard. She served as Director at Tumml, was an early member of the Urban Innovation Fund team (Senior Associate), and later held operator roles at High Resolves (COO/CEO, Ventures). She is the founder of Human Leadership Lab and has served as a venture partner/advisor to network VC firms.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed investments in urban-focused sectors: transportation, energy & sustainability, proptech, govtech, edtech, fintech, public safety

enrichment.personal_bio: David Aronoff is Chairman and Managing Partner at MCJ and was a General Partner at Flybridge Capital Partners (joined 2005). He focuses on infrastructure, semiconductors, SaaS, IoT and cybersecurity and has served on multiple company boards. He holds a BS (University of Vermont), an MS (USC) and an MBA (Harvard Business School).
enrichment.career_background: Nearly three decades in technology investing and operations: early technical roles at Bell Labs and Chipcom; co‑founder/COO of HappyPuppy/Attitude Network; nearly a decade at Greylock Partners in early‑stage investing; General Partner at Flybridge Capital Partners (joined 2005); now Chairman & Managing Partner at MCJ, and board member/advisor to multiple technology companies and institutions.
enrichment.investment_focus: Semiconductors, infrastructure & cloud, developer platforms, SaaS, IoT and cybersecurity (now also climate tech via MCJ)

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture partner associated with XSeed Capital and an early-stage investor focused on cloud computing, enterprise software and mobile. Formerly led operations and business development for Yahoo’s Cloud Group and helped facilitate the spin-off that became Hortonworks. Mentor at UC Berkeley SkyDeck and holds a BS from the University of Kansas and MBAs from Columbia and UC Berkeley.
enrichment.career_background: Held leadership roles at Yahoo (led operations and business development for its Cloud Group and helped with the Hadoop/Hortonworks spin-off), was an investment banker in TMT at Thomas Weisel Partners, co‑founded the startup Actively, and has served as a mentor/advisor at UC Berkeley SkyDeck and other accelerators. Has worked as a venture partner at XSeed Capital and is involved with Crux/Crux Capital in venture roles.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage / early-stage investments in cloud computing, enterprise SaaS, mobile, and big data/analytics.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Subtraction Capital who focuses on early-stage enterprise/B2B software. Former aerodynamics engineer at Boeing and later product/marketing executive at companies including NextCard, Coupons.com, Practice Fusion and Atlassian. Mentors product, engineering and marketing teams and invests in companies he would want to work for.
enrichment.career_background: Paul trained as an aerospace engineer (BS, Iowa State) and worked as an aerodynamics engineer at Boeing before moving into product and marketing leadership roles (NextCard, Coupons.com, Practice Fusion, Atlassian). He co-founded/served as partner at Subtraction Capital (founded 2013), investing in early-stage enterprise software and advising portfolio companies; holds an MS in Manufacturing Systems Engineering from Stanford.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) enterprise/B2B software with emphasis on healthtech, fintech, data/analytics/AI, marketing & sales modernization; occasional deep-tech (aerospace/robotics).

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at SOSV who founded SOSV’s life‑sciences practice in Europe (IndieBio/RebelBio). Co‑founder of CoderDojo and WeForest, former early investor/co‑founder at XING, and a public speaker on tech and sustainability. Serves in diplomatic and nonprofit roles, including as a special diplomatic envoy for St Kitts and Nevis and Chair of the SENS Research Foundation.
enrichment.career_background: Entrepreneur, investor and philanthropist. Early career included COO at Davnet and early involvement with XING; later co‑founded CoderDojo and WeForest. At SOSV since 2011, he founded the firm’s European life‑sciences accelerator (RebelBio/IndieBio EU) and leads sourcing for SOSV’s Ireland fund; he also holds board/advisory roles (e.g., SENS Research Foundation).
enrichment.investment_focus: Life sciences / synthetic biology, healthtech & longevity, climate/planetary health, deep tech (hardware/quantum software), early‑stage seed / pre‑seed investments

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at OCA Ventures focused on early-stage technology investments across enterprise software, deep tech and fintech. Sits on or has served as an observer/board member for multiple portfolio companies. Prior roles include investment banking at BMO Capital Markets, tax advisory at KPMG, and product/finance lead at FreeBeePay; he was also on the founding team of Stir, Inc.
enrichment.career_background: Over a decade in finance, entrepreneurship and venture capital. Before OCA Ventures he worked as an investment banking analyst at BMO Capital Markets and as a tax advisory associate at KPMG, served as product/finance lead at FreeBeePay, and was a founder on Stir, Inc. At OCA he has led and supported seed through Series A/B investments and held board or observer roles at several portfolio companies. He holds a BS in Finance & Accounting from Purdue University and has pursued graduate study in computer science at DePaul University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed - Series A/B; sectors: enterprise software, consumer software, fintech, digital health, deep tech

enrichment.personal_bio: Design leader and operator who co-founded Ligature (a design‑centric early‑stage fund). Previously led product and design teams at Instagram, Airbnb, Square and Strava; currently holds a senior design role at Google. Invests and advises early-stage, design‑led startups.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and General Partner at Ligature (design‑focused VC). Built and scaled product/design teams at Square, Strava, Airbnb and Instagram; later served as Head of Design roles at Pulley and (as of 2024) at Google working on Workspace monetization. Educated at the University of Cincinnati (BS).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed, Seed and Series A; emphasis on financial infrastructure, software and frontier technologies (design‑led product focus).

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at AME Cloud Ventures and founder of Quill Meetings. MEng from Imperial College London. Spent several years building businesses and leading BD in China and India before joining AME in 2012.
enrichment.career_background: Joined AME Cloud Ventures in 2012, served as Managing Director and later as Venture Partner managing early‑stage investments; previously led international business development at Cloud Valley and founded startups (EnTrip, Evoleas) while working in China and India. Holds an MEng from Imperial College London and is the founder of Quill Meetings.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed to later-stage startups building infrastructure and value chains around data — cloud, data infrastructure, AI/ML and software-defined infrastructure.

enrichment.personal_bio: Product designer, technologist, and investor best known for proposing the hashtag. General Partner at Ride Home Fund, investing in applications of generative AI. Previously held product and developer-experience roles at Google and Uber; based in Oakland, California.
enrichment.career_background: Chris Messina is a product designer and operator who has worked on developer platforms and product teams at Google and Uber, co-founded startups (including a YC-backed conversational AI company), and served in product leadership and community roles (e.g., Republic, On Deck). He now invests through the Ride Home AI Fund, focusing on early-stage, product-led AI opportunities.
enrichment.investment_focus: Generative AI; pre-seed to Series A; product-led software startups

enrichment.personal_bio: Samuel Harrison is a co‑founder of Blockchain.com Ventures and an early‑stage crypto investor. He has led blockchain investments at Blockchain.com Ventures and later co‑founded Faction (Lightspeed Faction) where he serves as a managing partner. Previously he led early‑stage investments at Naspers/Prosus and began his career in finance at Morgan Stanley.
enrichment.career_background: Started in finance (Morgan Stanley), joined Naspers/Prosus where he led early‑stage investments (2014–2018), co‑founded Blockchain.com Ventures in 2018 and served as a managing/venture partner there, and later co‑founded/became Managing Partner at Faction / Lightspeed Faction while remaining affiliated with Blockchain.com Ventures.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage blockchain & crypto (Seed–Series A); token and equity investments across DeFi, infrastructure, developer tooling, and NFTs/gaming.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and CEO of HoneyBook (founded 2013). Acts as an NFX Scout/angel investor, participating in pre‑seed and seed deals. Publicly recorded investments include Salsa and CapitalOS.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded HoneyBook in 2013 and serves as CEO. Prior roles include owner of Backy‑Bar Ltd and an internship at Yehuda Raveh & Co. Educated at Reichman University (IDC Herzliya).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed‑stage startups (scout/angel activity); focus areas include marketplaces, SaaS, consumer internet and FinTech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director of Silicon Valley Connect and an active angel investor/advisor to startups. Former Vice President of Corporate Development & Strategy and VP of Strategic Initiatives at LinkedIn. Serves on corporate boards (e.g., Walker & Dunlop, RallyPoint) and is Senior Advisor to the President at Arizona State University.
enrichment.career_background: Founder and Managing Director of Silicon Valley Connect (since ~2007), managing a portfolio of startups and advising organizations on networked innovation. Previously held senior roles at LinkedIn (VP Corporate Development & Strategy; VP Strategic Initiatives) and has experience in venture firms (SoftBank, NeoCarta), startups, think tanks and universities; currently holds multiple board and advisory positions.
enrichment.investment_focus: Angel / seed investments in enterprise SaaS, education technology, future-of-work solutions, and networked innovation initiatives

enrichment.personal_bio: Guillaume "G" Cabane is a growth advisor, angel investor, and co‑founder/general partner at HyperGrowth Partners. He previously served as VP of Growth at Segment, Drift, and Gorgias and advises numerous B2B SaaS and data startups. He also operates as a scout/angel affiliated with Sequoia Capital.
enrichment.career_background: Experienced growth operator and advisor: early career included ~6 years at Apple; later held VP Growth roles at Segment, Drift, and Gorgias; co‑founded HyperGrowth Partners to advise and invest in high‑growth B2B startups; active angel investor and Sequoia scout focusing on seed/early rounds and GTM scaling.
enrichment.investment_focus: B2B SaaS; growth & go-to-market; seed and early-stage investments; data/AI; fintech

enrichment.personal_bio: John Richards is the founder and managing partner of Startup Ignition Ventures and an active angel investor and mentor based in Provo, Utah. He co-founded BoomStartup, taught entrepreneurship at Brigham Young University, and previously held senior roles related to InfoSpace and Google Fiber in Utah.
enrichment.career_background: John Richards built an early career in publishing and online directories that led to executive roles during the InfoSpace era, later serving as an associate professor of entrepreneurship at BYU and managing partner of UtahAngels. He co‑founded BoomStartup, worked on Google Fiber operations in Provo, and launched Startup Ignition (and Startup Ignition Ventures) to run entrepreneur bootcamps and make pre‑seed investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage investments in SaaS, B2B and vertical-industry software, with interest in consumer and mobile software and early-stage enterprise tools.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner and co‑founder at Unovis Asset Management, leading the firm’s activities in North America and Israel. Investor focused on alternative proteins and food‑system innovation with prior experience founding a CPG brand and working across logistics, culinary operations and creative services. Holds a BA from Universidad Iberoamericana and an MBA from Babson College.
enrichment.career_background: 25+ years across the food value chain: corporate banking and logistics roles; founded Bodhi Natural Snacks (CPG); ran a restaurant and a creative agency; later served as a venture partner at New Crop Capital before co‑founding and serving as Managing Partner at Unovis Asset Management. Serves on/has served as director or board advisor for several portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage investments in alternative proteins (plant‑based, fermentation, cultivated), foodtech and consumer food & beverage (seed to Series A)

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner and GM / co‑founder of Angel Squad at Hustle Fund. Former operator (early roles at Lyft, Zoox, BlackBird) who now builds angel syndicates and runs investor education programs. Focuses on pre‑seed and seed investing, particularly marketplaces and consumer tech.
enrichment.career_background: Brian Nichols is co‑founder and GM of Hustle Fund's Angel Squad (started 2020). He previously co‑founded RewardTag and held early/operator roles at Lyft (market operations), Zoox, and BlackBird. He founded and scaled the Lyft syndicate (UpLyft) and ran the On Deck Angels program before joining Hustle Fund to build Angel Squad and lead syndicate/SPV investments alongside the fund.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed stage startups; marketplaces and consumer tech; building/teaching angel syndicates and SPV investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at Lanta Digital Ventures based in Barcelona. Early-stage investor focused on technology startups (AI, SaaS, mobile, data/IoT, healthtech). Former CFO at Fractus and founding partner of Startupbootcamp IoT & Data; active as advisor and board member in multiple portfolio companies.
enrichment.career_background: Founder and Founding Partner of Lanta Digital Ventures (Barcelona); previously CFO at Fractus and a founding partner at Startupbootcamp (IoT & Data). Serves as investor, advisor and board member for several early-stage technology companies across Europe and the US.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed) investments in internet & mobile, AI / machine learning, SaaS and enterprise software, data analytics, IoT and healthtech (primarily Spanish and European startups)

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Pantera Capital, focused on the firm’s venture and token investments in blockchain and digital assets. Joined Pantera in 2014 and has led or supported 100+ crypto-related investments and firm research/public commentary. Holds a BA from the University of California, Berkeley.
enrichment.career_background: Paul Veradittakit is a Managing Partner at Pantera Capital (since 2014), where he focuses on venture and token investments across the crypto ecosystem. Prior to Pantera he was an associate at Strive Capital and earlier worked in consulting and research roles (Hatch Consulting, LECG). He serves or has served as a board member/advisor to multiple crypto companies and mentors several accelerator programs.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early to growth-stage venture and token investments in blockchain, cryptocurrencies, DeFi, crypto infrastructure, and tokenized real-world assets

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Flybridge Capital Partners and co‑founder of XFactor Ventures. Former founder/CEO of Fashion Project and Dough; invests in consumer, marketplaces and commerce‑driven businesses. Based in Boston, MA.
enrichment.career_background: Anna Palmer is a two‑time founder turned investor. She co‑founded XFactor Ventures (a seed fund backing women founders) and served as co‑founder/CEO of Fashion Project and Dough. She joined Flybridge as General Partner in 2020, serves on several startup boards (e.g., Intramotev, MelodyArc, Returnalyze), and holds a B.A. from Eureka College and a J.D. from Harvard Law School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) consumer, commerce 3.0, marketplaces, community‑driven businesses; supports female and gender‑diverse founding teams.

enrichment.personal_bio: Reid Hoffman is an entrepreneur, investor, author, and podcaster. He co-founded LinkedIn, served as an early executive at PayPal, and joined Greylock as a partner in 2009. He co-founded AI companies including Inflection AI and Manas AI and has served on multiple public and private boards.
enrichment.career_background: Hoffman was an early PayPal executive and co‑founded LinkedIn in 2003. After years as a prolific angel investor, he joined Greylock in 2009 focusing on early‑stage companies with network effects. He has co‑founded AI startups (Inflection AI, Manas AI), authored several business/AI books, hosts the Masters of Scale podcast, and serves on boards including Microsoft and Aurora.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage consumer and enterprise software; network‑effect businesses; AI and transportation/automation

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑Founder and General Partner at VU Venture Partners and Co‑Founder & CEO of Venture University. Former Managing Director of Investments at Cleveland Avenue and Founder/Managing Director of Simon Venture Group. Adjunct professor at NYU; ranked on industry VC powerlists.
interests: Food & beverage brands and F&B tech
enrichment.career_background: 15+ years in venture capital and private equity, including founding and leading Simon Venture Group (Simon Property Group’s corporate VC) and serving as Managing Director of Investments at Cleveland Avenue. Co‑founded VU Venture Partners and Venture University, and has served as an adjunct professor teaching venture capital.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer, Enterprise, FinTech/Blockchain, Healthcare, Frontier Tech, PropTech; early and growth-stage (seed to venture) investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at P10x Ventures and co-founder & CEO of Salestable (SalesTable). Former Director of Product Management at Oracle with >15 years in enterprise SaaS and product-led startups. Based in the San Ramon / San Francisco Bay Area and active as an angel investor and accelerator mentor.
enrichment.career_background: Product leader turned founder and investor. Held senior product roles including Director of Product Management at Oracle (until ~2022), co‑founded Product10x accelerator and Salestable (SalesTable), and serves as Managing Partner at P10x Ventures (investing at pre-seed/seed). Active mentor in accelerator programs (e.g., Techstars) and operator-investor in early-stage SaaS and AI startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Jonah Midanik is Managing Partner / COO at Forum Ventures and co‑founder of Forum’s AI Studio. A serial entrepreneur by background, he founded Limelight and Immersion and now leads Forum’s pre‑seed accelerator and AI venture‑building efforts. He is based in Toronto, Canada.
interests: Applied / agentic AI and venture building
enrichment.career_background: Electrical engineer (B.Eng., Western University). Founded Immersion Media and later Limelight Platform; served in marketing and operational roles at several startups. Joined Forum Ventures in 2018 as COO/General Partner and now runs Forum’s AI Studio and pre‑seed/accelerator programs; serves as advisor/board observer for multiple portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed & seed B2B SaaS; applied/agentic AI (venture studio); accelerator-backed GTM and early scaling support

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at True Wealth Ventures, focused on early-stage, women-led companies that improve human and/or environmental health. Former CEO of DreamIt (startup accelerator) and founder of Holiday Golightly; serves as an NSF I‑Corps instructor and startup mentor. Holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and a BA in Biology from Duke University. citeturn0search0turn6search12
enrichment.career_background: General Partner at True Wealth Ventures (investing in women‑led consumer health and sustainability startups); previously CEO of DreamIt (accelerator/fund), founder of Holiday Golightly, and held VP roles at AllRecipes, Jobster, Classmates.com and LexisNexis. NSF I‑Corps instructor and frequent startup mentor; serves on/has served on several portfolio company boards and advisory panels. Education: BA Biology (Duke), MBA (Harvard Business School). citeturn0search0turn6search12

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and General Partner at Brickyard, an early-stage venture firm and founder residency based in Chattanooga, TN. Previously co‑founded Bellhops (operations/COO role) and consumer app The House. Invests in and supports pre-seed/seed technology startups through Brickyard’s on-site founder outpost.
enrichment.career_background: Matt Patterson is a co‑founder and General Partner of Brickyard (founded 2021), a Chattanooga‑based early‑stage investment firm and founder outpost. Before Brickyard he co‑founded Bellhops (served as an early operator/COO) and later launched The House. He is based in Chattanooga and works with founders who relocate to Brickyard to accelerate toward product‑market fit.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Bloom Equity Partners (founded 2020). Former co‑founder & CEO of SaplingHR (acquired by Kallidus). Serves on boards of Soutron Global, RightCrowd and Viostream and invests via MacVentures Group.
enrichment.career_background: Bart founded Bloom Equity Partners to acquire and grow lower‑middle‑market software and tech‑enabled services businesses. Prior to Bloom he co‑founded SaplingHR (acquired by Kallidus), held operating roles including at General Assembly, and has been an active angel/early investor and board member across enterprise software companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Majority investments and growth‑oriented buyouts in B2B software, enterprise/SaaS and tech‑enabled business services (lower‑middle‑market).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner at Brighter Capital. Former software engineer at Facebook and Yahoo; an early Meta employee who worked on Facebook Ads. Active angel investor focused on early-stage companies and SPVs, based in the San Francisco Bay Area.
enrichment.career_background: Yun-Fang Juan founded Brighter Capital and has been an active angel investor since ~2012, backing 100+ direct deals and numerous SPVs. Prior to investing she spent a decade as a software engineer (including at Facebook/Meta and Yahoo), co‑creating Facebook Ads, and later founded and sold a startup. She holds a BS from National Taiwan University and an MS from UC Berkeley.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) technology investments across marketplaces, consumer internet/social commerce, enterprise software, constructiontech and hardware.

enrichment.personal_bio: Iyinoluwa Aboyeji is a co‑founder and Founding Partner (General Partner) of Future Africa, an early‑stage investment platform backing African startups. He previously co‑founded Andela and served as a co‑founder and early leader at Flutterwave. He holds a BA in Legal Studies from the University of Waterloo and has served in advisory and board roles across education, fintech and public‑sector initiatives.
interests: Public policy and governance relating to innovation
enrichment.career_background: Aboyeji began as a founder/operator in education and publishing (Bookneto/Imprint), co‑founded Andela (2014) and later co‑founded Flutterwave (2016), serving in senior leadership. He shifted to investing and platform building as a founding partner of Future Africa (fund/collective), and has served as an advisor and board member for several startups and public initiatives, including a role in the 2019 Nigerian presidential campaign and multiple advisory boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early‑stage African technology startups (fintech/payments, marketplaces, mobility, edtech, healthtech)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner at Tapas Capital. Former Amazon executive with VP roles in product management (FBA), investor relations, technology finance and CFO for Asia & emerging markets, and earlier an M&A banker. Holds an MBA from UC Berkeley Haas and a BS in Chemistry from the University of Washington.
enrichment.career_background: Rob Eldridge is the co‑founder and Managing Partner of Tapas Capital (a Bellevue-based early-stage VC). He spent over a decade at Amazon in senior finance, investor relations and product leadership roles (including FBA and regional CFO responsibilities for Asia), and earlier worked in technology M&A at Broadview International and at Sun Microsystems. He advises and invests in early-stage companies, with an operational focus on product and go-to-market scaling.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed/seed & early-stage; sector-agnostic with emphasis on software-driven businesses, marketplaces/consumer platforms, AI/developer tools, and fintech/blockchain.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner at Lobby Capital with ~25 years working with technology entrepreneurs. Previously a partner at August Capital for 20 years. Invests across enterprise software, infrastructure, SaaS, fintech/payments and consumer marketplaces. Lecturer in entrepreneurship and venture capital at Stanford GSB and Harvard Law School.
enrichment.career_background: David Hornik is a founding partner of Lobby Capital. Prior to Lobby he spent two decades as a partner at August Capital and earlier practiced law at firms including Cravath and Perkins Coie. He founded The Lobby conferences and VentureBlog/VentureCast, teaches at Stanford and Harvard Law, and serves on multiple nonprofit and museum boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed/Series A) investments in enterprise software, SaaS and infrastructure; fintech/payments; marketplaces and consumer services.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at UpHonest Capital and an active early-stage investor based in Silicon Valley. Recognized on the Forbes Midas Seed List (Midas Seed 2024). Attended high school in Singapore and earned a degree from the University of San Francisco.
enrichment.career_background: Started as an angel investor, founded Wei Fund and later UpHonest Capital. Focuses on sourcing and accelerating early-stage, cross-border tech startups and has co-invested with major Silicon Valley funds. Notable portfolio companies include Rippling, GrubMarket, Mashgin and others across consumer and enterprise sectors.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (angel–Series A); cross-border technology startups focused on AI, IoT, cloud, enterprise SaaS, consumer tech, biotech/health, fintech and robotics

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Gradient Ventures, Google’s AI-focused seed fund. Former founder and CEO of Radius, a B2B customer data platform. Early investor in companies including Lyft, Udemy and Palantir; focuses on AI- and data-driven startups.
enrichment.career_background: Software engineer early at Facebook; co‑founded and served as CEO of Radius (grew to 100+ employees and raised >$100M). Joined Gradient Ventures as a general/ managing partner, leading seed and early-stage investments in AI- and data-rich companies. Briefly studied Philosophy & Computer Science at UC Berkeley before leaving to work on startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage (pre-seed, seed, Series A) investments in AI/ML and data-rich startups — primarily B2B SaaS, developer tools and fintech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Indian‑born American entrepreneur and angel investor. Co‑founder and former CEO of AngelList and founder of The Hit Forge (an early‑stage fund launched circa 2007). Known for early-stage investments in companies such as Uber, Twitter (X), and Postmates and for public commentary on startups, crypto, wealth, and wellbeing.
interests: Entrepreneurship, wealth creation, and personal development
enrichment.career_background: Naval Ravikant is an entrepreneur and investor who co‑founded Epinions and AngelList, launched the early‑stage fund The Hit Forge (circa 2007), and has founded/co‑founded other ventures including MetaStable (crypto hedge fund) and Spearhead. He is widely active as an angel and seed investor and publishes podcasts and writing on business and personal philosophy.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed/Series A) technology startups — consumer marketplaces, developer tools/platforms, and crypto/blockchain projects.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and first CTO of LivingSocial and a former partner at Lightspeed Venture Partners. Active angel investor since 2013 through Batalion Capital, backing early‑stage consumer and technology startups. Writes and publishes at aaronbatalion.com.
enrichment.career_background: Aaron co‑founded HungryMachine (later LivingSocial) and served as its CTO through its rapid growth. He joined Lightspeed as a partner in 2015, led consumer‑tech investments, and stepped away from institutional venture around 2018 to focus on building and angel investing via Batalion Capital.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early‑stage investments in consumer internet, marketplaces, e‑commerce/social commerce, developer tools/SaaS, web3/crypto, and hardware/autonomous systems.

enrichment.personal_bio: Listed on KohFounders' team as a Venture Partner. Co‑founder of Andrena (fixed‑wireless ISP) and active angel investor; has held venture partner roles at Beta Bridge and Hypothesis. Educated at Princeton University (BA, Economics & Environmental Studies).
enrichment.career_background: James Smits is a co‑founder and senior operator at Andrena and is listed as a Venture Partner at KohFounders. He has served as a venture partner at Beta Bridge and Hypothesis, was Program Director/Partner at Tigerlabs, worked in business development at Banyan Water, and served as an Honorary Fellow at the University of Melbourne. His background combines operator experience in internet infrastructure with early‑stage investing and startup programming.
enrichment.investment_focus: Formation / pre‑seed and angel investments; sectors include healthcare tech, edtech, climate/agtech, fintech, future of work, proptech and frontier tech; focuses on founders outside the Bay Area.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director / CEO of Alchemist Accelerator and co‑founder of the program. Fenwick & West Lecturer of Entrepreneurship at Stanford University. Former member of the DFJ investment team and earlier roles in product management and consulting. Holds BS and MS (Stanford) and an MBA (Harvard Business School).
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and long‑time leader of Alchemist Accelerator (enterprise‑focused seed accelerator). Previously on the DFJ investment team where he led early institutional investments (including Justin.TV/Twitch, PubMatic, Vizu and others). Earlier worked in product management at enterprise startups and as a consultant at McKinsey & Company. Educated at Stanford (BS, MS) and Harvard Business School (MBA).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage enterprise (B2B/B2B2C) startups—technical founding teams; enterprise software and deep‑tech (AI, quantum, cleantech) focused on customer traction and revenue generation.

enrichment.personal_bio: Erica Brescia is a Managing Director at Redpoint Ventures focused on early-stage infrastructure, developer tools, and security investments. She previously co-founded Bitnami and served as Chief Operating Officer of GitHub, and serves on the board of the Linux Foundation.
enrichment.career_background: Erica co-founded Bitnami (YC W13), which was acquired by VMware, and later served as COO of GitHub where she helped scale the company. She has been a board member of the Linux Foundation since 2016 and joined Redpoint as a Managing Director leading seed and Series A investments in infrastructure, developer tools, DevOps, security and AI.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed, Series A) investments in infrastructure, developer tools/DevOps, open source, security, and AI.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner and co-founder at Flybridge Capital Partners and Senior Lecturer at Harvard Business School. Focuses on AI, vertical SaaS and fintech startups and runs The Graduate Syndicate micro-seed fund. Author of books on venture capital and startup careers; active in diversity and education non-profits.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Flybridge (2003) and earlier co‑founded Upromise (President & COO, acquired by Sallie Mae). Served in senior roles at Open Market (IPO 1996) and began his career at The Boston Consulting Group. Teaches entrepreneurship at Harvard Business School and founded The Graduate Syndicate micro‑seed fund.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage, AI-native companies (vertical AI / AI-native vertical SaaS); fintech; consumer/internet commerce; data infrastructure and developer platforms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Capital Factory, an Austin-based accelerator and early-stage investor. Serial entrepreneur who founded OtherInbox and earlier email startups (e.g., SKYLIST, UnsubCentral). Active angel investor, mentor and Entrepreneur in Residence at the University of Texas. Based in Austin, Texas.
enrichment.career_background: Joshua Baer founded Capital Factory and serves as its CEO; he previously founded and led several email-related companies (SKYLIST, UnsubCentral, OtherInbox) and has been an active angel investor and mentor. He teaches startup courses at the University of Texas, has served in advisory roles to multiple startups, and has been recognized as a Henry Crown Fellow and Eisenhower Fellow.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and seed investments (primarily Texas-based startups), developer/enterprise SaaS, email & marketing technology, dual-use commercial/government tech

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner, Fund Strategy at Lerer Hippeau (since 2015) who leads the firm’s fund/secondary portfolio work including SB Capital and BN Capital. Previously a partner at SoftBank Capital and an investment banker in J.P. Morgan’s Tech, Media & Telecom group. Focuses on early-stage investments in digital media, consumer and enterprise mobile, gaming and related marketing technologies.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in investment banking at J.P. Morgan (Tech/Media/Telecom), was an associate at Constellation Ventures, then spent roughly a decade as a partner at SoftBank Capital before joining Lerer Hippeau in 2015. At Lerer Hippeau he runs fund strategy and secondary portfolio management alongside leading early-stage investments and board roles.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed to Series A; consumer and enterprise tech with emphasis on digital media, mobile, gaming, advertising/marketing tech and education technologies.

enrichment.personal_bio: CEO and founder of Neo, a mentorship community and venture fund. Co‑founder of Code.org and an early investor/advisor in companies including Dropbox, Facebook, Airbnb and Uber. Based in San Francisco. citeturn2search0
enrichment.career_background: Serial entrepreneur and angel investor: co‑founded LinkExchange (acquired by Microsoft), co‑founded iLike (acquired by Myspace), helped launch Code.org, and founded Neo where he serves as CEO. citeturn2search12
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage tech (developer tools, AI/infrastructure), accelerator-driven talent scouting and mentoring. citeturn1search6

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑Founder and Co‑Managing Partner of DCVC, a deep‑tech venture firm. Tech entrepreneur and investor with decades of experience; founded Da Vinci Systems and has served in multiple VC roles. Holds a degree in Physics from Yale and is named on 50+ patents.
enrichment.career_background: Matt Ocko co‑founded DCVC (Data Collective) and is co‑managing partner. Previously founded Da Vinci Systems (VP of R&D) and has held investing/partner roles at firms including VantagePoint, SOFTBANK Technology Ventures/Mobius, Sevin Rosen and Archimedes Capital. He has led investments across deep‑tech sectors and is listed on 50+ patents; holds a Physics degree from Yale University.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at 500 Global, responsible for ecosystem development, investor-education programs and corporate–startup innovation. Joined 500 in 2011 to lead international investments and later expanded to Managing Partner overseeing accelerator and partnership initiatives. Founder of +INNOVATORS and a member of the Kauffman Fellows (Class 17). Holds a BA from Fundação Getulio Vargas and an MLA from the University of Pennsylvania.
enrichment.career_background: Joined 500 Global (formerly 500 Startups) in 2011 to pilot international investments and became Managing Partner overseeing global flagship funds, accelerator programs and corporate innovation. Previously founded +INNOVATORS (a hub for Brazilian tech founders) and worked as a management consultant on distribution and go‑to‑market strategies for Fortune 500 clients. Kauffman Fellow (Class 17) and guest lecturer for VC education programs at Stanford, INSEAD and Berkeley.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture investor and technology executive. Co‑founder and former general partner of Start Fund (early-stage/Y Combinator-focused), co‑founder of Moses Capital, and President & CEO of Emerging Travel Group. Early member of DST Global and active angel/seed investor in consumer internet, marketplaces and travel tech.
interests: Travel technology and B2B travel platforms
enrichment.career_background: Started in investments at DST Global/DST Russia (late 2000s), co‑founded Start Fund in 2011 (with Yuri Milner/SV Angel) to back early‑stage/YC startups, joined Ostrovok/Emerging Travel Group in 2013 and became President & CEO in 2017, and co‑founded Moses Capital (fund‑of‑funds) in 2023 while remaining active in angel/seed investing.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early‑stage startups (YC/accelerator-backed); consumer internet & marketplaces; travel tech; fintech/crypto

enrichment.personal_bio: Medha Agarwal is an early-stage investor who served as a Partner at Redpoint Ventures, focused on fintech, vertical SaaS, marketplaces and healthcare. She joined Defy.vc as a General Partner in late 2023. Previously she founded two startups and began her career at Bain & Company before moving into venture at Bessemer.
enrichment.career_background: Medha began her career at Bain & Company, co-founded two startups (skedge.me and Roomidex), and started investing at Bessemer Venture Partners. She spent seven years as a Partner at Redpoint Ventures where she led early-stage investments across fintech, vertical SaaS, marketplaces and healthcare (working with companies such as Whatnot, Tend, Proper and Anvyl), and in October–November 2023 joined Defy.vc as a General Partner.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed to Series A; fintech, vertical SaaS, marketplaces, healthcare / healthtech

enrichment.personal_bio: Repeat founder and angel investor; currently CEO & co‑founder of Groupthink. She previously co‑founded and led Mattermark, held early marketing/product roles at Twilio and GitLab, and has served as an investing partner/limited partner at XFactor Ventures.
enrichment.career_background: Danielle Morrill is a repeat entrepreneur and operator — co‑founder and CEO of Groupthink, co‑founder and CEO of Mattermark, and co‑founder of Referly. Her prior roles include marketing and product leadership at Twilio and GitLab, and she has acted as an investing partner/limited partner at XFactor Ventures while making personal angel investments and providing executive coaching.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed & seed; female‑founded startups. Sector focus includes B2B SaaS, developer tools, AI/ML, data infrastructure/analytics, and deeptech (including aerospace).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and managing partner at FPV Ventures. Former early Google engineer who founded Google Analytics and Google Voice and later a General Partner at GV and partner at Felicis. Known for early investments in Canva, Plaid, Flexport and other large outcomes.
enrichment.career_background: Wesley Chan began as a software engineer (Microsoft, HP Labs) and joined Google in the early 2000s, where he helped build Google Analytics, Google Voice and parts of Google Ads. He became a founding General Partner at Google Ventures, later joined Felicis as a managing director, and in 2022 co‑founded FPV Ventures where he serves as managing partner focusing on early‑stage, product‑driven companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage / seed; product‑led consumer and SaaS; biotech & drug discovery; fintech; enterprise/developer tools; mission‑driven education & logistics

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur, educator and investor focused on building Puerto Rico’s startup ecosystem. Former Director of Operations at Parallel18 and currently leads investment efforts for P18Ventures. Ph.D. in Chemical Engineering (UC Davis) with founder experience in biotech and education startups.
interests: Early-stage venture investing in Puerto Rico & LatAm
enrichment.career_background: Ph.D. in Chemical Engineering from UC Davis; founder of Inserogen (biotech spin-off) and BetaBox Labs (education/innovation experiences). Served as Parallel18’s founding Chief Operations Officer / Director of Operations, built the accelerator curriculum and mentor network, and now leads P18Ventures and investment initiatives on behalf of Parallel18 and the Puerto Rico Science, Technology & Research Trust. Also has held adjunct teaching roles and works as a consultant and angel investor.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed �to Series A) startups across software, fintech, healthtech/biotech, edtech and marketplaces; primary geography Puerto Rico and Latin America, with international cohorts.

enrichment.personal_bio: Former NFL linebacker turned investor; co‑founder and longtime managing partner of Next Play Capital (now operating as Next Legacy Partners). Focuses on providing athletes, entertainers and non‑traditional investors access to top venture funds and co‑investments. Founder and chairman of the Ryan Nece Foundation; BA from UCLA.
enrichment.career_background: Ryan Nece played seven seasons in the NFL (Tampa Bay Buccaneers, Detroit Lions) and won Super Bowl XXXVII. After retiring he worked in investing and real estate (Arenda/DeBartolo, Provident), co‑founded StraightCast Media (assets acquired by FOX Sports), and in 2014–2015 co‑founded Next Play Capital to pool athlete/entertainer capital into access‑constrained VC funds and venture co‑investments. He serves as Managing Partner of the firm (now part of Next Legacy), is a Henry Crown Fellow (Aspen Institute) and chairs the Ryan Nece Foundation.
enrichment.investment_focus: Fund-of-funds and direct co-investments into access-constrained venture funds and venture-backed companies (consumer, fintech, IT/SaaS); athlete and creator-led opportunities.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Share Ventures, a Los Angeles–based venture studio that builds and funds startups focused on human performance. Co‑founder of MoviePass and founder of NextMedium and bLife. Has served as an Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence at True Ventures and as a Board/Venture Partner at Upfront Ventures.
enrichment.career_background: Hamet Watt is an entrepreneur and investor who founded Share Ventures (venture studio) and previously co‑founded MoviePass, NextMedium and bLife. He has held roles as Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence at True Ventures, Board/Venture Partner at Upfront Ventures, and has worked on early Africa-focused venture investing; his work centers on creating and scaling companies in health, wellness, and consumer experiences.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / pre-seed venture studio model focused on human performance (health, longevity, wellness), consumer products and software

enrichment.personal_bio: Sonja Hoel Perkins is founder and Managing Director of The Perkins Fund and a veteran technology investor with 30+ years in venture capital. She spent 22 years at Menlo Ventures, founded Broadway Angels and Project Glimmer, and launched The Perkins Fund in 2016. Her career includes investments that reached multibillion-dollar valuations (e.g., McAfee, F5, Acme Packet, The RealReal).
interests: Supporting women founders and diversity in VC
enrichment.career_background: Began in private equity/VC at TA Associates, moved to Symantec in business development, then joined Menlo Ventures in 1994 where she became the firm's youngest general partner and spent 22 years. In 2010 she co-founded Broadway Angels and later founded Project Glimmer; in 2016 she launched The Perkins Fund. She holds a BS from the University of Virginia and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.investment_focus: High-technology companies across stages (seed to late); enterprise software, security/networking, data/AI, consumer marketplaces; emphasis on female founders and long-term founder support.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Blue Startups, the Honolulu-based accelerator she co‑founded in 2012. Active angel investor and startup advisor; formerly Managing Director of Hawaii Angels and co‑founder of Kolohala Ventures and HI Impact. Holds a BA in Political Science from UC Santa Cruz and an Executive MBA from the University of Hawaiʻi.
enrichment.career_background: More than 20 years in business strategy, private equity and early-stage investing. Co-founded Kolohala Ventures (2006), founded HI Impact (2010), served as Managing Director of Hawaii Angels, and since 2012 has led Blue Startups as Managing Partner. Active in local nonprofit and ecosystem roles supporting entrepreneurship and impact investing.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage / seed investments in scalable technology companies; sectors include software, travel & tourism, and sustainability; emphasis on Hawaii-based and East–West (Asia–US) opportunities and female founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at BDMI focused on seed and early-stage investments in digital media and enterprise software. Holds an MBA from MIT Sloan and an engineering degree from Cooper Union; joined BDMI in 2012 after co-founding High Line Venture Partners.
enrichment.career_background: Sim co-founded the seed fund High Line Venture Partners, worked in strategy and M&A at IAC and earlier at Gabriel Ventures, and joined BDMI in 2012. At BDMI he has led seed and early-stage investments across media, adtech and enterprise software and has been involved in multiple exits; he holds an MBA from MIT Sloan and a BE from Cooper Union.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments in digital media, online video/streaming, enterprise SaaS, creator-economy businesses, adtech and DTC commerce.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at Divergent Capital (based in New York). Former general partner at K50 Ventures and Kairos and an active angel investor since 2014. Background as a founder/operator and head of growth with a BA from NYU Stern.
enrichment.career_background: Katie Shea co‑founded Divergent Capital in 2021 and leads early‑stage investments focused on technical and consumer founders. Prior roles include General Partner at K50 Ventures and Kairos, founder of a consumer manufacturing company (FUNK‑tional Enterprises), and growth/marketing leadership at startups such as Ordergroove and Homejoy. She has been an active angel investor since 2014.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed / seed and early stage investments in technical and scientific founders and consumer startups — areas include AI/ML, advanced manufacturing, robotics, materials, biotech/healthtech, and consumer DTC/brands.

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal / Director (Fintech) at Plug & Play (Plug & Play Tech Center), based in Sunnyvale, CA. Leads early-stage Fintech and crypto/web3 investments. Public profiles record investments including Criptan, Bankuish, Oraan, Railz and Verse.
enrichment.career_background: Works at Plug & Play (Ventures) focusing on Fintech and crypto investments. Public professional profiles list prior finance/internal-audit roles at DNB and Luminor and finance education at Banku Augstskola.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage Fintech; Crypto / Web3; Payments; financial infrastructure & APIs; seed / pre-seed investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Early-stage investor and operator — co‑founder of Evening Fund and CEO & co‑founder of Vareto. Former Facebook product & data lead and Sequoia scout; writes micro checks and supports founders on product and GTM. Based in the U.S.; active in pre‑seed/seed investing through Evening Fund and related vehicles.
interests: Product and go-to-market support for founders
enrichment.career_background: Kat Orekhova left academia for industry, building data science and product teams at Facebook before moving to product leadership at Ironclad. She cofounded Vareto (CEO) and has been an angel investor and scout (Sequoia), later co‑founding Evening Fund and participating in Darkmode Ventures as a GP; she focuses on small, hands‑on investments and operator support.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed micro‑checks (~$50K–$100K) into B2B SaaS, APIs, fintech, marketplaces, developer tools and AI; operator-focused, hands‑on product & GTM support.

enrichment.personal_bio: Arjun Dev Arora is an early‑stage investor and advisor based in the San Francisco Bay Area. He founded ReTargeter (acquired) and has served as a partner at 500 Startups and as Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence at Expa. He later founded Format One to advise founders and emerging fund managers.
enrichment.career_background: Arjun founded and led ReTargeter (acquired in 2015), later served as a Partner at 500 Startups and as Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence at Expa, and is the founder/managing partner of Format One. He advises startups, funds, and corporate teams on fundraising, board & team leadership, and go‑to‑market growth.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed/pre‑seed) technology startups; ad/marketing technology; consumer & marketplaces; enterprise SaaS

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Canvas Ventures (Canvas Prime) who leads early‑stage investments in fintech, digital health, AI and SaaS. Previously led early investments including Lending Club, Luminar and Doximity. Holds a BS in Chemical Engineering (University of Missouri) and a JD/MBA from UC Berkeley.
enrichment.career_background: Started at Procter & Gamble, was an early employee and VP of Marketing at NextCard, then joined Morgenthaler Ventures in 2007. Co‑founded Canvas (2013) and has been named repeatedly to Forbes’ Midas List for venture investors.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (Series A/B) investing in FinTech, digital health, AI/ML, SaaS and marketplaces.

enrichment.personal_bio: Software engineer turned founder and investor. Founded EdgiLife / LoveWithFood (acquired 2018) and served as CEO of Whistle Labs; now an Investment Partner at XFactor Ventures and General Partner at Transform Capital. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area.
enrichment.career_background: Aihui Ong built EdgiLife (and consumer brand LoveWithFood) from product to multi‑million revenue and exited in 2018. She later served as CEO of Whistle Labs and has held operating roles at SnackNation. She is a General Partner at Transform Capital, an Investment Partner at XFactor Ventures, and mentors at 500 Global and Techstars. She holds a BSc in Computer Science (National University of Singapore) and an MBA (Warwick Business School).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / Seed; CPG & DTC; Consumer tech and e-commerce; AI & data-driven insights; B2B software and commerce enablement; supporting female/underrepresented founders

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial entrepreneur and angel investor; co‑founder/CEO of Houseparty and Meerkat and currently CEO/co‑founder of Towns/Here Not There Labs. Served as a scout for Sequoia Capital and has backed early-stage consumer and web3 startups. Educated at the Technion and originally from Israel.
enrichment.career_background: Ben Rubin co‑founded Meerkat and later Houseparty (acquired by Epic Games). He has served as a Sequoia Capital scout (starting 2017), was an EIR at Benchmark, and now leads Here Not There Labs / Towns, focusing on decentralized messaging and community protocols. He trained as an architect at the Technion and often frames product design in spatial/architectural terms.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage consumer social and messaging, real‑time video/streaming, and decentralized/web3 protocols (seed to early VC)

enrichment.personal_bio: Toot Shani is the Founding Managing Partner and CEO of Sarona Ventures, a global VC and tech ecosystem headquartered in Tel Aviv. She previously founded Ment Group and Tosh Productions and has held roles in economic development, business development and startup ecosystem programs. Shani is active in global entrepreneurship communities and speaks publicly on startups and innovation.
interests: AI and generative AI applications for enterprise
enrichment.career_background: Toot Shani co-founded and leads Sarona Ventures after earlier founding Ment Group (an economic development/entrepreneurship firm) and Tosh Productions. Her prior roles include leadership and business-development positions (including work with Festo and municipal leadership programs) and extensive work running entrepreneurship and scale-up programs across geographies; she is an active speaker and member of international startup communities.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed to Series B; enterprise software, AI/generative AI, SaaS, FinTech, InsurTech, PropTech, RetailTech, SMB-focused technology

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director and founder of Otherwise Fund, a founder-angel network based in the San Francisco Bay Area. Early-stage investor with seed and multi-stage checks; known for early bets in companies such as Figma, Notion and Robinhood. Former head of Index Ventures’ seed practice and previously worked in product roles at Google and YouTube.
enrichment.career_background: Terrence began investing at Index Ventures (2010–2017), where he co-created and led the firm’s seed practice and incubated an angel fund. In 2017 he launched Otherwise (a founder-angel network) and serves as its Managing Director while investing independently; earlier career roles include product and marketing roles at Google and YouTube. He holds graduate degrees from LSE and Stanford GSB and a BA from Colgate University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Founder-angel / network model; primarily seed and pre-seed (sometimes into Series A/B); check sizes roughly $100K–$1M; geography: US/Canada; sectors: SaaS, marketplaces, AI/GenAI, Web3/crypto

enrichment.personal_bio: Listed on YOBE Ventures' team page as a Junior Associate. Works on sourcing and supporting Seed–Series A tech and growth-equity deals. Educated at Copenhagen Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Associated with YOBE Ventures (listed as Junior Associate on the firm site). Profiles and directories also link him to investor relations and early-stage investment activity; prior roles and affiliations include outreach/business development work and involvement with SwissBorg. Educated at Copenhagen Business School (BSc; MSc listed).
enrichment.investment_focus: Sector-agnostic tech and growth equity; Seed to Series A (primary); geographic focus includes US, Europe/UK, Israel and LATAM; typical check sizes reported ~$50K–$500K.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑Founder and General Partner at Baukunst and a longtime operator‑investor based in Boston, MA. Former Partner at Atlas Venture and co‑founder of Premise and Onshape; later co‑founded Bolt. Focuses on early, design‑and‑engineering‑led companies and has led or advised numerous engineering‑software and hardware investments.
enrichment.career_background: Thirty‑year career as an entrepreneur and early‑stage investor: co‑founded Premise (engineering/CAD spinout) and Onshape, was a Partner at Atlas Venture (1993–2012), co‑founded Bolt (2012) and co‑founded Baukunst (2022). Education includes MS (MIT), MBA (INSEAD) and Dipl.‑Ing. (TU Berlin). Credited with leading and supporting many first‑round investments in engineering and product companies and with having raised/managed substantial venture capital over his career.
enrichment.investment_focus: Leading pre‑seed/seed checks in "creative technologists" — engineering & CAD tools, hardware/manufacturing, enterprise/engineering SaaS, climate/cleantech, and design‑led consumer/industrial products.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Istech Energy Ventures and Country Manager at AVK International based in Istanbul. Guest lecturer and mentor on entrepreneurship and corporate innovation; active angel investor with several early-stage investments recorded. Holds engineering and executive business education credentials.
enrichment.career_background: Mechanical engineer by training (Istanbul Technical University) with an Executive MBA from Sabancı University and executive coursework at MIT Sloan. Serves as Country Manager for AVK International, partner at Istech Energy Ventures, guest lecturer at Yeditepe University, and startup mentor; involved in early-stage angel investments in energy, sustainability and product-led growth companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) investments focused on EnergyTech and climate/sustainability, renewable energy and IoT solutions; also considers AI and SaaS verticals.

enrichment.firm_name: Jumpstart Foundry (part of Jumpstart Health Investors)
enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner at Jumpstart Health Investors and co‑founder of Jumpstart Foundry; founder and managing partner of Jumpstart Nova. Active early‑stage healthcare investor and ecosystem builder in Nashville; co‑founder and minority owner of Nashville Soccer Club and author of Create and Orchestrate.
enrichment.career_background: Marcus Whitney is a founding partner of the Jumpstart Health Investors platform and co‑founder of Jumpstart Foundry (a Nashville‑based pre‑seed healthcare fund). He founded Jumpstart Nova (a fund focused on Black‑led healthcare companies) and previously founded/led initiatives including the Health:Further conference and companies such as Clariture Health and Moontoast; earlier in his career he held technology leadership roles at Emma. He serves on several industry and nonprofit boards and is a public speaker and author.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed healthcare startups (health IT, digital health, tech‑enabled services, consumer health/wellness, diagnostic devices); seed/Series A for Black‑founded and led healthcare companies (Jumpstart Nova).

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Lerer Hippeau. Joined the firm in 2015 from SoftBank Capital and was promoted to Managing Partner in 2022, where he is principally responsible for LH Select. Focuses on early-stage and select-stage investments across enterprise and consumer sectors.
enrichment.career_background: Began his career in investment banking at Canaccord Genuity, then served as an Associate at Polaris Partners and led digital strategy at Life Line Screening. Joined SoftBank Capital as a Senior Associate before joining Lerer Hippeau in 2015; holds an MBA from Columbia Business School and a BA from Colby College.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and Select (Series A–C); enterprise and consumer investments, with emphasis on enterprise software, consumer/mobile, marketplaces, SMB-focused products, and digital health.

enrichment.personal_bio: Chair & General Partner at B Capital Group. Co‑founder of First Round Capital and founding President of Renaissance Technologies; early internet and database pioneer. Former professor (University of Pennsylvania, Cornell); PhD in Operations Research (Cornell); based in New York.
enrichment.career_background: Academic early in his career (Professor of Decision Sciences and Computer Science at the University of Pennsylvania; faculty at Cornell), then helped found Renaissance Technologies (served as President), was an early investor with Idealab, co‑founded First Round Capital, and later joined B Capital Group as Chairman/General Partner. Serves on multiple nonprofit and corporate boards; holds a PhD from Cornell and a BS from City College of New York.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage to growth-stage technology companies (Technology, AI/ML, Data, Healthcare, Climate)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing General Partner of SOSV, which he started in 1995 after the IPO of MapInfo. Early entrepreneur (co‑founded MapInfo and NetCentric) who now focuses on early‑stage deep‑tech startups addressing human and planetary health. Known for philanthropic support of education and humanitarian causes; resides in Princeton, NJ.
interests: Deep tech for human & planetary health
enrichment.career_background: Sean O'Sullivan holds a BSc in Electrical Engineering from Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute and an MFA in Film Production from USC. He co‑founded MapInfo (street‑mapping software) and NetCentric, founded SOSV in 1995, and launched accelerator programs including HAX and IndieBio. He has founded humanitarian initiatives (JumpStart International), holds multiple patents (≈30), and has transitioned SOSV into a global early‑stage investor and operator of vertical accelerators.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed ("first check") deep‑tech investments via SOSV's accelerator programs (IndieBio, HAX) — sectors include biotech/life sciences, hardware & robotics, climate & decarbonization, food tech, and advanced manufacturing (initial checks up to approximately $550,000).

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director and Head of Closed Loop Ventures, leading the firm’s venture capital and growth equity strategies and managing a portfolio of early-stage circular-economy companies. Experienced in deal sourcing, execution, portfolio management and value creation. Previously worked in clean energy project finance and growth equity; holds an MBA from Stanford GSB and a BA from Pomona College.
enrichment.career_background: Danielle leads Closed Loop’s Ventures Group (seed through growth equity) and oversees sourcing, diligence, transactions and portfolio management. Prior to Closed Loop Partners she worked in growth equity and project finance with NewWorld Capital Group, Invex Infraestructura and Queensland Investment Corporation. She has served on boards of portfolio companies and nonprofit organizations and holds an MBA from Stanford Graduate School of Business and a BA from Pomona College.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and growth investments in the circular economy: materials & advanced manufacturing, recycling & recovery, sustainable consumer goods and packaging, textiles & apparel, food & agriculture, and circular technology/supply-chain solutions.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor formerly focused on ventures, energy and climate at Plug & Play. Invests in climate/energy, cleantech and startups in emerging markets; writes about future of work and education. Education: Industrial Engineering, Universidad Pontificia Comillas.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in venture and corporate innovation roles at Plug & Play (Ventures, Energy & Climate lead). Later held commercial/management roles in climate-tech companies. Holds a degree in Industrial Engineering from Universidad Pontificia Comillas.
enrichment.investment_focus: Climate & Energy, Cleantech, Emerging markets (MENA/Africa), Future of Work & Education, Early-stage (pre-seed/seed)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder & CEO of Inovexus, a cross-border acceleration fund that invests in early-stage B2B tech startups. Based in Paris, he has spent decades building companies (including activity in California) and runs Inovexus’s Deal Club and acceleration programs. Serves as a French Foreign Trade Advisor (Les CCE - Île‑de‑France) and completed executive programs at emlyon, Harvard Business School and UCLA Anderson.
enrichment.career_background: Philippe Roche founded Inovexus and leads its accelerator and Deal Club. Prior to Inovexus he spent many years building and advising technology companies (including work in California) and has held entrepreneurial and consulting roles tied to firms referenced in public bios. He also serves as a French Foreign Trade Advisor and has completed executive education at emlyon, Harvard Business School and UCLA Anderson.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed to Seed / Series A; early-stage B2B SaaS and deeptech; accelerator-led investments with emphasis on cross-border (Europe↔US) scaling and mentorship-driven growth

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Geometry Venture Development, a rolling-fund angel network based in Istanbul that invests ~$20K–$50K in go-to-market stage technology startups. Works with early-stage founders on commercialization and fundraising; has prior project-management and consulting roles in Turkish corporate and public tech programs.
enrichment.career_background: Over a decade in the Turkish startup ecosystem: founder of Geometry Venture Development (since 2019); project manager and consultant roles at the Technology Development Foundation of Turkey (TTGV) and Türk Telekom; earlier experience at İTÜ ARI Teknokent/İTÜ Çekirdek and Keiretsu Forum Istanbul. Education includes Marmara University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / seed / go-to-market technology startups (typical checks $20K–$50K); sectors: AI/ML, healthtech/medtech, SaaS, fintech, IoT, cybersecurity and digital assets.

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal at PivotNorth Capital who invests in early-stage technology startups. Public profiles associate her with pre-seed/seed investing across AI, digital health, climate/cleantech and consumer/e‑commerce. Educated at the University of Notre Dame.
enrichment.career_background: Principal at PivotNorth Capital focused on sourcing and evaluating pre-seed/seed opportunities. Prior roles include venture-focused positions at Platform Venture Studio and fellowship roles at early-stage investment programs; holds a bachelor’s degree from the University of Notre Dame.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage venture investments in software and tech-enabled businesses (AI, digital health, climate/cleantech, consumer and e-commerce, creator economy)

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Vast Ventures and founder/CEO of Fabric (healthcare technology). Former President of Moat (acquired by Oracle) and CEO of Instinctiv (acquired by SoundCloud). Named to Forbes 30 Under 30 and has taught as an adjunct at Cornell Tech.
enrichment.career_background: Left Cornell University to start his first company, later served as CEO of Instinctiv (acquired by SoundCloud) and President of Moat (acquired by Oracle). Joined Vast Ventures in 2014 as a partner and has been active as an angel investor; in 2021 he founded Fabric (healthcare platform) and has served as its CEO while remaining involved at Vast and as an adjunct instructor at Cornell Tech.
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise software; consumer internet; healthcare/digital health; AI/cloud software; fintech — stages: pre-seed, seed, Series A and growth.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and venture partner active in frontier markets. Founded Frontier Dawn Partners and is a co‑founder/managing partner at Lateral Frontiers (Lateral Capital). Background in capital markets and emerging‑markets VC with a focus on technology‑enabled financial infrastructure and enterprise software.
enrichment.career_background: Rob Eloff began his career in capital markets (JP Morgan, Credit Suisse) and served as an Executive Director at Goldman Sachs before moving into private markets. He was Investment Director at African Capital Investments, established Frontier Dawn Partners (an evergreen vehicle), and co‑founded Lateral Frontiers (Lateral Capital), where he is a managing partner. He holds a Master’s in Finance from the University of Cambridge and an undergraduate degree from the University of Cape Town.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (Seed / Series A) investments in fintech, digital infrastructure and cleantech for frontier markets (primarily Africa).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at Primitive Ventures and a long-time crypto investor focused on protocol and infrastructure investments. Formerly Managing Director at DHVC (Danhua Capital); holds a Master’s in Information Systems from Carnegie Mellon University and a Bachelor’s from Sun Yat‑sen University.
enrichment.career_background: Started her career at eBay in product/analytics roles, served as Managing Director at DHVC (Danhua Capital), and in 2018 founded Primitive Ventures to invest from the team’s balance sheet in web3/crypto projects across seed to Series A.
enrichment.investment_focus: Web3/Blockchain and crypto protocols; early‑stage (seed—Series A) investments in protocol infrastructure, token projects, and on‑chain economies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and managing partner of Listen (founded 2010), entrepreneur and brand builder who invests in early-stage consumer startups. Former Leo Burnett account leader; adjunct lecturer in startup branding at Northwestern Kellogg. Serves on multiple consumer-focused company boards and nonprofit boards in the Chicago area.
enrichment.career_background: Jeff Cantalupo founded Listen in 2010 and leads its consumer-focused investing and brand-building efforts. He began his career at Leo Burnett in brand and advertising roles, and later moved into angel and venture investing. He teaches startup branding at Northwestern’s Kellogg School of Management and holds board seats at several Listen portfolio companies and local nonprofits. He earned a BA from the University of Iowa.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage consumer brands (CPG, food & beverage, wellness, femtech), consumer internet and consumer-facing fintech; typical check sizes from pre-seed to Series A (sweet spot ~ $1.5M).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and managing partner of Trajectory Ventures and Trajectory Capital. Lifelong entrepreneur and investor focused on disruptive technology across AI, adtech, fintech and infrastructure. Serves on multiple public and private boards and is CEO of Collective Audience (appointed 2023).
enrichment.career_background: Peter Bordes has 30+ years as an operator, founder and investor. He founded MediaTrust, served as CEO of Kubient (led the company through an IPO in August 2020), and later founded Trajectory Ventures/Trajectory Capital. He is a board director at several companies (including Beasley Broadcast Group and Fraud.net), co‑founder/managing partner of TruVest, and vice chair of Ocearch.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑to‑growth stage technology companies in AI, data/analytics, adtech/digital media, fintech/payments, cybersecurity, cloud/compute infrastructure and mobility/aerospace.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Digitalis Ventures focused on companies across human and animal health. Formerly worked in corporate strategy/innovation at Mars, built rural healthcare pilots in India with Piramal e-swasthya, and began his career in corporate finance at GE Healthcare. He holds an MBA from Northwestern (Kellogg) and a B.A. from Boston College.
interests: Tech-enabled health services & social care infrastructure
Public health and access to care
enrichment.career_background: Amit is a Partner at Digitalis Ventures where he leads investments across healthcare technology and related domains. Prior roles include corporate strategy and corporate innovation at Mars, operational work in rural healthcare with Piramal e-swasthya, and corporate finance positions at GE Healthcare. He serves on the board of the Fund for Public Health NYC and holds an MBA from Kellogg and a B.A. from Boston College.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage investments in healthcare technology, health sciences/biotechnology, and animal/pet health; tech-enabled health services and social care infrastructure.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder & Partner at Banter Capital. Former Vice President/Principal at SignalFire and previously on investment teams at BoxGroup and Dorm Room Fund. Focuses on seed and pre-seed consumer internet and marketplace startups. Holds a BA from the University of Pennsylvania.
enrichment.career_background: Started investing and advising while at University of Pennsylvania (Dorm Room Fund); worked on early-stage investing teams including BoxGroup; product role at Quidd; joined SignalFire as VP/Principal (investment role); founded Banter Capital where he serves as Founder & Partner.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed & pre-seed; consumer internet and marketplaces; early-stage, product-led consumer startups

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Mindful Venture Capital, an early-stage VC based in Menlo Park. Senior Advisor to the Stanford Behavior Design Lab with a focus on habit formation and consensual/mindful technology design. Previously served as Principal at Silicon Valley Data Capital and held product and innovation roles at RBC, Interim COO at IdeaFlow, and analyst roles at Morgan Stanley. Holds a B.S. in Symbolic Systems from Stanford University.
enrichment.career_background: Ari founded Mindful Venture Capital and leads the firm’s investment strategy focused on early-stage, B2B/B2B2C companies that apply behavior design and data science. Prior to founding Mindful VC she was Principal at Silicon Valley Data Capital, led product and new-product development roles at Royal Bank of Canada (Group Product Manager / Director), served as Interim COO at IdeaFlow, and worked as an analyst at Morgan Stanley. She has been a researcher and now advisor at Stanford’s Behavior Design Lab and holds a B.S. in Symbolic Systems from Stanford.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Pre-Seed, Seed, Series A) B2B / B2B2C companies applying behavior design, enterprise AI/ML, healthtech, fintech, and infrastructure (IoT/5G).

enrichment.personal_bio: Healthcare-focused investor and commercialization executive. Former Venture Partner at Refinery Ventures; later served as Chief Commercialization Officer at Case Western Reserve University and joined Cleveland Clinic Ventures as a partner. Board member or advisor to several healthcare startups (medical devices, AI, therapeutics). Holds a BA from Miami University and an MBA from Duke University (Fuqua).
interests: Early-stage (post-seed to Series A) venture work
enrichment.career_background: Todd Schwarzinger has a background in healthcare investment banking and venture/lending. He was an Executive Director in healthcare investment banking at Morgan Stanley, later held senior roles at Hercules Capital and as Managing Director, Life Sciences & Healthcare at Silicon Valley Bank. From 2019–2022 he was a healthcare venture partner at Refinery Ventures, led commercialization at Case Western Reserve’s Veale Institute, and subsequently joined Cleveland Clinic Ventures as a partner. He holds a BA in Finance from Miami University and an MBA from Duke University (Fuqua).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-scale / post-seed to Series A technology investments with emphasis on digital health, medical devices/diagnostics, biotech/therapeutics and human-capital / enterprise software.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and angel active in crypto/DeFi and Web3. Former Partner at ParaFi Capital and earlier worked in investment banking and growth investing. Publicly visible in the DeFi community and a participant in NFT/DAO activity.
enrichment.career_background: Santiago Roel Santos began in investment banking (financial sponsors) at J.P. Morgan, moved to growth investing at Sageview Capital, served as Director of Research & Growth at Elysium Health, and later joined ParaFi Capital as a Partner focused on crypto and DeFi. He is also identified in public sources as a founder of Inversion (a crypto/private-equity strategy) and an active angel investor in Web3 projects.
enrichment.investment_focus: DeFi and Web3 protocols, crypto infrastructure, NFTs/gaming, early-stage token and venture investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner and managing partner at Oyster Ventures, a San Francisco–based early-stage VC. Three-time fund manager with prior roles at Rothenberg Ventures and Draper Dragon; earlier career in media and M&A. Active investor in fintech, blockchain/crypto, marketplaces, media tech and SaaS.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and Founding Partner at Oyster Ventures (San Francisco). Previously Managing Director at Rothenberg Ventures and Venture Partner/VP roles at Draper Dragon; earlier experience in M&A and cross‑border business development (Eight Solutions / FFD Labs, Cameron Pace Group) and as a producer/anchor in media (CCTV, Travel Channel). Education listed at Peking University (B.S.).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed–seed) investments in FinTech, blockchain/crypto, marketplaces, AI/ML, media tech and SaaS

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Riot Ventures. Career institutional venture investor focused on companies at the intersection of hardware and software for enterprise, industrial and transportation applications. Has led investments in defense/aerospace, logistics, advanced manufacturing and infrastructure companies.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and General Partner at Riot Ventures (since 2017). Previously an investor at Saturn Partners (opened the firm’s LA office). Over a decade of experience supporting companies from ideation through growth; serves on boards and advises portfolio companies in robotics, logistics, defense and manufacturing. Holds a BBA from James Madison University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed to growth-stage investments in deep technology: defense & aerospace, logistics & transportation, advanced manufacturing, robotics, hardware + infrastructure, and applied AI/ML for physical industries.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner at Practical Venture Capital. Previously founding partner of 500 Startups and an early investor at Founders Fund; earlier served as Director of Marketing at PayPal. Graduated from Johns Hopkins University (BS, Engineering & Applied Mathematics).
enrichment.career_background: Dave McClure is a Silicon Valley entrepreneur and investor with 25+ years of experience.
