He co‑founded 500 Startups, managed multiple micro‑VC funds, worked on the investment team at Founders Fund, and served as Director of Marketing at PayPal before launching Practical Venture Capital in 2019 to focus on LP/GP and direct secondaries.
enrichment.investment_focus: VC secondaries (LP/GP interests in 5–10 year microVC funds) and direct secondary stakes in breakout portfolio companies; later‑stage/mid‑growth investments in SaaS, marketplaces, fintech and consumer tech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Irish-born venture investor based between San Francisco and London. Former Goldman Sachs TMT banker who ran a corporate VC fund at Universal Music Group. Co‑founder of Tapestry VC and listed as a co‑founder/partner of Amaranthine/Semble; invests in seed and early-stage technical and repeat founders.
enrichment.career_background: Mechanical engineering graduate from University College Dublin. Began his career in TMT investment banking at Goldman Sachs, then founded and ran Universal Music Group’s corporate VC program. Later co‑founded Tapestry VC (and was involved with Amaranthine/Semble) and has led investments across media, consumer and deep‑tech startups while investing from San Francisco and London.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments in technical and repeat founders across the US and EU; focuses on consumer tech, media, robotics/IoT and AI/enterprise software.

enrichment.personal_bio: Lolita Taub is the founder and General Partner of Ganas Ventures, a Latina-led VC that writes $100K checks into pre-seed and seed community‑driven startups across the US and Latin America. She is a community builder who runs a large founders/funders newsletter and matching tools to connect underestimated founders with capital and investors. Based in San Diego, she holds an MBA from IE Business School and a BA from the University of Southern California.
enrichment.career_background: Former sales and operator in enterprise tech (IBM, Cisco), Lolita moved into VC as a Principal at Backstage Capital, served as a scout for Lightspeed, co‑founded The Community Fund, and later launched Ganas Ventures. She has also held roles at Catalyte (Chief of Staff/Corporate Development), been an LP/venture partner in several networks, and runs community and matching products to support early‑stage founders.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed checks (typically $100K) into community‑driven Web2 and Web3 startups headquartered in the US and Latin America, with emphasis on diverse/BIPOC and underrepresented founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner and co‑founder of Flybridge Capital Partners (founded 2002). Early‑stage investor focused on developer platforms, data infrastructure, and AI‑infused complex systems. Co‑founder and investment partner at XFactor Ventures; long‑time board member of MongoDB.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Flybridge in 2002 after serving as a General Partner at Greylock Partners (joined 1994). Earlier worked at Company Assistance Limited (Warsaw) and Bain & Company. Holds a BA (Stanford) and an MBA from Harvard Business School (Baker Scholar).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed investments in AI, data infrastructure, developer platforms, AI‑native vertical SaaS, and AI‑infused complex systems.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director at New York Venture Partners; serial entrepreneur and former founder of SPOT, Launch.it and BrandYourself (acquired). Holds an MBA from Columbia Business School and has sourced, diligenced and invested in dozens of early-stage startups.
enrichment.career_background: Managing Director at New York Venture Partners since 2015, where he focuses on pre-seed/seed investments and portfolio support. Previously co‑founded Launch.it and SPOT and was an early co‑founder/CMO at BrandYourself; holds an MBA from Columbia Business School and a BS from Syracuse University (Whitman School).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / Seed (early-stage); sectors: AI/ML, frontier tech (robotics, space), VR/AR, SaaS, consumer & developer tools, digital transformation

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at Cool Climate Collective and a movement-driven startup investor. Former Venture Partner/EIR at 500 Startups and Google for Startups; co‑founder of Storefront and SocialEarth. Listed on Forbes 30 Under 30 and active in climate tech, Web3, and startup ecosystem programs.
enrichment.career_background: Tristan co‑founded Storefront (marketplace for retail pop‑ups) and SocialEarth, and later served as a Venture Partner at 500 Startups where he helped direct accelerator and seed investments (~$30M) across 200+ startups. He has been Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence at Google for Startups, a Terra ClimateTech VC Fellow, and since 2021 is a Founding Partner at Cool Climate Collective, investing in early‑stage climate solutions and operating a syndicate model.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage climate tech (Pre‑seed/Seed) via syndicate/SPVs — decarbonization, materials & biotech, food/agriculture systems, circular economy, and founder/operator support for go‑to‑market and scaling.

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and angel investor focused on human augmentation; founder of the Human Augmentation Syndicate and co‑founder of Reveri. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area and active as a board member and early‑stage investor. citeturn0search2
enrichment.career_background: Founded and led multiple internet companies (I/PRO, Topica, TextMarks) and has served on boards including Strava, NeoSensory and Freedom Financial; co‑founder of Reveri and active angel investor. Holds a B.S. (MIT) and an MBA (Stanford). citeturn1search2
enrichment.investment_focus: Human augmentation (exoskeletons, enhanced/extra senses), wearables, brain–computer interfaces, genomics. citeturn0search5

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Heartcore Capital based in Austin, TX. Holds a PhD from WHU and focuses on consumer internet, marketplaces and travel. Former entrepreneur and angel investor with board roles in several European consumer startups.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Heartcore in 2013 from Accel Partners. Previously a principal at Atlas Venture and founder/CEO of Qwerly; early angel investor in companies such as Last.fm and Onefinestay. Serves on multiple boards and focuses on early-stage consumer investments and founder support.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed–Series A) consumer internet: DTC brands, marketplaces and travel platforms, and consumer-facing software.

enrichment.personal_bio: Adam Nash is co‑founder and CEO of Daffy, a consumer fintech donor‑advised fund platform. He is a longtime product executive and angel investor who previously served as President & CEO of Wealthfront and as a product leader at LinkedIn and Dropbox. Nash is an adjunct lecturer at Stanford and holds BS/MS (Computer Science) from Stanford and an MBA from Harvard.
interests: Charitable giving / philanthropy and donor‑advised funds
enrichment.career_background: Product and operations executive turned founder and investor. Nash led product at LinkedIn, was President & CEO of Wealthfront, and served as VP of Product & Growth at Dropbox before co‑founding Daffy; he also serves on boards (e.g., Acorns, Shift) and teaches personal finance at Stanford.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage/seed consumer fintech and financial services; product‑led consumer software and marketplaces; developer/tools and fintech adjacent charitable‑tech

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of KW Angel Fund and an NYC-based angel investor. Former early executive at MoPub/Twitter and operator (CEO/cofounder) at Facet and Lever Health. Focuses on supporting technical founding teams and helping companies scale to institutional rounds. citeturn5search5turn2search2
enrichment.career_background: Serial operator and angel: early business lead roles at MoPub (later Twitter) and OneSignal; co-founder/CEO roles at Lever Health and Facet (acquired); founder of KW Angel Fund and active angel/syndicate leader. Background includes business development, GTM and scaling early-stage startups. citeturn2search2turn3search0
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed investments in AdTech, MarTech, B2B/SaaS and SMB software, with interest in health & wellness; typically small checks (commonly $5–10K) and active syndicate participation. citeturn6search6turn5search0

enrichment.personal_bio: Cory Klippsten is the CEO and co‑founder of Swan Bitcoin and a managing partner at Bitcoiner Ventures. He is an angel investor and advisor who has worked at Google, McKinsey, Microsoft and Morgan Stanley and holds an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business. He is a frequent commentator on Bitcoin and lives in Los Angeles with his family.
enrichment.career_background: Klippsten is the founder and CEO of Swan Bitcoin (founded 2019) and a managing partner at Bitcoiner Ventures (partner). Prior to founding startups he held roles at Google, McKinsey, Microsoft and Morgan Stanley and earned an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business. He has served as an advisor to several crypto firms and as an angel investor in early‑stage companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Bitcoin‑focused infrastructure and applications; early‑stage (seed) investments; marketplaces, platforms and SaaS

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner and co-founder at Courtside Ventures, an early-stage VC focused on sports, gaming, fitness and media. He leads investments across sports betting, digital media and wellness and has been involved with early bets such as Beam and The Athletic. Previously a partner at Interplay Ventures and an associate at UBS; BA from University of Maryland, College Park.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and Partner at Courtside Ventures (launched 2016), previously a Partner/Venture Partner at Interplay Ventures and an Associate at UBS. Founded a CRM company for professional and college sports teams and serves/has served on boards including The Athletic and 24 Hour Fitness.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed/Series A) investments in sports, gaming, fitness/wellness, sports media, collectibles and consumer-focused lifestyle startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor at Mucker Capital based in Austin, Texas. Invests in pre-seed, seed, and Series A startups across the Mountain West and Southeastern U.S. Prior roles include Principal at Social Starts and Joyance Partners and Director on the Strategy & Operations team at The Advisory Board Company. Holds a BSE in Operations Research & Financial Engineering from Princeton University and an MBA from the McCombs School of Business (UT Austin).
enrichment.career_background: Joined Mucker Capital in 2020 to invest in and accelerate early-stage companies; previously spent ~3.5 years as a Principal at Social Starts and Joyance Partners focused on software investments in education, consumer and healthcare, and earlier worked in strategy & operations at The Advisory Board Company/EAB advising on revenue, product launches and M&A. Educated at Princeton (BSE) and UT Austin (MBA).
enrichment.investment_focus: Stages: pre-seed, seed, Series A. Sectors: healthcare (distribution/healthtech), alternative education, consumer brands, AI/ML, vertical SaaS, marketplaces. Geography focus: TX, Mountain West, Southeastern U.S.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Lowercarbon Capital focused on early-stage climate tech. Former investor at On Deck, Floodgate and First Round’s Dorm Room Fund; previously led international expansion at Square and served as a tech policy advisor to California Governor Gavin Newsom. Holds an MBA/MA from Wharton and the Lauder Institute and undergraduate degrees from UC San Diego.
enrichment.career_background: Operator‑turned‑investor: led international expansion at Square; worked on investing teams at First Round’s Dorm Room Fund and Floodgate; founding partner at On Deck’s venture fund; joined Lowercarbon Capital initially as Chief of Staff and now serves as Partner, sourcing and shepherding early climate-tech investments. Educated at UC San Diego and the University of Pennsylvania (Wharton + Lauder).
enrichment.investment_focus: Climate tech (carbon removal, energy, electrification, climate infrastructure and software); early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) investments and founder‑led zero‑to‑one support.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner of HCVC / Hardware Club. Former structured‑equity professional at BNP Paribas with an EM Lyon Master in Management. Leads a community‑driven VC focused on scaling hardware and hardtech startups from early stages.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in structured equity at BNP Paribas before co‑founding Hardware Club (HCVC) to build a community and venture arm supporting hardware and hardtech founders. Serves as Founder & Managing Partner at HCVC, co‑founded Elephants & Ventures, and has been active in founding/mentoring initiatives (Hello Tomorrow / Techstars) and board roles for portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage hardtech/hardware (pre‑seed to Series A); sectors include robotics, AI infrastructure, climate/energy, space, defense and tech‑bio.

enrichment.personal_bio: Matt Mullenweg is the co‑founder of WordPress and founder & CEO of Automattic. He is the founder/principal of Audrey Capital, an angel investment and research company, and an active early‑stage investor focused on web and open‑source projects. He is also an avid photographer and public speaker.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑creator of WordPress (2003) and founder of Automattic (2005), Mullenweg has led Automattic as CEO while investing and advising through Audrey Capital. He has served on boards (including GitLab) and has backed a range of developer‑focused and consumer internet companies, maintaining a public profile around open source, distributed work, and web infrastructure.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage angel investments in open‑source software, web publishing, developer tools, web infrastructure, and consumer internet platforms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Lou Kerner is a crypto investor and partner at Blockchain Coinvestors who manages the Blockchain Coinvestors AngelList syndicate. He founded CryptoMondays and the CryptoOracle Collective and has served as CEO of Blockchain Coinvestors Acquisition Corp. Kerner began his career as an equity analyst and later ran internet businesses before moving into VC and crypto investing.
enrichment.career_background: Former equity analyst at Merrill Lynch and Goldman Sachs, Kerner went on to run internet companies (.tv, Bolt), found The Social Internet Fund, and invest as an angel. He later partnered at Flight Ventures and founded CryptoMondays and CryptoOracle; since 2019–2020 he has been a partner/advisor at Blockchain Coinvestors, runs its AngelList syndicate, and has held roles including CEO of Blockchain Coinvestors Acquisition Corp. and Head Crypto Analyst for Quantum Economics.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage blockchain / crypto projects, web3 startups, token investments, fund-of-funds and venture co-investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at First Star Ventures and a technologist-investor based in the Boston/Cambridge area. Focuses on early-stage "hard" tech — AI/ML, decentralization/web3, edge/sensors and computational biotech. Former product/engineering lead at Semantic Machines, Locately (co‑founder/CTO) and Endeca. Holds an AB in Computer Science from Harvard University.
enrichment.career_background: Drew Volpe is a technologist, entrepreneur and investor. He co-founded and is Founding Partner of First Star Ventures (focused on pre-seed/seed deep‑tech investments). Previously he was founding VP of Product Development at Semantic Machines, co‑founder/CTO of Locately, and Director of Product Development at Endeca (acquired by Oracle). He holds an AB in Computer Science from Harvard University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / Seed; deep tech (AI/ML, decentralization/web3, edge/sensors); computational biotechnology / techbio; cloud & infrastructure

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor, entrepreneur, and author focused on the intersection of exponential technologies and decentralized networks. Founder and Managing Partner of Network Society Ventures and founder/trustee of Network Society Research. Active in Web3/blockchain since 2010 and involved in AI, longevity, and the future of work.
enrichment.career_background: David Orban is founder and Managing Partner of Network Society Ventures (since 2015), founder/trustee of Network Society Research and Network Society Lab, CEO of Actioneer, faculty/advisor at Singularity University, and a mentor for the Thiel Fellowship. He studied physics in Italy and has founded and led multiple technology startups while advising and investing in early-stage companies across AI, Web3 and other exponential-tech sectors.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / early-stage investments at the intersection of exponential technologies and decentralized networks (AI, Web3/crypto); sectors include energy, manufacturing, healthcare, education, and finance.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investment professional who served as a partner at Tiger Global Management (joined 2017). Known for leading many of the firm’s fintech and payments investments and for covering emerging markets including India. Reported to have left Tiger Global in July 2024.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in private investments at CPP Investment Board (analyst, ~2011–2014), was a Private Equity Associate at Apollo Global Management (~2014–2017), and joined Tiger Global Management as a partner in 2017 — overseeing fintech and emerging-market deals until his reported departure in July 2024.
enrichment.investment_focus: Fintech and payments; internet and enterprise software; investments across early to late-stage (emphasis on growth-stage), with a focus on emerging markets (notably India).

enrichment.personal_bio: Tod Sacerdoti is a General Partner at Flex Capital and the CEO and co-founder of Pipedream. He previously founded BrightRoll and led its sale to Yahoo for $640M, then served as VP of Display & Video Advertising Products at Yahoo. He is an active angel investor and holds an MBA from Stanford and a B.A. from Yale.
enrichment.career_background: Entrepreneur and investor: founded BrightRoll (served as CEO; led to acquisition by Yahoo), served as VP of Display & Video Advertising Products at Yahoo, co-founded Flex Capital (General Partner) and founded Pipedream (CEO). Active angel investor across developer tools, SaaS, adtech and fintech companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage software investments (seed to Series B) with emphasis on developer tools, B2B SaaS, marketplaces, adtech/video advertising, fintech and data/analytics.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner at Version One Ventures, an early-stage VC based in Vancouver. Former entrepreneur (co‑founder of JustBooks; COO at AbeBooks) with a PhD in Business Economics. Focuses on seed/pre‑seed investments across SaaS, marketplaces, crypto/Web3 and climate/energy. Serves/has served on multiple startup boards and as a board partner at Andreessen Horowitz.
enrichment.career_background: Built and sold an online marketplace (JustBooks) and served as COO of AbeBooks (acquired by Amazon). Earned a PhD from WHU (Otto Beisheim School of Management). Founded Version One Ventures in 2012 to invest in mission‑driven founders; has served as a board partner at Andreessen Horowitz and sits on several company and nonprofit boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage investments in SaaS, marketplaces, crypto/Web3, climate/energy, fintech and enterprise software

enrichment.personal_bio: Technology entrepreneur, investor and operator; co‑founder and President of Operate (a SoCal venture studio) and Managing Director at BankTech Ventures. Focuses on building and investing in data‑centric SaaS and fintech startups; hosts the Operate podcast. MBA, UCLA Anderson; BA, Indiana University.
enrichment.career_background: Serial entrepreneur and operator with senior roles at Aspiration (COO), Happy Money (CMO/founding CMO), Experian Consumer Services (Chief Product & Innovation Officer) and CEO of RealPractice (acquired). Co‑founded OC4/Operate in 2019 to run an operator‑first venture studio and has served as investor, board member and advisor to multiple startups in SaaS, fintech and data/analytics.
enrichment.investment_focus: Data‑centric B2B SaaS; fintech & community/bank technology; early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) operator‑embedded investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Raizlabs (sold 2017) and former Managing Director of Techstars Boston. Currently a general partner at Raiz Capital / FoundersEdge and an active angel investor and advisor; Tufts University alumnus.
enrichment.career_background: Began his career on the Windows XP user-experience team at Microsoft. In 2003 he founded Raizlabs (mobile design & engineering), sold the company in 2017 and stayed on as Chief Innovation Officer with the acquirer. He later served as Managing Director of Techstars Boston and founded Raiz Capital / FoundersEdge, working as an early-stage investor and mentor to startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) startups; healthcare & medtech; climate/clean tech; user-experience-led consumer and enterprise software; mobile and AI-driven products.

name: Gil Penchina
firm: Ridge Ventures (Formerly known as IDG Ventures USA)

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Ridge Ventures (joined 2011; promoted to Managing Director in 2017). Serial entrepreneur and prolific angel investor active across crypto and early‑stage technology startups. Former member of the pre‑IPO eBay team and ex‑CEO of Wikia; holds a BS (UMass Amherst) and an MBA (Kellogg).
enrichment.career_background: Joined Ridge Ventures as a Venture Partner in 2011 and as a Managing Director in 2017. Previously served on eBay’s pre‑IPO executive team (VP/GM roles), was CEO of Wikia (Fandom), and has founded/co‑founded startups and angel syndicates (Flight.vc). Active angel investor with 100+ personal investments and multiple board/advisor roles.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed / Series A) enterprise and consumer software, developer infrastructure, fintech and crypto.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and co‑CEO of Odin (a platform for structuring SPVs and deploying angel/fund capital). Former Project Director – Ventures at Coca‑Cola European/Europacific Partners (CCEP) and Head of Inbound at Crowdcube. Trinity College Dublin alumnus with experience building and advising consumer and Go‑to‑Market startups.
enrichment.career_background: Patrick (often called Paddy) Ryan co‑founded Odin in 2020 to simplify deal structuring and capital deployment. Prior roles include Project Director – Ventures at Coca‑Cola European/Europacific Partners (CCEP) (2019–2020) and Head of Inbound at Crowdcube (2017–2019); he has also founded consumer ventures (e.g., Ishka Wines & Spirits) and worked on market entry for Irish trade in Russia. He studied at Trinity College Dublin and has been active as an angel/investor.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage/seed investments in sustainability & climate tech (packaging, water, emissions), consumer brands and RTM, and B2B e‑commerce/retail‑tech and supply‑chain solutions.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at Amasia, a thesis‑driven VC focused on climate and sustainability. Over 30 years in venture/private equity with prior roles at General Atlantic, Insight Partners, TH Lee Putnam Ventures and Kubera Partners. Chairs the Board of Trustees at the University of Pennsylvania and is active in climate‑focused philanthropy and advisory roles.
enrichment.career_background: Ramanan has been a venture investor for more than three decades. He began his career at McKinsey and General Atlantic, was an early partner at Insight Partners, co‑managed TH Lee Putnam Ventures, co‑founded Kubera Partners, and in 2013 co‑founded Amasia to invest in sustainability and climate companies. He serves as Chair of the University of Pennsylvania Board of Trustees and on several nonprofit and academic advisory councils.
enrichment.investment_focus: Climate & sustainability, behavior‑change driven solutions; Seed to Series B; cross‑border investments (US, Southeast Asia, India, Europe, Latin America)

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial technology entrepreneur and angel investor based in the San Francisco Bay Area. Founder of Archimedes (Archimedes Labs/Archimedes Accelerator), founding shareholder of TechCrunch, and founder & CEO of SignalRank. Has advised and invested in early-stage software and platform companies globally.
enrichment.career_background: Keith Teare is a long-time Silicon Valley entrepreneur and investor. He founded Archimedes (an incubator/accelerator), co-founded or led multiple companies including RealNames and Cyberia, was a founding shareholder of TechCrunch, served senior roles at Accelerated Digital Ventures, and currently leads SignalRank. His activity spans founding, advising, and early-stage investing with a focus on software platforms and emerging tech.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and seed investments in software/platform companies; interests in AI, blockchain/web3 and platform-enabled consumer/enterprise startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Angel investor and operator. Served as Principal, ODX and Head of the On Deck Investor Network (2021–2022). Listed as VP, Corporate Development at Merit (from 2022) and has acted as an advisor and board observer to several early-stage startups.
enrichment.career_background: Worked on investor and community programs at On Deck (Principal, ODX; Head of the On Deck Investor Network, 2021–2022). Has held corporate development and partnerships roles (listed at Merit from 2022) and operates as an angel investor and advisor to early-stage companies. Education listed as a B.S. from DePaul University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage angel investments in GovTech, education, fintech and companies at the intersection of regulation and technology.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and former CEO of Yobs (an AI interview-intelligence startup acquired by Gong). Product leader at Gong (Director / GM-level product roles) and an operator-investor who co-founded Evening Fund to write ~$50–100K checks into early-stage startups. Based in New York (Brooklyn).
enrichment.career_background: Raphael Danilo co-founded Yobs (talent/interview intelligence) and led it through venture funding and acquisition by Gong; after the acquisition he joined Gong in product leadership roles. He is an operator-investor (co-founded Evening Fund) and has been active as an angel/GP investing in early-stage AI and enterprise startups while advising several startups and funds.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed/Series A) startups; B2B SaaS and enterprise AI/ML (including HR/recruiting tools); operator-led investing with typical checks in the ~$50K–$100K range.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner and co-founder of Off The Grid Ventures, an early-stage VC that backs women and foreign/immigrant founders in B2B tech and fintech. Formerly active in secondary direct and venture investing (Arc Venture Partners, Cipio Partners) and began his career in investment banking. Holds an MBA from Wharton and degrees from Sciences Po and Sorbonne University.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at Off The Grid Ventures (since 2016). Prior roles include co‑founder/managing partner at Arc Venture Partners, senior/venture partner roles at Cipio Partners and related firms, and early-career investment banking at Lehman Brothers / BNP Paribas. Educated at Sciences Po, Sorbonne University and The Wharton School (MBA).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed stage investments in B2B/enterprise software and fintech; emphasis on investing in women and foreign/immigrant founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: Andrew Tan is a San Francisco–based entrepreneur and early-stage investor. He is founder of Nova (acquired) and a general partner at Builders (Builders VC). Tan has held AI/product and data roles at Handshake, Google, and Sequoia and writes newsletters on AI and founders.
enrichment.career_background: Founder of Nova (acquired); founder of Builders Capital (Builders syndicate) and active angel investor. Prior roles include leading generative AI/product at Handshake and data science/product roles at Sequoia and Google; involved in writing and curating AI-focused newsletters and operating/venture roles since 2018.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed–Series A); AI / generative AI, enterprise SaaS, developer tools, fintech, deep tech

enrichment.personal_bio: New York–based investor and partner at Backpocket. Previously a Principal at Comcast/Genacast and Senior Principal at B Capital; began in venture at Bloomberg Beta after engineering roles at Tapad. Focuses on early-stage technology companies across fintech, SaaS, AI and related sectors.
enrichment.career_background: Morgan Polotan is an early-stage investor with a background in engineering and venture capital. He worked at Bloomberg Beta early in his VC career, served as Principal at Comcast Ventures/Genacast, was Senior Principal at B Capital, and has held partner roles (including Monashee/Backpocket). He has led or supported seed and Series A investments across fintech, infrastructure, quantum hardware, and enterprise software.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) investments in FinTech, SMB SaaS, AI, Web3/Crypto, PropTech, Payments and Marketplaces.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of K50 Ventures, a purpose-driven early-stage firm focusing on access and affordability for the world’s working class. Based in New York, he invests primarily at pre-seed and seed and has a background as an entrepreneur and early-stage investor. Prior roles include investor at Blumberg Capital and operator roles at 1-Page and Jumptap.
enrichment.career_background: Ryan Bloomer founded K50 Ventures and serves as its managing partner; the firm writes first institutional checks into mission-driven founders across health, finance, and work. Before K50 he founded two startups, worked on business development at Jumptap, was an early hire at 1-Page, and invested at Blumberg Capital; he has also been involved with the Kairos founder community.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed & seed; sectors: health, finance (fintech/financial inclusion), work (SMB/future-of-work); geographies: US, Latin America, Africa; typical check size $250K–$2M.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Partech (joined 2019) and founding partner of Irregular Expressions. Former CTO and engineering leader at startups including Cadre, Fountain, One Kings Lane and Mint. Focuses on early-stage investments in developer-focused infrastructure and tooling.
enrichment.career_background: Engineer-turned-investor with 20+ years in technical leadership. Held VP/CTO roles at Mint, One Kings Lane, Fountain and Cadre; earlier engineering roles at Motorola and Oracle. Began angel/advising activity in 2012, founded the Irregular Expressions syndicate in 2018 and joined Partech's venture team in 2019. Holds an M.S. in Computer Science from Telecom Paris (Télécom ParisTech).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed / Series A) technology startups, primarily business-to-developer tools: developer tooling, infrastructure, observability, ML/MLOps, data infrastructure, security; selective fintech and SaaS.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at First Row Partners who focuses on pre-seed investing in creator-led media, commerce and SMB software. Lecturer at the University of Washington Foster School teaching angel investing and entrepreneurship. 25+ years in the startup ecosystem with prior founder and leadership roles; co‑founder of The $1k Project.
enrichment.career_background: Minda Brusse co‑founded First Row Partners (Seattle) to invest in pre‑seed software companies and applies arts‑based frameworks to sourcing and supporting founders. She is a Venture Partner/Network Partner with 2048 Ventures, has served as a fund manager and scout in Seattle angel groups, teaches experiential investing courses at the UW Foster School, and previously held operating and leadership roles at startups and Accenture. She also co‑founded The $1k Project, which raised and distributed cash grants during the COVID‑19 pandemic.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed investments in creator-controlled media & commerce, SMB software and data services, and education/entrepreneurship-focused tech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner and co‑founder of Seaside Ventures, focused on investing in science‑driven consumer health and wellness startups. Former co‑founder/operator of Kyoku and USC Iovine Young Academy alum; supports portfolio companies on commercialization, manufacturing, and go‑to‑market.
enrichment.career_background: Harrison Valner (known as Harry) co‑founded Seaside Ventures in 2021 and serves as Managing Partner, leading external engagement, investor relations, and portfolio operations. Earlier he co‑founded Kyoku, worked in product and operations roles at startups (including ROBO 3D during high school) and studied at USC's Iovine Young Academy. At Seaside he focuses on commercializing consumer health products and connecting founders to operational and distribution partners.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage/seed investments in science‑driven consumer health and wellness (preventive medicine/Medicine 3.0), longevity, biotech, therapeutics, and consumer health products.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner at Four Acres Capital and co‑founder of Supernode Ventures. Former investor at Eniac Ventures with earlier roles in operations at Minibar Delivery and as an analyst at Goldman Sachs. MBA from Columbia Business School; BA from University of Pennsylvania.
enrichment.career_background: Started in investment management at Goldman Sachs, moved to operations at Minibar Delivery, then into VC at Eniac Ventures. Co‑founded Supernode Ventures (managing partner) and later launched Four Acres Capital as a founding partner focused on software-first early-stage companies. Educated at the University of Pennsylvania (BA) and Columbia Business School (MBA).
enrichment.hometown: New York City, New York, United States
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed & seed-stage software-first companies (consumer mobile, enterprise/productivity, marketplaces/e‑commerce, hardware/IoT)

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Emergence Capital since 2010. Led Emergence's early investment in Zoom and serves on several public and private company boards. Former founder of AXG Tecnonexo and holds an MBA from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Emergence in 2010 and was later promoted to General Partner; has led/partnered on investments including Zoom, Chorus.ai and Crunchbase. Prior to VC he founded AXG Tecnonexo, a SaaS e-learning company operating across Latin America and the U.S. He is a Kauffman Fellow and Endeavor Entrepreneur and holds a BS in economics from Universidad de San Andrés and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Cloud and enterprise SaaS (B2B software), enterprise/go-to-market applications, digital media

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Endure Capital, an early-stage, cross-border VC founded in 2015. Entrepreneur and former software engineer who has invested in startups across MENA, Africa and global markets (early investor in Careem and other notable companies). Active in ecosystem development and founder mentoring.
enrichment.career_background: Tarek trained as a software engineer and worked in embedded software and consulting (including IBM Global Delivery Services and Skopos Consulting). He founded Tamkeen Capital and later launched Endure Capital in 2015. He also founded the nonprofit Alboraq and has served on boards such as Endeavor Egypt. Education listed in public profiles includes Ain Shams University, The American University in Cairo and coursework at MIT.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed to Series A), cross-border investments with sector-agnostic mandate favoring transportation/mobility, fintech, digital health, marketplaces/e-commerce, and deep/impact tech in MENA/Africa and select global opportunities.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Second Century Ventures and a lead for the REACH accelerator, focused on sourcing and supporting real estate technology startups. Former founder/executive with operating experience at BitTorrent, Avalon Digital Marketing Systems and CaptureQuest. Educated at Brigham Young University (BA) and MIT (Master's).
interests: Fintech for property and mortgage-related products
SaaS and data-driven real estate analytics
enrichment.career_background: Tyler Thompson is a managing partner at Second Century Ventures and a managing partner for REACH, the fund’s real-estate-focused accelerator. He sources and diligences early-to-mid stage PropTech investments and supports portfolio companies through REACH. Prior roles include strategic relations at BitTorrent and executive/CEO positions at Avalon Digital Marketing Systems and CaptureQuest; he also held business-development roles at Deductr and the Business Software Alliance.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early to mid-stage investments in real estate technology (PropTech), SaaS and data-enabled startups, adjacent fintech and home services (seed through Series B).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at Starting Line, a Chicago-based seed-stage consumer venture firm. Previously a Principal at Chicago Ventures and a Kauffman Fellow. Holds an MBA from University of Chicago Booth and a BA from New York University; focuses on consumer marketplaces, products and consumer fintech.
enrichment.career_background: Founded and runs Starting Line (launched 2018). Prior to Starting Line he was Principal at Chicago Ventures and an Entrepreneur at Foundation Capital; earlier roles include Director of Marketing at CardRunners and a period as a professional poker player. Kauffman Fellow (Class 18); MBA, University of Chicago Booth; BA, New York University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage consumer startups (marketplaces, direct-to-consumer products & services, consumer fintech, creator-economy platforms).

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner and founding managing member at Canvas Ventures. Former partner at New Enterprise Associates (NEA) and co‑founder of Mazu Networks (acquired by Riverbed). Focuses on marketplaces, enterprise SaaS, and data/AI-enabled platforms. Holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and a BSc from MIT.
enrichment.career_background: Paul spent ten years as a partner at NEA, working on multiple companies that reached public markets or successful acquisitions. He co‑founded Mazu Networks (network security) before moving into VC, and joined Canvas as a founding managing member in 2014. He began his career at Medtronic and McKinsey and holds degrees from MIT (BS) and Harvard Business School (MBA).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (primarily Series A/B) software and services: fintech, digital health, enterprise SaaS, marketplaces/logistics, real estate, and AI/data platforms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at 7percent Ventures and a serial entrepreneur turned investor focused on deeptech and frontier technologies. Co‑founder of the ICE founder community and DragonChasers; sits on the boards of Universal Quantum, AeroVolt and Greenjets. Former founder of startups including BritishPathe.com, Playtxt and Rummble.
enrichment.career_background: Andrew J Scott is a multi‑time founder who transitioned to venture investing as a founding partner of 7percent Ventures (est. 2014). He has founded and led multiple startups (notably BritishPathe.com, Playtxt and Rummble), co‑founded the ICE founder network, and invests primarily in pre‑seed/seed deeptech and transformative software companies. He serves on several portfolio boards and splits time between the UK and US.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed / Seed and early stage investments in deeptech and transformative software; sectors include quantum computing, AI/future compute, spacetech/aerospace, hardware/robotics, and climate/clean technologies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at The Refiners, a San Francisco‑based seed fund and accelerator. Repeat entrepreneur originally from France (founder/CEO roles at Emakina/Reflect, blueKiwi, Kwarter) and founder/CEO of Uncut.fm; host of the Silicon Carne podcast. Active in pre‑seed/seed investing and mentoring international founders.
enrichment.career_background: Serial entrepreneur who founded Reflect (Emakina), blueKiwi (sold to ATOS), and Kwarter; co‑founded The Refiners (2016) to run a Silicon Valley accelerator for foreign founders and later launched Diaspora Ventures (rolling fund) and Uncut.fm. Based in San Francisco after moving from France; serves as investor, mentor and advisor to early‑stage startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed stage; sector‑agnostic with emphasis on cross‑border/international founders, B2B and B2C startups (SaaS, marketplaces, consumer products), and early creator‑economy/web3 opportunities.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of PIABO, a Berlin-based communications agency serving tech and digital-economy companies. Active business angel and limited partner, invested in multiple VC funds and startups. Regular speaker, mentor and host of the "Business Class" podcast focused on technology and entrepreneurship.
enrichment.career_background: Founded PIABO in 2006 and leads the agency as CEO. Previously Head of Global Corporate Communications at Jamba; co‑founder of enable2grow and a partner in MXP Ventures / Millwright-related initiatives. Acts as an angel investor and LP across seed/early-stage funds and sits on/works with several investment committees and VC partners internationally.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed to early-stage tech (SaaS, marketplaces, fintech, healthtech, AI/ML, Web3/blockchain, consumer & deep tech); strategic investments tied to international growth, brand and communications support.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Commsor (community/go-to-network platform). Serial community builder who started The Chunk (a Minecraft network) and the Community Club; active angel investor in early-stage tech startups. Based primarily in Copenhagen (previously New York).
enrichment.career_background: Mac Reddin is the founder and CEO of Commsor (founded 2019), a platform that helps companies measure and activate their networks and communities. He previously built and exited The Chunk (a Minecraft gaming network) and founded the Community Club; he has participated as an angel investor in several early-stage rounds while leading Commsor as it scaled internationally.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and Series A investments; early-stage tech with emphasis on community/impact, B2B SaaS, and go-to-market/network-driven startups (typical check sizes reported $100K–$1M+).

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at 1517 Fund who focuses on pre-seed and seed investments in deep tech. Writer and career coach who maintains a personal website and runs Get Ahead Labs. Former early operator at Praxis and advisor to several startups.
enrichment.career_background: Joined 1517 Fund in a marketing role in 2017, served as Principal (2019–2022) and is listed as Partner (since 2022). Former founding-team operator at Praxis (roles included COO and Business Development Director). Runs Get Ahead Labs and has held advisor roles at startups including Quickcard and Usage AI. Attended the University of Pennsylvania.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage investments in deep tech, biotech, energy/cleantech, industrials and hardware, founder-first teams

enrichment.personal_bio: Brett Fink is a partner and founder associated with Greater Holding Company / GRTR BRNDS, based in Los Angeles. He was an early hire and Senior Vice President at Old Pal and has prior roles at 500 Startups, Snap, Casper, and Moderne Ventures. Fink advises and makes angel investments in early-stage consumer and DTC brands and leads brand, licensing, and go-to-market work for regulated consumer categories.
interests: Cannabis / hemp brands and regulated consumer products
enrichment.career_background: Started in product and growth roles at Snapchat and Casper, then moved into accelerator and venture roles at 500 Startups and Moderne Ventures. He joined Old Pal as a founding-team Senior VP to scale a multi-state cannabis brand, and subsequently founded/lead GRTR BRNDS / Greater Holding Company, a studio/advisory focused on building consumer brands in regulated industries while also angel investing in early-stage startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage consumer brands (CPG), cannabis/hemp brands, DTC/e-commerce, brand partnerships and licensing, seed/pre-seed angel investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Marc Ladin is a partner at Project Voice Capital Partners (PVCP) and co‑founder/general partner of VoicePunch, focused on voice and conversational AI investing. Formerly a marketing executive (CMO) at several fast‑growth SaaS companies, he now invests in early‑stage voice/NLP startups. He is based in the Los Angeles / Santa Monica area.
enrichment.career_background: Marc Ladin has led marketing and growth at startups and scaleups (Everbridge, TigerConnect, CallFire and others) and transitioned to investing in voice and conversational AI. He founded VoicePunch (voice‑focused early‑stage fund) and joined Project Voice Capital Partners as a partner; he has served on boards/advisory roles for companies including MagicLinks.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) conversational AI and voice/audio startups; generative AI/NLP and voice‑first interfaces; typically small seed checks via a rolling fund model (PVCP).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and partner at AgFunder. PhD in computational biology from Yale; background as a scientist and engineer. Publishes and speaks on agrifood, foodtech and agtech topics.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and partner at AgFunder, a venture firm focused on agrifood, AI, biology and climate. Holds a PhD from Yale University in computational biology and several other degrees; prior work as a scientist/engineer and frequent contributor/speaker on food & agriculture technology.
enrichment.investment_focus: Agrifoodtech (agtech & foodtech); biotechnology & computational biology; robotics & agricultural automation; AI/ML for agriculture; climate tech; typically seed to Series A

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director, General Partner and CFO at AAF Management Ltd., a Washington D.C.–based early‑stage venture firm. 17+ years of experience across corporate finance, investor relations and venture investing; co‑founded AAF and has deployed capital across the US, Europe and MENA. Holds a B.A. from the University of Chicago and an MBA from Wharton; resides in Washington, D.C.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and senior investment leader at AAF Management Ltd. (since 2016), responsible for sourcing, investing and fund finance. Prior to AAF spent ~10 years at OCI N.V. (investor relations, strategy, corporate finance) and earlier roles at Deloitte Tax LLP (Chicago) and Deutsche Bank leveraged finance (London). Also invests via family office Darwazah Capital and is a Kauffman Fellow (Class 25).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑Seed, Seed and Series A; sectors include fintech, blockchain/crypto, digital health, enterprise software and consumer marketplaces; also invests in and allocates to emerging managers.

enrichment.firm_name: Launch House (House Capital / Launch House Ventures)
enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and investor focused on community-driven startups and health. Co‑founder of Launch House and Commsor; founder & CEO of Superpower. General Partner at Launch House’s venture arm (House Capital) investing in early‑stage companies.
enrichment.career_background: Worked as a data scientist at J.P. Morgan early in his career. Co‑founded Commsor (community software) and later co‑founded Launch House; helped launch Launch House’s venture arm (House Capital / Launch House Ventures) and serves as a GP. More recently founded Superpower, a consumer health/longevity startup, while continuing to invest in pre‑seed and seed companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and Seed; community-driven consumer startups, Web3/crypto, fintech, B2B SaaS, creator tools, and health/longevity

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture / growth investor at Smash Capital based in New York. Previously worked in investment roles including Investment Manager at AirTree. Educated in commerce/economics at UNSW with exchange study at the University of Amsterdam and a summer program at LSE.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Smash Capital in a venture/growth investing role (role listed from 2022). Prior to Smash he held investment roles at AirTree (2020–2022) and has served as a board observer/member for multiple startups (e.g., Mr Yum, Joyn, Lanes & Planes).
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth-stage venture investments (seed through later stages) in consumer internet, software, marketplaces, gaming, FinTech and AI. Typical check range reported ~$100K–$5M with a target/sweet-spot near $1.5M.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner of Chingona Ventures, an institutionally-backed pre-seed fund focused on tech and tech-enabled U.S. startups. Former investor at MATH Venture Partners and earlier roles at Goldman Sachs. Holds a BSE in Industrial & Operations Engineering from the University of Michigan and an MBA from Northwestern (Kellogg). Active in Chicago’s startup ecosystem and co-founder of the Latinx Founders Collective.
interests: Underrepresented/Latinx founders and diversity in VC
enrichment.career_background: Samara Mejia Hernandez founded Chingona Ventures in 2019 and serves as its sole/lead general partner, building a portfolio across fintech, health tech, future of learning and future of work. Prior to founding Chingona she was an investor/venture partner at MATH Venture Partners and spent several years at Goldman Sachs in asset management and FICC roles. She is a Kauffman Fellow, sits on multiple boards/advisory roles, and co-founded the Latinx Founders Collective.
enrichment.investment_focus: Primarily pre-seed and seed-stage U.S. tech and tech-enabled companies (FinTech, Future of Learning, Future of Work, Health/Wellness) with emphasis on underrepresented founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner and founder of A-Force Ventures, an early-stage fund that backs female-led and consumer-focused startups. Experienced media and technology executive who led music and virtual experiences at Roblox and later served as CEO of Napster. Based in Nashville, TN.
enrichment.career_background: Over 25 years in media, mobile and technology across the UK, Asia and the U.S.; held roles at BMG and Bertelsmann (international business development), AT&T Wireless (launched mobile music services), Endemol (digital and branded entertainment), and was VP, Global Head of Music at Roblox before becoming CEO of Napster. Founder of Tribalist and Managing Partner of A-Force Ventures; holds degrees in Chinese and Economics from Durham University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed, seed, Series A) consumer internet and mobile startups, with emphasis on female founders and consumer lifestyle sectors (travel, health, entertainment, consumer products, dating, fashion, education); also active in gaming, metaverse and web3-related consumer businesses.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Cabra VC. Active investor in early-stage B2B software and subscription businesses, focusing on pre-seed/seed and early rounds in the US, India and Europe. Serves on boards of several portfolio companies including Improvado and Mobalytics. Mentor at accelerators such as 500 Startups and Alchemist.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Cabra VC in 2016 and has 15+ years of experience in business development, product launches and partnerships. Previously founded/led retail, R&D and fintech startups in Russia, and has served as mentor at 500 Startups and Alchemist. Holds a graduate degree (M.Sc.) in strategic management from the Higher School of Economics.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / Seed and early-stage VC; B2B SaaS, enterprise & subscription businesses; geographic focus: USA, India, Europe

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner and co-founder at Locus Ventures, a seed-stage VC investing across North America and Asia. Former software engineer at Facebook and founding engineer at Operator. Holds graduate degrees from Stanford University and Carnegie Mellon University. Active angel/seed investor in B2B and consumer startups.
enrichment.career_background: Co-founded Locus Ventures (2016) and invests at seed/early stages. Prior to venture work he was a software engineer at Oracle, Yahoo, and Facebook and a founding engineer at Operator. Education includes an M.S. in Management Science & Engineering from Stanford and engineering degrees from Carnegie Mellon.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments across AI, FinTech, B2B SaaS, cloud/infrastructure and climate tech; geographic focus on North America and Asia.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Digitalis Ventures, a New York–based venture firm that backs early-stage companies in life sciences, health technologies, and animal health. Serves on multiple boards and trustees (including The Jackson Laboratory) and chairs Digitalis Commons, a nonprofit for public-interest health technologies. Educated B.A. (Williams College) and J.D. (University of Pennsylvania Law School). citeturn1view0turn3search1
enrichment.career_background: Founder and Managing Partner of Digitalis Ventures (founded 2016). Co‑founder and General Partner at Ascent Biomedical Ventures. Previously founding Director of the Mount Sinai Institute of Technology and a professor in the Department of Population Health Science and Policy at the Icahn School of Medicine; active trustee and board member for research and global organizations. Represents Digitalis on boards including GRO Biosciences and Terray Therapeutics. citeturn1view0turn3search1turn7search2
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage companies across life sciences, health technologies & services, and animal health (human health, biotech, healthtech, and animal/companion health). citeturn8search5turn7search2

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Foundry Group since 2015, focused on early-stage investing and building Foundry’s partner-fund strategy. Previously managed the private investment program for the University of Texas Investment Management Company (UTIMCO). Holds an MBA from the University of Texas at Austin and a BBA from Texas Christian University; is a CPA and CFA charterholder. Based in Boulder, Colorado.
interests: Institutional LP/fund strategy and supporting emerging managers
Founder mentoring and portfolio company support
Network-building across founders, GPs, and LPs
enrichment.career_background: Lindel managed UTIMCO’s private investment program for over a decade where he developed the endowment’s venture program, then joined Foundry as a partner in 2015 to lead direct investments and Foundry’s partner-fund strategy. Earlier he worked in KPMGs M&A tax practice. He holds an MBA (UT Austin), a BBA (TCU), and is both a CPA and CFA charterholder.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage technology startups (seed through Series A); direct company investments and investments in/partnering with other venture funds; LP/fund strategy and emerging-manager support.

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and early-stage investor. Co‑founder and CEO of Autograph and co‑founder/former CEO of AbstractOps. General Partner / active angel with Autopilot Fund; focuses on products that automate work and serve as systems of record. Holds degrees from Northwestern University and Stanford University.
interests: People / HR tech and headcount tooling
enrichment.career_background: Started in management consulting (BCG), then joined the founding team and served as COO at Forge (Equidate). Co‑founded AbstractOps (CEO), became an active angel and General Partner at Autopilot Fund, and is currently co‑founder & CEO of Autograph, a people‑intelligence / HR platform. Educated at Northwestern (BA) and Stanford (MS).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed, occasionally Series A) enterprise SaaS: systems-of-record & data platforms, workflow automation / 'API for X' products, people/HR tech, and marketplaces.

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial entrepreneur and early-stage investor active in Brazil's startup ecosystem since the late 1990s. Co‑founder of Bossanova (Bossa Invest) and founder/CEO of Nuvini. Known for leading high-volume pre-seed investments and for operating serial-acquirer strategies in SaaS.
enrichment.career_background: Founded multiple internet and marketing companies (Zeek, ideia.com, Conectis, Experience Club) before co-founding Bossanova (Bossa Invest) in 2011. At Bossanova he helped scale a high-volume pre-seed investment platform; in 2020 he co-founded Nuvini, a SaaS roll-up/holding focused on acquiring and scaling B2B software businesses.
enrichment.investment_focus: B2B and B2B2C technology startups (particularly SaaS); pre-seed / early-stage investments in Brazil/Latin America; SaaS consolidation and acquisition-led growth strategies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Clinical psychologist and entrepreneur who served as an Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence at Trinity Ventures. Founding team member at Omada Health, founder/CEO of Maximus, and an Assistant Clinical Professor at UCSF. Advises and angel‑invests in early‑stage health and consumer startups.
enrichment.career_background: Trained as a clinical psychologist (BA Harvard; PhD UCLA) who moved into health‑tech entrepreneurship and venture investing. He was a founding clinical leader at Omada Health, founded Actualize, served as Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence at Trinity Ventures (2018), has advised VCs and startups, and is the founder and CEO of Maximus while holding a part‑time clinical professor role at UCSF.
enrichment.investment_focus: Health tech and consumer health (digital therapeutics, telemedicine, consumer wellness); consumer & enterprise software; typical stages: pre‑seed/seed to Series A (angel and co‑investments).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder‑turned‑investor. Previously founded Re:store (acquired) and co‑founded Showcast; served as a Scout investor for Sequoia Capital beginning in 2022. Advises and mentors early consumer and creator‑focused startups.
enrichment.career_background: Selene founded Re:store (pre‑seed led by Sequoia) and later co‑founded Showcast; both businesses led to exits/mergers. Since 2022 she has invested as a Scout for Sequoia Capital and worked as an advisor/mentor to consumer and retail startups and corporate innovation teams (including advisory roles with Chanel and Intel Ignite).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed / seed consumer and creator‑focused startups (creator economy, social commerce, marketplaces, AR/VR, product‑led growth)

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner and co‑founder of Adapt Ventures, an early‑stage VC and venture studio. Previously on the investment team at Plug and Play Ventures; focuses on transformative solutions across legacy industries (financial services, industrials, real estate). Named to Forbes 30 Under 30 (Venture Capital). Educated at New York University (BS) and Imperial College London (MSc).
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at Adapt Ventures (since 2020). Prior experience on the investment team at Plug and Play Ventures. Holds a corporate strategy / director role at GK (corporate group) and serves as board observer/advisor roles for select portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) investments in fintech, B2B SaaS, consumer, marketplaces, real estate and industrials; global mandate with emphasis on the US, Latin America and MENA.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner on the consumer investing team at Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), focused on AI and consumer apps. Previously an early-stage investor at CRV and an analyst on Goldman Sachs’ Alternative Investments & Manager Selection team. Stanford BA (Economics) and Stanford GSB MBA; co‑founder of the Accelerated newsletter and co‑creator of Cardinal Ventures at Stanford.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Andreessen Horowitz as a partner on the consumer/AI investing team (role from 2021). Prior to a16z she invested at CRV (2017–2021) and began her career at Goldman Sachs; while at Stanford she co‑founded the on‑campus incubator Cardinal Ventures and later co‑founded the Accelerated newsletter/community.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer & consumer AI; marketplaces; creator tools; SMB software and automation; early-stage (seed/Series A) investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Transpose Platform (founded 2015). Co‑founder and Chairman of AGI House Accelerator and former executive at Trusted Insight. Prior roles include investment leadership at Sutter Health and positions at Merrill Lynch, Visa and BNY Mellon.
enrichment.career_background: Trang Nguyen co‑founded Transpose Platform in 2015 and leads the firm’s formation‑stage investing and platform-building efforts. She co‑founded AGI House Accelerator and previously served as an executive at Trusted Insight. Earlier in her career she led investment initiatives for Sutter Health (managing institutional portfolios) and held roles at Merrill Lynch, Visa and BNY Mellon; she holds an MBA from UC San Diego (Rady School).
enrichment.investment_focus: Formation‑stage and early‑stage venture investing; AI/deep tech, platforms, fintech, enterprise software; partner to founders and venture studio formation

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner at Good Growth Capital, focused on early-stage transformative science and technology investments. Former CEO of Ignition Ventures, inventor with multiple patents, and board member for several portfolio companies. Holds degrees from Harvard (A.B.), Cambridge (M.Phil), and an MBA from MIT Sloan.
interests: Early-stage deep tech (life sciences & hard sciences)
Medical devices, diagnostics and monitoring technologies
enrichment.career_background: Co-founder and Managing Partner at Good Growth Capital (early-stage VC). Previously CEO of Ignition Ventures where she helped spin out technology-based companies from academic labs. Serves on multiple for‑profit and non‑profit boards, has authored articles for outlets including Newsweek and Harvard Business Review, and holds several patents. Education: A.B. (Harvard), M.Phil in Plant Sciences (Cambridge), MBA (MIT Sloan).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed, seed and Series A investments in transformative science and technology — primarily life sciences (medtech, diagnostics, therapeutics), data science, GreenTech/hard sciences and advanced materials.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and former CEO of Goji (a fintech asset-management platform). Venture Partner at Vala Capital focusing on sustainability investments; also works as a venture coach and advisor to early-stage ClimateTech and sustainability founders.
enrichment.career_background: Jake founded Goji and led the business through multiple VC investment rounds; he is a chartered accountant by background and later moved into investing, advisory and founder coaching. He serves as a Venture Partner at Vala Capital and is involved with several portfolio companies (including Sennen and Mondra).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed/early) investments in Sustainability and ClimateTech, with experience in FinTech and asset-management related businesses.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner at Graph Ventures and an active angel investor. Former head of product partnerships at Uber and former product/business roles at Facebook. Holds an MBA from Stanford and a BA from McGill; focuses on early-stage, product-led startups.
enrichment.career_background: Matt Wyndowe is a founding partner at Graph Ventures where he invests in and advises early-stage, product-driven startups. He previously led product partnerships at Uber and held product and business development roles at Facebook; earlier in his career he worked at McKinsey and several startups. He holds an MBA from Stanford and a BA in Economics (with computer science) from McGill.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed) product & platform companies; SaaS/SMB software, marketplaces, developer tools/infrastructure, consumer apps, education tech

enrichment.personal_bio: Silicon Valley-based angel investor and startup advisor. Early member of the Python core team (BeOpen/PythonLabs) and co‑founder/CEO of Ceqoo. Member of Sand Hill Angels with multiple seed-stage investments, focused on enterprise SaaS and developer-facing products.
enrichment.career_background: Seasoned Silicon Valley software executive who worked on early Python releases at BeOpen/PythonLabs, co‑founded Ceqoo, and has served as an advisor and angel investor (member of Sand Hill Angels). Active in seed-stage investing and go‑to‑market/sales enablement topics.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage and early-stage investments in enterprise SaaS, enterprise/SMB software, health care IT, developer tools, and AdTech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder & CEO of Reforge and growth-focused angel investor; advisor to Long Journey Ventures. Former VP of Growth at HubSpot, he writes and teaches on product-led growth and growth strategy.
enrichment.career_background: Founder and CEO of Reforge (since 2016). Previously VP of Growth at HubSpot (2014–2016), Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence at Trinity Ventures, and co‑founder of startups including Viximo and Boundless. Active advisor and angel investor to early‑stage companies, focusing on product and growth.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage startups (pre‑seed, seed, Series A); SaaS, marketplaces, networks, consumer internet, AI, and product‑led business models

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder, CTO/CISO and lead business development manager at Platinum (Platinum.fund). Software architect and cryptography-focused engineer who works on Web3/DeFi products and DAO tooling. Active as an angel/venture partner in blockchain and DeFi investments.
enrichment.career_background: Anton Dziatkovskii is a co‑founder and long‑time executive at Platinum (Platinum.fund / Platinum Q DAO Engineering), serving as CTO/CISO and lead business development manager since the mid‑2010s. His background is in software architecture, blockchain engineering (Solidity, Rust, Substrate) and big‑data analytics; past roles and advisory work include positions linked to Merlion, 4finance/INFINTO, Everex Global and multiple Web3 projects (advisor/tech lead). He has also been involved in launching Platinum’s Q DAO ecosystem and related DeFi products.
enrichment.investment_focus: Web3 / Blockchain, DeFi, early‑stage crypto and fintech startups (pre‑seed / seed), security and infrastructure projects

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and investor; co‑founder and CEO of Collective and co‑founder of AddThis (acquired by Oracle). Founding partner and current Venture Partner at Expa, where he helped build the studios early-stage investing program. Active angel/advisor to multiple consumer and infrastructure startups.
interests: Early-stage startup building & venture studio model
Products and platforms for founders / solopreneurs (back-office, fintech)
enrichment.career_background: Hooman Radfar studied computer science and economics (University of Pennsylvania) and earned an M.S. from Carnegie Mellon. He co-founded Clearspring/AddThis and later joined Expa (initially as EIR and then a founding/venture partner) to lead early investing and studio projects. He founded 10e9 as a personal investment/advising platform and in 2020 co‑founded Collective, where he serves as CEO, focusing on back‑office financial services for self‑employed professionals.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed stage startups; venture-studio company building; fintech and financial services for small businesses; marketplaces, logistics, consumer and B2B SaaS

enrichment.personal_bio: Operating Partner and Head of Corporate Development at Bessemer Venture Partners based in Redwood City. Former Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of Oracle with prior CFO roles at DoubleClick, King World Productions, and Nielsen. Lecturer at Stanford and leader of Bessemer’s CFO Council, advising portfolio company CEOs and CFOs.
enrichment.career_background: Jeff Epstein is an Operating Partner at Bessemer Venture Partners (joined 2011) where he leads the firm’s CFO Council and advises portfolio companies on finance and operating strategy. Previously he was Executive Vice President & CFO of Oracle and served as CFO at DoubleClick, King World Productions and Nielsen’s Media Measurement group; he began his career in investment banking at The First Boston Corporation. He is a lecturer at Stanford and serves on multiple public and private boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Marketplaces; enterprise (B2B) software; AI software; advertising technology; CFO/advisory for finance leadership

enrichment.personal_bio: Chris Altchek is founder & CEO of Cadence, a health‑technology company focused on remote patient monitoring and chronic care. He co‑founded and served as CEO of Mic (a digital media publisher) and later worked in corporate development at Bustle. He is also a scout/angel affiliated with Lightspeed and previously worked at Goldman Sachs and in policy at the White House. He holds a B.A. from Harvard University.
enrichment.career_background: Chris Altchek studied social studies at Harvard and began his career in policy and investment banking (including a policy internship at the White House and work at Goldman Sachs). He co‑founded Mic in 2011 and led it as CEO until its acquisition; following that he worked in corporate development at Bustle. In 2020 he co‑founded Cadence and serves as its CEO, and he is listed as a scout/individual investor affiliated with Lightspeed Venture Partners.
enrichment.investment_focus: Health tech (remote patient monitoring, chronic care); consumer/digital media; early-stage / seed investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at Motivate Venture Capital. Serial entrepreneur with multiple exits (InnFlux, PowerSurge, RIVS) and a prolific early‑stage investor. Holds a BA from the University of Notre Dame and an MBA from Northwestern University's Kellogg School of Management.
enrichment.career_background: Two‑time founder-operator turned investor: built and exited InnFlux and PowerSurge, founded RIVS (video hiring platform) and co‑founded the IrishAngels angel group. Co‑founded Motivate Venture Capital in 2019 to invest in pre‑seed and seed startups; serves as Founder & Managing Partner. Education: BA (Notre Dame), MBA (Northwestern Kellogg), and executive education in VC/PE at Harvard.

He has held product leadership roles at Google and Facebook, has served as a mentor to accelerator programs, and has invested in and advised early‑stage hardware and software companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early‑stage internet/software and hardware startups targeting the Mexican/Latin American market; lightweight, scalable software and early hardware (drones/robotics) plays.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Rabbit Ventures and a serial entrepreneur and angel investor. Co‑founder and former CEO of Beyond Security (acquired in 2021). Active investor and advisor focused on cybersecurity and B2B software, based between Seoul and the Bay Area.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and CEO of Beyond Security (sold to HelpSystems/Fortra in 2021); serial founder and investor with 30+ personal investments across Israel, Silicon Valley and Korea. Serves as General Partner at Rabbit Ventures (founded 2023) and holds advisory/board roles at several startups. Education: B.Sc. in Computer Science (Technion) and MBA (Tel Aviv University).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage B2B SaaS and developer/infrastructure tools, with emphasis on cybersecurity and Korea→US cross‑border founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Diverse Strategies and an active angel investor based in the San Francisco Bay Area. Member of the Berkeley Angel Network and former member of Sand Hill Angels; advisor to Berkeley SkyDeck and founding investor/advisor at The Batchery. Holds degrees from the University of California, Berkeley.
enrichment.career_background: Clifford Tong has led Diverse Strategies (a venture consulting firm) since 1990 and previously worked at IBM in marketing and technical roles. He has been an active angel investor for 15+ years, serves/served on multiple angel groups (Berkeley Angel Network, Sand Hill Angels, InSync Angels, Keiretsu Forum) and has advised university and accelerator programs including Berkeley SkyDeck and The Batchery. He has also founded/co‑founded internet startups and served on public small-business advisory bodies in California.
enrichment.investment_focus: Angel / early-stage investments (pre-seed to Series A) across AI, enterprise SaaS, digital health, climate/clean tech, fintech and consumer internet; typical check sizes reported ~$5,000–$50,000 (via Berkeley Angel Network).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Partner at Switch Ventures, based in San Francisco. Former early executive at AppDirect and ex-consultant at McKinsey & Company. Focuses on seed and early-stage investments and partnering closely with founders.
enrichment.career_background: Paul Arnold previously worked as a consultant at McKinsey & Company and was an early senior executive at AppDirect (head of business operations). He founded Switch Ventures and serves as Founder & Partner, investing primarily at seed and early stages. Education listed in public profiles includes a J.D. from the University of Michigan Law School and a B.S. from the University of Utah.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / early-stage investments across consumer, marketplaces, fintech, healthtech and B2B SaaS.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at K50 Ventures who leads the firm’s Work & Learning focus and invests across the US and LATAM. Previously on the investment team at Flybridge Capital Partners and held operating roles at Dreamit and Offerpop; co‑founded a consumer messaging app. Cornell B.S. in Entrepreneurship; splits time between New York City, Mexico City and Istanbul.
interests: Future of work & learning (edtech, workforce platforms)
Early-stage (pre-seed & seed) investing in US & LATAM
enrichment.career_background: Founding partner at K50 Ventures (joined 2020) focused on pre-seed and seed investments in work, health and finance. Prior to K50 he was on Flybridge’s investment team (sourced/supporting deals including Imperfect Foods, Wethos, Narrator) and earlier held operator/accelerator roles at Dreamit Ventures and Offerpop and co‑founded a consumer messaging startup. Active volunteer with NYC entrepreneur programs.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed & seed investments in Health, Finance and Work (including edtech and workforce platforms); primary geographies: United States and Latin America.

enrichment.personal_bio: Independent angel investor and operator. Former partner on the deal team at Andreessen Horowitz and later led startup/VC partnerships roles at Google and YouTube. As of 2024–2025 has worked on startup/API partnerships at OpenAI. Active in seed/pre-seed angel activity in tech sectors including Web3 and developer platforms.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in finance and product roles early in his career (including UBS and Proclivity), joined Andreessen Horowitz as a partner on the deal team (circa 2015–2018), then held startup/VC partnership roles at Google Cloud and product/Chief of Staff roles at YouTube (2018–2024). In 2024 moved to a startups/API-focused role at OpenAI and invests independently at the angel/seed stage.
enrichment.investment_focus: Angel / seed-stage investments focused on AI and developer platforms, Web3/crypto, marketplaces and consumer products, enterprise SaaS and cloud infrastructure, and AR/VR.

enrichment.personal_bio: Builder and seed-stage investor based in New York City. Co‑founder of Workstreamer (acquired 2009) and Heights Media; has held roles building capital networks including Director of On Deck Angels. Partner at Intangible Ventures and active angel investor and advisor.
enrichment.career_background: Sam Huleatt is a founder-turned-investor with an MBA from Johns Hopkins and a BA from Bates College. He co‑founded Workstreamer and Heights Media, served as Director for On Deck Angels & Fund Team (2021–2023), was an EIR at Primary Venture Partners, and is a partner at Intangible Ventures, advising and investing in early-stage startups and capital-network initiatives.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage early investments; hands-on operator support for founders; sectors include B2B SaaS, marketplaces, fintech, adtech and consumer/health-adjacent startups

enrichment.personal_bio: Senior Vice President, Unlocking Innovation at LACI, overseeing founder-facing incubation programs and LACI’s investment vehicles (LACI Impact Fund and Cleantech Debt Fund). Prior roles include VP Corporate Strategy at Groupe PSA and head of the automotive industry vertical at the World Economic Forum; earlier experience at Coda Automotive, Toyota Europe and McKinsey. Education includes a BA from Stanford University and an MBA from The Wharton School, University of Pennsylvania.
enrichment.career_background: Alex Mitchell leads LACI’s incubator and investment activities with a focus on scaling cleantech startups and deploying non-dilutive and venture capital strategies. He previously served as VP of Corporate Strategy at Groupe PSA, headed the automotive industry vertical at the World Economic Forum, and held operational roles at Coda Automotive, Toyota Europe and McKinsey. He holds undergraduate and graduate degrees from Stanford and Wharton respectively.
enrichment.investment_focus: Cleantech / climate tech (especially sustainable mobility and transportation), early-stage incubation and commercialization, and climate-focused finance (debt and impact funds).

enrichment.personal_bio: Rui Ma is an angel and early-stage investor based in the San Francisco Bay Area. She served as Greater China Partner at 500 Startups and was a Venture Partner at Synaptic Ventures (2020–2021). She founded Tech Buzz China and has a background in investment banking and cross-border investing.
enrichment.career_background: Rui Ma has worked in investment banking and investing (Merrill Lynch, Morgan Stanley, The Raine Group), served as Greater China Partner at 500 Startups, founded Tech Buzz China, led the nonprofit Rookie.Fund, and held venture partner roles including at Synaptic Ventures (2020–2021). She is based in the San Francisco Bay Area and has operated across the US and Greater China.
