enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage companies in psychedelic medicines and related life-sciences, and early-stage technology companies preparing for North American capital markets.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder & CEO of Favs and former global startup pipeline lead at Techstars. Venture partner/advisor on Techstars Rising Stars and an early-stage investor and startup mentor. Background includes founding roles at Orai and CMO at Evolve (acquired by HubSpot).
enrichment.career_background: Saba Karim led global startup sourcing and pipeline efforts at Techstars (Pipeline/Head of Startup Pipeline) and served as a partner/advisor on the Techstars Rising Stars pre-seed fund. He co-founded Orai, served as CMO at Evolve (acquired by HubSpot), and is founder & CEO of consumer social startup Favs. Educated at Deakin University and Stanford (Global Management).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and early-stage startups (consumer social, marketplaces, productivity/dev tools, fintech/DeFi) with focus on founder support, accelerator-backed deals, and underrepresented founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Iaso Ventures who leads the firm’s strategy and investments at the intersection of life sciences and technology. Former Chief Digital Strategist at Roivant Sciences and long‑time research faculty at Massachusetts General Hospital/Harvard Medical School. Holds a DPhil from the University of Oxford and postdoctoral training at MIT.
enrichment.career_background: Wasim Malik is Managing Partner at Iaso Ventures, where he focuses on early‑stage investing and venture building in brain health and adjacent life‑science areas. He was the first Chief Digital Strategist at Roivant Sciences, has served on the research faculty at Massachusetts General Hospital/Harvard Medical School, completed postdoctoral work at MIT, and holds a DPhil in electrical engineering from Oxford. He is also an active angel investor and serves on multiple industry and advisory boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage life sciences and healthtech (seed–Series A) with emphasis on neuroscience/neurotech, AI/ML‑enabled drug discovery, computational biology, R&D platforms and outcome management.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner at Infinita Fund. Focuses on accelerating "stranded technologies" by using startup cities, network states and legal engineering to reduce regulatory frictions. Based in Próspera (Roatán, Honduras).
interests: Regulatory and legal engineering for innovation
enrichment.career_background: Founder & General Partner at Infinita Fund (since 2022); co‑founder/CEO of Vitalia / Infinita City; former founder of MetaMeet and early-stage operator with prior roles in strategy and growth at companies including Dalia Research and consulting experience. Educated at Hertie School (MPP) and Syracuse University (MA).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage investments in biotechnology (longevity), web3/crypto, hard tech/hardware, logistics and startups that leverage special jurisdictions/startup cities.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and CEO of Canal (ShopCanal Inc.), a distributed commerce/ecommerce marketplace platform. Former Consumer Investment Partner at Andreessen Horowitz (2017–2021). Based in San Francisco and focused on consumer software, marketplaces and commerce infrastructure.
enrichment.career_background: Co-founded Canal in 2021 and has served as its CEO. Prior to founding Canal he was a consumer investor/partner at Andreessen Horowitz (2017–2021). Earlier roles include business development at Omniata and Heighten, fixed-income work at Jefferies, and finance/macroeconomic strategy at the Government Development Bank for Puerto Rico. Education includes a B.A. from Yale University and graduate study at the National University of Singapore.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer & marketplace startups; ecommerce and DTC brand distribution; commerce infrastructure/platforms; typically early-stage (seed to Series A)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of proChain Ventures, a specialist VC focused on pre-seed and seed supply‑chain technologies. Based in St. Louis, Missouri, he invests in hardware and software that improve resilience, traceability, decarbonization and mobility across supply chains. Former corporate venture and supply‑chain executive with an MBA from Saint Louis University.
enrichment.career_background: J.P. Keating founded proChain Ventures after a career leading corporate innovation and venture programs at large companies and participating as a venture partner/angel. His prior roles include technology & strategic ventures at Allstate, startup engagement and supply‑chain innovation roles at ConAgra Foods and Ameren, internal audit/supply‑chain at Anheuser‑Busch InBev, and multiple roles at Boeing. He holds a BS and an MBA from Saint Louis University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed & seed supply‑chain tech (hardware & software): deep tech, unmanned cargo/mobility, enterprise/AI‑enabled supply‑chain SaaS, traceability, resilience and decarbonization.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner and co‑founder of Dipalo Ventures, an early‑stage VC focused on hard tech and manufactured innovations. Serial entrepreneur and product designer with prior roles at Motorola, PwC, Publicis Sapient and as co‑founder/CEO of Demibooks (acquired by EDC). Active angel and mentor with experience investing across the US Midwest and Bangladesh.
enrichment.career_background: Founding Managing Partner at Dipalo Ventures (since 2016), previously Venture Partner at NextGen Venture Partners and founder/CEO of Demibooks (acquired). Past roles include product and UX work at Motorola Mobility and positions in consulting and financial services (PwC, Publicis Sapient, Fannie Mae). Holds an MS and MBA (Virginia Tech) and a BS in Electrical Engineering (West Virginia Wesleyan).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage hard tech / manufactured innovations: climate & energy, industrial and manufacturing, medical devices, materials science, and connected consumer & IoT devices.

enrichment.personal_bio: Operator-turned-investor focused on early-stage B2B SaaS. Venture Partner at Forum Ventures (joined 2022) and Chief Business Officer at FlavorCloud (since March 2024). Former Global Head of Shipping & Fulfillment at Shopify with product and GTM leadership at Pitney Bowes and LexisNexis.
enrichment.career_background: Maia Benson spent 20+ years building and scaling SaaS products for SMBs — roles include Global Head of Shipping & Fulfillment at Shopify, Global Digital Products Lead at Pitney Bowes, and product leadership at LexisNexis. She co‑founded NiftyLuxe, joined Forum Ventures as an investor/venture partner in 2022, and became Chief Business Officer at FlavorCloud in 2024. Education: MBA, Cornell University; BA, Syracuse University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) B2B SaaS with emphasis on eCommerce, logistics & supply chain, shipping/fulfillment, and go-to-market execution.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner and Managing Director at DiverseCity Ventures, focused on accelerating tech-enabled startups with social, economic, and environmental impact. Former founder of CINESHARES and media/film entrepreneur; active advisor and coach to accelerators and NSF programs. Based in Sacramento, CA, and involved in tech policy and AI ethics initiatives.
enrichment.career_background: Mariah Lichtenstern is the founding partner of DiverseCity Ventures and has led the firm since the mid-2010s. She previously founded CINESHARES and Lightedstar Entertainment, served as Managing Director for the Founder Institute (Sacramento chapter), and holds advisory or board roles with CalSEED, Berkeley SkyDeck, FourthWave, UCLA Ventures and Aspen Tech Policy Hub; she also coaches NSF Convergence Accelerator cohorts and advises on AI ethics.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage, tech-enabled companies with measurable social, economic, or environmental impact (cleantech, fintech, edtech, civictech, sports & entertainment, agtech); emphasis on inclusive teams and diversity.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and General Partner at Steamwork Ventures, an early‑stage VC focused on connected solutions that impact health, wealth, or the climate. Former product and payments executive with leadership roles at MasterCard and later client-facing roles at Visa; also an adjunct professor and startup mentor. Active in FoundersBoost LA and startup ecosystem programs.
enrichment.career_background: Tatiana Mulry is a co‑founder and General Partner at Steamwork Ventures. She previously led global mobile payments strategy and product development at MasterCard (including work on tokenization and developer programs), ran a digital product/marketing consultancy (DDx Media), and has served as an adjunct professor (USC) and instructor (CalArts). She has co‑directed FoundersBoost LA and has industry experience across product, analytics, and go‑to‑market for enterprise and consumer platforms.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed to Series A) companies in FinTech/payments, SaaS & AI, HealthTech/MedTech, ClimateTech, IoT and other connected‑device solutions; U.S. focus, preference for teams with domain experience.

enrichment.personal_bio: C.S. Freeland (Christa Freeland) is cofounder and Founding Executive Director of the Texas Venture Alliance and editor of the Texas Venture Newsletter. Based in Austin, she organizes statewide events including Texas Venture Fest and works on building the Texas venture ecosystem.
enrichment.career_background: Has worked for the majority of the last decade at an Austin venture studio and in accelerator/angel network roles. Cofounded the Austin Venture Association and later the statewide Texas Venture Alliance (founded 2022), launches and runs Texas Venture Fest and the Texas Venture Gala, and serves as editor-in-chief of the Texas Venture Newsletter. Also noted as a World Economic Forum Global Shaper and advisor on political campaigns.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed & pre-seed stages; direct-to-consumer/CPG; developer tools & SMB software; real estate/PropTech; wellness & hospitality

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Magma Partners since 2018. Chilean entrepreneur and former Techstars Regional Director for Latin America (2016–2018). Founder/CEO of Sanosnack and co‑founder of Ciudad Emergente; has lived and worked in Austin and New York.
enrichment.career_background: Pedro Pablo del Campo is a partner at Magma Partners (joined 2018). He previously served as Regional Director of Business Development for Latin America at Techstars (2016–2018) and has founded and led ventures in Chile (including Sanosnack SPA and a design firm), and cofounded Ciudad Emergente. He focuses on supporting early‑stage founders and building connections between US and Latin American ecosystems.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed to Series A) investments in Latin America with emphasis on fintech, insurtech, marketplaces and cross‑border startups targeting the US market.

enrichment.personal_bio: Angel investor and advisor based in the San Francisco Bay Area. Member of Sand Hill Angels since 2017 with a background as a marketing and strategy executive. Holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and a B.Sc. from the University of Toronto. Active as an advisor to early-stage technology companies and a volunteer high‑school CS teacher.
enrichment.career_background: Over a multi‑decade career he has held senior roles at McKinsey (Senior Engagement Manager), Accenture (Managing Partner), McCaw Cellular (CMO) and NextWave (SVP Sales & Marketing), served as CEO/founder of several startups (e.g., Wifi.com, Trust.MD, Wavespot), and more recently acts as an investor/advisor to startups and organizations such as Barcelona Ventures and AlphaICs.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage and early-stage technology companies (telecom/wireless, SaaS/enterprise software, healthcare & medical devices); active in marketing/GT M and product-led growth areas.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Andreessen Horowitz (a16z) where he leads the firm’s Apps practice. Serial entrepreneur and operator — co‑founder/CEO of TrialPay (acquired by Visa) and co‑founder of Affirm — with a BA in Applied Mathematics & Computer Science from Harvard.
enrichment.career_background: Rampell cofounded multiple startups (FraudEliminator → merged into SiteAdvisor; TrialPay → acquired by Visa; TXN; Point; Affirm) before joining Andreessen Horowitz in 2015 as a General Partner. At a16z he leads the Apps practice and serves on boards of numerous portfolio companies across fintech, consumer and enterprise software.
enrichment.investment_focus: Fintech and payments; consumer & enterprise apps; marketplaces and e‑commerce; early through growth-stage investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Managing Partner of Plexo Capital, an investor that backs emerging seed-stage VC funds (particularly led by diverse GPs) and makes direct early-stage investments. Incubated Plexo inside GV (Google Ventures) and spun it out in 2018. Former investing and operating leader with roles at GV, Comcast Ventures (Catalyst Fund), Zynga and senior roles at eBay and Nike. Holds an MBA from UC Berkeley (Haas) and a BS from Hampton University.
enrichment.career_background: Lo Toney incubated and spun out Plexo Capital from GV and serves as its founding managing partner. Prior to Plexo he was a partner at GV, led Comcast Ventures Catalyst Fund, served as GM for Zynga (Zynga Poker), and held senior product/GM roles at Nike and eBay. He has also been a founder/CEO (LearnStreet) and worked in consulting and corporate development; he holds an MBA from UC Berkeley (Haas) and a BS from Hampton University.
enrichment.investment_focus: LP investments into emerging seed-stage venture funds (focus on diverse GPs) and direct early-stage startup investments; sectors include marketplaces, consumer internet, fintech/payments, gaming/e-sports, enterprise software and infrastructure.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Lerer Hippeau; longtime media and tech investor and operator. Former Chairman & CEO of Ziff‑Davis and CEO of The Huffington Post; co‑founder of NowThis News and former partner at SoftBank Capital.
enrichment.career_background: Eric Hippeau began his career in publishing (served as President/CEO/Chairman of Ziff‑Davis), moved into venture as a Managing Partner at SoftBank Capital (early 2000s), served as CEO of The Huffington Post (2009–2011) and co‑founded NowThis News. He joined Lerer Hippeau as a managing partner around 2010 and has since led and advised media, consumer and enterprise investments. He was educated at the Lycée Français and Sorbonne (Paris).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) generalist investing across consumer and enterprise, with emphasis on digital media, D2C consumer brands, and health/AI

enrichment.personal_bio: Silicon Valley–based serial entrepreneur and investor (MIT MBA). Co‑founder/CEO of Evensi (acquired) and founder of multiple tech startups; active as a GP and fund manager. Focuses on creator economy, media/ music tech and Web3-related opportunities.
enrichment.career_background: Paolo Privitera is a serial founder and operator with over two decades in internet and media businesses. He co‑founded and led Evensi (event discovery platform) and earlier startups including Pick1, Digitix and Mestre; after Evensi's acquisition he served in corporate development at Events.com. He is a General Partner at ME Ventures and a fund manager/partner at 1521 Ventures, and serves as advisor/mentor to multiple accelerators and startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage investments in the creator economy: music & media technology, creator tools/platforms, Web3/blockchain for creators, fintech and distribution for creative industries

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding member and Managing Partner of BDMI who joined the fund as Chief Financial Officer in 2006 after roles in Bertelsmann's Corporate Controlling & Strategy (serving as chief of staff to the CEO). Leads BDMI investments in digital media, online video and next‑generation publishing and has served on boards/led investments in companies such as CrowdTwist, Skimlinks, StyleHaul and Zephr. Educated at HHL Leipzig Graduate School of Management (Dipl.-Kfm) and holds an MBA from Tulane University; was a Ph.D. candidate at Handelshochschule Leipzig.
enrichment.career_background: Joined BDMI in 2006 from Bertelsmann's Corporate Controlling & Strategy group (where he served as chief of staff to the CEO). At BDMI he has been a lead investor and board participant across digital media, adtech and publishing startups; previously studied at HHL Leipzig (Dipl.-Kfm), completed an MBA at Tulane University and was a Ph.D. candidate at Handelshochschule Leipzig.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed to Series A/B) investments in digital media technologies, online video/streaming, publishing and subscription products, adtech, content/distribution platforms and related SaaS for media.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and advisor based in the San Francisco Bay Area. Managing Partner at SV Venture Group and active as a venture/angel partner and mentor across several VC groups and accelerators. Focuses on early-stage technology companies and advises on operations, fundraising, business development and product. Over 20 years of experience spanning engineering, operations, analytics and IoT.
enrichment.career_background: Jordan Wahbeh is founder/Managing Partner of SV Venture Group and holds partner/venture partner and advisory roles at organizations including Network VC, Erez Capital, GSD Venture Studios and Bay Angels. He mentors at accelerators such as Berkeley SkyDeck and Plug and Play and has held corporate roles earlier in his career (including operations and product roles at DataRPM and Cisco). His work focuses on helping founders scale through operations, business development and fundraising.
enrichment.investment_focus: Stages: pre-seed, seed, Series A. Sectors: AI / Big Data, Industrial IoT, DeepTech, Digital Health, B2B SaaS; emphasis on operationally-driven technology startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at Zigg Capital, a New York–based VC focused on real estate and construction technology. Previously co‑founder & CEO of Floored (acquired by CBRE) and an early employee at Bonobos and TellApart. Invests in early-stage companies that intersect real estate, construction, hospitality and associated financial services.
interests: Residential & commercial real-estate finance / mortgage tech
enrichment.career_background: Started his career at Bain & Company, then held early roles at Bonobos and TellApart. Co‑founded Floored in 2012 and served as CEO until its acquisition by CBRE in 2017; subsequently led CBRE’s digital/technology team. Co‑founder of Red Swan Ventures and founding partner of Zigg Capital (launched 2018/2019), where he leads early-stage investments in property, construction and related technology companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage investments (pre-seed to Series B) in real estate and construction technology, plus related enterprise SaaS, marketplaces and real-estate finance/insurtech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner and co-founder of Hive Hatch. 7x founder and former VP of Labs/Innovation at SendGrid; co-founder of Joy Labs and founder/CEO of Get Structure. Focuses on product innovation and operational support for early-stage SaaS startups.
enrichment.career_background: Mike Rowan is a serial founder and operator who co-founded Hive Hatch (2021) and has held senior product and R&D roles including VP, Labs/Innovation at SendGrid. He has founded multiple startups (e.g., RatePoint, Joy Labs, Get Structure) and held R&D/product roles at GeoTrust; he also served in product leadership at Techstars Studio.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed to Seed/Early VC) SaaS and B2B software; hands-on operational support for startup founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investment professional who worked as an Associate / Senior Associate at SV Health Investors, focusing on early-stage therapeutics and biotech investments. Educated at College of the Holy Cross (A.B.) and University of Notre Dame (M.S.). Has recorded investments in companies developing novel medicines, including oncology and immunotherapy programs.
enrichment.career_background: Held analyst and associate roles at SV Health Investors (joined 2019; served as Associate/Senior Associate through 2022). Earlier experience at ClearView Healthcare Partners (analyst/senior analyst). Education: A.B., College of the Holy Cross; M.S., University of Notre Dame. Public profiles indicate a subsequent move to Estuary Capital (from 2022).
enrichment.investment_focus: Therapeutics and biotechnology (early-stage to Series B); oncology, neurodegeneration, genetic and infectious disease programs

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner at Cota Capital. Founded Saba Software and took it public; has invested in and mentored 100+ early-stage companies. Holds a B.A. in Applied Mathematics from the University of California, Berkeley.
enrichment.career_background: Serial entrepreneur and investor: worked in R&D roles at Oracle (late 1980s–1997), founded Saba Software (1997; later public), founded the family office Signatures Capital (2006), and co‑founded Cota Capital where he serves as a managing/founding partner focused on private and public enterprise technology investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Modern enterprise technology (early‑stage to growth/public): enterprise software, data & AI infrastructure, healthtech/biotech, deep tech/hardware, space and geospatial solutions.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Necessary Ventures, an early-stage VC that invests in "what the world needs." He leads pre-seed and seed investments with a focus on deep technologies and mission-driven companies. Education includes a J.D. from Stanford Law School, medical training at Drexel University College of Medicine, and a B.S. from Pennsylvania State University.
enrichment.career_background: Previously served on investment teams and as legal counsel at firms including Rothenberg Ventures and as Venture Partner at HOF Capital. Early in his career he worked on the Affordable Care Act in the U.S. Senate and in corporate roles at startups; he founded Necessary Ventures in 2020 and holds advisory/board roles (e.g., EnsoData, Upsolve).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed to Seed (lead pre-seed checks ~$250K–$2M); sector focus on deep tech, healthcare/medtech, climate/cleantech, fintech, and education; mission-driven, founder-led companies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Andrew Romans is CEO & General Partner at 7BC Venture Capital and host of the podcast "Fireside with a VC." He is a published author on venture capital and blockchain, a former founder/entrepreneur and university lecturer, and is based in Austin, Texas. Romans is trilingual (English, French, German) and holds an MBA from Georgetown University.
enrichment.career_background: Founder and General Partner of 7BC Venture Capital (founded 2018) and co‑founder/General Partner of Rubicon Venture Capital. Prior experience as a VC-backed entrepreneur and in technology sales/M&A (roles at Sentito Networks, Motive Communications), former professor of venture capital, and author of multiple books on VC and corporate venturing. Holds an MBA in finance from Georgetown University and a BA from the University of Vermont.
enrichment.investment_focus: Late seed and Series A; sectors include AI/ML, FinTech, software infrastructure / enterprise SaaS, PropTech and blockchain; also operates a fund-of-funds and runs LP/network-focused programs.

enrichment.personal_bio: Angel investor and advisor based in Los Angeles. Active in early-stage investing (pre-seed and seed) with check sizes typically between $50K–$250K. Holds an MBA from Queen's University and a CPA designation; provides financial advice and network support to founders.
enrichment.career_background: Alwyn Wong is a solo angel/family-office investor focused on pre-seed and seed-stage companies. Profiles on investor platforms list him as providing financial advice and network access to early-stage founders; his public education credentials include an MBA from Queen's University and Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA Canada).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage startups across sectors (sector-agnostic); leans toward fintech and govtech and selectively life sciences; typical check size ~$50K–$250K.

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial entrepreneur and investor; chairman of VaynerX and CEO of VaynerMedia. Founder/creator of VeeFriends and a prolific angel investor; co‑founder of Vayner/RSE, a New York–based early‑stage VC.
enrichment.career_background: Gary Vaynerchuk started by growing his family liquor business (Wine Library) into an e‑commerce leader, launched Wine Library TV, then co‑founded VaynerMedia (now part of VaynerX). He has co‑founded multiple companies (Resy, Empathy Wines, VaynerSports, VeeFriends) and invests across consumer tech, media, and crypto through angel rounds and Vayner/RSE.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early institutional rounds in consumer technology, media/marketing platforms, marketplaces, and web3/crypto

enrichment.personal_bio: Geoff Yang is a co‑founder and partner emeritus of Redpoint Ventures. He has invested across consumer media, digital content and network infrastructure and serves on several public and private boards. He holds a BSE from Princeton and an MBA from Stanford.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Redpoint Ventures in 1999 after serving as a General Partner at Institutional Venture Partners (IVP) from 1987–1999. Earlier roles included positions at First Century Partners and IBM. He is founder/CEO of Apeiron Life and has held board roles at Franklin Templeton, Warner Bros. Discovery and multiple Redpoint portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer media & digital content; network and infrastructure; consumer internet — primarily growth/later stages (Series C+).

enrichment.personal_bio: Writer and podcaster (Lenny’s Newsletter, Lenny’s Podcast), former Product Lead at Airbnb. Part-time angel investor and advisor; invests through AirAngels and personal checks. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area.
enrichment.career_background: Former engineer and founder (Localmind), joined Airbnb after an acquisition and rose to Product Lead for supply growth. Since 2019 he publishes Lenny’s Newsletter, hosts Lenny’s Podcast, and has been an active angel investor and advisor to early-stage startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage technology companies (pre-seed to Series A) across product-driven consumer and developer software, marketplaces, creator economy, and infrastructure

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at 500 Global who leads the firms Spanish-speaking Latin America efforts (500 Luchadores). Former founder of Mexican.vc and a Kauffman Fellow with a background as a software developer. Focuses on early-stage, product-driven startups in Latin America.
enrichment.career_background: Santiago Zavala studied mechatronic/mechanical & electrical engineering at Tecnol�F3gico de Monterrey. He joined 500 (now 500 Global) in 2011, helped build its Latin America program (500 LatAm / 500 Luchadores), and later became Global Managing Partner. Previously he co-founded Mexican.vc and has a multi-year background as a software developer; he is also a Kauffman Fellow (Class 21).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) startups in Latin America — fintech/payments, marketplaces/e-commerce, SaaS, developer tools and community-driven startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner at Harpoon Ventures; two-time U.S. Olympic medalist and former U.S. Navy SEAL. Holds an MBA from Stanford GSB and focuses on early-stage investments in mission-critical technologies related to national security and infrastructure.
enrichment.career_background: Competed as a U.S. Olympian (2004, 2008), served as a U.S. Navy SEAL, then entered venture investing with roles at Andreessen Horowitz and Lightspeed before founding Harpoon (2018). At Harpoon he leads early-stage investments in deep tech, AI, cybersecurity, and frontier technologies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage venture investing in defense-focused deep tech: AI/compute sovereignty, cybersecurity, aerospace & autonomy, advanced manufacturing, energy & materials, biotech/biosecurity

enrichment.personal_bio: Chris Sacca is a venture investor and founder of Lowercarbon Capital, which backs climate-focused startups. He previously founded Lowercase Capital and served as Google’s Head of Special Initiatives, and was an early backer of companies including Twitter, Uber, and Instagram. Since 2017 he shifted to climate investing and now leads Lowercarbon’s science and investment team. He is based in Jackson, Wyoming.
enrichment.career_background: Former attorney and Georgetown Law graduate, Sacca worked in corporate development at Google (Head of Special Initiatives) before founding Lowercase Capital, a prolific early-stage investor. In 2017 he pivoted away from broad VC to focus on climate and policy work, later founding Lowercarbon Capital to invest in companies reducing and removing greenhouse gases while supporting related research and philanthropy.
enrichment.investment_focus: Climate tech and decarbonization-focused venture investing (carbon removal, clean energy, industrial & materials decarbonization); primarily early-stage to growth-stage startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and operator with a background in private wealth and law. Joined SV Angel in 2011 and has originated seed investments including Fundbox, iCracked, Delighted, and DroneBase. Co-founder and Managing Partner at Hawktail. Holds a B.A. from the University of Virginia.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in private wealth management at Morgan Stanley and began his career at Arnold & Porter LLP; joined SV Angel in 2011 (served as General Partner and later advisor) and co-founded venture firm Hawktail, where he is a managing partner.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and growth-stage software (consumer & enterprise); early-stage checks in AutoTech, enterprise applications and e‑commerce.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and former founder. Co‑founder and CEO of Bow & Drape (sold 2019); has served as an Investment Partner at XFactor Ventures and is a General Partner at Alpaca VC. Focuses on early‑stage consumer and commerce investments and serves on multiple company boards.
enrichment.career_background: Aubrie Pagano graduated from Harvard (BA) and began her career in strategy at Fidelity. She co‑founded Bow & Drape in 2012 and led the company to retail distribution and an acquisition in 2019. Toward the end of that journey she began angel/partner investing with XFactor Ventures and joined Alpaca VC as a General Partner in 2020; she currently sits on several boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed / seed (female‑founded); consumer & DTC; commerce enablement & supply chain; health & wellness; sustainability

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Background Capital, an early-stage VC based in San Francisco. Former general partner at CRV (Charles River Ventures) and founding CEO of LearnBoost (acquired by Automattic/WordPress). Early advisor or seed investor in companies including Instacart, Blockchain.com, Webflow and Clearbit. Holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and a BS from Georgia Institute of Technology.
enrichment.career_background: Rafael Corrales founded Background Capital in 2018 to invest in early-stage companies. Earlier he was a general partner at CRV where he sourced and led investments (including Amino, and sourcing deals such as PillPack and Airtable). Prior to investing he was founding CEO of LearnBoost (acquired by Automattic) and worked in M&A; he earned an MBA from Harvard Business School and a BS from Georgia Tech.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage venture (pre-seed/seed/Series A) focused on consumer internet, marketplaces, SaaS, developer tools and e‑commerce.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner and co‑founder of Coughdrop Capital. Co‑founder and former COO of Racket. Former senior operator at WarnerMedia/Fullscreen with prior roles at Teespring, Omaze and music/entertainment companies.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and General Partner at Coughdrop Capital (early‑stage VC, since 2015). Co‑founder & COO of Racket. Previously held senior operator roles including SVP/Creator at WarnerMedia (Fullscreen), and leadership positions at Teespring and Omaze; earlier experience launching CrowdSurge (Songkick) and at Red Light Management. Splits time between Los Angeles and Bend, OR.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed B2B software (SaaS) and AI startups; check sizes typically in the ~$25K–$150K range; emphasis on founders needing GTM/sales and product support.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Accelerator Ventures and senior partner/communications & media practice leader with a history of founding and advising technology and digital-media startups. Co-founder of MerchantCircle and Spoke; active angel investor and board advisor in mobile, games and local-commerce companies.
enrichment.career_background: Ben T. Smith IV began his career in management consulting (A.T. Kearney), co‑founded Spoke and MerchantCircle, served in executive roles at Borland/CodeGear and Reply!/MerchantCircle, and has been a venture partner and angel investor since the 2000s. He has held board and advisor roles at multiple startups and has written and published on digital media and startup strategy.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed/Seed consumer internet, local commerce and digital media (mobile/apps, marketplaces, adtech)

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Coughdrop Capital, an early‑stage microfund that invests in pre‑seed and seed B2B software. Founder/CEO of Racket and previously founder of Capiche and executive at Inside.com. Active angel/pre‑seed investor and early customer/investor in several well‑known startups.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Coughdrop Capital in 2015 and serves as a General Partner. Previously founded and led startups including Racket and Capiche, and held product/growth roles (Inside.com, developer evangelist roles earlier in his career). Invests and advises early‑stage founders, focusing on product and go‑to‑market support.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed-stage B2B software (SaaS, marketplaces); founder-first microfund checks; go-to-market and growth support.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner and former managing partner at MiLA Capital, a seed-stage firm focused on "tech you can touch." Previously scaled NEO Tech (global contract manufacturer) and co‑founded the Make in LA accelerator and Toolbox LA. Currently works as a coach and fractional COO for scaling startups.
enrichment.career_background: Shaun Arora scaled his family manufacturing business, NEO Tech, from tens of millions to roughly $800M in revenue, earning supplier awards from Raytheon and Boeing. He co‑founded Make in LA and MiLA Capital to support early-stage hardware founders, has served on multiple boards (including Somabar and NEO Tech), and now provides fractional COO services and coaching for startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / pre-seed hardware ("tech you can touch"); manufacturing & supply-chain enablement; mobility & aerospace; food & agtech; health & wellness; climate/cleantech

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder & Chairman of Dale Ventures, a global investment holding group headquartered in Dubai. Veteran operator-turned-investor who has led and founded multiple internet businesses and now invests across fintech, technology, media, consumer and real estate. Holds an MBA in International Business from SMU Cox School of Business and is based in Dubai.
enrichment.career_background: Founded Dale Ventures (Dale Ventures FZE) and serves as Founder & Chairman; the firm (founded 2017) invests globally across financial & business services, technology & media, consumer/retail and real estate. Prior to investing he spent two decades founding and leading internet-based companies (roles reported include CEO/President of firms such as HealthYes and Netualize). Education includes an MBA in International Business (SMU Cox) and a BBA from Texas A&M.
enrichment.investment_focus: Invests across financial & business services, technology & media, consumer/retail and real estate; typically seed to early-growth stage, global mandate.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder & CEO of Exponent Beauty and an investment partner at XFactor Ventures. Former President & CMO of The Red Door by Elizabeth Arden and co‑founder of Manicube. Holds a BA from Harvard College and an MBA from Harvard Business School. Based in San Francisco, CA.
enrichment.career_background: Liz Whitman is a beauty and consumer founder-operator turned early-stage investor. She founded Exponent Beauty (clinical skincare), previously co‑founded Manicube (acquired by The Red Door), served as President & CMO of The Red Door by Elizabeth Arden, and held marketing/product roles at BeautyBar (Quidsi) and American Express. She holds a BA from Harvard and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed & seed-stage investments in consumer and e-commerce startups (beauty, wellness, food), backing female founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner of BBG Ventures, an early‑stage VC backing female and other underestimated founders. Former media and consumer executive with leadership roles at ABC/Disney, Martha Stewart Living Omnimedia, Gilt Groupe and AOL; now focuses on seed and pre‑seed investments.
enrichment.career_background: Susan Lyne began in magazine publishing (founding editor of Premiere), moved into television and studio roles at Disney/ABC (rising to President, ABC Entertainment), and later served as CEO of Martha Stewart Living Omnimedia, CEO/Chair of Gilt Groupe and head of AOL’s Brand Group. In 2014 she co‑founded BBG Ventures and serves on multiple public and private boards (including GoPro and Blade).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) consumer and health startups led by female or otherwise underestimated founders; thesis areas include healthcare transformation, future of work & learning, financial inclusion, energy resiliency, vertical AI, and overlooked consumers.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Director of Portland Seed Fund; over a decade as an early‑stage investor and advisor in the Pacific Northwest. Oversees Portland State University’s entrepreneurial engagement and previously managed the PSU Business Accelerator. Serves on boards including Lumen Learning and Crowd Supply. Holds a B.A. from Boston University and an M.A. from the University of Oregon.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Portland Seed Fund in 2011 and has led the firm’s seed investing activity across the Pacific Northwest. Previously a principal at Emergent and held growth roles at Auctionpay; has directed Portland State University’s accelerator and served in leadership roles for Angel Oregon and the Keiretsu Forum Portland chapter. Active in regional startup ecosystem and nonprofit boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early‑stage companies (Pacific Northwest); sector focus includes SaaS/enterprise software, cleantech/energy, health tech/bioscience, and consumer products.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and full‑time General Partner at Coalition Operators, an early‑stage fund and operator network. Former communications lead at Box, partner/VP of marketing at Social Capital, and VP of Communications at Glossier. Lives in Brooklyn and focuses on backing early startups and connecting senior operators with cap tables.
enrichment.career_background: Started in communications at Hill & Knowlton, then led global communications at Box (through IPO). Moved to Social Capital as its first marketing partner, later served as VP of Communications at Glossier, then transitioned to angel and pooled-scout investing before co‑founding Coalition Operators to invest in and support early‑stage startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed / seed & early stage startups (sweet spot: Seed); sectors include future of work, commerce, climate, consumer and SaaS.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Graph Ventures and former founder of HelloToken and Yada. Harvard graduate and Thiel Fellow; also a published essayist. Supports early-stage founders and writes fiction/nonfiction in his spare time.
enrichment.career_background: Previously co-founded HelloToken and Yada; worked on investment teams and early-stage venture roles (listed roles include Frontier Tech / Rothenberg/other venture teams) before joining Graph Ventures as a partner. He combines operator-founders' experience with early-stage investing and writes nonfiction alongside his VC work.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed / seed) startups across consumer internet, marketplaces, Web3/blockchain, fintech, agtech, gaming/entertainment

enrichment.personal_bio: Ukrainian‑born entrepreneur and technologist. Co‑founder and former CTO of PayPal and founder/CEO of Affirm; co‑founder of HVF and partner at SciFi VC. Active angel and seed investor across fintech, AI and deep‑tech startups.
enrichment.career_background: Max Levchin co‑founded PayPal (served as CTO), later founded Slide and HVF (the incubator that spun out Affirm and Glow). He is founder and CEO of Affirm and a founding partner at SciFi VC; he has served on boards including Yelp and Yahoo and has invested in 100+ startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (brainstorm/seed/Series A) investing focused on fintech, AI, and science/deep‑tech — including payments, lending/credit infrastructure, marketplaces, enterprise software, healthcare, and security.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director at Endeavor Catalyst based in San Francisco. She leads fundraising and investor relations for Endeavor’s rules‑based co‑investment fund, which invests in Endeavor Entrepreneur‑led companies. Formerly in Google strategic partnerships and J.P. Morgan debt capital markets; University of Pennsylvania (Wharton) graduate. Grew up in Mexico.
enrichment.career_background: Jackie began her career in investment banking at J.P. Morgan (Debt Capital Markets), moved to Google as a Strategic Partner Manager for online publishers, and joined Endeavor in 2014 to help launch and run Endeavor Catalyst. At Endeavor she has focused on raising funds, managing investor relations, and deploying co‑investments into Endeavor Entrepreneur‑led companies globally.
enrichment.investment_focus: Co‑investments in Endeavor Entrepreneur‑led companies across emerging markets and North America; sectors include fintech, enterprise software, healthtech, edtech, agtech/food & beverage, consumer/retail; typically seed to growth-stage and Series A.

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal at Plug & Play Ventures (Ventures arm of Plug and Play Tech Center) focused on mobility and deep tech. MBA (Harvard Business School) and B.S. (Washington University in St. Louis). Prior roles include work at Accenture, Citi and Google; has served as board observer for several portfolio companies.
enrichment.career_background: Tarek Elessawi is an early-stage investor on Plug & Play’s Ventures team (roles listed as Senior Ventures Associate / Principal) working primarily on mobility and related deep‑tech sectors. He has experience in investment sourcing and diligence, has served as a board observer for companies including Locomation and Shoof, and previously worked in strategy/finance roles at firms including Accenture, Citi and Google. He holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and an undergraduate degree from Washington University in St. Louis.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Pre-seed, Seed, Series A) investments in mobility, enterprise software, and deep‑tech (including material science and biotech).

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Bain Capital Ventures who leads the Bay Area offices and focuses on early-stage application software and SaaS. Named to the Forbes Midas List (2012, 2013). Holds a BS in electrical engineering from Stanford and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
interests: Big data / machine learning for business apps
enrichment.career_background: Joined Bain Capital Ventures in 2003 and is a partner focused on seed and early-stage application software investing. Previously led product and sales at Trilogy (scaling revenues to $300M) and worked as a consultant at McKinsey. Serves on multiple portfolio boards and holds a patent titled “Method and Apparatus of Configuration Solutions.”
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage application software and SaaS (commerce enablement, sales & marketing/revenue operations, supply chain/industrial software, product-led growth, and AI/ML applied to business applications)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and co‑CEO of The Riveter; former investment partner at XFactor Ventures. Former corporate litigator; NYU School of Law (JD) and Emory University (BA). Based in Seattle, WA.
enrichment.career_background: Amy Sterner Nelson is an entrepreneur and former corporate litigator who founded The Riveter in 2017. She served as an investment partner with XFactor Ventures and has worked in political fundraising (co‑chair of Gen44 for President Obama). Educated at Emory University (BA) and NYU School of Law (JD).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed & seed stage; female‑founder led startups; future of work, femtech, parent‑focused companies

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Byers Capital and former General Partner at Google Ventures (GV). Ph.D. in Bioengineering from Stanford; invests across technology and biotechnology with a focus on deep tech and life sciences. Cofounder of NewLimit and an active angel/family-office investor.
enrichment.career_background: Blake Byers earned a Ph.D. in Bioengineering (Stanford), spent roughly a decade as a General Partner at Google Ventures (GV) where he led early-stage life‑science and technology investments, and founded Byers Capital (a single-family office) to invest directly in technology and biotech. He has cofounded NewLimit and maintains board/advisor roles across several startups; he also has an academic publication record in biomedical research.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage technology and biotechnology (Seed–Series A/B; opportunistic growth); deep tech (AI, mathematical reasoning, coding agents, quantum), drug discovery and clinical development, brain–computer interfaces, longevity.

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial entrepreneur-turned-angel investor and VC based in Chicago. Co‑founder of IrishAngels and co‑founder & Managing Partner at Motivate Venture Capital; founder of RIVS and iEstates. Holds a BA from University of Notre Dame and an MBA from Northwestern Kellogg.
enrichment.career_background: David Wieland is a founder and investor who built and exited multiple technology companies (including InnFlux and RIVS), co‑founded the Notre Dame‑affiliated angel network IrishAngels, and later co‑founded Motivate Venture Capital where he invests at pre‑seed and seed stages. He also runs family office Cardigan Ventures and has been active as a board member and mentor in the startup ecosystem.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage investments with a focus on fintech and B2B SaaS; broadly active across early-stage consumer and enterprise software.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Sound Ventures, responsible for investing, strategy and day‑to‑day management of the firm. Prior roles include leading Global Strategy at Marsh, SVP of Planning and Head of Investor Relations at iHeartMedia, and Head of Business Development & Strategy at CLEAR. She holds a BA from the University of Texas at Austin and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Effie Epstein is Managing Partner (also described as COO) at Sound Ventures, where she helps lead the firm’s investment strategy and operations. Before Sound Ventures she held senior strategy and planning roles at Marsh & McLennan, iHeartMedia and CLEAR and began her career in investment banking and strategy at Merrill Lynch and NYSE Euronext. She earned a BA from the University of Texas at Austin and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early- and mid-stage investments in transformative technologies — emphasis on AI/foundation models, enterprise & consumer software, healthcare and financial technology.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Relay Ventures focused on early-stage, AI-powered software for the connected/mobile world. Joined Relay as a summer intern in 2014, became full-time in 2015 and was promoted to Partner in January 2019. Background in product management and brand at Spin Master; MBA from University of Toronto (Rotman) and BA from McGill University. Based in Toronto.
enrichment.career_background: Started at Relay as a 2014 summer intern, joined full-time in 2015, promoted to Associate Partner in 2017 and to Partner in 2019. Prior to Relay he was a global brand/product manager at Spin Master. Supports deal sourcing, diligence and portfolio management; has served on the boards of AdmitHub, Alate Partners, Kira Talent and Quid and as a board observer for 7shifts, Blue J Legal and Circle. Education: BA (McGill) and MBA (Rotman).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed/Series A) investments in AI-powered software for mobile and connected devices; sector focus includes proptech, urbantech, fintech, sportstech and SaaS.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and founding partner at Trucks Venture Capital, focused on early‑stage investments in transportation and mobility. Author of the FoT (Future of Transportation) newsletter and founder of MobilityJobs; previously taught and was Executive Director of Stanford’s Revs automotive research program. Invests in autonomy, electrification, aviation and logistics startups with an emphasis on safety and decarbonization.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founding partner at Trucks (founded 2015), where he leads seed and pre‑seed investments in transportation startups. Previously Executive Director of Stanford’s Revs automotive research program and a lecturer at Stanford; earlier career in automotive media and racing programs. Runs the FoT newsletter and built MobilityJobs to connect talent with mobility startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed / pre‑seed) investments in transportation and mobility: autonomy, vehicle software, EV infrastructure, aviation/eVTOL, logistics and related hardware/software.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner at Foundry Group and former co‑founder and principal engineer of Excite. Began venture career at Mobius Venture Capital in 2000 and focuses on early‑stage technology investing, with a preference for developer‑focused products, enterprise software, and consumer internet businesses. Holds a B.S. in Symbolic Systems from Stanford University.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Excite in 1993 and worked there as a principal engineer; joined Mobius Venture Capital as a principal in 2000; co‑founded Foundry Group in 2007 and serves as a partner focused on early‑stage technology investments. Educated at Stanford (B.S., Symbolic Systems).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage technology — developer‑focused products & platforms, enterprise software/SaaS, consumer internet

enrichment.firm_name: Plug and Play Tech Center / Plug and Play Ventures
enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Plug and Play Tech Center, an innovation platform and in-house VC based in Silicon Valley. Serial entrepreneur and investor active since the late 1990s with early-stage investments in companies such as PayPal, Dropbox and LendingClub. Co‑founder of the Amidi Group and co‑founder of Amidzad (seed/early-stage investing).
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded the Amidi Group in 1980 and later co‑founded Amidzad (1999) to invest in early-stage technology companies. In 2006 he founded Plug and Play Tech Center, which runs accelerator programs, corporate innovation services and an in-house venture arm; he continues to lead Plug and Play while investing across fintech, health, AI and other technology sectors.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage technology startups; corporate innovation/accelerator programs; sector focus includes fintech, insurtech, healthtech, AI/ML, and IoT.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director, growth at Redpoint Ventures focused on enterprise software, cloud infrastructure and developer-facing businesses. Has a strong interest in AI and has led investments in companies including Stripe, HashiCorp and Twilio. Named to the Forbes Midas List multiple times. Holds a B.S. in Electrical Engineering from Duke University and an M.B.A. from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Longtime investor at Redpoint (joined shortly after the firm’s founding around 2000) who focuses on early growth and growth-stage enterprise software and infrastructure. Prior to venture capital he was Senior Manager of New Products at NorthPoint Communications, worked as a management consultant at Bain & Company, served as Director of Engineering at VideoPort Technologies, and began his career at Andersen Consulting. Educated at Duke University (B.S.E.E.) and Harvard Business School (MBA).
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise software (infrastructure & applications), cloud infrastructure, developer tools/platforms, open-source and growth-stage investments with interest in AI-enabled transformation.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and founder focused on early-stage startups. Former investor at BoxGroup and Bullpen Capital; co-founder and Chief Strategy Officer (CSO) of Blueprint Finance, a DeFi infrastructure startup. Holds an undergraduate degree from UCLA.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in early-stage venture roles (Bullpen Capital, ~2019–2021; BoxGroup, ~2021–2022) before co-founding Blueprint Finance (CSO/Co-founder) to build DeFi infrastructure (Concrete Protocol). Educational background includes an undergraduate degree from UCLA.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed to Seed; early-stage investments in fintech, DeFi/crypto infrastructure, developer tools, marketplaces, and consumer software.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Tyre Angel and an early HubSpot employee (hired as employee #6). Longtime sales and GTM leader who now works as an angel investor, advisor and board member for 25+ startups with an emphasis on diverse and socially responsible founders.
enrichment.career_background: Dan Tyre was an early HubSpot hire and spent 17+ years leading sales, partner and startup programs there. He founded Tyre Angel (2014) to provide capital, mentorship and go‑to‑market guidance to startups and serves as an angel investor, advisor and board member across more than 25 companies; he is also a limited partner in Stage 2 Capital.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) B2B and B2C startups; GTM/sales enablement and RevOps; SaaS/CRM (HubSpot ecosystem); diversity-led and socially responsible companies

enrichment.personal_bio: Seasoned founder and operator turned VC; joined Redpoint in 2017 and is a Managing Director focused on early-stage enterprise software. Previously co‑founded multiple enterprise startups, served as EVP & GM of ServiceCloud at Salesforce, and was CEO of Campaign Monitor.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded four enterprise software companies (three acquired, including Assistly which was acquired by Salesforce). Served as EVP & GM of Salesforce ServiceCloud, then CEO of Campaign Monitor, and joined Redpoint Ventures in 2017 where he invests in B2B/enterprise startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑ and growth‑stage B2B/enterprise software (SaaS), customer experience/CRM, AI/automation for back‑office and operations

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial entrepreneur and investor — co‑founder and CEO of data.world and founder of Bazaarvoice and Coremetrics. Joined Austin Ventures as a Venture Partner in 2012 and focuses on early‑stage software investing. Native Austinite involved in seed and angel investing through Hurt Family Investments.
enrichment.career_background: Brett Hurt founded Coremetrics (acquired by IBM) and later co‑founded Bazaarvoice, leading it through IPO and follow‑on transactions. He co‑founded data.world and serves as its CEO; he joined Austin Ventures as a Venture Partner in 2012 and invests via Hurt Family Investments. Education includes an MBA from The Wharton School and a BBA in MIS from the University of Texas at Austin.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage and seed software (SaaS, enterprise IT, data platforms); primarily Texas‑focused, lead and growth investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Bessemer Venture Partners focused on cloud, SaaS, and AI. Co-author of Bessemer’s 10 Laws of Cloud Computing and the State of the Cloud reports; frequent contributor to BVP’s Cloud 100 work. Former founder & CEO of Trigo Technologies; sits on multiple public and private company boards and served as NVCA Board Chair.
enrichment.career_background: Byron co-founded Trigo Technologies (acquired by IBM), worked at McKinsey and TA Associates, then joined Bessemer in 2005 where he leads the firm’s cloud and AI investing practice. He has led or participated in many high-profile cloud and SaaS investments, co-authored BVP cloud research, and serves on several boards and industry organizations (including NVCA).
enrichment.investment_focus: Cloud & SaaS, enterprise software, vertical SaaS, AI & ML, developer platforms, growth-stage investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder & CEO of Summer Health and a Sequoia scout/partnered founder (partnered 2022). Previously led business development at hims & hers and worked in business operations at Twitter and in investment banking at Barclays. Holds an MBA with Distinction from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Started in investment banking at Barclays, then managed a business operations unit at Twitter. After earning an MBA at Harvard Business School (partnered at Rough Draft Ventures), she led strategic partnerships at hims & hers, served as a Sequoia scout/partnered founder (2022), and founded Summer Health (CEO). She is also an active angel investor and co‑author of a book on business development.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (Seed/Series A) consumer tech and digital health, with emphasis on pediatric/consumer healthcare and consumer products

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor formerly on VU Venture Partners' investment team; based in San Francisco. Prior roles include Developer Strategy (Metaverse Content Apps, Reality Labs) and Partner/Business Engineer work at Meta and software engineering roles at Microsoft and Uber. Active in early-stage/seed investing and developer-focused frontier technologies.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in software engineering and developer relations (Uber, Microsoft), then at Meta in fintech partnerships and Developer Strategy for Reality Labs/Metaverse content. Transitioned into venture investing with roles including Investor at VU Venture Partners and fellow/investor positions with programs such as SomosVC and The Council.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed–Series A) startups across AR/VR, frontier/deep tech, developer tools, space & robotics, web3/blockchain, and climate/AgTech

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and operator focused on hardware, crowdfunding and alternative investments. Co‑founder & COO/Managing Partner at Vincent (investment adviser) and previously Venture Partner / Head of Platform at Hardware Club; earlier roles at Indiegogo leading hardware and blockchain/investing efforts. Educated at the University of Illinois Urbana‑Champaign.
interests: Crowdfunding and go‑to‑market for physical products
enrichment.career_background: Evan Cohen has held operating and investing roles across hardware and crowdfunding: Senior Director (Hardware, Design & Technology) and Head of Investing & Blockchain at Indiegogo; Partner / Head of Platform and Venture Partner at Hardware Club (HCVC); and co‑founder / COO (Managing Partner) of Vincent, an advisor for alternative assets. He studied at the University of Illinois Urbana‑Champaign.
enrichment.investment_focus: Hardtech/hardware startups and hard‑tech marketplaces; early‑stage investments; blockchain/crypto and alternative asset advisory.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investment and corporate development professional at Playrix who has worked on strategic partnerships, M&A and venture investments. Has served on game-company boards and invested via corporate and angel channels. Background in finance and corporate finance roles at VK (Mail.Ru) and Ernst & Young.
enrichment.career_background: Served in business development and investment roles at Playrix (Director of Business Development / Investment Director), has worked as an investment director with cyber•Fund and held board roles (including on Nexters until April 2023). Earlier roles include Deputy CFO / corporate finance at VK (Mail.Ru Group) and senior consultant at Ernst & Young. Educated at Novosibirsk State University; holds ICAEW qualification.
enrichment.investment_focus: Games (mobile/PC) and game studios/publishing; Web3/blockchain infrastructure; consumer internet and marketplaces; early-stage and corporate venture investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Next47 focused on deep tech and industrial enterprise investments (robotics, manufacturing, logistics, AI/ML). Invests across early to growth-stage rounds and works with founders building hardware-software systems and vertical enterprise platforms. Education: B.S. in Electrical Engineering from Yale and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Grew up in Bulgaria. Trained as an electrical engineer (Yale) and earned an MBA at Harvard. Worked as an engineer and project manager at Synergy Efficiency Solutions in Indonesia, then moved into VC (G2VP) focusing on industrial and mobility tech before joining Next47 in 2019 as an investor; has served as an observer on industrial/robotics boards and participates in startup mentor networks.
enrichment.investment_focus: Deep tech and enterprise (robotics, manufacturing/industrial tech, logistics & supply‑chain software, AI/ML, vertical SaaS); early through growth stages.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Khosla Ventures focused on biotechnology, digital health and AI/ML applications in medicine. He holds an MD and PhD in biomedical informatics from Stanford and has postdoctoral training in biochemistry/genetics; author of 50+ scientific publications. Serves on boards and advises multiple Khosla portfolio companies.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Khosla Ventures in a research/venture role (scientist-in-residence) and progressed to Principal then Partner. Trained as an MD/PhD in biomedical informatics at Stanford, completed postdoctoral work with Ronald W. Davis, and previously worked in AI research (MITRE) and as co‑founder/chief scientist of Stimulomics. Publishes and licenses biomedical/computational IP and works on company boards and new investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Biotechnology, digital health/medtech, and AI/ML applied to biology and medicine (genomics, precision/individualized medicine, neurotech)

enrichment.personal_bio: Former MLB player turned investor and entrepreneur. Co‑founder of VCP with Marc Lore, chairman & CEO of A‑Rod Corp, and co‑owner/co‑chair of the Minnesota Timberwolves & Lynx. Active investor in sports, consumer, media and technology companies.
enrichment.career_background: Alex Rodriguez built A‑Rod Corp (founded mid‑1990s) into a diversified investment platform across real estate, sports, media and consumer. He co‑founded VCP Ventures with Marc Lore in 2021, serves as CEO of Slam Corp (a SPAC), sits on the board of and has invested in multiple sports and media businesses, and is an Emmy‑winning analyst and public speaker.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage technology and tech‑enabled B2B/B2C; sports, media & entertainment; consumer brands and real estate

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Pareto Holdings. Active early-stage angel investor and company builder; co‑founded Atom Finance and several startups and serves on multiple boards. Known for high-volume seed/pre-seed investing and incubating companies through Pareto.
enrichment.career_background: Edward Lando founded Pareto Holdings in 2020 and serves as its Managing Partner. He has co‑founded companies including Atom Finance, Goody, Zamp, Link Money and Palazzo, and is a founding investor/board member at Misfits Market and other portfolio companies. He is an active angel investor with numerous early investments and holds a degree from The Wharton School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage startups across fintech, consumer, SaaS, developer tools, Web3 and AI

enrichment.personal_bio: Elias Torres is a partner at The Community Fund and a serial tech founder and angel investor. He co-founded Drift (served as CTO) and has since founded AI startup Novy/Agency. Torres invests at early stages with a focus on community-driven and product-led companies.
enrichment.career_background: Torres began his career as an engineer at IBM, then held senior engineering roles (Lookery) before co-founding Performable (acquired by HubSpot). He served as VP of Engineering at HubSpot, then co‑founded Drift (CTO). More recently he founded Novy/Agency, was named a Henry Crown Fellow, and acts as an angel/partner investing in seed and pre-seed startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed community-driven companies; applied AI; future of work; early-stage SaaS and consumer products

enrichment.personal_bio: Eric Schmidt is a technologist and investor who co-founded Innovation Endeavors. He led Google as CEO (2001–2011) and later served as executive chairman/technical advisor at Alphabet; he also co-founded Schmidt Futures and the Special Competitive Studies Project (SCSP).
interests: Early-stage deep tech and engineering biology
enrichment.career_background: Eric Schmidt is a longtime technology executive and investor. He served as CEO of Google from 2001–2011 and as executive chairman/technical advisor of Alphabet through 2020; he co-founded the venture firm Innovation Endeavors (2010), the philanthropic/impact organization Schmidt Futures, and founded the Special Competitive Studies Project (SCSP). He has held board and advisory roles across academia, healthcare and government innovation initiatives.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed / Series A) investments in intelligent software & AI, computing infrastructure, physical economy/robotics, engineering health/biotech, climate/clean tech, supply chain and fintech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding/Managing partner at Fil Rouge Capital with 20+ years in telecom, manufacturing and services. Co‑founder of DoubleRecall (YC S11) and ABC Accelerator; active early‑stage investor in the CEE/SEE region. Holds an MSc in telecommunications engineering and is based in the region (Croatia/Luxembourg offices).
enrichment.career_background: Julien built and led telecom businesses worldwide (multiple CEO roles), helped found DoubleRecall (YC S11) and ABC Accelerator, and co‑founded Fil Rouge Capital in 2016 to invest in and scale early‑stage startups across Southeastern and Central Europe. He has participated in global M&A and financing transactions and serves on several portfolio boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed, seed, Series A) startups—B2B and B2C software with sector focus including marketplace, Industry 4.0, logistics, adtech/music, healthtech and mobility.

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial entrepreneur and investor; Co‑Founder & Entrepreneur Partner at Unusual Ventures. Founded AppDynamics (acquired by Cisco), and co‑founded Harness and Traceable. IIT Delhi alumnus and active mentor to early‑stage founders.
enrichment.career_background: Founded AppDynamics in 2008 and led it through growth and its 2017 acquisition by Cisco. After launching BIG Labs, he co‑founded Harness and Traceable and in 2018 co‑founded Unusual Ventures to mentor and invest in seed‑stage startups. Recipient of regional entrepreneur awards and inventor on multiple US patents.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early‑stage investments in enterprise software, developer tools, infrastructure, AI and cybersecurity

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder & Managing Partner of Horizon 3 Venture Studio. Serial entrepreneur who co‑founded Clover (acquired) and Bix (acquired); previously led product at eBay and Yahoo. MIT S.B. in Urban Planning; based in the San Francisco Bay Area.
enrichment.career_background: Leonard Speiser is a serial founder and investor. He co‑founded consumer and payments companies including Bix and Clover, served as Group Product Manager at eBay and Senior Director of Product at Yahoo, co‑founded the deep‑learning fund Neuron.VC, and currently runs Horizon 3 Venture Studio (partnering with large enterprises to found startups). He holds an S.B. from MIT.
enrichment.investment_focus: Corporate venture studio model (partnering with Fortune 500 clients); seed to Series A checks; focus areas include fintech/payments, proptech/real‑estate partnerships, AI/enterprise software and developer‑facing platforms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture investor and founding partner who led SoftBank’s consumer internet and e‑commerce investing efforts. As SBIA’s head of Consumer Internet & eCommerce she led and represented the firm on boards including Coupang, Flipkart and Fanatics. Prior to SoftBank she worked at M/C Partners, Goldman Sachs and J.P. Morgan and teaches entrepreneurial finance at Stanford.
enrichment.career_background: Started investment career at J.P. Morgan and worked in Goldman Sachs’ Principal Investment Area before joining M/C Partners as a vice president. Joined SoftBank in 2015 to help build its growth equity efforts, became a founding partner at SoftBank Investment Advisers and led the firm’s global e‑commerce and consumer internet investments; has served on multiple public and private boards and acted as a visiting lecturer at Stanford Graduate School of Business.
enrichment.investment_focus: E‑commerce, consumer internet and marketplaces; logistics/fulfillment and last‑mile; robotics & automation; fintech and growth/late‑stage investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Transformation Capital and former partner at Sequoia Capital. Focuses on growth‑stage digital health and healthcare IT investments. Boston College alumnus; based in the San Francisco Bay Area.
interests: Consumer health platforms and benefits tech
enrichment.career_background: Began in equity research at Fidelity, later spent over a decade investing at Sequoia Capital (healthcare focus), and joined Transformation Capital as a managing partner in 2019 to lead growth‑stage digital health investing and board work with portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth‑stage (Series B and later) digital health and healthcare IT & services; typical investment/checks historically in the ~$10M–$40M range.

enrichment.personal_bio: Patrick McKenna is a partner at Comeback Capital and co‑founder/executive chairman of Facet Wealth. He is an entrepreneur and early‑stage investor who co‑founded LiveOps and NexRep and has invested in 40+ startups. He previously served as a lieutenant in the U.S. Army and worked in M&A at Morgan Stanley; he holds an MBA from Georgetown and a BS from the University of Southern California.
enrichment.career_background: McKenna began his career as a technology officer in the U.S. Army, moved into M&A at Morgan Stanley, then joined Silicon Valley startups. He co‑founded LiveOps and NexRep, later co‑founded Facet Wealth and HighRidge Ventures, and now invests through Comeback Capital focusing on pre‑seed/seed opportunities outside traditional tech hubs.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed‑stage technology startups (particularly in the American Heartland/Midwest); key sectors include FinTech, marketplaces, automation/robotics and future‑of‑work platforms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of PruVen Capital, a multi-stage venture firm backed initially by Prudential Financial. Previously co‑founded and co‑led Citi Ventures' global venture investing platform; earlier roles include partner at Battery Ventures and product roles at PMC Sierra and TiVo. Holds a BS from IIT Bombay and an MS from Stanford University.
enrichment.career_background: Ramneek founded PruVen Capital (2020) to invest in and scale startups across insurance, financial services, healthcare and enterprise technology. Prior to PruVen he co‑founded Citi Ventures’ venture investing efforts (co‑head), led investments in 25+ companies while at Citi, was a partner at Battery Ventures (India expansion), and held product development roles earlier in his career; he is also an active angel investor.
enrichment.investment_focus: InsurTech, FinTech, HealthTech, PropTech/Real estate, Enterprise software & data/AI; multi‑stage (seed to growth)

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and scout active in early-stage deals. Stanford BS (Symbolic Systems); early product hire at Cometeer. Public profiles record angel investments including Marriage Pact and TuMeke, and list roles as a scout for early-stage funds (including Sequoia and OVO) and an investing role at True Ventures.
enrichment.career_background: Stanford graduate (BS Symbolic Systems). Worked as a product hire at Cometeer, served as a scout for Sequoia and other early-stage funds, and has held investing/fellow roles at True Ventures; has participated in angel/pre-seed investments (e.g., TuMeke, Marriage Pact).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage startups; AI/ML, developer tools, consumer, fintech, and decentralized science (DeSci).

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner & Managing Director at Khosla Ventures with an engineering background. Led early firm investments in companies such as Berkshire Grey, GitLab, Rocket Lab and Hermeus. Holds a BS in Mechanical Engineering from Purdue and a PhD in Mechanics & Computation from Stanford; co‑founded AI company MetaMind.
enrichment.career_background: Sven is a Partner and Managing Director at Khosla Ventures where he focuses on technically deep startups. Previously he spent several years at Mohr Davidow Ventures leading technical diligence, co‑founded and served as CEO of MetaMind (acquired by Salesforce), and worked at Volkswagen’s Electronics Research Lab. He was lead engineer/project lead on Stanford’s autonomous vehicle "Stanley" and holds a PhD from Stanford and a BS from Purdue.
enrichment.investment_focus: Robotics, AI/ML, space and frontier technologies, enterprise software/infrastructure, advanced manufacturing

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and General Partner at AngelPad who invests in and mentors early-stage technology startups. Former Google product leader and co-author of patents related to search and advertising. Based in San Francisco.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded AngelPad in 2010 and runs its accelerator/investment program, acting as an early (often first) investor and hands‑on mentor to portfolio founders. Prior to AngelPad he spent ~7 years at Google in product roles (including international product marketing and product evangelism) and is listed as co‑author on patents for online advertising and local search.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage / early-stage technology startups (marketplaces, mobile, adtech, SaaS, data/AI)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and operator active in developer tooling and AI. Co‑founder of Blossom and Lemmings; listed as a partner/angel at Magic. Based between San Francisco and Vienna and active as an early‑stage investor and technologist.
enrichment.career_background: Serial founder and engineer — founded Blossom (project management/developer tooling), ran the Lemmings incubator and other projects, and has served as an angel investor and partner at Magic. More recently named co‑founder/CTO of Rakun; regularly speaks and mentors in the Vienna and San Francisco startup communities.
enrichment.investment_focus: AI/LLMs, developer‑facing tooling and SaaS; pre‑seed and seed stage startups

enrichment.personal_bio: Emeritus Partner at Digitalis Ventures focused on solutions in human and animal health. Former Nestlé executive with long experience in nutrition and corporate venturing; past Chairman of ChromaDex and co-founder of Nutrition Capital Network. Holds a B.Sc. from the University of Leeds and an M.Sc. from the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine.
enrichment.career_background: Steve Allen spent most of his career at Nestlé working in nutrition businesses and corporate venturing. He served as Chairman of the Board at ChromaDex (CDXC), co‑founded Nutrition Capital Network, and has held investment and advisory roles including Managing Member of California Agricultural Orchards LLC and Vice‑Chairman at 6 Pacific Partners. He is listed as Emeritus Partner (Digitalis) and has been involved with portfolio companies such as Eden Brew, Kenzen, and Second Genome.
enrichment.investment_focus: Human and animal health (life sciences & health tech); nutrition and functional ingredients; animal/pet therapeutics; early‑stage venture investing (seed–Series A)

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at S3 Ventures since 2013 who invests in Seed through Series B companies. Focuses on business technology, digital experiences, and healthcare technology. Prior experience includes investing in small-cap public equities at Western Standard and roles in corporate strategy; holds a BS from the University of Southern California.
enrichment.career_background: Joined S3 Ventures in 2013 and works with multiple portfolio companies as a partner and board member/observer. Earlier he invested in small-cap public companies at Western Standard, worked in corporate strategy at Southern California Edison, ran a small computer liquidation business, and served as interim CEO of Qualia.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed, Series A, Series B; Business Technology, Digital Experiences, Healthcare Technology

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-Founder and Managing Director at ForgePoint Capital, a sector-focused VC investing in cybersecurity and infrastructure software. Serial entrepreneur and early cybersecurity pioneer with multiple leadership roles and exits. Focuses on backing early-stage cybersecurity companies and helping them scale to exit.
enrichment.career_background: Alberto Yépez is a serial entrepreneur and investor who founded and led enCommerce (acquired by Entrust), served as Co-CEO and President of Entrust, and was Chairman & CEO of Thor Technologies (acquired by Oracle). He held senior roles at Apple and Oracle, served as Entrepreneur in Residence at Warburg Pincus, was a Managing Director at Trident Capital, and co-founded ForgePoint Capital. He holds a BS from the University of San Francisco and attended programs at Northwestern University's Kellogg School and the Universidad Nacional de Ingenieria in Lima, Perú.
