enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage venture investments in cybersecurity, infrastructure software, AI/ML for security, identity, cloud security, application security, and cyber risk management.

enrichment.personal_bio: Alex Pall is a musician/producer (one half of The Chainsmokers) and a General Partner at Mantis VC. He co‑founded Mantis in 2019 and invests in early‑stage, technology‑enabled startups. He leverages his public profile and network to support portfolio companies.
enrichment.career_background: Pall gained public recognition as co‑founder of The Chainsmokers and has since expanded into venture investing. In 2019 he co‑founded Mantis VC (with Drew Taggart, Milan Koch and Jeffrey Evans) and serves as a General Partner; Mantis invests at Seed and Series A across sectors including security, fintech, AI, healthcare, gaming and consumer tech.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed & Series A technology-enabled startups (cybersecurity, AI, fintech, healthtech, gaming, consumer/creator economy)

enrichment.personal_bio: Andy Dunn is an entrepreneur and angel investor best known as co‑founder and long‑time CEO of Bonobos. He co‑founded Red Swan Ventures and has backed 100+ startups. He is founder/CEO of Pie and author of the memoir Burn Rate. He chairs the board of Monica + Andy.
enrichment.career_background: Dunn earned a B.A. from Northwestern and an MBA from Stanford. He worked at Bain & Company and Wind Point Partners before co‑founding Bonobos in 2007 (served ~10+ years as CEO; Bonobos sold to Walmart in 2017). He co‑founded Red Swan Ventures (seed/angel investing) and has backed many consumer and marketplace startups; he is founder/CEO of Pie and authored Burn Rate.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) consumer & consumer‑internet investments, DTC brands, marketplaces and platform businesses

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner on the consumer investing team at Andreessen Horowitz, focused on Gen‑Z consumer trends, retail and commerce infrastructure, and the future of cities. Prior to a16z she was a seed‑stage investor at Floodgate and worked in product and engineering roles at startups including Solv Health and FundersClub. She began her career as a consultant at McKinsey & Company and graduated from Princeton University, magna cum laude. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area.
interests: Future of cities / real estate & construction
enrichment.career_background: Began as a management consultant at McKinsey in San Francisco, then worked in product and engineering roles at early startups (FundersClub, Solv Health). Moved into VC as a seed investor at Floodgate before joining Andreessen Horowitz as a partner on the consumer team, investing in early‑stage consumer, commerce, and education companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage consumer (seed–Series A); marketplaces and social commerce; commerce & retail infrastructure; education/edtech; creator economy; future of cities / real estate.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Innovent Capital Group; serial entrepreneur and early-stage investor with 30+ years building and incubating technology companies. Active in fintech/Web3, enterprise SaaS (notably tax-credit/incentive software), real estate-finance and climate/ESG technologies.
enrichment.career_background: Brett Markinson is the founder and CEO of Innovent Capital Group and has founded or chaired multiple companies including Incentify and Homium. He has participated in or led early-stage businesses and incubations (e.g., Hautelook, LowerMyBills, SoleSociety) and sits on advisory boards including Babson College’s Blank Center for Entrepreneurship. His work centers on incubating and investing in software-driven businesses that digitize traditional asset classes and services.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed–Series A) technology and healthcare; fintech and decentralized finance (Web3/DeFi); enterprise SaaS (tax & incentive software, B2B/government software); real estate-finance / home-equity fintech; climate tech / ESG; ecommerce platforms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Lerer Hippeau based in New York City. Joined Lerer Hippeau in 2018 and was promoted to partner in 2021. Holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and a BA from Cornell University.
enrichment.career_background: Early-stage investor with prior roles in VC and startups. Before Lerer Hippeau she worked at FirstMark (Vice President) and Flybridge (Associate), and held business development roles at LearnVest and Behance. Education includes an MBA from Harvard Business School and a BA from Cornell University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed/Series A) investing across consumer (DTC, e-commerce, wellness) and enterprise (SaaS) sectors

enrichment.personal_bio: Operating Partner and founding member at Revolution Ventures, focused on supporting existing portfolio companies. Serves on multiple portfolio boards and previously helped open Revolution’s San Francisco office and lead initial fundraising for Revolution Growth and Revolution Ventures.
enrichment.career_background: Began in investment banking at UBS (Financial Sponsors & Leveraged Finance), then worked on fund formation/secondaries at Probitas Partners. Joined Revolution in 2010, became a founding member of Revolution Ventures, helped launch the San Francisco office and lead early fundraises; currently an Operating Partner supporting portfolio companies and serving on boards (e.g., Bloomscape, Sila, Wagmo).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Series A–B) consumer and fintech: marketplaces, fintech/insurance, vertical software, e‑commerce, healthcare

enrichment.personal_bio: Former NFL linebacker who transitioned to entrepreneurship, media, and investing. Co-founder and Chairman of Qey Capital; founder of BowTie Cause and the Hillman Accelerator. Active angel investor focused on early-stage consumer and SaaS startups.
enrichment.career_background: Played 11 seasons in the NFL after graduating from the University of Michigan. After football he launched multiple businesses (BowTie Cause, VMG Creative, Proclamation), hosted TV shows, and moved into investing and advising — co-founding and serving as Chairman of Qey Capital and holding board/advisor roles with organizations including Outside (Pocket Outdoor Media), Washington Nationals Philanthropies, Petram Data and Granite Creek Capital.
enrichment.investment_focus: Diverse founders; consumer internet & DTC; SaaS/platform startups; seed / pre-seed and angel rounds; sports & media.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Working Capital Fund, focused on investing in technology to create more ethical and transparent global supply chains. Over 20 years of experience across human rights advocacy and impact investing, including more than a decade leading grant-making and impact-investing at Humanity United. Holds a BA from the University of California, Berkeley and an MBA/MA from The Wharton School and the Lauder Institute (University of Pennsylvania).
interests: ethical supply chains and worker rights
impact investing and worker welfare solutions
AI/data tools for supply‑chain risk detection
enrichment.career_background: Ed Marcum has worked at the intersection of human rights and venture investing for two decades. He led Humanity United’s grant-making and impact‑investing efforts to address forced labor in supply chains before becoming a founding leader and Managing Partner of Working Capital Fund (incubated by Humanity United), which closed a Supply Chain Innovation Fund in 2018 to back early‑stage technology solutions.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage technology for ethical supply chains (seed–Series A): AI/ML, traceability/blockchain, worker‑voice and training, fintech for workers, health & safety wearables

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor formerly a Director at SoftBank Investment Advisers (SBIA); currently a Partner at Gradient Ventures. Has invested across fintech, logistics, enterprise security and marketplace businesses and began her career at Morgan Stanley. Holds a BA in Economics and Mathematics from Columbia University.
enrichment.career_background: Started as an analyst at Morgan Stanley, was an associate at New Enterprise Associates (NEA), served as a Director at SoftBank Investment Advisers (2018–2023) where she backed companies such as Brex and Flexport, and joined Gradient Ventures as a Partner (2024–present). Educated at Columbia University (BA, Economics & Mathematics).
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise and consumer technology; fintech; logistics & transportation; healthtech; real estate/proptech; growth-stage and late-stage investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and angel investor; Venture Partner at Acequia Capital and CEO of Playlist (the parent brand uniting Mindbody, ClassPass, and Booker). Former CEO and longtime leader at ClassPass; early Microsoft corporate strategy executive. Has led or seeded investments in notable consumer and wellness technology companies.
enrichment.career_background: Started in product and corporate strategy at Microsoft, then founded Livestar (acquired by Pinterest). Cofounded Doppler Labs and other startups, served as executive chairman/CEO at ClassPass, and led ClassPass through its acquisition by Mindbody; has been a venture/angel investor and served as a venture partner at Acequia Capital. Currently leads Playlist (Mindbody/ClassPass/Booker) as CEO while continuing active angel investing.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments in consumer internet, marketplaces, health & wellness (digital health), consumer hardware/wearables, and SaaS/marketplace businesses.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture advisor at Relay Ventures based in the San Francisco Bay Area. Former chairman & CEO of Automatic (Automatic Labs) and Chief Creative Officer at Nuance; earlier served as VP Speech Strategy at Yahoo and CCO at Tellme. Active angel investor and advisor to multiple mobile, voice, and connected‑device startups.
interests: AI / machine learning applied to consumer products
enrichment.career_background: Over a multi‑decade career Clayton has founded Clayton Multimedia, held senior product and design roles at Tellme and Yahoo, served as Chief Creative Officer at Nuance, and led Automatic (Automatic Labs) as chairman/CEO. He later became an investor and advisor, holding board/advisor roles across several startups and serving as a venture advisor at Relay Ventures. He holds a BA from San Francisco State University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage investments in North America focused on urbantech (autonomy/robotics/mobility), proptech, fintech, and sportstech; emphasis on mobile/connected-device software and hardware.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Wocstar Capital and co‑founder/General Partner of the WOCstar Fund. Former JPMorgan M&A and philanthropy executive with 30+ years of experience; Wharton and University of Michigan graduate. Focuses on early‑stage investments in women‑of‑color founders and diverse teams.
interests: Women‑of‑color founders / diversity & inclusion in VC
enrichment.career_background: Began at Sun Microsystems; held senior roles at JPMorgan (Mergers & Acquisitions, International Government Relations, Global Philanthropy). Later founded Harriet Capital / Prometheus Exchange and launched the WOCstar Fund and Wocstar Media/Academy. Serves on nonprofit and cultural boards and is active in media and storytelling initiatives.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage venture capital focused on women‑of‑color founders and diverse, inclusive teams; tech areas including media & data, consumption, fintech and sustainability; impact investing.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Bright Success Capital, a Hong Kong–based family office focused on cross-border technology investments. Provides strategic value in manufacturing, supply chain, market strategy and operations. Previously worked in R&D and supply-chain roles at global technology firms and holds a BS in Industrial Engineering from Purdue University.
enrichment.career_background: Hilton Tam is the founder and chief executive of Bright Success Capital, a Hong Kong family office established in 2014 that invests across stages in technology companies. His stated expertise includes manufacturing and supply chain, market strategy and operational guidance; prior roles include positions at Seagate Technology and Cisco Systems. He earned a Bachelor of Science in Industrial Engineering from Purdue University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Hardware, robotics, consumer electronics, fintech, biotechnology, healthcare, enterprise software and deep tech; family-office, stage-agnostic investments (seed to late stage).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Runkeeper (acquired by ASICS in 2016) who launched the My Climate Journey podcast in 2019 and subsequently founded MCJ Collective to invest in climate startups. Holds a BA from Wesleyan University and an MBA from Babson College. Focuses on early-stage climate and energy investments and community-driven climate media.
enrichment.career_background: Jason founded and served as CEO of Runkeeper from ~2008 until its acquisition by ASICS in March 2016, then served as ASICS’s Global Head of Digital. In 2019 he launched the My Climate Journey podcast and built MCJ Collective (MCJ) as a community-backed early‑stage climate fund and media platform where he is founder / venture partner.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage climate and energy tech (pre-seed to Series A) focused on energy transition, industrial decarbonization, carbon removal, and software/hardware that enables electrification and resilience.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Foresite Capital, a U.S.-focused healthcare and life‑sciences investment firm. Physician and entrepreneur with an MD and MBA from Harvard and BS/BSEE from Yale; co‑founder of GelTex and Theravance and an investor in companies such as 10x Genomics and Jazz Pharmaceuticals. citeturn2view1turn1search1
interests: Data science / AI applied to biotech
enrichment.career_background: Physician‑turned‑investor who co‑founded GelTex Pharmaceuticals and Theravance, served in venture roles including partner at Sierra Ventures and co‑founder of Prospect Ventures, and founded Foresite Capital in 2011 to back data‑driven healthcare companies. citeturn2view1turn3search6
enrichment.investment_focus: Multi‑stage healthcare and life‑sciences investing with emphasis on therapeutics, genomics and life‑science infrastructure, and data/AI‑enabled biotech. citeturn2view1turn5search5

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Cedar Capital Group and former partner at Tiger Global; led roughly 200–250 venture investments while at Tiger and left in late 2022 to start his own firm. Focuses on early-stage enterprise software and B2B technology investing (Series A–C). citeturn0search2turn0search1
enrichment.career_background: Began in investing roles at Silver Lake and Elliott Management, joined Tiger Global (partner, led the firm’s software/B2B investing) from 2017–2022, and founded Cedar Capital Group/Cedar Investment Management after leaving Tiger. Holds a BA from Princeton. citeturn4search7turn0search1
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage technology (Series A–C) with emphasis on enterprise software/B2B, fintech, marketplaces and developer infrastructure (global tech companies). citeturn0search2turn4search6

enrichment.firm_name: Sierra Point Capital (aka Sierra Point Ventures)
enrichment.personal_bio: Partner Emeritus at Menlo Ventures and founder/CEO of Sierra Point Capital. Longtime VC focused on communications, storage, semiconductors, internet services and financial technology. Serves/has served on boards including Betterment and Credit Sesame. Educated at MIT (BS/MS, EE) and Stanford GSB (MBA).
enrichment.career_background: John Jarve joined Menlo Ventures in 1985 and is Partner Emeritus after decades leading investments across communications, storage, semiconductor, internet and fintech sectors. He is founder and CEO of Sierra Point Capital (Atherton, CA), has held multiple board seats (e.g., Betterment, Credit Sesame, DataXu/roku), and was lead investor in several companies that completed IPOs. He holds BS and MS degrees in electrical engineering from MIT and an MBA from Stanford GSB.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-to-growth stage technology companies in communications, storage/infrastructure, semiconductors, internet services, and financial technology.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Tribe Capital. Ph.D. in physics from Stanford University. Known for applying data science and quantitative methods to early‑ and growth‑stage venture investing.
interests: Data‑driven venture investing / quantifying product‑market fit
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Tribe Capital in 2018 and serves as a General Partner. Previously Partner & SVP of Quantitative Investing and Data Science at Social Capital, and led data science & analytics teams at Facebook. Earlier work includes analytics at Slide and product management at Microsoft; holds a Ph.D. in theoretical physics from Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Data‑driven investments across seed to growth‑stage technology companies — emphasis on FinTech, enterprise software, consumer internet and Web3/crypto.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner at Torch Capital, an early-stage VC focused on consumer technology. Former co‑founder of digital media company InsideHook and operator in music talent management. MBA from Columbia Business School and life member of the Council on Foreign Relations.
enrichment.career_background: Started in music talent management, then worked in McKinsey’s media & entertainment practice and on Jack Welch’s JWMI; led US operations at Mendeley and co‑founded InsideHook. Founded Torch Capital (2018) and invests primarily in early‑stage consumer tech, serving on/advising several boards and nonprofit organizations.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage consumer technology (DTC brands, consumer fintech, consumer health, creator-economy services); seed through early growth.

enrichment.personal_bio: Joseph Lubin is a co‑founder of Ethereum and the founder of ConsenSys. He serves as Chairman & Managing Partner at Ethereal Ventures and is a long‑time builder and investor in the Ethereum/Web3 ecosystem.
interests: Permissionless blockchain networks and protocol infrastructure
enrichment.career_background: Lubin studied Electrical Engineering and Computer Science at Princeton. He worked in software and finance roles (including Goldman Sachs) before co‑founding the Ethereum project and founding ConsenSys in 2014; he later cofounded Ethereal Ventures to invest in early‑stage blockchain and Web3 startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) investments in blockchain/Web3: decentralized protocols, infrastructure, DeFi, NFTs, and developer tooling

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Bread and Butter Ventures, where she leads investments in digital health and enterprise SaaS. Former founding director of Google for Startups and an investment partner at Revolution’s Rise of the Rest. Co‑founder of Silicon North Stars, a nonprofit that connects underserved Minnesota youth to tech opportunities.
enrichment.career_background: Mary Grove spent 15 years at Google (including founding director of Google for Startups) and later served as an investment partner at Revolution’s Rise of the Rest Seed Fund before becoming a Managing Partner at Bread and Butter Ventures. She co‑founded the nonprofit Silicon North Stars and serves on multiple nonprofit and regional boards while leading seed‑stage investing focused on healthtech, foodtech, and enterprise software.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage investments in foodtech, digital health (vertical SaaS/data/AI), and enterprise SaaS; U.S.-focused but invests nationally.

enrichment.personal_bio: Experienced operator-turned-investor. Former head of DeNAs US investment arm and ex-operator at Netscape, Kakaku.com and Digital Garage. Founding partner at Hike Ventures, based in San Francisco, focused on early-stage applied AI and cross-border (USJapan) deals.
enrichment.career_background: Started as a programmer and practice manager at Netscape, later served as CTO/COO at Kakaku.com and held leadership roles at Digital Garage. Led Open Network Lab as CEO, ran DeNAs San Francisco investment activities (Partner, Strategic Investment Office, 20142017), and is a founding partner at Hike Ventures investing in seed-stage applied-AI startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed) investments in applied/vertical AI, with interest in mobility, healthcare, VR/AR and USJapan cross-border opportunities.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and managing member of Drummond Road Capital; active angel investor focused on seed and early-stage software companies and accelerator-backed startups. Former CEO of Cohesant and founder/CEO of Sputnik7; serves as Senior Fund Advisor at DalFort Capital Partners. Holds a BA from the University of Massachusetts Amherst and a JD from Yale Law School.
enrichment.career_background: Morris Wheeler founded Drummond Road Capital (1999) and has managed a diversified venture and private equity portfolio. He was Chairman and CEO of Cohesant (sold to Graco in 2008), founded Sputnik7 (early internet music distribution), and mentors/ invests in companies from accelerators (TechStars, 500 Startups, Y Combinator). He is listed as a Senior Fund Advisor at DalFort Capital Partners and has served on multiple company boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage technology investments (software, SaaS, developer tools), digital media, and infrastructure/industrial tech; active with accelerator-backed deal flow.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Audacious Ventures focused on backing audacious, early-stage founders. Previously a partner at Gradient Ventures and Kleiner Perkins and co‑founder of YC-backed Proxino. Studied Computer Science at the University of Virginia; childhood across multiple continents informs his founder-first perspective.
enrichment.career_background: Muzzammil (MZ) Zaveri is a Partner at Audacious Ventures. He previously invested at Gradient Ventures (Google’s AI fund) and Kleiner Perkins, worked on product and strategy at Tencent, and co‑founded Proxino (YC S11). He studied computer science at the University of Virginia and focuses on pre-seed/seed investments in developer tooling, enterprise software, and AI-enabled startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed & Seed; early-stage startups; developer tools & infrastructure; enterprise SaaS and AI; fintech & healthcare B2B

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at BOLD Capital Partners with 30+ years in venture and startup commercialization. Previously co‑founded and served as General Partner at Monitor Ventures and led commercialization at Interval Research; early career at Boston Consulting Group. Educated in electrical engineering at IIT Delhi, holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and a PhD in EE from Stanford University.
interests: Technologies in and around the body to improve health
Technologies in and around manufacturing systems to improve productivity
Helping BOLD be an effective partner to entrepreneurs
enrichment.career_background: Neal has led early‑stage investing and startup commercialization roles for over three decades. He co‑founded Monitor Ventures, served as head of commercialization at Paul Allen’s Interval Research, and began his career at the Boston Consulting Group. His academic background is EE (IIT Delhi), an MBA from Harvard Business School and a PhD in Electrical Engineering from Stanford.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed/Series A) investments in life sciences, healthcare, deep tech/frontier tech and productivity technologies driven by exponential scientific advances.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Interlock Capital and founder of Fresh Brewed Tech. Co‑founder of edtech startup Portfolium (acquired by Instructure) with a background in mechanical engineering (UC San Diego) and early aerospace work on Space Shuttle main engines. Active in building startup ecosystems and angel investing in early‑stage companies.
enrichment.career_background: Neal Bloom is an engineer-turned-founder and investor. He began his career working on large aerospace systems (Space Shuttle main engines), co‑founded Portfolium (acquired by Instructure), and later founded Fresh Brewed Tech. He is Managing Partner at Interlock Capital, serves on boards/volunteer organizations in the San Diego startup ecosystem, and holds a B.S. in Mechanical Engineering (UC San Diego) and an MBA (Pepperdine).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed, seed) startups; sectors include aerospace/space, digital health, cybersecurity, marketplaces, enterprise SaaS, and climate/AgTech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Fulgur Ventures (since 2019) and an angel investor since 2008. Focuses on Bitcoin and Lightning Network startups and on product management and go-to-market for early-stage companies. Background includes senior product and business-development roles at Acronis and Kaspersky Lab.
enrichment.career_background: Oleg has worked in product management and international business development for security and infrastructure software firms, including roles at Kaspersky Lab and as Director of Product Management (Cloud Services) at Acronis. He has been an active angel investor since 2008 and joined Fulgur Ventures as a partner in 2019, focusing on early-stage investments in Bitcoin, Lightning and related financial infrastructure.
enrichment.investment_focus: Bitcoin and Lightning Network; consumer wallets & applications; financial infrastructure; early-stage (pre-seed/seed) investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture investor who served as an MBA Associate at Transmedia Capital (2016–2018) and is currently a partner at Nine Four Ventures. Holds an MBA from The Wharton School and a BS in Finance from Santa Clara University. Based in San Francisco and focuses on early-stage technology investments, particularly PropTech and SaaS.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in venture and investment roles at Transmedia Capital (MBA Associate, 2016–2018), SV Angel (Associate, 2014–2016) and began his career in investment banking (Goldman Sachs; Seven Hills). After Wharton MBA he joined Nine Four Ventures, where he is a partner. Education: MBA, The Wharton School; BS Finance, Santa Clara University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed & early-stage investments in digital media, SaaS, enterprise software, marketplaces and fintech (U.S.-focused).

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture investor with a decade+ of experience in Michigan early-stage funds. Served as Director at Red Cedar Ventures and Michigan Rise (managed by RCV) and joined Invest Detroit as SVP, Venture & Director, ID Ventures in January 2024. Experienced in designing PO (purchase-order) financing and pre-seed equity programs for Michigan startups.
interests: purchase-order financing and alternative startup capital
enrichment.career_background: Prem has held investment roles across Michigan venture programs: Director at Red Cedar Ventures and Michigan Rise (managed by MSU Research Foundation), Director at Invest Michigan, Portfolio Manager at the Michigan Economic Development Corporation, and early-career VC associate at Michigan Accelerator Fund I. He holds an MS (University of Michigan - School of Information), an MBA (Grand Valley State University) and a BBA (Western Michigan University).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / pre-seed investments in Michigan-based technology and life-sciences startups, university/IP spinouts, and early-stage commercialization (including PO financing).

enrichment.personal_bio: Rizwan “Riz” Virk is an entrepreneur, angel investor, author and academic researcher focused on games and the metaverse. He is a venture partner at Griffin Gaming Partners, founder/executive director of Play Labs @ MIT and runs Bayview Labs. He teaches and conducts metaverse research at Arizona State University and holds degrees from MIT and Stanford GSB.
enrichment.career_background: Computer scientist (BS, MIT) and management graduate (SM, Stanford GSB) who has founded multiple companies (Bayview Labs, Midverse Studios, Play Labs @ MIT) and served on/advocated for many startup boards. He is a prolific Silicon Valley angel investor, a venture partner at Griffin Gaming Partners, and a faculty associate / researcher at Arizona State University studying metaverse and virtual worlds.
enrichment.investment_focus: Gaming (studios, content, platforms), gaming infrastructure and tooling, web3/blockchain gaming, VR/AR/metaverse; seed to growth-stage investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder, Chairman and CEO of Vista Equity Partners, which focuses on enterprise software and related technology businesses. Trained as a chemical engineer (Cornell) and holds an MBA from Columbia; previously worked at Kraft and Goldman Sachs before founding Vista in 2000. Active philanthropist notable for gifts to HBCUs and STEM education initiatives.
enrichment.career_background: Robert F. Smith earned a B.S. in chemical engineering from Cornell (1985) and an MBA from Columbia Business School (1994). He worked in R&D at Goodyear and Kraft (holding several patents), then joined Goldman Sachs in technology M&A before founding Vista Equity Partners in 2000. At Vista he has directed the firm’s investment strategy and overseen hundreds of transactions and the build-out of a large portfolio of enterprise software companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise software, B2B SaaS and data/technology-enabled companies; private equity, private credit and permanent capital strategies; operational transformation and scaling of software businesses.

enrichment.personal_bio: Sam Landman is a venture investor and board director who served as a Managing Director at Comcast Ventures and later co‑founded Mosaic General Partnership. He has led and advised investments across consumer media, insurtech, cleantech and healthtech. He holds a BA from Bucknell University and an MBA from the Tuck School of Business at Dartmouth.
enrichment.career_background: Sam Landman began his investing career after roles at Gladwyne Partners, Genacast Ventures and The Electric Sheep. He was a Managing Director at Comcast Ventures (joined the team in 2009) where he sourced and led investments across media, advertising, consumer and frontier tech. He later co‑founded Mosaic General Partnership and serves on multiple public and private company boards. He holds a B.A. from Bucknell University and an MBA from Dartmouth (Tuck).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early–to–growth stage technology: data & AI, enabling technologies, energy & sustainability, health tech, proptech, advertising/marketing technology and consumer/media.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Managing Partner at Mighty Capital and founder/chair of Products That Count. Former product leader at Facebook/Meta and Nokia; holds an MS in electrical engineering and an MBA from Stanford. Kauffman Fellow and member of YPO; frequent speaker and lecturer on product and investing.
enrichment.career_background: SC Moatti is the founding managing partner of Mighty Capital, a San Francisco‑based VC that focuses on product‑first enterprise software. She previously led product teams at Facebook/Meta and Nokia and founded Rendez‑Vous Labs (acquired by Facebook). She also founded Products That Count, lectures at Stanford and Columbia executive programs, serves on public and private boards (including Opera Software), and is a Kauffman Fellow.
enrichment.investment_focus: Series A / early‑growth product‑first B2B SaaS and enterprise software; AI & data infrastructure; developer/platform tools

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and investor; co‑founder of Zillow and Hotwire and co‑founder/chair at Pacaso. Founder and General Partner at 75 & Sunny, active in building startups through a studio and seed investing. Former CEO of Zillow (until 2019) and board member at several public and private tech companies.
enrichment.career_background: Spencer Rascoff co‑founded Hotwire (sold to Expedia) and Zillow (served in multiple roles and was CEO for ~10 years). He later co‑founded Pacaso, dot.LA, Queue, Recon Food and heyLibby, and runs 75 & Sunny, a Los Angeles‑based startup studio and seed investor. Earlier in his career he worked in investment banking at Goldman Sachs and private equity at TPG; he has served on boards including Palantir, TripAdvisor and Varo Bank and has taught entrepreneurship at Harvard.
enrichment.hometown: Manhattan, New York; Los Angeles, California
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage startups with emphasis on proptech/real estate, creator economy, e‑commerce, fintech and marketplace businesses

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at GFR Fund, focusing on gaming, entertainment and consumer-focused technology. Previously worked in corporate finance and M&A (including roles advising at Morgan Stanley) and held investment/operating roles at GREE and Mitsubishi. Education: Bachelor of Law, Hitotsubashi University; MBA, University of Chicago.
enrichment.career_background: Teppei Tsutsui is a General Partner at GFR Fund (formerly GREE VR Capital), leading the firm’s investments in gaming, entertainment and consumer tech. He has prior experience advising M&A at Morgan Stanley, worked in corporate planning and investment roles at GREE, and held business development roles at Mitsubishi Corporation. He has taken board/advisory roles for portfolio companies and holds an MBA from the University of Chicago.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage investments in gaming, entertainment and consumer technology, with emphasis on AR/VR/immersive, creator economy/social, Web3/blockchain gaming, and generative AI for media.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at First Round Capital and former product leader at Google, Facebook, Twitter and Dropbox. Focuses on helping early-stage founders find product–market fit and on "power tools" — developer, data and design-focused platforms. Holds BS and MS degrees in Computer Science from Stanford University.
enrichment.career_background: Started as an Associate Product Manager at Google (Gmail), then held product roles at Facebook and Twitter after his startup Cover was acquired; later served as VP of Product & Design at Dropbox. Joined First Round as Founder in Residence (2018) and became a Partner focused on seed / early-stage investments and PMF support.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / early-stage startups; product-market fit support; developer tools, data/AI/ML, design tools, and infrastructure

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and Co-CEO of FIGS and an investment partner at XFactor Ventures. Formerly worked in investment banking and private equity (Citigroup, The Blackstone Group). Holds a BA in Economics from Tufts University and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Trina co-founded FIGS, a digitally native healthcare apparel company, and led its growth to a public company. Prior to FIGS she worked in Citigroup’s investment banking/private equity groups and at The Blackstone Group. She holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and a BA from Tufts University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage startups (preferentially with at least one female founder); sectors include healthcare, e-commerce and technology.

enrichment.personal_bio: Tyler Winklevoss is an American investor and entrepreneur. He co‑founded Winklevoss Capital (2012) and the Gemini cryptocurrency exchange (2014), and is Gemini's CEO. He is a former Olympic rower and holds a BA from Harvard and an MBA from Oxford.
enrichment.career_background: Tyler Winklevoss earned a BA in economics from Harvard and an MBA from Saïd Business School, Oxford. He co‑founded ConnectU (later ConnectU/HarvardConnection), then Winklevoss Capital in 2012; in 2014 he and his brother founded Gemini, where he serves as co‑founder and CEO. He represented the U.S. in rowing at the 2008 Olympics and has participated in venture and token investments through Winklevoss Capital and related funds.
enrichment.investment_focus: Cryptocurrency & blockchain; early‑stage venture (seed/Series A); fintech and financial infrastructure; Web3 / metaverse; consumer & direct‑to‑consumer startups

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of Oper8r (a cohort program for emerging fund managers) and author of How To Raise A Venture Capital Fund. Previously invested as an institutional allocator at Hall Capital Partners and Sapphire Ventures and has taught at Stanford GSB. Focuses on training and scaling emerging VC managers and early‑stage technology investing.
enrichment.career_background: Winter Mead worked as an institutional investor at Hall Capital Partners and later at Sapphire Ventures (roles from senior associate to principal). He co‑founded Oper8r to support and train emerging fund managers, authored a book on raising VC funds, and has served as junior faculty/teaching assistant at Stanford Graduate School of Business. He also founded Coolwater Capital, an academy and investment vehicle for emerging managers.
enrichment.investment_focus: Enabling and investing alongside emerging fund managers; early‑stage technology startups (pre‑seed/seed); institutionalization and operational scaling of VC firms

enrichment.personal_bio: Business/Investment Associate at Innovent Capital Group supporting the firms seed fund and internal incubations, with a focus on market research and go-to-market strategy. Graduated from New York University (BS, research psychology). Prior roles include research/operations at 25Madison and business development/marketing at Onda; listed as HR Manager at Homium (2023).
enrichment.career_background: Associate for the Innovent seed fund (research and GTM support); previously worked in research and incubator roles at 25Madison, business operations/marketing at Onda (2020021), and served as Human Resources Manager at Homium in 2023. Educated at New York University (BS, research psychology).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed) investments in technology-enabled B2B businesses, including fintech, Web3/blockchain, climate/energy, real estate/proptech, and B2B SaaS.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and General Partner at ScienceVest, a seed-stage fund and platform for hard‑tech and life‑science startups. Kauffman Fellow (Class 19) and licensed professional engineer with a computer engineering degree and a Juris Doctor. Runs/helps run Impact Science Angels and focuses on financing translational science and scalable impact-oriented technologies.
interests: Startup ecosystem building and entrepreneurship education
Impact investing for scalable social outcomes
enrichment.career_background: Ramphis co‑founded ScienceVest in 2016 and has served in venture roles focused on first‑check investments into hard‑tech and life‑science companies. He is a Kauffman Fellow (Class 19), has researched funding gaps for translational science, cofounded Impact Science Angels, and has held roles supporting ecosystem development (including work with accelerators and ecosystem programs). He holds a BSc in computer engineering and a JD, and began his career in technology roles (including at Microsoft).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / pre-seed investments in hard‑tech and life‑science startups (biotech, discovery tools, AI/robotics, sensors, energy/materials); first‑check, high‑conviction co‑investing.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Weekend Fund. Previously worked in product and risk roles at TrueLayer and Stripe and joined Weekend Fund after several years as Chief of Staff. Writes investment memos and helps source early-stage deals. Recently relocated to San Francisco.
enrichment.career_background: Started her career at Stripe (risk/product roles), was the first product hire at TrueLayer in London, interned at Mithril Capital and worked with Kairos Society and Kalaari Capital; joined Weekend Fund initially as Chief of Staff and progressed to Partner/General Partner. Educated at University of California, Berkeley.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage investing across consumer internet, creator economy tools, audio/voice products, distributed work, fintech/payments, and developer/no-code tooling.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder & CEO of Connection Silicon Valley, she helps Canadian startups access Silicon Valley investors, mentors and customers. Co‑founder and general partner at Women’s Equity Lab and publisher at Disruption Magazine. Angel investor and advisor focused on early-stage and women‑led companies.
interests: Canadian startups — US/Silicon Valley market entry
Supporting women founders & increasing diversity in VC
Early‑stage angel investing and fundraising readiness
enrichment.career_background: Joanne Fedeyko is the founder and CEO of Connection Silicon Valley and launched the Canadian Women’s Network to connect Canadian founders with Silicon Valley. She co‑founded Women’s Equity Lab (an angel group focused on women‑led companies), has served as Executive Director of the C100 association, and works as an advisor and mentor to startups. Trained as a Certified Management Accountant, she has lived in Silicon Valley since 1999.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) startups; Canada→US/Silicon Valley market entry; women‑led founders and increasing diversity on cap tables; life sciences/health innovation

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal at Watertower Ventures who focuses on sourcing, diligence and portfolio support for early-stage companies. Formerly worked in GE's IT Leadership Program and at Slalom; holds a BS from Cornell Engineering and an MBA from UCLA Anderson. Active in technology investing with an operating background in cloud and product.
enrichment.career_background: Started in GE's IT Leadership Program (migrated GE applications to public cloud), moved to Slalom Consulting and early-stage product roles (including Comake and a Product Technology role at Google), and joined Watertower Ventures as a Principal where he contributes to sourcing, due diligence, operations and portfolio management. Education: BS, Cornell University (Engineering); MBA, UCLA Anderson School of Management.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / seed and early-stage investments in consumer technology and enterprise software (SaaS, marketplaces, fintech, real estate tech, media & gaming); typical check size ~$100k–$1.5M.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner and co‑founder of Interlock Capital. Detroit native and electrical engineer who moved to San Diego in 1998 and has been a founder/operator in early‑stage startups since. Founded Email Copilot (acquired) and later served in product/data leadership at Seismic before launching Interlock to enable community-driven angel investing. Mentor with Techstars and the Founder Institute.
enrichment.career_background: Started as an electrical engineer in the Detroit auto industry, moved to San Diego in 1998 and joined early startups. Founded and led Email Copilot (acquired), held VP product/data roles at Seismic, and in 2020 co‑founded Interlock Capital, where he serves as Managing Partner. Active mentor in Techstars and Founder Institute and an angel/syndicate investor in numerous early‑stage companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed); SaaS, B2B and enterprise software; data & analytics; marketplace and consumer‑facing startups (via community syndicates)

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of Behind Genius Ventures (founded 2021). Has served as Chief of Staff at Series and worked in early‑stage investing and growth roles. Educated at Occidental College with a focus on product‑led, pre‑seed/seed startups.
enrichment.career_background: Josh Schlisserman co‑founded Behind Genius Ventures and has held operator and investor roles including Chief of Staff at Series and head of growth at Vicarious. He has run operator‑led investing vehicles (Picks & Shovels / solo GP work) and writes/speaks on product‑led growth and problem–market fit. He studied at Occidental College.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed-stage, product‑led growth startups (developer tools, fintech, Web3/crypto, creator/media/gaming)

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director of Techstars Boston, focused on early-stage accelerator programs and founder support. Formerly Investment Principal and Director of Platform at Techstars; prior roles include Associate Director at Harvard Business School. Holds an MBA from NYU Stern and a BA from Johns Hopkins University.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Techstars in 2021 (Director of Platform), progressed to Investment Principal and was named Managing Director of the Techstars Boston accelerator. Previously served as Associate Director at Harvard Business School's Arthur Rock Center for Entrepreneurship and held business development and sales leadership roles at OpenFrame and Paint Nite.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / Seed investments via accelerator programs; focus on healthtech, sustainability/climate, proptech, AI/ML and B2B SaaS

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner and President at Positive Sum. Former COO and board member at balena; previously chief of staff to the CEO at Impossible Foods and an investment analyst at the University of Washington. Holds a B.A. from the University of Washington.
enrichment.career_background: Worked as an investment analyst at the University of Washington (2011–2014), served as Chief of Staff to the CEO at Impossible Foods (2014–2016), held product and commercial leadership roles at balena culminating as COO and board member (2016–2022), and joined Positive Sum as Partner and President in 2022.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage technology (Seed–Series A); focus on data services, enterprise applications, Web3/crypto, fintech, marketplaces and hardware/IoT

enrichment.personal_bio: Product designer-turned-investor who co-founded Bolt, a pre-seed venture firm focused on hardware and connected devices. Served as Bolt’s founder/GP (2012–2019), was an EIR at Eclipse Ventures, and joined Ten Percent Happier as President & COO in 2020. Has a background in product design and prototyping.
enrichment.career_background: Ben Einstein trained as a product designer and founded Brainstream Design before co-founding Bolt in 2012 to back hardware-first startups. He led Bolt’s hands-on, engineering-forward pre-seed program through 2019, spent 2019–2020 as an Entrepreneur-in-Residence at Eclipse Ventures, and moved into operator roles as President & COO of Ten Percent Happier beginning in 2020.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed hardware and physical-product startups (connected devices, IoT, robotics, manufacturing, consumer electronics); hands-on engineering/prototyping support.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and operator based in Dubai. Co‑founder and General Partner at Leyden Ventures and serves as an Investment Partner & Advisor at GINCO Investments; also a Venture Partner at Further Ventures and Learn Capital. He sits on nonprofit boards (StartOut, Victory Institute), has spoken at SXSW and the UN Leaders on Purpose summit, and completed executive education including UC Berkeley’s venture capital program.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner at Rock Health Capital. Focuses on early-stage (Seed–Series A) investments at the intersection of healthcare and technology. Former senior leader at Roche Diagnostics and Genentech; BA in Economics from Harvard University.
interests: Enterprise partnerships & advisory for healthcare organizations
enrichment.career_background: Bill Evans leads Rock Health Capital as Founder and General Partner. Prior to Rock Health he launched Roche Diagnostics' Navify oncology decision‑support unit and held leadership roles at Genentech. He began his career at Goldman Sachs and worked as a software engineer in Silicon Valley before moving into healthcare innovation and investing.
enrichment.investment_focus: Digital health and health IT; Seed through Series A; clinical decision support, telehealth, care delivery platforms, and enterprise healthcare partnerships

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Immeasurable and serial entrepreneur who bootstrapped Student Brands (founded 1999) and sold it to Barnes & Noble Education in August 2017 for about $58.5M. Co‑founder and former CEO of Solve (YC S17), later acquired; now invests via Immeasurable, a Los Angeles–based family office.
interests: Philanthropy & human rights (North Korean refugee support)
enrichment.career_background: Blaine Vess built Student Brands from a college startup into a bootstrapped edtech business and exited in 2017. He later co‑founded Solve (YC S17), which was acquired, and founded Immeasurable to invest in and acquire companies and to back founders and funds. He serves on nonprofit boards and is active in impact filmmaking and philanthropy.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) investments and acquisitions focused on education, health, communications and financial technology; also invests in funds and impact/film projects.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and Managing/General Partner at Charge Ventures, a NYC-based pre-seed/seed fund. Co-founder and President of Kumospace and an Adjunct Professor at Columbia Business School. 2x founder and serial investor with prior roles as EIR at PrimaryVC, Director of Investments at AppFund, and an early-career equity research analyst. Dartmouth graduate and Fulbright Scholar; hails from Ocean City, MD.
enrichment.career_background: Brett Martin co-founded Charge Ventures in 2015 and leads its pre-seed/seed investing activity. He co-founded Kumospace (virtual workspaces) and teaches data analytics/technology strategy as an adjunct at Columbia Business School. Earlier he co-founded startups including Sonar and Switch, served as an EIR at PrimaryVC, was Director of Investments at AppFund, and began his career in equity research after graduating from Dartmouth and completing a Fulbright.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / seed-stage investments in AI/ML, data-driven software, developer tools/APIs, marketplaces, creator economy, D2C healthcare, and future-of-work technologies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Lead Edge Capital based in New York. Leads growth-stage software, internet and tech-enabled services investments and serves on the firm's investment, disposition and management committees. Holds a B.S. from the Wharton School (University of Pennsylvania) and an M.B.A. from Columbia Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Lead Edge in 2012 and is a member of the Investment Committee. Prior to Lead Edge he was on the investment teams at FTV Capital (Vice President) and Bessemer Venture Partners. Holds a B.S. in Economics from Wharton and an M.B.A. in Finance from Columbia Business School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth-stage investments in software, internet, and tech-enabled services (minority and buyout positions; private and public opportunities).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner at Camber Creek, a venture firm focused on real estate technology. Leads due diligence, investment decisions and portfolio support. Previously served as President of Operations for a large private real estate development and management company; holds a B.A. from the University of Michigan.
interests: AI/ML applied to the built environment
enrichment.career_background: Casey Berman founded Camber Creek and serves as its Managing Partner; he leads the firm’s investment process and works closely with portfolio companies to scale commercial adoption. Prior to Camber Creek he was President of Operations for a large privately held real estate development and management company and he holds a B.A. from the University of Michigan.
enrichment.investment_focus: Real estate technology (PropTech); early and growth-stage enterprise SaaS for property/building operations, construction tech, sustainability/ESG, and real-estate fintech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Dr. Chenxi Wang (Ph.D., University of Virginia) is the founder and Managing General Partner of Rain Capital, a San Francisco–area venture fund focused on cybersecurity. She is a former Carnegie Mellon faculty member and former VP of Research at Forrester, and has held senior strategy roles at security firms including Twistlock and Intel Security. Wang is an active investor and a women-in-tech advocate and serves on corporate and nonprofit boards.
enrichment.career_background: Founder and Managing General Partner at Rain Capital; former VP of Research at Forrester; earlier faculty (Carnegie Mellon University). Held senior strategy/product roles at security companies (including Twistlock and Intel Security/CipherCloud). Active board member and advisor to startups and a Fortune 500 company (MDU Resources).
enrichment.investment_focus: Cybersecurity (enterprise/cloud/attack-surface), AI & analytics applied to security; early-stage / seed enterprise software investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Christopher Steed is Chief Investment Officer and Managing Director at Paladin Capital Group. He joined Paladin in 2008 and leads the firm’s multi-stage, national security–related investment strategy with a focus on IT and cybersecurity portfolios. He oversees deal sourcing, execution and portfolio company management and has served on boards of multiple portfolio companies. Prior to Paladin he worked in Merrill Lynch’s Private Banking and Investment Group and holds a CAIA designation.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Paladin Capital Group in 2008 and serves as CIO and Managing Director, leading the firm’s multi-stage investment strategy focused on dual‑use and national security‑relevant technologies. Responsibilities include sourcing and executing investments, portfolio management and board oversight. Previously worked in Merrill Lynch’s Private Banking and Investment Group and holds the Chartered Alternative Investment Analyst (CAIA) designation.
enrichment.investment_focus: Multi-stage (Seed through Growth) investments in cybersecurity, digital infrastructure resilience, dual‑use/national security technologies, enterprise IT and critical‑infrastructure solutions.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at TSVC and serial technology entrepreneur with a Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign. Focuses on seed-stage investments in deep tech, IoT/edge, cloud and enterprise software, and the China–US market. Former founder/CEO of Mash5 and earlier roles as co‑founder/CTO of brightinfo and President & CTO of Thinkmart.
enrichment.career_background: Dr. Chun Xia is a founding partner of TSVC (founded 2010). He is a serial entrepreneur — founder/CEO of Mash5 Technologies and co‑founder/CTO of brightinfo and Thinkmart — and previously worked as an architect at Sun Microsystems. He holds a Ph.D. in Computer Science (UIUC) and a B.Eng from Tsinghua University and mentors Tsinghua entrepreneurship programs.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / pre‑seed stage; deep tech (AI chips, semiconductors); healthtech & biotech; enterprise software & SaaS; robotics & lab automation

enrichment.personal_bio: Cindy Cole is a Technical Partner at Digitalis Ventures with a DVM and Ph.D. in cardiovascular pharmacology from the University of Florida. She is an Associate Clinical Professor and Director of the Racing Laboratory at the University of Florida and is a diplomate of the American College of Veterinary Clinical Pharmacology. Prior to Digitalis she held R&D and management roles at IDEXX, Novartis Animal Health, Piedmont Pharmaceuticals and Mars Petcare.
enrichment.career_background: Dr. Cole holds a DVM and Ph.D. (cardiovascular pharmacology) from the University of Florida, has served on the faculty at UC Davis, and is currently an Associate Clinical Professor and Director of the Racing Laboratory at the University of Florida. She worked in R&D and product/management roles at IDEXX, Novartis Animal Health, Piedmont Pharmaceuticals and Mars Petcare before joining Digitalis Ventures as a Technical Partner.
enrichment.investment_focus: Human and animal health; life-sciences/biotech; early-stage therapeutics, diagnostics, and pet health

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor, founder and writer who builds media, education and small-business holding companies. Venture Partner at Magma Partners and founder of Contrarian Thinking/Contrarian Capital; former institutional roles at Vanguard, Goldman Sachs, State Street and First Trust. Active board member and investor in cannabis, early-stage startups and Main Street businesses.
interests: Main Street / small-business ownership and acquisitions
Early-stage venture and Latin America startups
Cannabis industry investing and growth equity
enrichment.career_background: Codie Sanchez began as an investigative journalist, then moved into finance with roles at Vanguard, Goldman Sachs and State Street before leading Latin America investments at First Trust. She served as a partner/MD at Entourage Effect Capital (cannabis growth equity), founded Contrarian Thinking and related holding/fund vehicles focused on small businesses, and is a Venture Partner / board member at Magma Partners.
enrichment.investment_focus: Main Street small-business acquisitions (service-based, cashflow businesses); early-stage venture (seed–Series A) including Latin America; cannabis/growth equity; founder-led startups and creator-driven education.

enrichment.personal_bio: Executive Director in the Technology team at M Ventures, focused on technology and deep‑tech investments. PhD in Chemistry from MIT with research on quantum dots, display materials and biomedical imaging. Based in Boston and active as a board director/observer across M Ventures' tech portfolio.
enrichment.career_background: Daniel earned his BSc and MSc in Chemistry from RWTH Aachen University and a PhD in Chemistry from MIT. He joined M Ventures after participating in the M Ventures Fellowship and supporting the team as an analyst; he became an Associate in 2019 and was promoted within the Technology team to an Executive Director role in June 2025. He sources and leads technology investments (hardware, semiconductors, photonics and related deep tech) and serves as board director/observer for portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Technology investments (semiconductors, advanced computing, photonics/optics, deep‑tech hardware); early to growth stage within M Ventures' Technology fund.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner & Lead Mentor at XX and managing partner at Antigravity Capital. Cofounder and former CEO of Disqus. Early-stage investor and mentor focused on product-led software startups and AI-enabled businesses.
enrichment.career_background: Cofounded and led Disqus as CEO before its acquisition, then moved into investing and mentoring. Served as Partner & Lead Mentor at XX and is a managing partner at Antigravity Capital; also advises startups and sits on advisory boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / true-seed; early-stage software startups; AI-enabled product companies; product-market fit and hands-on founder support

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and product leader; Venture Partner at TMV focused on EdTech and the future of work. Co‑founder of drop.io (acquired by Facebook) and Imagine Easy Solutions/EasyBib (acquired by Chegg); later served as VP of Product at Chegg. Currently co‑founder of Unwind Media / Solitaired and advises early‑stage startups on product, engineering and go‑to‑market.
enrichment.career_background: Began as an Associate Consultant at Bain & Company, then co‑founded drop.io (acquired by Facebook) and Imagine Easy Solutions/EasyBib (acquired by Chegg). After the EasyBib acquisition he served as Chegg’s VP of Product for Writing Tools. He is a co‑founder of Unwind Media (Solitaired) and serves as a Venture Partner at TMV, advising and leading investments in education, work‑tech and consumer product startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed/Series A) startups in EdTech, Future of Work and the care economy; product‑led SaaS, consumer gaming/cognitive health, and no‑code/AI tools.

enrichment.personal_bio: David J. Adelman is a Philadelphia-based entrepreneur and the founder of Darco Capital, the family office investment vehicle. He is CEO of Campus Apartments and co‑founder and vice chairman of FS Investments. He invests across climate tech, consumer brands, fintech, sports & media, and real estate.
enrichment.career_background: Adelman built Campus Apartments into a national student‑housing platform (CEO), co‑founded FS Investments (vice chairman), and founded Darco Capital as his family office. He is a partner in Harris Blitzer Sports & Entertainment, founded Darco Spirits, and serves on several regional and nonprofit boards. He holds a B.A. in Political Science from Ohio State University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Family office investments across climate tech, consumer products (food & spirits), fintech, enterprise technology, sports & media, and real estate (student housing).

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Good Growth Capital focused on GreenTech and Life Sciences investments. Former co-founder and managing partner at Capital A Partners and prior Managing Director roles at Katalyst Venture Partners and Techstars/Arcadis City of 2030. Co-founded and exited B2B supply-chain company Supplybase; holds a BS in Mechanical Engineering (Clemson) and an MBA (UNC Kenan‑Flagler).
enrichment.career_background: Started in engineering and business roles at GE, DuPont and Conoco; co-founded and sold Supplybase (B2B supply‑chain software); held investor/operating roles at Katalyst Venture Partners and as Managing Director for the Techstars/Arcadis City of 2030 accelerator; co‑founded Capital A Partners before joining Good Growth Capital where he leads due diligence and serves on/observes several portfolio boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed through Series A investments in life sciences/medical devices, green tech/clean energy, data sciences and advanced materials/hard-science deep-tech.

enrichment.personal_bio: David Rosenthal is an investor and co‑host of the Acquired podcast. He co‑founded Wave Capital (seed fund focused on marketplaces) and previously worked as a principal at Madrona Venture Group. He holds an MBA from Stanford GSB and a BA from Princeton University, and runs an AngelList fund called Kindergarten Ventures.
enrichment.career_background: Rosenthal spent over a decade in venture and finance: analyst roles at UBS and The Wall Street Journal, followed by positions at Meritech and StartX, then principal at Madrona Venture Group (joined 2010). He co‑founded Wave Capital in 2017 and later launched Kindergarten Ventures (an AngelList fund). He is co‑host of the Acquired podcast and serves/has served on boards including Icebrg.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage marketplaces and consumer/enterprise technology; angel and growth‑stage tech via personal/AngelList fund (Kindergarten Ventures)

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture capital investor and recording artist; co‑founder and General Partner at Time BioVentures. Harvard alumnus who shifted from a music career and Spotify artist-in-residence role into early-stage investing, focusing on life sciences and healthcare.
enrichment.career_background: Graduated from Harvard; frontman of Chester French and later Artist‑in‑Residence at Spotify (2011–2015). Transitioned to investing, co‑founding Inevitable Ventures and, in 2020, Time BioVentures, where he leads investments in therapeutics, diagnostics, research tools, and healthcare delivery companies and serves on several boards/advisory roles.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage life sciences and healthcare (therapeutics, diagnostics, research tools, and healthcare delivery)

enrichment.personal_bio: American entrepreneur and investor; founder and CEO of FUBU and founder of The Shark Group. Longtime investor on ABC’s Shark Tank and a New York Times/Wall Street Journal best-selling author and public speaker.
enrichment.career_background: Daymond John co-founded FUBU in 1992 and scaled it into an internationally recognized apparel brand. He later founded The Shark Group (brand consulting) and joined ABC’s Shark Tank as an investor; he also publishes business books and runs entrepreneurship programs and events.
enrichment.hometown: Hollis, Queens, New York City, U.S.
enrichment.investment_focus: Branding, fashion/apparel and consumer product startups (early to early-growth)

enrichment.personal_bio: Dídac Lee is a Spanish entrepreneur and business angel. He is co‑founder and Managing Partner at Galdana Ventures and co‑founder of TradeInn (Scubastore). He served on FC Barcelona's board as Head of Digital (2010–2020) and has invested in several Spanish and international startups including Glovo and Badi.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Galdana Ventures in 2015. Previously founded and led multiple tech companies (including TradeInn/Scubastore, Inspirit and Fhios). Served on FC Barcelona's board leading digital transformation (2010–2020). Active angel investor, mentor and board/advisor to portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Fund-of-funds investing in venture capital with exposure to early-stage technology sectors (consumer internet, e‑commerce, marketplaces, sports tech)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of White Star Capital. Over two decades of experience in investment banking and venture capital, focused on helping technology companies scale internationally. Has led investments and exits across consumer, fintech, mobility and digital health sectors.
interests: Partnering with founders and global scale-ups
enrichment.career_background: Founded White Star Capital in 2007 and serves as Founder & Managing Partner. Previously co‑founded a transatlantic M&A advisory firm (media & technology) and worked in M&A and corporate finance at Merrill Lynch and ABN AMRO. Educated at HEC Montréal (B.Com) and holds an M.Sc. in Finance from ESSEC.
enrichment.investment_focus: A.I., Digital Health, Fintech, Foodtech, Future of Work, Industrial Technologies, Mobility and Wellbeing; primarily Series A/B and early growth for globally ambitious tech companies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Fei-Fei Li is a Stanford computer science professor, co‑founder and chairperson of the nonprofit AI4ALL, and creator of the ImageNet dataset. She co‑founded World Labs (spatial‑intelligence AI) and has served in industry roles including Chief Scientist of AI/ML at Google Cloud.
enrichment.career_background: BA in Physics (Princeton) and PhD in Electrical Engineering (Caltech). In academia she is the Sequoia Professor and co‑director of Stanford’s Human‑Centered AI Institute; she served as Director of Stanford’s AI Lab and was Chief Scientist of AI/ML at Google Cloud (2017–2018). She co‑founded AI4ALL (co‑chair) and later co‑founded World Labs; she also participates in advisory and board roles for AI companies and organizations.
enrichment.investment_focus: AI / machine learning, computer vision, robotics & spatial intelligence, deep tech, AI‑enabled healthcare and education (angel / early‑stage)

enrichment.personal_bio: Fran Hauser is a startup investor, bestselling author, keynote speaker and champion of women in the workplace. A former President of Digital at Time Inc., she has funded and advised dozens of consumer-focused and female-founded startups. She is the author of The Myth of the Nice Girl and Embrace the Work, Love Your Career and is a LinkedIn Top Voice.
enrichment.career_background: Hauser spent ~15 years in digital media, rising to President of Digital at Time Inc. after roles at Moviefone/AOL. Since 2014 she has been an active angel/seed investor and advisor focused on consumer, media and female‑founded companies; she is also a bestselling author, speaker and founder of Bookbound and opened Bedford Books in 2024.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (angel/seed) consumer startups — consumer & DTC brands, CPG, digital media/publishing, wellness; emphasis on female‑founded companies

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner and CEO of 10X Capital, a New York–based investment firm. Serial entrepreneur and investor active since 1999 who has been involved in founding teams such as InternetCash, RefinanceOne and TheNumber. Focuses on technology, fintech and digital assets. Attended New York University.
enrichment.career_background: Hans Thomas founded 10X Capital in 2004 and serves as its CEO. Prior to 10X he was on founding teams and senior roles at InternetCash, RefinanceOne and TheNumber; he has led investments and merchant-banking activities spanning venture, treasury and public-market strategies. Educated at New York University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Technology-focused venture investing (fintech, digital assets/digital infrastructure); early-stage and growth-stage equity; merchant-banking, treasury and SPAC sponsorship strategies

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Executive Chair of FIGS (healthcare apparel); former Co‑CEO until August 2022. Investment partner at XFactor Ventures where she evaluates early-stage startups. Areas of interest listed on her XFactor profile include healthcare, e‑commerce and technology. She holds a B.A. from the University of Wisconsin–Madison.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded FIGS in 2013 and led product and marketing; served as Co‑CEO until August 2022 and currently serves as Executive Chair. Prior to FIGS she ran a high‑end handbag business (Heather Hasson bags) and related consumer ventures. Serves on nonprofit and corporate boards (e.g., RxArt) and is listed as an investing partner at XFactor Ventures.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed stage checks into female‑founded or mixed‑gender founding teams; sectors highlighted include healthcare, e‑commerce/consumer and early‑stage technology

enrichment.personal_bio: CEO and co‑founder of Health Wildcatters, a Dallas-based healthcare seed accelerator and fund. Physician (MD, Medical University of Vienna) with an MBA (SMU) who leads the accelerator, seed investments and founded the Health Hacking Crisis Network.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder, CEO & Partner at Health Wildcatters (since 2013). Previously managing director – medical technology at NTEC (North Texas Enterprise Center) and faculty at UT Southwestern (NIH‑funded principal investigator). Education: MD (Medical University of Vienna) and MBA (SMU Cox School of Business). Founder of the Health Hacking Crisis Network (nonprofit).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage healthcare (digital health/mHealth, medical devices, diagnostics); seed/accelerator-stage investments and mentorship.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at LifeX Ventures, investing where software meets science (AI + health/longevity). Serial entrepreneur — co‑founder/CEO of CoverWallet, Pixable and Contactive — and cofounder of iPronics. Educated at Cambridge (MEng/PhD) and MIT (MBA).
enrichment.career_background: Scientist‑turned‑entrepreneur and investor. Built and led three startups in New York (Pixable, Contactive, CoverWallet) with multiple exits, worked at McKinsey and Microsoft Corporate Strategy, and later co‑founded iPronics and LifeX Ventures; holds a PhD from Cambridge and an MBA from MIT.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed/pre‑seed) investments in longevity, AI applied to health and life sciences, biotechnology and genomics, and deep‑tech commercialization of scientific research.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at GingerBread Capital focused on investing in women-led companies. Former product manager and Goldman Sachs analyst who founded Tigress Ventures to advise and scale female-led businesses. Selected as a Kauffman Fellow (Class 27).
enrichment.career_background: Started at Goldman Sachs in capital markets and trading, moved into product roles at American Express and TravelClick, founded Tigress Ventures in 2014, served as Venture Partner/EIR at Plum Alley, and joined GingerBread Capital as a Partner in 2018; named a Kauffman Fellow in 2022.
enrichment.investment_focus: Invests in women-led, technology-enabled companies across early to growth stages; sectors include healthcare, consumer products, enterprise/SaaS and education.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and advisor focused on early-stage technology companies in the Pacific Northwest. Previously worked at Institutional Venture Partners (IVP) on later-stage investments and began his career in technology investment banking. Serves on or has served on multiple Voyager portfolio boards including WellSaid Labs and Kaskada.
enrichment.career_background: James Newell began in technology investment banking at Bank of America/Merrill Lynch, later joined IVP as an investor working on later-stage deals (including Kayak, Carbonite, Casper, Checkr and others). He joined Voyager Capital in the Pacific Northwest (joining publicly reported in 2017) where he focuses on lead and seed/Series A investments and board/advisory roles for portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Lead early-stage (seed / Series A) investments in B2B technology: enterprise software, SaaS, cloud infrastructure, analytics and AI/ML, primarily in the Pacific Northwest and California

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and angel investor best known for co-founding GroupMe and Fundera. Co-founder/partner at Magellan where he helped build companies and seed investments; later listed as a venture partner at Union Square Ventures. Based in Brooklyn, NY.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded GroupMe (launched 2010, acquired 2011) and later founded Fundera (launched 2013/2014, acquired by NerdWallet in 2020). Has been an active angel investor and operator, served on Splice’s board, and was a principal at Magellan (magellan.ventures) building companies and making early investments; holds a BA from Columbia University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage / seed investments; fintech and small‑business finance; consumer marketplaces and social apps; developer tools and creator/music technology

enrichment.personal_bio: Senior Google executive and angel investor based in San Francisco. Known for leading Google’s Ads & Measurement/product efforts and for prior leadership at AdMob. Serves on nonprofit and industry boards (Girls Who Code, IAB).
enrichment.career_background: Jason Spero is a longtime digital advertising and mobile leader who joined Google via the AdMob acquisition and has held senior roles including VP in Google’s Global Business Organization and global product lead for Ads & Measurement. Earlier roles include VP & GM North America at AdMob, Entrepreneur-in-Residence at Redpoint, and senior marketing/product roles at Digital Chocolate and Openwave. He serves on boards and advises startups and funds.
enrichment.investment_focus: Mobile & advertising technology, ad measurement/analytics, early-stage/angel investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Managing Partner at GFT Ventures with over 20 years of venture capital experience. Previously co‑founder of TransLink Capital and Managing Director of Samsung Ventures. Holds an MBA from Stanford GSB and MS/BS degrees in Chemistry from Seoul National University. Active angel investor, advisor and AAMA board member.
enrichment.career_background: Jay began his investment career at Vertex Management (Temasek’s VC arm), served in business development roles including Dialpad, worked at McKinsey and Goldman Sachs, then led Samsung Ventures’ U.S. operations. He co‑founded TransLink Capital and later co‑founded GFT Ventures, focusing on early‑stage frontier technologies; he also serves in advisory and board roles (including AAMA).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed & Series A) investments in AI & data science, autonomous machines, AR/VR, blockchain/web3 and other frontier technologies; primary geographies: United States and Israel.

enrichment.personal_bio: Jeff Cherry is the founder and Executive Director of Conscious Venture Lab and Managing General Partner of Conscious Venture Partners. He leads an early-stage accelerator and fund focused on purpose-driven, impact-oriented startups and inclusive entrepreneurship. Cherry has helped launch dozens of venture-backed companies and serves on boards including Hungry Harvest. citeturn0search0turn5search0turn0search3
interests: Diversity & support for female and minority founders
Urban economic development and equitable entrepreneurship
Sustainable food systems and food access
enrichment.career_background: Entrepreneur, operator and investor with 30+ years building companies in engineering, design, consulting and investment management; founded Conscious Venture Lab in 2013 and serves as Managing General Partner of Conscious Venture Partners. He advises boards (e.g., Hungry Harvest, McKean Defense), has led accelerator cohorts and fund investments focused on seed/pre-seed companies, and has received awards for social-impact entrepreneurship. citeturn3search2turn0search0
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / pre-seed and early-stage investments in purpose-driven and impact companies, U.S.-focused with an emphasis on Baltimore and underserved founders. citeturn5search0turn4search2

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Craft Ventures and former co‑founder & CEO of StubHub. Early‑stage investor focused on marketplace and transaction‑fee businesses; active board member and angel investor. Previously founded Spreecast and worked in private equity/finance before entrepreneurship.
enrichment.career_background: Jeff Fluhr earned dual degrees in engineering and economics from the University of Pennsylvania and attended Stanford Graduate School of Business. He co‑founded StubHub in 2000 and served as CEO until its acquisition by eBay in 2007, later founding Spreecast. He began his career at The Blackstone Group and Thomas Weisel Partners and joined Craft Ventures as a partner, investing in marketplaces, AI and payments companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Marketplaces; AI applications; Payments (early‑stage marketplace and payments businesses)

enrichment.personal_bio: Former long-time CEO of LinkedIn who now serves as LinkedIn Executive Chairman and is a founding partner of Next Play Ventures. Focuses on investing in and coaching founders building purpose-driven, product-focused companies and on social-impact initiatives such as The Compassion Project. Holds a BS in Economics from the Wharton School.
enrichment.career_background: Jeff Weiner was CEO of LinkedIn from 2008 to 2020 and became Executive Chairman in 2020. He co-founded Next Play Ventures (founding partner) to invest in and coach early- and growth-stage founders. Earlier roles include executive positions at Yahoo and Warner Bros.; he is a board member or advisor to several nonprofits and companies and holds a BS in economics from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early- and growth-stage investments across B2B/SaaS, productivity and collaboration tools, fintech, consumer apps, edtech, health/wellness and data/AI-enabled platforms; emphasis on coaching founders and purpose-driven companies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Shutterstock (founded 2003) and its Executive Chairman since 2020; serial entrepreneur and active angel investor.
