Co‑founder/managing member of Pareto Holdings, an early‑stage investment vehicle/venture studio. Based in Miami; focuses on early software, marketplaces and media startups.
enrichment.career_background: Jon Oringer founded Shutterstock in 2003, served as CEO until 2020 and became Executive Chairman. He holds a B.S. in computer science and mathematics from SUNY Stony Brook and an M.S. in computer science from Columbia University. After transitioning to Executive Chairman he began investing and co‑founding Pareto Holdings to back and build early‑stage companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed-stage software (SaaS), marketplaces, media/content, Web3/blockchain, network-effect businesses

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at A.Capital Ventures who focuses on early-stage crypto and blockchain protocol investments. Previously led crypto and technical investments at SV Angel and co‑founded ETHGlobal. Background as a software developer; holds a degree in Astrophysics & Mathematics from the University of Waterloo and was included on Forbes 30 Under 30.
enrichment.career_background: Began as a software developer and held engineering roles before joining SV Angel, where he built internal tools and led the firm’s crypto/technical investments. Co‑founded ETHGlobal to grow Ethereum developer communities and joined A.Capital Ventures as a General Partner to invest in early-stage crypto and infrastructure companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed–Series A) investments in crypto protocols, blockchain infrastructure, DeFi, developer tooling and related developer communities.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and President of For Good Ventures, an impact-focused investment platform that backs clean tech, climate technologies, health, education and financial-accessibility solutions. Former investment banker at Deutsche Bank (M&A) and Goldman Sachs (TMT). Holds degrees from Cornell University and an MBA from The Wharton School.
enrichment.career_background: Built For Good Ventures from a family-office vehicle (est. 2015) to deploy direct and fund investments across climate, health, education and inclusive-capital strategies. Prior to founding For Good Ventures she worked in M&A at Deutsche Bank and in Technology, Media & Telecom investment banking at Goldman Sachs. She later joined Bay Bridge Ventures as a founding General Partner while continuing to lead For Good Ventures and serve on multiple impact-focused boards and nonprofits.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and growth investments in clean tech / climate technologies, health innovation, education technology, and financial-accessibility / inclusive capital.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and CEO of Endeavor and president of Endeavor Catalyst. Prominent voice on global entrepreneurship and author of the New York Times bestseller Crazy Is a Compliment. Serves on public company boards and leads Endeavor’s co‑investment fund focused on Endeavor Entrepreneurs worldwide.
enrichment.career_background: Linda Rottenberg co‑founded Endeavor in 1997 and has led the organization as CEO while overseeing Endeavor Catalyst, the fund that co‑invests in Endeavor Entrepreneurs. She serves on the boards of public companies (including Globant and Olo), is a published author, and has held advisory roles with Yale and global institutions. She holds a BA from Harvard and a JD from Yale Law School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Co‑invests in Endeavor Entrepreneur‑led startups in emerging and underserved markets; typical stages Series A–C; sector focus includes fintech, enterprise software/SaaS, marketplaces, consumer, health and AI/ML.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Director of Scalar Capital, a crypto investment firm. Former product manager at Coinbase who worked on internal compliance, fraud, and finance systems. Known for early crypto/token investments and listed on Forbes 30 Under 30 (Finance). Holds a B.A. in Economics from UC San Diego.
enrichment.career_background: Started in risk analysis at AIG, joined Coinbase in 2014 as a product manager focused on internal tools and compliance, then co‑founded Scalar Capital (2017) to invest in crypto assets and tokens; has served as an advisor to projects such as 0x and has been involved in crypto ecosystem initiatives and media (e.g., co‑producing an Ethereum documentary).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and token investments in blockchain projects: privacy tech, DeFi, layer‑2/infrastructure, NFTs, and developer/protocol tooling.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and President of National Grid Partners (NGP) and Chief Technology & Innovation Officer at National Grid. Launched NGP in 2018 to invest in startups that support grid modernisation, AI/analytics, IoT/edge and decarbonization. Previously led investments at Intel Capital and served at The Westly Group. Holds a BS (Penn State) and an MBA (Harvard Business School).
enrichment.career_background: Lisa Lambert founded National Grid Partners in 2018 and served as its President while holding the role of Chief Technology & Innovation Officer at National Grid. Prior to NGP she spent 19 years at Intel (including leadership of Intel Capital’s software/services and the Diversity Fund) and was managing partner at The Westly Group. She has led corporate venturing, incubation and utility–startup partnerships focused on deploying technology across National Grid’s networks.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early and growth-stage investments at the intersection of energy and technology, with emphasis on future electric networks (grid modernisation), customer-facing energy solutions, efficiency through innovation (AI/analytics, cloud/edge, IoT), and decarbonizing gas and broader energy systems.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Director of RPM Ventures and an early-stage investor focused on fintech and mobility. Former entrepreneur (co‑founder of QuantumShift) and early employee at MessageMedia; has served on 20+ startup boards. Based in Ann Arbor, Michigan.
enrichment.career_background: Marc Weiser co‑founded RPM Ventures (formerly Waypoint) and serves as its Managing Director. Prior to RPM he co‑founded QuantumShift and was an early employee at MessageMedia; he has served as an adjunct professor at the University of Michigan, served on the NASA National Advisory Council science committee, and is Chairman of McKinley, Inc. He has led/participated in numerous board roles and seed/early-stage investments across mobility, fintech, marketplaces and real‑estate tech.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed & early-stage investments in Fintech, Mobility/Automotive (connected car, autonomy), B2B/B2B2C enterprise software, Marketplaces, InsurTech and Real Estate Tech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director at MATH Venture Partners and an adjunct lecturer in entrepreneurship and innovation at Northwestern University’s Kellogg School of Management. Serial entrepreneur and early Apple employee; co-author of Exit Right and host of the podcast "The Real Work with Mark Achler." Focuses on early- to mid-stage technology investments and founder-oriented operational support.
enrichment.career_background: Early employee at Apple, co-founded multiple companies (including The Whitewater Group, Kinesoft and Emmi Solutions), and was a founding partner at Kettle Partners. Served as SVP of New Business, Strategy & Innovation at Redbox before co-founding MATH Venture Partners in 2014. Teaches entrepreneurship at Northwestern Kellogg and serves on boards/advisory roles for several portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early- to mid-stage technology companies (B2B/B2C software, marketplaces, e-commerce, IoT); emphasis on teams with strong customer-acquisition capabilities and operational scalability.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner at 11 Tribes Ventures. Former strategy consultant focused on M&A and an entrepreneur; holds an MBA from University of Chicago Booth. Emphasizes a founder-first approach that allocates capital and resources to founder wellbeing.
enrichment.career_background: Launched 11 Tribes Ventures after a career in strategy consulting (M&A) where he advised on deals totaling over $750M. Earned an MBA at the University of Chicago Booth School of Business and serves as an adjunct professor of finance at Wheaton College. Leads the firm’s investing, fundraising and operations with a focus on "capital and care" for founders.
enrichment.investment_focus: Founder-first early-stage venture capital (first institutional capital; pre-seed to seed). Focus areas include enterprise SaaS, marketplaces, consumer & food brands, ag/food tech and health/security technologies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Max Ventures based in New York City. Focuses on earliest-stage investments with a repeat emphasis on digital health and marketplaces. Co‑founder of Elion and active seed investor/board member in several health‑tech startups. Former White House appointee and adjunct lecturer at Columbia Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Max Ventures in 2019 (principal, later partner/general partner), co‑founded incubated companies including Elion, and serves on several early‑stage boards (e.g., UnityAI, noble). Previously a White House appointee/Senior Advisor in the Office of Investment and Innovation, worked at NYCEDC/US Tech Future, was a venture fellow at AlleyCorp, and is an adjunct lecturer at Columbia Business School. Holds a B.A. from the University of Washington and an MBA from Columbia Business School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed / seed stage; primary sectors: digital health, digital commerce & marketplaces, fintech, enterprise software (including govtech/AI applications).

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal at Initial Capital with a background in mobile business development and strategic partnerships across gaming and consumer apps. Serves on or advises multiple game and Web3-focused companies (e.g., MetaBit Games, Amihan Entertainment, Traplight). Holds a BS from The University of Texas at Austin.
enrichment.career_background: Mayra built a career in mobile and digital games business development (roles at Glu Mobile, SEGA and other studios) before moving into venture investing. She joined Initial Capital as a Principal (profiles list her at the firm since 2017) and has taken board or advisory roles at several portfolio companies focused on games and Web3.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments in games, mobile consumer apps, Bitcoin/Web3 and consumer technology

enrichment.personal_bio: Michael Girdley is a San Antonio–based entrepreneur and investor; he is a co‑founder and managing director at Geekdom Fund and chairs Girdley Enterprises. He co‑founded Dura Software and Codeup and previously led the family business Alamo Fireworks. He focuses on early‑stage tech investing and building the San Antonio startup ecosystem.
enrichment.career_background: Girdley began in product and engineering roles at RSA Security and BEA/WebLogic, later ran Alamo Fireworks as CEO, and co‑founded/acquired software businesses through Dura Software. He co‑founded Codeup, helped launch Geekdom Fund (managing director), and holds leadership/board roles across Dry Line Partners, CyberFortress, Scalepath and other San Antonio tech initiatives.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed investments in early‑stage tech startups, with sector focus on SaaS/enterprise applications, AI, robotics/autonomy, SMB software and Web3.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Foothill Ventures. PhD in Electrical Engineering (Stanford) and educated at Tsinghua University; focuses on semiconductors, medical devices and deep‑tech investments. Co‑founder of TEEC Angel Fund and active in early‑stage investing since 2010.
enrichment.career_background: Dr. Michael (Xuecheng) Jin is a managing partner at Foothill Ventures (formerly Tsingyuan Ventures) and began venture investing with the TEEC Angel Fund in 2010. Prior roles include VP of Engineering & GM of China Technology Center at iWatt, CTO at Simple Silicon and CTO at iGC Corp; he has co‑founded startups and served on multiple startup boards. He holds advanced degrees from Tsinghua University and Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed/Series A) investments in deep tech, semiconductors & hardware, and medical devices / life sciences

enrichment.personal_bio: Michael E. Novogratz is the founder and CEO of Galaxy Digital, a New York–based investment firm focused on digital assets and blockchain. He previously was a partner at Goldman Sachs and a senior executive at Fortress Investment Group. He is active in philanthropy, including criminal-justice reform initiatives.
enrichment.career_background: Novogratz began his career at Goldman Sachs (elected partner in 1998), later joined Fortress Investment Group as a senior executive, and founded Galaxy Digital to provide institutional financial services, trading, asset management and venture investing for the digital-asset ecosystem (Galaxy launched publicly from 2018-era activity and has since expanded into multiple business lines).
enrichment.investment_focus: Digital assets and cryptocurrencies; blockchain infrastructure and protocols; institutional trading and asset management; venture investments and token/economic-layer projects; data center and mining infrastructure.

enrichment.personal_bio: Michael Peres (aka Mikey Peres) is a serial entrepreneur, software engineer, journalist and angel investor who invests at pre-seed and seed stages. He hosts the Michael Peres Podcast and has founded media and tech ventures including Breaking 9 To 5, Her Forward and Hexa PR Wire. He focuses on Web3, software, consumer tech, blockchain, fintech and martech.
enrichment.career_background: Peres has founded multiple tech and media startups, works as a journalist and podcast host, and provides early-stage capital and operational/engineering support to founders. He holds degrees in computer science, mathematics and Jewish studies and describes typical initial checks in the $50k–$250k range for pre-seed/seed opportunities.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage companies in Web3/crypto, software, consumer tech, blockchain, fintech and martech; typical check size $50k–$250k.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner at First Star Ventures focused on early-stage deep-technology investments. Advises MIT CSAIL and mentors startup programs; previously co‑founded an MIT machine‑learning startup and worked at Applied Predictive Technologies. Holds an MIT Master of Finance and a B.S. in Mathematics from the University of Toronto.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and managing/founding partner at First Star Ventures (early‑stage, deep tech). Prior roles include co‑founder of an MIT startup (early work that contributed to Infervision), business consultant at Applied Predictive Technologies (APT), and private‑equity/growth investing experience; active mentor/advisor to programs such as MassChallenge and accelerator communities.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed stage; deep‑tech / frontier computing (AI/ML, computational biotech, edge/sensors, robotics, decentralization); primarily US (Boston/Cambridge) early‑stage startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at ArcTern Ventures based in San Francisco, focused on early-stage climate tech investing. Former head of residential/consumer energy at Shell with earlier roles building battery and clean-energy businesses at Dow and NRG. Winner of the 2019 U.S. DOE C3E business award. Active in board and sector work across battery manufacturing, distributed energy and built-environment decarbonization.
interests: Home electrification and built environment decarbonization
enrichment.career_background: Began as an environmentalist and worked in mining and conservation before moving into corporate clean-energy roles (Dow/Dow Kokam, NRG Energy, Shell) where she built battery, solar/wind and residential energy businesses. Joined ArcTern Ventures as a partner to lead investments from the firm’s San Francisco office, focusing on energy, mobility, circular economy and materials.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage climate tech (energy & grid, battery manufacturing & EV charging, mobility, built environment/home electrification, circular economy/materials); typically Series A–B.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Lead Edge Capital. Oversees the firm’s investment, disposition, and management committees and has led/co-led investments in companies including Alibaba, Asana, ByteDance, Duo Security, Grafana and Spotify. Former nationally ranked alpine ski racer; B.A. in Economics (Williams College) and MBA (Wharton). Based in the firm’s Santa Barbara office.
interests: Late-stage / pre-IPO scaling and public secondary investments
enrichment.career_background: Founded Lead Edge Capital and serves as Managing Partner. Previously on the investment team at Eastern Advisors (Tiger Management) and an Analyst at Bessemer Venture Partners; began his career in investment banking at UBS and Barrington Associates. Serves on boards/boards-related organizations including the U.S. Ski & Snowboard Foundation and the Santa Barbara Museum of Art.
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth equity (minority and buyout) in software, internet, and tech-enabled services; typical investment sizing in the growth-stage / late-stage range ($25M–$300M) with emphasis on recurring-revenue/SaaS businesses.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner of 1confirmation, an early-stage crypto and Web3 venture firm he launched in 2017. Previously worked in business development at Coinbase and as a principal at Runa Capital. Early investor in NFT and crypto-native projects including OpenSea and dYdX.
enrichment.career_background: Started in investment roles at North Atlantic Capital, moved into business development at Coinbase (early employee), then worked at Runa Capital before founding 1confirmation in 2017. 1confirmation focuses on early-stage equity and token investments across crypto, NFTs and blockchain infrastructure.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage crypto & Web3 (NFTs, DeFi, blockchain protocols, developer tooling and token-native marketplaces).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑Founder and Managing Director at Griffin Gaming Partners, a venture firm focused exclusively on gaming. Formerly head of gaming at LionTree and Global Co‑Head of Internet & Digital Media Investment Banking at Bank of America Merrill Lynch. In 2024 he launched GoodGame Advisors, a boutique M&A and strategic advisory firm for the games industry.
interests: M&A and strategic advisory for gaming companies
enrichment.career_background: Nick Tuosto is a co‑founder and Managing Director at Griffin Gaming Partners. He previously led gaming coverage and served as a managing director at LionTree and was Global Co‑Head of Internet & Digital Media Investment Banking at Bank of America Merrill Lynch. He launched GoodGame Advisors in 2024 and holds degrees from Brown University (A.B.) and Stanford Law School (J.D.).
enrichment.investment_focus: Gaming (content/studios), software infrastructure & developer tools, social platforms/communities, and gaming-related Web3; strategic M&A and advisory for game companies

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at QED Investors, a venture firm focused on fintech. Previously co‑founded Capital One and served as its President and COO. Chairs or serves on boards of several fintech portfolio companies and is based in Virginia.
enrichment.career_background: Nigel Morris co‑founded Capital One in 1994 and served as President and COO until 2004. In 2007 he co‑founded QED Investors, where he leads fintech investments and sits on or chairs multiple portfolio company boards; he also advises consulting firms and academic institutions and is a London Business School fellow.
enrichment.investment_focus: Fintech (consumer finance, credit, payments, embedded finance); early‑stage through growth‑stage investments; global focus with emphasis on U.S., U.K./Europe and Latin America.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and CEO of B12; angel investor active in early-stage software and internet companies. Former VC at General Catalyst and co-founder of student-focused Rough Draft Ventures; founding-team advisor at Getaround. Based in the U.S.
interests: AI and automation for small businesses
enrichment.career_background: Nitesh Banta is the co-founder and CEO of B12, a company that builds automated front-office products for small businesses. He previously worked as a venture investor at General Catalyst, co-founded Rough Draft Ventures, and was part of the founding team/advisor at Getaround. Outside of B12 he performs angel investing through a personal vehicle (listed as Angel Investor at Stellar Capital).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage software, internet and technology companies (AI/automation, marketplaces)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Flagship Pioneering and co‑founder & board chairman of Moderna. Serial life‑sciences entrepreneur and inventor with more than 100 patents who has cofounded and helped build dozens of biotech and technology startups. Former CEO of PerSeptive Biosystems and a longtime lecturer at MIT Sloan and Harvard Business School. Active in philanthropic and humanitarian initiatives related to Armenia and global education.
enrichment.career_background: Trained as a biochemical engineer (B.Eng., McGill; Ph.D., MIT). Founded PerSeptive Biosystems (later acquired) and served in senior roles at Applera before founding Flagship (originally Flagship Ventures/NewcoGen) in 2000. Has cofounded and helped build many life‑science and technology companies (including Moderna) and holds 100+ patents; has lectured at MIT Sloan and Harvard Business School and serves on several institutional boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Creating and funding early‑stage platform companies in biotechnology, life sciences, mRNA and platform therapeutics, synthetic biology, bio‑agriculture/sustainability, and AI-enabled drug discovery

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of K2 Global (launched 2015). Early backer in multiple technology companies including Spotify, Airbnb, Uber, Coinbase, Palantir and Impossible Foods. Runs K2’s activity across Asia and the U.S., investing across seed to growth stages. citeturn1view0turn2search4turn2search2
enrichment.career_background: Launched K2 Global in 2015 to invest in private technology companies; has led the firm’s investments across early-to-growth stage tech and served in investment and board roles with multiple portfolio companies and related organizations. citeturn4search1turn0search7
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-to-growth stage technology companies (Internet/software); emphasis on fintech, foodtech/consumer brands, AI/ML, and Web3/crypto. citeturn1view0turn2search4turn4search1

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director (early) at Redpoint Ventures focused on AI and machine learning. Former senior software engineer on LinkedIn’s machine learning team. Holds a B.S. in Electrical Engineering & Computer Science from Yale and an M.S. (CS, AI concentration) and MBA from Stanford.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Redpoint in 2018 (initially as an intern), worked previously as a senior software engineer on LinkedIn’s machine learning team, and has led investments across AI, infrastructure, and SaaS. Promoted to Managing Director at Redpoint in May 2025.
enrichment.investment_focus: AI, Infrastructure, SaaS; stages: Seed to Series A; enterprise and developer-facing startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at FPV Ventures. Former COO of Cisco Collaboration and former COO/CIO roles at Morgan Stanley. Serves as an investor/advisor and board member across tech and biotech companies; holds a B.S. from MIT.
enrichment.career_background: Pegah Ebrahimi is co‑founder and Managing Partner of FPV Ventures (launched 2022). Prior to VC she served as COO of Cisco Collaboration, held senior COO/CIO roles at Morgan Stanley’s technology and investment banking groups, and cofounded Spark Box Toys. She sits on public and private company boards and advises companies including Canva and Snyk.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) investments in enterprise software, developer platforms, biotech/drug discovery, and frontier technologies, with emphasis on mission-driven founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director and co-founder of Griffin Gaming Partners. Former President of Interactive Ventures, Games & Digital Strategy at Lionsgate and co‑founder & CEO of Nerdist Industries. Active investor and advisor in the games and esports ecosystem.
enrichment.career_background: Peter Levin is a media and gaming executive-turned-investor. He co-founded Griffin Gaming Partners after senior roles at Lionsgate (President, Interactive Ventures, Games & Digital Strategy) and Legendary Entertainment (Co‑President, Digital Strategy), and previously co‑founded Nerdist Industries. Levin has served on boards and as an investor/advisor to multiple gaming and esports companies, and has led or stewarded investments and partnerships across games, licensing and digital platforms.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early and late-stage investments across the gaming ecosystem: game studios and content, social platforms, game infrastructure/tech, and gaming-related Web3.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner Emeritus at Eclipse Ventures and a longtime Silicon Valley investor and operator. Co‑founder of National Semiconductor and former General Partner at Sequoia Capital and Khosla Ventures. Known for investing in semiconductors, systems and hardware-heavy startups and for board/mentorship roles at many industrial and semiconductor companies.
enrichment.career_background: Pierre Lamond began as an engineer at Transitron Electronics and joined Fairchild Semiconductor’s R&D team before co‑founding National Semiconductor. He held executive roles (Coherent Radiation, Advent), served as a General Partner at Sequoia Capital (1981–2008), was a General Partner at Khosla Ventures (2009–2014), and joined Eclipse Ventures in 2015 where he is Partner Emeritus.
enrichment.investment_focus: Hardware-first and deep-tech companies transforming physical industries (manufacturing, logistics, transportation, energy, healthcare), semiconductors and systems; typically early-stage (seed/Series A) investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Priya Saiprasad is a venture investor who served as a Partner at SoftBank Investment Advisers (SoftBank Vision Fund) and is a co‑founder and General Partner of Touring Capital. She focuses on growth‑stage software and AI/ML‑enabled enterprise companies. Previously she was a founding member of M12 (Microsoft’s venture fund) and a partner at Mayfield.
enrichment.career_background: Started in investment banking (UBS), worked in Square/Block corporate development, was a founding principal at M12 (Microsoft’s VC arm), joined Mayfield as a partner, served as a Partner at SoftBank Investment Advisers (Vision Fund) leading growth‑stage software investments, and co‑founded Touring Capital.
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth‑stage enterprise software, AI/ML-enabled applications, and consumer technology

enrichment.personal_bio: Ram Jambunathan served as Senior Vice President and Managing Director of SAP.iO, overseeing the SAP.iO Fund (early‑stage CVC investments) and the SAP.iO Foundries accelerator programs. He is an engineer by training (PhD, University of Michigan) and a former founder and McKinsey consultant. At SAP.iO he focused on strategic B2B enterprise software investments, startup acceleration and inclusive entrepreneurship.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder of T‑Networks (fiber‑optics startup), former consultant at McKinsey & Company, and long‑time SAP executive (joined ~2009). At SAP he rose to lead corporate strategy and then SAP.iO (managing the Fund and Foundries, investing in early‑stage B2B startups across cloud, data/AI, HR, procurement and sustainability). In 2023 he moved into a strategy role at Intapp while remaining known for his prior leadership of SAP.iO.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (Seed–Series A) B2B enterprise software — strategic CVC investments and equity‑free accelerators focused on cloud & platform technologies, data/AI, HR/future‑of‑work, procurement/supply‑chain, and sustainability.

enrichment.personal_bio: Robert Garber is Managing Partner at 7wire Ventures, where he focuses on digital health investments that empower consumers. He was promoted to Managing Partner in August 2024 and serves on multiple portfolio company boards. He holds an MBA from Kellogg and a BA from the University of Pennsylvania.
enrichment.career_background: Over 30 years in healthcare and technology investing and operations. Prior roles include Managing Director at Stratus Ventures and KB Partners, executive roles in high-growth ecommerce and software companies, and co-managing multiple venture funds (reported as co-managing six funds with $650M+ AUM).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early- and growth-stage digital health: healthcare IT, consumer-facing health platforms and technology-enabled services.

enrichment.personal_bio: R "Ray" Wang is Founder, Chairman, and Principal Analyst of Constellation Research and a Venture Partner at Mindful Venture Capital. He co-hosts the webcast DisrupTV and is the author of books on digital transformation, including Disrupting Digital Business (HBR Press) and Everybody Wants to Rule The World. He is a frequent keynote speaker and advisor to enterprise and startup leaders on AI, Web3, and digital strategy.
enrichment.career_background: Ray Wang founded Constellation Research (principal analyst, chairman) and previously held roles at Forrester Research, Oracle, PeopleSoft and consulting firms such as Deloitte and Ernst & Young. He co-hosts DisrupTV, has authored books on digital transformation, serves on advisory boards, and is listed as a Venture Partner at Mindful Venture Capital.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Pre-seed, Seed, Series A); enterprise software & SaaS; AI and Web3/metaverse; behavior-design informed technology; healthcare and fintech

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at SRB Ventures and founder of SRB Holdings; author and creator who publishes The Curiosity Chronicle. Former private-equity investor (Altamont Capital Partners) with seven years of buyout experience. Stanford BA/MA; active angel/early-stage investor in 40+ startups.
enrichment.career_background: Bloom spent seven years on the investment team at Altamont Capital Partners (private equity), served on several portfolio company boards, then launched SRB Ventures (Fund I ~$10M) in January 2022 as Managing Partner. He also operates SRB Holdings (personal holding company), publishes The Curiosity Chronicle, and wrote The 5 Types of Wealth.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage venture (seed–Series A); ~$100K–$250K checks; sector-agnostic technology focus including fintech, SaaS, consumer, and Web3.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of Nextdoor and Venture Partner at Unusual Ventures. Experienced product and marketing leader who helped scale Nextdoor and previously held product/marketing roles at Microsoft, Epinions and Shopping.com. Holds degrees from Harvard College and Harvard Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Sarah Leary began her career as a product manager at Microsoft, later served in product and marketing leadership at Epinions and Shopping.com (acquired by eBay), and co‑founded Nextdoor where she led product, marketing and operations. She joined Unusual Ventures as a Venture Partner focused on the firm’s consumer practice and serves on/with several startups and boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed to Series A consumer startups — especially community platforms, marketplaces and social/networked consumer products.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at Innovation Endeavors and a four‑time entrepreneur. Co‑founder/CEO of FiberTower and Slice and co‑founder/CTO of Clarus and SQLFinancials. Serves on multiple startup boards (e.g., Skylo, Citrine, Afresh, Replica) and is a Lecturer in Management at Stanford GSB.
enrichment.career_background: Serial entrepreneur turned investor: co‑founded and led multiple tech companies (SQLFinancials, Clarus, FiberTower, Slice) before joining Innovation Endeavors as a founding partner. Active board member and investor in enterprise and deep‑tech startups; Lecturer in Management at Stanford GSB. Education: MS in Management (Stanford GSB), BBA (University of Florida).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (Seed–Series A) technical founders building capital‑intensive, transformative technologies across AI/ML, supply chain & food tech, materials & advanced manufacturing, robotics, and connectivity.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner (Europe) at ARCH Venture Partners focused on identifying and evaluating early-stage life‑science and physical‑science technologies. Co‑founder or early contributor to companies including Vizgen and Scale Biosciences; serves on or observes several portfolio boards. Trained as a chemical engineer with BS/MS from Stanford and an MBA from the University of Chicago.
interests: Early‑stage company formation and venture creation
enrichment.career_background: Joined ARCH in 2015 (started as an analyst) and was promoted to Partner (Europe) in 2022. Prior to ARCH he worked on early technical teams at synthetic‑biology and cleantech companies (LS9, Cobalt Technologies) and has led business development and formation efforts for multiple ARCH portfolio companies. Education: B.S. and M.S. in Chemical Engineering (Stanford University); M.B.A. (University of Chicago Booth School of Business).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed/Series A) life sciences and physical sciences — biotech, life‑science tools, synthetic biology, sequencing/spatial genomics, chemicals, semiconductors, energy and sustainable materials; company formation and technical due diligence.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑Founder and Partner at Northpond Ventures; former CFO at Sands Capital Management; MBA Harvard Business School, BA Rice University, CFA. Focuses on science‑driven venture investing (life sciences, diagnostics, molecular tools). citeturn6search1turn4search0
enrichment.career_background: Consultant at McKinsey & Company early in her career; served as CFO/finance leader at Sands Capital Management; co‑founded Northpond Ventures in 2018 and serves as Partner; sits on multiple portfolio company boards. citeturn4search0turn3search2
enrichment.investment_focus: Life sciences and technology (biotechnology, diagnostics & molecular diagnostics, therapeutics), platform tools and AI/ML for biology; partnerships with academic labs and translational research. citeturn6search1turn7search1

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of NOEMIS Ventures, an early‑stage VC based in New York. Former investment banker at JPMorgan Chase and Wells Fargo; holds an MBA from Cornell and a BS from Brooklyn College. Focuses on pre‑seed and seed investments in fintech, AI/ML and marketplaces.
enrichment.career_background: Simeon worked in corporate finance and market risk at JPMorgan Chase and later in leveraged finance at Wells Fargo before founding NOEMIS Ventures in 2017. He built a pilot portfolio with personal capital and later closed a debut institutional fund focused on pre‑seed and seed fintech, AI/ML and marketplace companies. Education: BS (Brooklyn College); MBA (Cornell Johnson).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed‑stage startups in fintech, AI/ML and marketplaces.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Managing Partner at Celesta Capital and a 30+ year technology executive and investor. Previously a senior leader at Intel (including roles in Intel Architecture Group and Intel Capital) and founder of IndusAge Partners. Focuses on deep‑tech investments spanning semiconductors, hardware, AI/ML and cloud/infrastructure. Holds an MBA from UCLA and technical degrees from the Indian Institute of Science and The American College.
enrichment.career_background: Sriram is the Founding Managing Partner of Celesta Capital (formerly WRVI Capital) and has spent nearly two decades at Intel in senior management roles (including VP roles in Intel Architecture Group and Intel Capital). He founded IndusAge Partners (cross‑border US‑India VC) before joining Celesta and serves on multiple portfolio boards and advisory bodies; he holds an MBA from UCLA Anderson and technical degrees from the Indian Institute of Science and The American College.
enrichment.investment_focus: Deep tech (semiconductors, hardware/systems, AI/ML), cloud & infrastructure, enterprise software; early‑stage to growth (Seed–Series B).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Partner at Chicago Ventures, a seed‑stage VC based in Chicago. Former senior executive at Performics/DoubleClick with a background in digital marketing and early‑stage startups. Active board member and investor in fintech, logistics, and enterprise software companies.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Chicago Ventures in 2011 and leads deal sourcing, fund management, and portfolio work. Founder/Managing Partner of Twin Capital; earlier served as Senior Vice President at Performics (part of the DoubleClick/Google/Performics lineage). Holds a B.S. in Economics from Southern Methodist University and serves on multiple company boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early‑stage technology companies (fintech/payments, logistics & supply chain, marketplaces, enterprise SaaS, healthcare tech)

enrichment.personal_bio: Tim O'Reilly is the founder, CEO and chairman of O'Reilly Media and a partner at early-stage venture firm O'Reilly AlphaTech Ventures (OATV). He helped popularize concepts such as "open source" and "Web 2.0" and convenes conferences and publications on technology trends. He serves on multiple nonprofit and company boards and is the author of WTF? What's the Future and Why It's Up to Us.
interests: Open source software and developer communities
Web platforms and internet business models
enrichment.career_background: Founded O'Reilly Media in the 1980s and grew it into a publishing, conference and learning business focused on technology; co‑founded and serves as partner at O'Reilly AlphaTech Ventures (OATV) to invest in early-stage technology companies. Active in public conversation about tech policy, open source, and the future of platforms; serves on boards including Code for America and PeerJ and has authored books on technology and society.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage / institutional-seed investments in developer tools, infrastructure, enterprise and consumer software, web platforms; support for revenue-focused Indie.VC-style financing.

enrichment.personal_bio: Tina Sharkey is an entrepreneur, investor, board member and educator best known for co-founding Brandless and co-founding iVillage. She served as CEO of Sherpa Foundry and as a venture partner at Sherpa Capital, and has held senior roles at BabyCenter (Johnson & Johnson), AOL and the Sesame Street Digital Group. Sharkey sits on several public and private boards and teaches business innovation; she is based in Northern California.
enrichment.career_background: Sharkey began her career co-founding iVillage, later led programming and community businesses at AOL, and served as Chairman & Global President of BabyCenter. In 2013 she became CEO of Sherpa Foundry and later a venture partner at Sherpa Capital before co-founding Brandless (where she served as CEO and chair). She has held board and advisory roles at companies including Ipsy, Brit + Co, Havenly and PBS, and is active as an angel and early-stage investor and lecturer.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer brands, direct-to-consumer e-commerce, marketplaces and media/community-driven startups (early stage)

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Enspire Capital and Bay Area-based angel investor and mentor. Active in early-stage technology investing with focus areas including IoT, mobile and retail/enterprise software. Founder of IPforAsia and former business-development executive in semiconductor and software companies.
enrichment.career_background: Venture Partner at Enspire Capital; angel investor and advisor with board/observer roles (e.g., ReplyBuy, ShoCard). Founder of IPforAsia and mentor at Plug and Play and SparkLabs. Previously held business development and product roles at NXP Software, Philips/Philips Components and other technology companies. Education: BS (UC Santa Barbara), MBA (Santa Clara University).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage technology (TMT): Telecommunications, Media & Technology; Mobile; Cloud; SaaS; IoT; cross‑border US ↔ Greater China / Asia investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at NTT Venture Capital (NTTVC). Serial entrepreneur and longtime VC investor previously a Partner at Norwest Venture Partners; founded Virtela (acquired by NTT). Serves on multiple boards and focuses on enterprise and infrastructure technology investments.
enrichment.career_background: Vab Goel is a technologist-turned-investor who founded NTT Venture Capital in collaboration with NTT. He spent ~19 years as a partner at Norwest Venture Partners, founded Virtela (an overlay network company acquired by NTT), and held senior technology roles at Qwest and Sprint. He holds a B.S. in Electrical Engineering from George Mason University and serves on several boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise software, cloud & infrastructure, AI/ML, developer tools and digital health; invests across seed to growth stages.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Marin Sonoma Impact Ventures (MSIV), a regional venture fund for Marin + Sonoma counties. His career includes roles at Citi (fixed income sales), Cisco (global government & community relations), Glassdoor (Head of Business Development), and SmithRx (Head of People & Corporate Operations). He holds an MPP from Harvard Kennedy School and a BA from Cornell and lives in Corte Madera, California.
interests: North Bay / regional startup ecosystem development
Impact investing and local economic development
Early-stage technology (SaaS, fintech, AI, clean energy)
enrichment.career_background: Zachary Kushel founded MSIV in 2020 to mobilize local capital and talent for Marin and Sonoma startups. Prior to MSIV he worked on Wall Street (Citi), held political roles including work for the U.S. Senate and the 2008 McCain campaign, and held senior positions in tech and startups — including Cisco, Glassdoor (Head of Business Development) and SmithRx (Head of People & Corporate Operations). He has an MPP from Harvard Kennedy School and a BA from Cornell.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage / seed investments in Marin & Sonoma startups; impact-driven technology across SaaS, fintech, AI, clean energy and advanced mobility

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Trust Ventures and founder/managing partner of Freehouse Capital Partners. Former managing partner at VTF Capital and Head of Product at Zappos; later CEO of Pilotworks and involved in the Downtown Project with Tony Hsieh. Lives between Austin and northwest Montana and invests in early-stage startups and real‑estate growth opportunities.
enrichment.career_background: Experienced operator and investor: Venture Partner at Trust Ventures (advises startups on regulatory strategy), Founder/Managing Partner at Freehouse Capital Partners (real estate & growth investing), former Managing Partner at VTF Capital (seed-stage ecommerce/retail tech), Head of Product at Zappos (led product and campus development), and CEO/COO roles at Pilotworks.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed–Series A) startups in retail/commerce technology, consumer & food/hospitality, precision health; real‑estate and growth investments; companies facing regulatory/public‑policy barriers.

enrichment.personal_bio: Zak Williams is the co‑founder and CEO of PYM, a company focused on mental‑wellness products, and a mental‑health advocate. He is a venture partner at Social Impact Capital and an active angel investor in early‑stage tech and consumer companies. He holds an MBA from Columbia Business School and a BA from New York University.
enrichment.career_background: Zak Williams founded and leads PYM (mental‑wellness products). He previously served as COO of Crossing Minds and held business development and marketing roles at Condé Nast and N3TWORK. He is active on nonprofit boards and advocacy groups focused on mental health and holds an MBA from Columbia Business School and a BA from NYU.
enrichment.investment_focus: Impact-focused early‑stage investments across essentials of human need (health, food, environment, education, housing) and mission-driven consumer/health startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Software engineer and early-stage investor/advisor who served as a Venture Partner / campus lead for Contrary at the University of Maryland (2017–2018). Worked on infrastructure teams at Segment and Airplane and lists current work on scripting infrastructure; authored UMD course 'Practical Cloud Computing with AWS'.
enrichment.career_background: Colin King holds BS and MS degrees in Computer Science from the University of Maryland (focused on distributed systems). He founded and taught a UMD course on cloud computing, served as a Venture Partner/Advisor for Contrary at UMD (2017–2018), and has worked at Segment and Airplane (and lists work on scripting infrastructure).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / university-founded founders; cloud infrastructure and developer tools; early-stage technical founders

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of BRAVA Investments; impact investor focused on high-growth companies that deliver measurable economic benefits to women. Technologist and serial entrepreneur; author of LEAPFROG: The New Revolution for Women Entrepreneurs.
interests: Board & advisory work for mission-driven organizations
enrichment.career_background: Nathalie Molina Niño is the founder and CEO of BRAVA Investments. She has served as interim Chief Revenue Officer of PowerToFly and led the launch of SELF MADE. She co-founded Entrepreneurs@Athena at Barnard College and has advised and held board/advisory roles with organizations including Accion Opportunity Fund, WOCstar, FullCycle and Cadence Health. She is the author of LEAPFROG and invests via her family office and BRAVA.
enrichment.investment_focus: Gender-lens and impact investments in high-growth technology, consumer, healthcare and education companies — typically seed to growth-stage businesses that demonstrably improve the economic well-being of women.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Remi (direct-to-consumer sleep and dental wellness products). Former analyst and associate at Sinai Ventures (2018–2019) and BMW i Ventures (2017–2018). NYU Stern alumnus; based in the San Francisco Bay Area.
enrichment.career_background: Worked as an analyst at BMW i Ventures, then as an analyst and associate at Sinai Ventures where he sourced and led diligence on multiple deals. In December 2019 he founded Remi and serves as its CEO; has also served as a venture scout and remains active in VC networks and DTC entrepreneurship.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage software and internet companies; mobility & transportation; consumer DTC and health/wellness

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and General Partner at Andreessen Horowitz, focused on consumer investing and AI-native products. Former founder (SocialDeck, Snowball) and product leader at Google and Credit Karma; joined a16z in 2019 and serves on multiple portfolio company boards.
interests: AI-native and generative AI consumer tools
enrichment.career_background: Anish graduated from the University of Waterloo and worked as a software engineer at Amazon before co-founding SocialDeck (acquired by Google). He led mobile product efforts at Google, founded Snowball (acquired by Credit Karma), held senior product and GM roles at Credit Karma, and joined Andreessen Horowitz as a General Partner in 2019; he serves on several a16z portfolio boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer technology (mobile/creator apps), fintech/consumer finance, AI/GenAI consumer products

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner and Chief Evangelist at Pegasus Tech Ventures based in Silicon Valley. Focuses on deep-technology investments (AI, robotics, quantum/neuromorphic, space, materials, medtech) and runs Startup World Cup outreach. Co‑founder and former Managing Director of Garage Technology Ventures and co‑author of Getting to Wow!.
enrichment.career_background: Bill Reichert co‑founded Garage Technology Ventures in 1998 and served as its Managing Director before Garage was acquired by Pegasus Tech Ventures; he joined Pegasus as Partner & Chief Evangelist to manage US investments and global startup programs. Earlier he was a founder or senior executive at several venture‑backed startups (including Trademark Software, The Learning Company, Academic Systems) and worked at McKinsey & Company, Brown Brothers Harriman, and the World Bank. He has served on multiple startup boards/observer roles, taught venture finance at UC Berkeley, and is Chief Evangelist for the Startup World Cup. He holds a B.A. from Harvard and an MBA from Stanford.
enrichment.investment_focus: Deep technology (AI/ML, robotics, quantum & neuromorphic computing, space, materials science, medical technology); early-stage (seed to Series A); global market expansion (U.S., Asia, Europe).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Eudemian Ventures, a San Francisco–based early-stage venture firm. Over 20 years of experience in venture capital, startup entrepreneurship and management consulting. Previously co-led Kearney’s Technology Practice and is the author of "21st Century Leadership".
enrichment.career_background: Began as a securities analyst at Merrill Lynch in the late 1990s, became an early-stage investor during the dotcom era, founded an Austrian PropTech startup (later exited), and served as a Senior Principal at Kearney co-leading the Technology Practice in San Francisco before founding Eudemian Ventures in 2018.
enrichment.investment_focus: US early-stage (seed/post-seed/Series A) software startups; sectors include AI, B2B SaaS, Consumer, Marketplaces, FinTech and Digital Health.

enrichment.personal_bio: Neuroscientist-turned early-stage investor focused on life sciences and deep tech. Former Head of Bio & Deep Tech at BoxOne Ventures and co‑founder/General Partner at Pamir Ventures. Regularly serves as an early investor, board member/observer, and mentor for translational biology and computational startups.
enrichment.career_background: Trained as a neuroscientist (undergraduate at Purdue; master’s as a George J. Mitchell Scholar; doctorate from the Richard M. Fairbanks School of Public Health). Founded or operated biotech startups (e.g., Mekonos, Corstem), held business development roles (including Accenture/Numerate-related work), served as Head of Bio & Deep Tech at BoxOne Ventures (2018–2024), was a Venture Partner at Entrepreneur First, an External Advisor to AstraZeneca, and is co‑founder/General Partner at Pamir Ventures.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage life sciences and biotech, computational biology/deep tech, AI applied to biology, translational drug discovery; pre-seed and seed, founder-first investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner and Head of the Cultural Leadership Fund (CLF) at Andreessen Horowitz, where she connects cultural leaders to technology companies and advances Black participation and wealth-generation in tech. Formerly worked in venture roles at Unusual Ventures and as an MBA investment fellow; holds an MBA from Stanford GSB.
interests: Black wealth generation & diversity in tech
Talent pipeline / HBCU and nonprofit partnerships
enrichment.career_background: Megan Holston-Alexander leads a16z’s Cultural Leadership Fund, a vehicle that coinvests across a16z portfolio companies and donates management fees/carry to nonprofits focused on advancing Black talent into tech. She previously held investor roles at Unusual Ventures, was an MBA investment fellow at Foundation Capital, interned at Lightspeed and Omidyar Network, and earlier worked in nonprofit operations and as a lecturer. She holds a BA from Clark Atlanta University, an MA from the University of Houston, and an MBA from Stanford Graduate School of Business.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer and creator-economy startups, crypto, fintech, enterprise, bio/health; primarily early-stage (seed/Series A) while participating across a16z fund stages.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Director of HealthTech Capital and founder of MedStars. Long-time HealthTech/digital-health entrepreneur, angel investor and mentor with startup operating and board experience. Holds an MBA from Harvard and a master's in business engineering from the Université Libre de Bruxelles.
enrichment.career_background: Anne DeGheest has led and advised early-stage healthcare companies since the 1980s. She founded MedStars (1986) and HealthTech Capital (2010), has held operating and marketing roles at companies including Nellcor and Omnicell, and provided early-stage capital or advisory support to companies such as Pyxis (CareFusion), Aspect Medical, VISX, Thermage, Visicu and Masimo. Her public bios state her life-science portfolio companies have generated roughly $27 billion in market capitalization and include multiple IPOs; she is a frequent industry speaker and has guest-lectured at Stanford Business School.
enrichment.investment_focus: HealthTech / digital health (hospital-to-home), medical devices, diagnostics, healthcare services and DTC health products; primarily early-stage/angel and seed investments with mentoring support.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at Pillar VC with over two decades in venture capital. Primarily a seed-stage investor who often backs university spinouts and scientific founders. Early investor in Algorand and lead/backer in companies across AI, biotech, enterprise software and crypto.
enrichment.career_background: Jamie Goldstein is a founding partner of Pillar VC. He spent 18 years as an investing partner at North Bridge Venture Partners and prior to that co-founded PureSpeech, a speech-recognition company. He holds a BS from MIT and an MBA from Harvard Business School and has led investments in companies such as Algorand, PathAI, Desktop Metal and PillPack.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and pre-seed investments in deep tech and scientific founders, including biotech/synbio, AI/ML, enterprise software, crypto/blockchain, hardware and vertical SaaS.

enrichment.personal_bio: Actor, producer and investor Robert Downey Jr. is the founder of FootPrint Coalition, a media/nonprofit/venture group that backs sustainable technologies. He is an active angel investor in climate, food and materials startups and is based in Los Angeles.
enrichment.career_background: Robert Downey Jr. built a career as an actor and producer (co‑founder of Team Downey) and launched FootPrint Coalition (founder, 2019) to pair media, grants and venture capital in support of environmental technologies; FootPrint Coalition Ventures (rolling funds) opened to outside investors in 2021. He also participates in angel investments across early-to-growth stage startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Sustainable / climate technologies across food & agriculture, new materials and bioplastics, energy & transport; robotics and AI for environmental applications; media & nonprofit grantmaking; investment stages: seed through Series B (early-to-growth stage).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and managing partner at Aperture Venture Capital, a Philadelphia‑based seed-stage firm that backs diverse founders leveraging financial innovation. Previously led Comcast Ventures' Catalyst Fund and was a partner at Dreamit; worked with Morgan Stanley’s Multicultural Innovation Lab. Adjunct Assistant Professor of Venture Capital at Duke University’s Fuqua School of Business (2024–present).
enrichment.career_background: Experienced early‑stage investor and operator who co‑founded Aperture VC in 2021 to back diverse founders in fintech and enterprise software. Earlier roles include lead investor for Comcast Ventures’ Catalyst Fund (diversity‑focused), partner at Dreamit Ventures, Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence with Morgan Stanley’s Multicultural Innovation Lab, and founding partner roles in earlier VC efforts. Education: MBA, Duke University (Fuqua); MS and BS, Computer Science, North Carolina State University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) fintech, financial infrastructure and enterprise software; emphasis on insurance, lending/banking, payments, security & identity; backing diverse and multicultural founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Director of Allied Venture Partners, an angel syndicate headquartered in Calgary. Ex-founder and angel investor since 2012 who launched Allied in 2020 to scale early-stage investment access in Western Canada. He focuses on sourcing and syndicating Seed–Series A software and technology deals across Canada and the U.S.
enrichment.career_background: Exited a Toronto-based CPG startup (circa 2012), worked in sales and marketing roles, began angel investing in 2012, and served as a VC scout and advisor before founding Allied Venture Partners in 2020. At Allied he manages a large angel network that deploys Seed and Series A capital into software and technology startups across North America.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed to Series A software & technology companies (primarily North America); emphasis on enterprise SaaS, FinTech/payments, marketplaces, AR/immersive, logistics and health tech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at DR-Ventures. Investor and startup adviser specialising in capital raising, financial modelling and commercial strategy for pre-seed to Series A companies. Based in the United Kingdom.
enrichment.career_background: Serial entrepreneur and advisor; founder/Managing Partner of DR-Ventures (venture advisory and micro-investor). Previously worked in hospitality and ran fundraising and commercial roles for hospitality and early-stage businesses; currently focuses on preparing startups for raises and advising on investor relations and financial strategy.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed to Series A; advisory-led micro-investing and capital-raising support with focus on B2B SaaS, travel & hospitality tech, consumer/F&B, edtech and selected deep-tech opportunities.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner / Principal at 1859 Ventures. Serial entrepreneur and startup mentor who has run accelerator programs (Techstars, WeWork) and led founder programs such as Patriot Boot Camp. U.S. Navy veteran active in the Oregon startup ecosystem.
interests: Diversity & inclusion for founders (women, BIPOC, LGBTQ+, veterans)
enrichment.career_background: Josh Carter is a serial entrepreneur and operator who co-founded BrightWork (served as CEO and took the company through Techstars), has held roles at WeWork Labs and in telecom (including work with Twilio/Google-related projects), served as COO/interim CEO of Patriot Boot Camp, worked with Maritime Blue innovation programs, and is GP/Principal at 1859 Ventures. He is a U.S. Navy veteran and runs founder-focused programs and meetups in Oregon.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / pre-seed investments in Oregon-based founders; emphasis on underrepresented founders (women, BIPOC, LGBTQ+, veterans); sector focus: deep tech, B2B SaaS, FinTech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and CTO of Rain, a payments/crypto-focused card platform. Previously served as an investment scout at Lightspeed Venture Partners and was a principal software engineer at Intuit after an exit of his prior startup (Playbook HR). Stanford University computer science graduate active in early‑stage investing and founder communities.
enrichment.career_background: Charles Naut co‑founded Rain (co‑founder & CTO, 2021–present). He was an Investment Scout at Lightspeed Venture Partners (circa 2020–2022), earlier co‑founded Playbook HR (acquired by Intuit) and served as a Principal Software Engineer at Intuit (2015–2019). He studied computer science at Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) startups; fintech/payments and crypto infrastructure; future‑of‑work and SMB software; developer tools / SaaS.

enrichment.personal_bio: Vice President on the investment team at BIP Ventures. Joined BIP Ventures in 2020 and focuses on early-stage investing across software, marketplaces, media, and esports. Former competitive esports athlete and streamer; holds a B.S. in Business and Computer Science from Franklin & Marshall College.
enrichment.career_background: Joined BIP Ventures in 2020 and is a Vice President on the investment team. Previously an early-stage investor at Candela Partners and Ulysses Diversified Holdings and co‑founder/CEO of SimplyStow. Writes about startups and VC and holds a B.S. in Business & Computer Science from Franklin & Marshall College.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage venture investments in software, marketplaces, media & entertainment (including gaming/esports and AR/VR), tech-enabled marketplaces, enterprise SaaS, and healthtech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Five-time CEO (two founder-led, three investor-appointed) with deep corporate development experience. Skilled in corporate finance, sales operations and KPI-driven revenue scaling. Mentor at the Founder Institute, delivering lectures on capital strategy, fundraising and scaling revenue operations.
enrichment.career_background: John Allen has served as CEO five times (two as a founder, three as an investor-appointed CEO). He brings expertise in corporate development, structured high-velocity operations, corporate finance, P&L and cashflow management, and roll-out of KPI-driven sales organizations. He was part of a family-office deal team involved in investments and roll-ups of technology and tech-enabled companies and mentors founders through the Founder Institute.
enrichment.investment_focus: Energy technology, energy efficiency, sustainability/LOHAS, energy blockchain, water resource management, SaaS and financial technologies; seed-stage through later-stage corporate venture investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal at Valia Ventures who sources and evaluates early-stage opportunities with a focus on health, AI-powered vertical applications, and fintech. Mentor in Techstars New York; prior experience includes operational roles at startups and consulting at PwC. Graduated Summa Cum Laude from Boston University (B.S. in Business Administration).
enrichment.career_background: Currently a Principal at Valia Ventures supporting the firm’s portfolio and sourcing deals. Previously held operational roles at startups and worked as a consultant at PwC. Serves as a mentor for Techstars New York and contributes to Valia’s portfolio communications and diligence.
enrichment.hometown: Grew up in Los Angeles, CA; originally from Aleppo, Syria.
enrichment.investment_focus: Health, AI-powered vertical applications, FinTech; early-stage (pre-seed to Series A)

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of Blocklead Venture Studio and entrepreneur focused on web3, AI and fintech. Based in San Diego, CA, and active in early‑stage/pre‑seed startup support and LATAM founder outreach.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and managing partner at Blocklead Venture Studio (startup studio/accelerator founded 2022). Previously launched Avenue Neo Bank (blockchain‑powered fintech) and held roles with OneValley Ventures and Ganas Ventures; has spoken and advised at industry events and worked on Web3 and fintech initiatives supporting LATAM founders.
enrichment.investment_focus: Web3 / Blockchain, AI (early‑stage), Fintech (neo‑banking), pre‑seed and seed stage startups, LATAM‑focused ventures

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Latitud, a pre‑seed/seed VC and startup platform for Latin America. Previously VP of Growth & Marketing at Duolingo, where she helped scale the product from single‑digit millions to ~200M users. Based in New York; active in early‑stage LatAm investing and founder community programs.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and GP at Latitud (since 2020). Earlier she was VP of Growth & Marketing at Duolingo (2013–2018), led international growth at Tumblr and ran a boutique growth agency in Brazil; holds a B.A. from Brandeis University and was born and raised in São Paulo, Brazil.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed investing across Latin America; sector‑agnostic with a bias toward fintech, vertical SaaS, healthtech, marketplaces and AI/software‑first businesses.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and operator with experience at consumer subscription startups and early-stage venture capital. Previously a founding-team member at The Beard Club and later an investor at Mucker Capital, focused on sourcing and supporting seed‑stage software and consumer companies. Holds a BS in Business Administration from USC Marshall School of Business.
enrichment.career_background: Kiyan began his career working in private equity and as a founding-team member at The Beard Club (Dollar Beard Club). He joined Mucker Capital as an investor where he sourced and supported pre-seed to Series A investments across software and consumer verticals before moving on to subsequent investor roles.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and Series A investments in internet software & services (SaaS, enterprise), consumer DTC/subscription, marketplaces, e-commerce and payments/fintech

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at First Round Capital who leads the firm’s Platform efforts and hosts the In Depth podcast. Joined First Round as an intern and rose through investing and platform roles; credited with architecting initiatives such as The Review and Angel Track. Holds degrees in economics and film from New York University.
interests: Content and storytelling for founders (publishing, podcasts)
enrichment.career_background: Berson joined First Round in 2008 as an intern and progressed through associate and VP roles before becoming a partner (role since 2016). He leads the firm’s Platform team, helped build programs like The Review, Angel Track and Network, and co-leads First Round’s work advising founders on fundraising, PMF and GTM.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage (early-stage) investments in the US & Canada; generalist across enterprise SaaS, developer tools, fintech and consumer with emphasis on founder support, GTM and product-market fit.

enrichment.firm_name: Launch House (House Capital / Launch House Ventures)
enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder of Launch House and a managing partner at its venture arm (House Capital / Launch House Ventures). Former product/analytics roles at Airbnb and Uber; writes Houck’s Newsletter. Active angel/early-stage investor focused on founders building in creator, crypto, and fintech spaces.
enrichment.career_background: Michael Houck co-founded Launch House in 2020 and helped launch its venture arm (House Capital / Launch House Ventures). He previously worked on product and analytics teams at Uber Eats and Airbnb, and runs Houck’s Newsletter and other founder-focused projects. He has been active as an early-stage investor and board member in several startups and leads investing efforts tied to the Launch House community.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed & seed) startups; Web3/Crypto; FinTech; Creator economy & newsletters; community/coliving-driven founders

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and early-stage investor. Co‑founder of Sema4.ai and founder of Robocorp; served as a Sequoia Scout affiliated with Sequoia Capital (listed 2020–2024). Active in developer tools, open‑source, automation and infrastructure investments.
enrichment.career_background: Finnish‑born technologist and founder with an academic background from Aalto University. Co‑founded Robocorp (RPA) and later Sema4.ai; has served as a Sequoia Scout and advised AI/ML infrastructure companies and projects (including involvement with the Robot Framework Foundation and advising Valohai).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage startups in developer tools, enterprise SaaS, automation (RPA), AI and infrastructure

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of WhatsApp and co‑founder/executive chairman of the Signal Technology Foundation. Donated an initial $50M (structured as a loan) to launch the Signal Foundation and has led its nonprofit effort to build privacy‑focused messaging. Former software engineer and engineering leader with past roles at Apple, Adobe and Yahoo. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area.
enrichment.career_background: Brian Acton is a software engineer and entrepreneur who co‑founded WhatsApp (2009) and helped grow it through its acquisition by Facebook in 2014. He left WhatsApp in 2017 and in February 2018 co‑founded the Signal Technology Foundation with Moxie Marlinspike, providing initial funding and serving as executive chairman (and later interim CEO of Signal Messenger LLC). Earlier in his career he worked at Apple, Adobe and Yahoo in engineering roles.
enrichment.investment_focus: Privacy‑focused technology and secure messaging; open‑source software; early‑stage/seed investments in developer tools and cybersecurity.

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal at Arthur Ventures based in Minneapolis. Joined Arthur Ventures in 2020 after working as an investment banking analyst at Lazard. Holds a BA in Economics from Harvard University.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Arthur Ventures as an Associate in 2020 and is currently a Principal. Previously an investment banking analyst at Lazard supporting M&A across industrials, business services and TMT sectors. Graduated from Harvard University with a degree in economics.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early growth B2B software (enterprise SaaS); fintech and cybersecurity investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner & Head of Americas at Picus Capital (joined 2020), based in New York. Previously worked in Investment Banking and Capital Markets at Credit Suisse and has earlier experience in private capital and consulting. Graduated from WHU – Otto Beisheim School of Management and completed studies at the University of Florida.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Picus to establish and run the firm’s Americas operations; leads sourcing and portfolio work for the region. Prior roles include Credit Suisse (Investment Banking & Capital Markets in New York and London) and earlier experience in private capital, consulting and entrepreneurship (co-founded rebound GmbH). Educated at WHU and University of Florida.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage technology companies (pre-seed, seed, Series A) with sector focus on FinTech (payments, banking infrastructure, embedded finance), Real Estate/PropTech, HR, energy & climate, mobility, e-commerce and health.

enrichment.personal_bio: Jun Deng is an Investment Partner at Joyance Partners focused on early-stage health, biotech and consumer-health startups. She holds a Ph.D. in Molecular Physiology from UCLA and has a background in biomedical research. Deng is also active with Social Starts and HealthTech Capital and serves as a mentor/advisor in multiple accelerator programs.
enrichment.career_background: Jun Deng trained as a biomedical researcher (Ph.D., UCLA) and transitioned into venture investing. At Joyance Partners she shaped health and techbio strategy and has led or participated in numerous early-stage investments and board/observer roles; she is/has been an investment partner at Social Starts and an investor/advisor with HealthTech Capital and a mentor at programs including Singularity University and Endless Frontier Labs.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and Partner at SaaS Ventures, an early-stage fund focused on enterprise B2B software. Works on sourcing, diligence and portfolio support for seed/seed+ investments. Holds an MBA from the University of Maryland and a B.A. from Franklin & Marshall College.
enrichment.career_background: Previously an analyst at the Maryland Venture Fund and worked at Community Analytics; managed the University of Maryland’s angel investor group (Dingman Angels) and served in roles at regional funds before co-founding SaaS Ventures in 2017. Education includes an MBA from University of Maryland (Smith) and a B.A. from Franklin & Marshall College.
