enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner at Vine Ventures L.P., an early-stage, software-focused VC investing across the U.S., Israel and Latin America. Previously an investor at Insight Venture Partners and a partner at Sinai Ventures; former Head of Corporate Development at Dynamic Yield. Based in Tel Aviv and New York City and serves on nonprofit and board roles such as United Hatzalah.
enrichment.career_background: Eric Reiner co‑founded Vine Ventures in 2020 and leads the firm's investing and portfolio efforts. He began his investing career at Insight Venture Partners, later served as Head of Corporate Development at Dynamic Yield and was a partner at Sinai Ventures before launching Vine. He is active in the U.S. and Israeli startup communities and has been involved in multiple board and nonprofit roles. He graduated from Northwestern University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed to Series A) software-focused investments with emphasis on fintech, marketplaces, SaaS and AI across the U.S., Israel and Latin America.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at Dux Capital, focused on early‑stage investments across the U.S. and Latin America. Responsible for investor relations, portfolio management and parts of the investment team. Previously a corporate & investment banker at HSBC Mexico. Holds an MBA from IE Business School and a BA in Finance from Tecnológico de Monterrey.
enrichment.career_background: José Luis Silva Vázquez is co‑founder and Managing Partner of Dux Capital, an Austin‑based early‑stage VC. Before founding Dux he worked in HSBC’s Global Banking team in Mexico covering corporate and investment banking (M&A, debt & equity capital markets, structured finance and treasury). He holds an MBA from IE Business School (with a joint program at Singapore Management University) and a BA in Finance from Tecnológico de Monterrey.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed/Series A) investments in the U.S. and Latin America, with emphasis on Latinx founders; sector focus includes fintech, SaaS, marketplaces and consumer/foodtech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Chief Decentralization Officer of DecentraNet (founded 2017). Blockchain evangelist since 2013 who organizes and advises across web3, crypto and early-stage ventures; also works on psychedelics and next‑generation therapeutics. Based in San Juan, Puerto Rico.
enrichment.career_background: Founded DecentraNet (investment & advisory) and serves as its Chief Decentralization Officer. Co‑founder of d10e (decentralization conference) and AMMA Healing; has advised projects including Securrency, Humaniq and Lucy Scientific. Earlier worked in business development for Ubitquity and organized the DC Blockchain/Bitcoin meetup. Holds a bachelor's degree in Physics from West Virginia University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (F&F, pre-seed, seed) investments and advisory focused on blockchain/web3, crypto & financial infrastructure, psychedelics/mental-health therapeutics, next‑generation therapeutics and space/impact tech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Joanna McFarland is co‑founder and CEO of HopSkipDrive and an Investment Partner at XFactor Ventures. She leads pre‑seed and seed investments in female‑founded companies and serves on boards including Sidecar Health and LA‑Tech.org. She holds an MBA from Stanford and a BS from Wharton and is based in Los Angeles.
enrichment.career_background: McFarland began her career in investment banking and private equity, then spent 15+ years in product management and business development at companies including WeddingChannel, Green Dot and YP.com. In 2014 she co‑founded HopSkipDrive (CEO) and later joined XFactor Ventures as an investment partner focusing on pre‑seed and seed female‑founded startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed stage investments in female‑founded companies; sectors of interest include marketplaces, consumer, working‑parent focused products and social impact.

enrichment.personal_bio: Jacob (Jake) Poliskin is Head of Investments at Darco Capital (David Adelman’s family office) and a founding partner at Shorewind Capital. He focuses on early-stage investments across climate tech, supply-chain/logistics, AI, enterprise software and consumer brands. Previously he was a senior associate at Mark Cuban Companies and holds a BS from Penn State University.
enrichment.career_background: Head of Investments at Darco Capital (directs David Adelman’s private investing activity, with emphasis on climate tech and consumer/enterprise technology). Founding partner at Shorewind Capital (early-stage VC). Previously Senior Associate at Mark Cuban Companies (sourced and managed seed/Series A opportunities). Penn State alumnus.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed, Series A) investments in climate tech / cleantech, supply-chain & logistics technology, AI and enterprise software, and consumer brands.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at Fellows Fund and founder of TalentSeer with ~20 years of experience across R&D, sales, marketing, HR and startup investing. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area and focused on early-stage AI investments.
enrichment.career_background: Entrepreneur-turned-investor: founder & CEO of TalentSeer (AI talent/recruiting firm, founded 2015) and founding partner/managing partner at Fellows Fund (AI-focused VC, founded 2021). Active angel/co-investor in early-stage AI and Web3 startups; previously has held operating roles and founded other startups. Educated at institutions including the Chinese Academy of Sciences (graduate study listed in public profiles).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage AI (seed / pre-seed / Series A), AI infrastructure and applications, selected Web3/crypto and healthcare AI investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal at SixThirty Ventures based in St. Louis, Missouri. Focuses on early-stage enterprise FinTech, InsurTech and cybersecurity investments. Previously a senior consultant at Aon (Aon Hewitt) advising institutional investors; holds an MBA from Washington University in St. Louis and a BS from Butler University.
enrichment.career_background: Joined SixThirty as a Principal and works on sourcing, diligence, and portfolio support for early-stage fintech/insurtech/cybersecurity companies. Prior to SixThirty he was a senior consultant at Aon Hewitt Investment Consulting advising institutional investors; educational background includes an MBA from Washington University in St. Louis and a BS from Butler University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed–Series A) FinTech, InsurTech, Cybersecurity and digital health — B2B enterprise financial and privacy-related startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Sweater Ventures who invests in early-stage consumer and fintech startups. Previously an operator and growth analyst at Uber and NetSuite and co‑founder of BeenThere. Holds an MBA from Kellogg School of Management and a BBA from the University of Wisconsin–Madison.
interests: Democratizing access to venture capital / elevating diverse founders
enrichment.career_background: Cara began her career in finance and operations roles (Macy’s, NetSuite), moved into growth/analytics at Uber, co‑founded BeenThere, then transitioned into VC with roles at Chicago Ventures and Selwyn Ventures before joining Sweater Ventures as a Partner (now Managing Partner). She holds an MBA from Northwestern (Kellogg) and a BBA from the University of Wisconsin–Madison.
enrichment.investment_focus: Stages: Seed, Series A. Sectors: FinTech, Consumer/CPG, Marketplaces, Healthtech, Proptech/real estate.

enrichment.personal_bio: Product operator, founder and angel investor. Former product roles at Facebook, FiscalNote and Beam; co‑founder of HeadsUp (acquired by Hightouch). Served as a Sequoia Capital scout (2021–2023) and invests in early‑stage SaaS, Web3/crypto and developer-focused startups.
enrichment.career_background: Momo Ong is a product leader and founder who has held product roles at Facebook and product leadership roles at FiscalNote and Beam. He co‑founded HeadsUp (acquired by Hightouch in 2023), has acted as a Sequoia Capital scout (2021–2023), and is an active angel investor focused on early‑stage companies. He studied at Princeton University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre-seed/seed) startups; sectors include SaaS, Web3/crypto, sales & CRM, marketplaces and developer tools. As a Sequoia scout his typical check size was reported around $10K–$25K.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder & CEO of Flex (also referenced as Flexbase) and co‑founder/general partner at 305 Ventures. Early‑stage investor and Thiel Fellow with a background building AI and education startups. Active in Miami and the broader U.S. startup ecosystem.
enrichment.career_background: Serial entrepreneur and investor. Co‑founded AI startup Volley (founder/CEO), later founded Flex (FinTech) where he serves as CEO. Co‑founded 305 Ventures (early‑stage fund) and is listed as an active angel/seed investor; also a Thiel Fellow. Public profiles and firm pages list roles spanning product, founder‑operator and angel investing.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed stage investments; sectors include FinTech, SMB software, AI/ML, Web3/DeFi, consumer & sports/media/gaming

enrichment.personal_bio: Chief Operating Officer at Founders Factory based in London. Former founder and CEO of Glow Digital Media (2008–2016), which was acquired in 2016. Operator and early-stage investor who builds and supports startups across climate, deep tech, fintech, health and media.
enrichment.career_background: Damian founded Glow Digital Media in 2008 and led it until its exit in 2016. He joined Founders Factory in 2019 in leadership roles across consumer and media, served as Chief Commercial Officer, and was appointed Chief Operating Officer in 2023. He also holds board and non-executive roles in several portfolio companies and operates as an angel / venture builder focused on early-stage startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed & Seed investing and venture studio (venture building); sectors include Climate, Fintech, Health, Deep Tech, Media

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and Chief Scientific Officer of Endpoint Health; Partner at Endpoint Ventures and an angel investor focused on life sciences. Co-founded GeneWEAVE (acquired by Roche) and served as a Visiting Partner at Y Combinator. Holds a BS in Electrical Engineering (UC Santa Barbara) and an MS/PhD in Biomedical Engineering (Cornell).
enrichment.career_background: Diego Rey is a life‑science entrepreneur and investor. He co‑founded GeneWEAVE (CTO; acquired by Roche), served as Head of Research at Roche for the GeneWEAVE division, was a Visiting Partner at Y Combinator focused on life sciences, and is co‑founder and CSO of Endpoint Health. He is a Partner at Endpoint Ventures and an angel investor; he holds a BS (UC Santa Barbara) and MS/PhD (Cornell University) in biomedical‑related fields.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at SemperVirens Venture Capital and an early InsurTech/FinTech investor. Cofounder of QED Investors and cofounder & chairman of the InsureTech Connect conference. Focuses on startups applying data and APIs to insurance, financial services, workforce and health tech.
enrichment.career_background: Spent a decade as an executive at Capital One, then cofounded QED Investors (boutique VC focused on data-driven companies). Later co‑founded InsureTech Connect and HR Transform and now serves as a General Partner at SemperVirens, investing in early‑stage B2B startups across health, wealth and work. Education includes a BA from Harvard and an MBA and JD from the University of Virginia.

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial entrepreneur and early-stage investor focused on spatial computing and perceptual technologies. Former founder (Nomadic) with product and motion-capture experience at Industrial Light & Magic, Walt Disney Animation, Electronic Arts and Vicon; held leadership roles at Loom.ai. Now Managing Partner at Spatial Capital, backing seed-stage teams building computer vision, 3D graphics and AI systems.
enrichment.career_background: 25+ years in emerging tech and visual effects: motion-capture and CG roles at ILM, Disney and EA; VP product/strategy at Vicon; founded Nomadic (CEO); VP Partnerships & Strategy at Loom.ai; venture partner at DART; currently Managing Partner and founder of Spatial Capital, investing in seed-stage spatial and perceptual computing startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage startups in spatial computing, computer vision, 3D graphics/avatars, AR/VR, perceptual computing and applied AI.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder & General Partner at Cybernetix Ventures, an early-stage VC focused on robotics, automation and industrial AI. Co‑founder of MassRobotics and former telecom/regional manager with graduate study at MIT and a BS from the American University in Cairo. Active board member and frequent speaker on robotics investing and commercialization.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder of MassRobotics where he led fundraising and corporate partnerships; served in strategy and research roles in robotics companies (including Vecna Robotics) after earlier regional leadership roles at Nokia Siemens Networks. In 2021–2022 he co‑founded Cybernetix Ventures to invest in pre‑seed to Series A robotics, automation and industrial AI startups and serves on several portfolio boards (e.g., Cambrian, Bionomous, Crgo).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed, seed and Series A investments in robotics, automation and industrial/physical AI; vertical focus on advanced manufacturing, logistics/warehousing, construction (AEC), healthcare/medical devices, agriculture and climate infrastructure; interest in enabling technologies (autonomy, machine vision, sensors/edge computing, cloud robotics, robot cybersecurity).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner at Alpine VC (alpine.vc). Previously a principal at Goodwater Capital and an associate at Redpoint Ventures; prior roles include Head of Business Operations at Stitcher and tech/finance roles earlier in his career. Holds MS and BS degrees in Computer Science from Stanford University.
enrichment.career_background: Ed Suh founded Alpine VC in 2022 and leads the firm’s seed and Series A investing activity focused on product-led consumer and SMB software. Before founding Alpine, he spent multiple years at Goodwater Capital and Redpoint Ventures conducting seed-to-growth investments, and earlier worked in business operations at Stitcher and in technology M&A at Merrill Lynch. He holds MS and BS degrees in Computer Science from Stanford.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed & Series A; consumer tech, prosumer software (creator & dev tools), SMB software; product-led growth (primarily US, with activity in Southeast Asia and other regions)

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and operator focused on enterprise infrastructure, developer tools, and SaaS. Led Tribe Capital’s enterprise software investing practice and joined Mayfield in 2023 to lead Select/Spring (Series B) investments. Prior operating background includes sales and business development roles at Cloudflare and other SaaS companies; earlier experience in investment banking.
enrichment.career_background: Sri began in investment banking and early-stage venture, later held sales and business development leadership roles (including Cloudflare). He built a syndicated angel fund (Overtime VC), led enterprise software investing at Tribe Capital, and joined Mayfield in September 2023 as a partner focused on Select/Spring (Series B) investments. He holds a B.S. in Finance from Case Western Reserve University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise infrastructure, AI, developer tools, and SaaS (primarily Series B / Select-Spring stage)

enrichment.personal_bio: Aravind “Avi” Bharadwaj is a venture investor who served as a Principal at Innovation Endeavors focused on enterprise software, data and AI/ML. He joined Intel Capital in 2022 as an Investment Director and leads investments in data/AI infrastructure and application companies.

He began his career as a software engineer at Goldman Sachs, worked as a data scientist/consultant at IBM, was Principal at Innovation Endeavors (2017–2022) where he led and served as director/observer on multiple enterprise and data-focused investments, and joined Intel Capital in 2022 as an Investment Director.
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise software; data & analytics; AI/ML platforms; early-stage (seed–Series A) investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Nobuhiro “Nob” Seki is a serial tech entrepreneur and investor; he is Founding Partner / Chief Investment Officer at Monozukuri Ventures. He previously served as an executive and CEO at Six Apart and cofounded FabFoundry. He holds an MBA from Carnegie Mellon University and a B.S. in Engineering from the University of Tokyo.
enrichment.career_background: Nobuhiro Seki has worked at the intersection of media, engineering and product startups for decades. He served as Executive Vice President and later President & CEO at Six Apart, cofounded FabFoundry (a hardware startup platform) and helped found the Maker Bootcamp/Shisaku fund initiatives; he is a founding partner and CIO of Monozukuri Ventures, focusing on early-stage hard‑tech and manufacturing-related investments. He holds an MBA from Carnegie Mellon and a BS from the University of Tokyo.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) hardware and deep tech: manufacturing, IoT/embedded, robotics, semiconductors/edge AI, medical devices

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner of Predictive VC, an early-stage firm that backs and builds applied‑AI companies with proprietary data moats. Former co‑founder and Chief Product Officer at Mural; earlier product roles at Digits and Kensho. Based between New York City and Latin America; Yale alumnus.

He previously co‑founded Mural and served as its CPO, and held early product roles at Digits and Kensho. He is an active angel investor and advisor to multiple startups across fintech, proptech, and AI.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and Seed investments in applied AI, fintech/payments, and product‑led software platforms with scalable data moats; emphasis on US–Latin America cross‑border go‑to‑market.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of Emergence Capital (2003) and long‑time investor focused on enterprise SaaS and cloud business software. Founder of seed firm Moai Capital and a Lecturer at Stanford GSB on angel & venture capital financing. Experienced board member who has backed and advised dozens of software companies.

Impact investing focused on autism employment and inclusive hiring
enrichment.career_background: Originally an engineer (Raychem, RCA, Westinghouse, Polaroid) with MS and BS in mechanical engineering from MIT and an MBA from Stanford. Early general partner at St. Paul Venture Capital, co‑founded Emergence Capital in 2003, later launched Moai Capital (seed/impact focus). Serves or has served on multiple public and private boards and teaches at Stanford GSB.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage enterprise SaaS / cloud business software (primary); personal seed investments via Moai Capital in consumer, IoT and impact (autism employment).

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Wavemaker Three‑Sixty Health and Managing Partner of MedTech Impact Partners. Former FDA leader (Deputy Division Director/Branch Chief) and VP of Regulatory Affairs & Quality Assurance at Implant Direct (Danaher). Lecturer and researcher in medtech innovation at UCLA and founder of the nonprofit MedTech Color.
enrichment.career_background: Over 20 years in medtech spanning 12 years at the U.S. FDA in progressive leadership roles (including Deputy Division Director), senior regulatory operating roles at Danaher/Implant Direct, and founder of MedTech Impact Partners (regulatory strategy). Serves as a venture partner at Wavemaker Three‑Sixty Health, sits on/observes several medtech boards, lectures and conducts research on medtech innovation at UCLA, and founded MedTech Color.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage healthcare (Seed & Series A); medtech / medical devices; diagnostics & digital health; health IT and AI-enabled clinical tools.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at Adapt Ventures. Founder of Altiam (IT services) and co‑founder of Heritage, a private network for family offices. Featured on Forbes 30 Under 30 (Venture Capital). BS in Finance & Economics, New York University.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder & Managing Partner of Adapt Ventures (early‑stage VC, founded 2020). Founder of Altiam, an IT services company, and co‑founder of Heritage, a private network for family offices and family businesses. Prior to Adapt he held investor roles at other venture firms (reported at RLC Ventures / Embed) and has an undergraduate degree from NYU.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed‑stage venture capital; sectors include fintech, software, consumer and healthcare; primary geographies U.S. and Latin America.

enrichment.firm_name: Shift One (Sh1ft; later rebranded as Movo)
enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and operator focused on frontline workforce and logistics marketplaces. Former regional GM at Uber and COO at 99 (Brazil); founder/CEO of Shift One (now Movo). Active angel investor and growth advisor in Latin American and logistics startups.
interests: Upskilling and training for hourly workers
enrichment.career_background: Jason Radisson began at McKinsey, scaled operations at Uber as a regional GM, and served as COO of 99 in Brazil. He founded Shift One (Sh1ft), which later became Movo, and has been an angel investor and advisor to startups in logistics, recommerce and labor marketplaces.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed/angel) investments in frontline workforce, logistics and HR/marketplace startups

enrichment.personal_bio: London-based investor and senior/management partner at MIW Ventures who also serves as an Executive Director at C2 Capital. Focuses on seed-stage technology companies with emphasis on Web3/blockchain, cybersecurity, AI and fintech. Has a background in digital marketing and capital-markets advisory and is active in Israeli tech export programs and mentorship.
enrichment.career_background: Holds senior roles at MIW Ventures (Managing/Senior Partner) and serves as Executive Director at C2 Capital; listed as Director/Executive Director on UK company records. Prior experience includes leadership roles in digital marketing and product/strategy at firms referenced on his public profiles (e.g., DoubleClick/CompuServe/Epsilon) and participation in tech export and mentorship programs (MIW Israel tech export programme, startup mentorship).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage technology startups (typical check sizes reported ~$50K–$5M). Sector focus: Web3/Blockchain, Cybersecurity, AI/DeepTech, FinTech, Media/Content; geographic focus includes the UK and Israel with international distribution.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑Founder and CEO of 8090 Industries, focused on investing in and accelerating companies in decarbonization, aerospace & defense, and deep tech. Has led multiple venture funds and served as a founding partner/managing director of Kairos K50 funds and as Managing Director of Ozmen Ventures. Combines early operational experience at Sierra Nevada Corporation with venture investing across seed and early growth stages. Born and raised in Reno, Nevada.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑Founder & CEO of 8090 Industries (leading the firm’s industrial and decarbonization investing). Previously a Founding Partner and Managing Director for Kairos K50 funds and Managing Director at Ozmen Ventures; early roles included program/engineering positions at Sierra Nevada Corporation. Educated at the University of Nevada, Reno (profileled as alumnus).
enrichment.investment_focus: Decarbonization, aerospace & defense, deep tech and advanced manufacturing; early‑stage industrial technology investments (seed through Series A)

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and general partner (emeritus) at Devlabs with 20+ years in software product development and venture finance. Based in Oakland, California, he has led Devlabs’ early-stage investments across the Americas and advised portfolio companies in fintech, B2B SaaS and AI.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and General Partner at Devlabs (founded 2013); prior experience in software product development and technology leadership including serving as CTO at TUMIS. Education includes University of California, Berkeley. Work focuses on fund structuring and investing in early‑stage B2B software across North America and Latin America.

enrichment.personal_bio: Dr. Cristina Escoda is Co‑Founder and Managing Partner at Tachyon Ventures, an early‑stage life‑sciences VC based in Los Angeles. She holds a PhD in Theoretical Physics and an MBA from NYU Stern, and co‑founded ORCA Computing. Her background spans derivatives structuring, D.E. Shaw, fintech, digital health and deep‑science investing.
enrichment.career_background: Cristina began as a derivatives structurer at HSBC LatAm in New York, joined the rotational associate program at D.E. Shaw, and later worked in portfolio management and product development across fintech, digital health and blockchain. She co‑founded Tachyon Ventures (2017) and ORCA Computing (2019) and has been a founder, advisor and investor in early‑stage science‑first companies for over a decade.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage, science‑first life sciences (biotech, bioengineering, transformative therapeutics) — IP‑backed, peer‑reviewed research with a focus on pre‑seed to Series A investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner at Kohala Ventures and founder/managing partner of Ignite Advisors. Operator, advisor and angel investor focused on early-stage technology and software companies; previously held senior commercial roles at Yahoo, Microsoft, Excite@Home and Disney. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area (resides in Marin County). citeturn1view0turn2view0turn5search2
enrichment.career_background: Began career in television with ABC News in New York City, moved to San Francisco in 1995, and held senior commercial roles at Excite@Home, Microsoft and Yahoo. Founded Ignite Advisors (operator/advisory firm) in 2008 and launched Kohala Ventures (independent seed fund) in 2018; serves as Founder and General Partner and invests primarily at seed/early stages. citeturn2view0turn1view0turn5search2turn3search6turn5search1

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and investor focused on compounding technologies, human performance, and consumer products. Co‑founder of Ketone‑IQ (H.V.M.N.), Archive, and Anti Fund (with Jake Paul). Stanford computer science graduate and inventor with peer‑reviewed publications and patents.

(Ketone‑IQ), Archive, and the venture firm Anti Fund, and serves as a founding partner/board director at Betr and a board director at Simplebet. He is active as an angel and early‑stage investor across AI, robotics, web3, and consumer startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture investor with experience across early-stage VC and crypto. Has held investing roles at Alumni Ventures, Truffle Ventures and (later) Hivemind; formerly co‑founder of RestEasy and an EIR at Columbia Build Lab. MBA from Columbia Business School and bachelor’s from Virginia Tech.
enrichment.career_background: Kayla Phillips is an early‑stage investor who worked on Alumni Ventures’ Basecamp/AV investing teams (VC role), later focused on crypto at Truffle Ventures and joined Hivemind as an investment principal. Prior roles include co‑founding RestEasy and serving as Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence at Columbia Build Lab; she holds an MBA from Columbia Business School and an undergraduate degree from Virginia Tech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner at Ensemble VC, Collin West founded the firm to apply data science to early-stage investing and help founders scale into team-led companies. He previously served on the founding fund team at Correlation Ventures and helped create the Kauffman Fellows VC fund and Research Center. He is based in Austin, TX and has authored research on VC practice and healthcare tech adoption.
enrichment.career_background: Collin began his VC career on the founding fund team at Correlation Ventures, later founding the Kauffman Fellows VC fund and the Kauffman Fellows Research Center. He founded Ensemble VC in 2020 to combine data science with operational support for founders. Earlier he founded businesses in digital advertising and adventure travel and worked as a strategy consultant at Accenture; he holds an MBA from Northwestern (Kellogg) and a BBA from Southern Methodist University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed / Series A) investments using data-driven signals; emphasis on helping founder-led companies build leadership teams; sectors include enterprise and consumer software, fintech, healthcare and marketplaces.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director and co‑founder at FAST — by GETTYLAB and a Managing Director at GETTY. Active on early‑stage investments focused on engineering‑heavy startups (deeptech, hardware, applied math/physics). Based in New York; has served as a board observer for multiple portfolio companies.
enrichment.career_background: Aniq Kassam is a VC investor and operator who co‑founded FAST — by GETTYLAB and serves as Managing Director (also holds Managing Director responsibilities at GETTY). He invests at pre‑seed/seed stages in engineering‑centric startups and has held multiple board‑observer and advisor roles across portfolio companies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Draper Cygnus focused on sourcing deep‑tech Latino founders and supporting portfolio development and investor relations. Co‑founder and General Partner of Embarca (accelerator/fund) in Mendoza (founded 2017). Background in business development and digital marketing; completed a Business Administration degree at Universidad Nacional de Cuyo and postgraduate programs in digital marketing and venture investments.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Embarca (accelerator and regional VC) in 2017 and later joined Draper Cygnus as a Partner to lead dealflow generation and portfolio work for early‑stage deep‑tech companies. Active in the Argentine VC ecosystem and Endeavor Cuyo; prior roles include marketing and business development positions in regional media and startup programs.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed investments in deep‑tech and decentralization (Web3/crypto), primarily focused on Latin America and the United States.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and former General Partner at Flex Capital, a San Francisco‑based venture firm that invests in early‑stage software companies. Previously a vice president at Battery Ventures and co‑founder/CEO of Daily Aisle. Educated at Emory University (Goizueta Business School).
enrichment.career_background: Jeffrey Lu co‑founded Flex Capital and served as a General Partner focused on early‑stage software investments. Before Flex he spent several years at Battery Ventures as an investor and earlier co‑founded and served as CEO of Daily Aisle; he began his career in investment banking/M&A. He holds a BBA from Emory University’s Goizueta Business School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed to Series B; early‑stage software (marketplaces, consumer internet, enterprise SaaS, data/middleware)

enrichment.personal_bio: Owner and Managing Partner at Osbon Capital Management (Boston). Holds a B.S. in Mathematics and a B.A. in Finance from Santa Clara University. Former Bloomberg sales professional; has served as CIO/advisor roles and founded 1TAB Ventures. Publishes articles for Osbon Capital and has participated in public media coverage about retail/social investing.
enrichment.career_background: Joined the family firm full-time as a partner in 2013; prior experience at Bloomberg covering institutional accounts. Has served in investment leadership and advisory roles (including at Unifimoney) and founded 1TAB Ventures. Writes and researches investment topics for Osbon Capital and participates in industry and charitable boards in Boston.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and seed-stage private investments across fintech, AI, health/healthtech, blockchain/crypto and other technology-driven sectors; family office/private investments and bespoke wealth management.

enrichment.personal_bio: Brian McClendon is a software engineer and executive who co‑founded Keyhole (the technology that became Google Earth) and later served as VP of Google Geo. He has held senior mapping and location roles at Uber and is Senior Vice President of Engineering (mapping/AR) at Niantic. He is a venture partner at UP.Partners and an active angel investor and board member in spatial, sensing, robotics, and mobility startups.
enrichment.career_background: McClendon began his career in 3D graphics (Silicon Graphics), co‑founded Keyhole (later acquired by Google) and led Google’s Geo engineering efforts (Maps, Earth, Street View). He left Google for Uber to lead maps and business platform work, later joined Niantic to head mapping and AR engineering, and serves as a venture partner at UP.Partners while advising and investing in early‑stage startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed/Series A) companies in mobility and the "moving world"—including transport/multi‑modal mobility, autonomy, sensing & hardware, positioning and spatial/AR software.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Bain Capital Ventures focusing on infrastructure software, cybersecurity and AI incubations. Former product leader at Atlassian; studied at UCLA. Founded and runs BCV Labs to incubate AI companies and technical founders. Promoted to partner at BCV in January 2024.
enrichment.career_background: Studied computer science at UCLA and worked as a product manager (including at Redfin and Atlassian) before joining Bain Capital Ventures in 2021. At BCV he has led and advised early-stage investments in AI infrastructure and security, launched BCV Labs (an AI incubator), and was promoted to partner in January 2024.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed/Series A) investments in infrastructure software, AI infrastructure & developer tools, and cybersecurity; incubation of AI startups via BCV Labs.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Clinikally (YC S22), a telehealth + e‑pharmacy focused on dermatology and consumer health. Former AI researcher at Stanford AIMI and Microsoft Healthcare; holds degrees from Stanford University. Recognized on Forbes 30 Under 30 (Asia).
enrichment.career_background: Arjun Soin is the founder of Clinikally (YC S22). He has worked as an AI researcher at the Stanford Center for Artificial Intelligence in Medicine & Imaging and at Microsoft Healthcare, held data/ML roles (including at Amazon and Curai Health), and was on the founding team of GetSafle. He holds BS and MS degrees from Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Angel / pre-seed & seed-stage investments in digital health, consumer DTC (beauty), AI/ML, web3/crypto, and climate tech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder of B2 Founders and an early-stage investor focused on pre-seed/seed startups across Latin America and North America. Former founder/builder with an MBA from Dartmouth (Tuck) and undergraduate studies in Colombia. Active angel/seed investor with recorded investments in fintech, crypto and marketplace companies.
enrichment.career_background: Co-founder and investor at B2 Founders. Prior experience as a startup founder/builder (associated with companies such as Grability and other early-stage projects) and investor; holds an MBA from Dartmouth College (Tuck) and undergraduate degrees from Colombian universities.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / pre-seed investments in fintech, payments, marketplaces, e-commerce and crypto with a focus on Latin America and North America

enrichment.personal_bio: Consumer growth investor and Principal at Avenir Growth Capital based in New York. Serves on the boards of Sundays and Malbon Golf and is a board observer at Nivoda. Holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and an HBA from the Ivey School of Business.
enrichment.career_background: Jonathan joined Avenir’s investment team in 2020 (rejoining after business school in 2022). Prior to Avenir he worked on Advent International’s Retail, Consumer & Leisure team and began his career in M&A at Moelis & Company and CIBC Capital Markets. He holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and an HBA from the Ivey School of Business.
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth equity focused on consumer brands, retail/DTC, commerce & marketing software and marketplaces (Series A–B).

enrichment.personal_bio: Professional high-school educator and school administrator who is an angel investor and member of Sand Hill Angels. Based in the San Jose / Mountain View area. Focuses on early-stage investments related to education, adolescent development and family/consumer products.
enrichment.career_background: Former high-school teacher and school administrator; angel investor and Sand Hill Angels member. Registered agent for Cannon Angel Investments LLC and Baron Family Fund LLC (California filings). Serves on bioethics committees (El Camino Health, Santa Clara County Medical Association) and on the John Sheehy Company investment committee.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage/angel investments in Education/EdTech, parenting & youth-focused consumer products, and consumer/technology startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Jack R. Selby is Managing Partner at AZ-VC and a Managing Director at Thiel Capital. An original PayPal employee and former Senior Vice President, he co-founded Clarium Capital and is an active technology investor and independent film producer. Selby is involved with investments and advisory roles in companies including SpaceX, Palantir, Affirm and Blend, and serves on several nonprofit and state economic boards.
enrichment.career_background: Selby began his career at PayPal as an early employee and later served as a Corporate Officer/Senior Vice President overseeing international and corporate operations. He co-founded Clarium Capital with Peter Thiel, is a Managing Director at Thiel Capital, and founded/serves as Managing Partner of AZ-VC. He is also an independent film producer and serves on boards and advisory bodies related to economic development and philanthropy.
enrichment.investment_focus: Series A/B (post-revenue) technology companies; primarily Arizona-domiciled companies; sector-agnostic, founder/entrepreneur-focused investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: CFO at Vanta and an active angel investor and scout. Former CFO of Menlo Security and Head of Finance for Cisco Cloud Security (via OpenDNS). Holds a BSBA from Washington University and an MSc in Finance from the London School of Economics.
enrichment.career_background: Finance and operating leader in security and SaaS: began in technology investment banking, moved into corporate finance and investor relations at Box and OpenDNS (Cisco Cloud Security), served as CFO of Menlo Security, and joined Vanta as CFO in 2023. Also serves as a scout/angel affiliated with Sequoia Capital.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and seed technology startups, with emphasis on enterprise security, SaaS and developer/platform infrastructure.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and operator focused on climate tech, primarily energy and decarbonization in the built environment. Serves as a Partner (Syndicate) at Climate Capital and works in partnerships/enterprise sales at Lumen Energy. Educational background: Dartmouth College.
interests: Go-to-market and partnerships for climate solutions
enrichment.career_background: Sam Runkle is a climate tech investor and operator. He is a Partner (Syndicate) / Principal at Climate Capital, where he focuses on early-stage investments in energy and the built environment, and concurrently works in partnerships and enterprise sales at Lumen Energy. Previously he participated in On Deck Climate Tech and held go-to-market roles at several startups. He holds a BA from Dartmouth College.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage climate tech (pre-seed – Series A) with emphasis on energy, built-environment decarbonization, PropTech/real-estate solutions, and emissions-reduction/adaptation technologies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and partner at Venture Development Partners. Experienced technology executive and entrepreneur; former CEO of Intellectsoft (2017–2022) and advisor to multiple Silicon Valley startups. Focuses on digital transformation, startup growth and operational scaling.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and partner at Venture Development Partners (VDP). Previously served as CEO and senior operations leader at Intellectsoft (listed as CEO, 2017–2022), board advisor for product strategy at GeoZilla (2017–2021), and held operations/Program roles in renewable energy and commercial real‑estate projects in Europe. Active angel/advisor to early‑stage tech companies and participant in VDP investment SPVs.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage technology (pre‑seed to Series A) — SaaS, enterprise software, AI, cloud/data services, fintech; U.S. market entry and scaling advisory.

enrichment.personal_bio: Seattle-based angel investor and founder of First Light Studios who focuses on early-stage consumer and DTC businesses. Active as a seed/pre-seed investor with typical checks in the $25k–$75k range.
enrichment.career_background: Founder & CEO, First Light Studios (2021–present). Prior experience includes roles in product and account management (Pushpay; Market Performance Group) and principal-level investing work (Keiretsu Forum). Acts as an individual/angel investor supporting consumer startups in the Seattle/Portland region.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage consumer brands (DTC, e-commerce, retail, food & beverage); seed / pre-seed checks; US-based consumer companies

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Director at Versant Ventures (since 1999) with a long operating and investing background in biotechnology. Founded Glycomed and later co‑founded and served as CEO of Cell Design Labs (acquired by Gilead in 2017). Has chaired or served on boards including Atreca, Clovis Oncology, Trius Therapeutics, Veracyte and others. citeturn4search1turn4search4
enrichment.career_background: BS in Biological Sciences (UC Irvine), MS in Ecology (UC Davis) and an MBA from Harvard Business School. Prior to co‑founding Versant (1999) he was founder, president & CEO of Glycomed and later led Cell Design Labs as CEO until its acquisition by Gilead; long track record of board roles at public and private biotech companies. citeturn4search4turn4search1
enrichment.investment_focus: Healthcare/biotechnology (novel therapeutics), medical devices, diagnostics and research tools; company creation and multi-stage investments. citeturn2search4

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Director of Blindspot Consulting with a background in corporate finance, licensing and brand management. Former President of Dunlop Sports Group and current COO/CFO at Tersa (health/wellness startup). Active as an early-stage investor with several angel/syndicate investments on record.
enrichment.career_background: Robert W. Reynolds is the founder and managing director of Blindspot Consulting (advisory and licensing). He served as President of Dunlop Sports Group and has held senior finance and operating roles in startups, including COO/CFO at Tersa. His work spans licensing/brand management, capital raises, and operational restructuring across consumer and sports-related businesses.
enrichment.investment_focus: Healthy aging; early-stage healthtech / age‑tech; life sciences / medtech; diagnostics & therapeutics

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and angel investor based in Miami, Florida. Former corporate M&A associate (Kirkland & Ellis) who served as Chief of Staff and Partner at Pareto Holdings and co‑founded/led startups including Noba. Active angel and scout with a focus on early-stage technology and AI investments.
enrichment.career_background: Trained as a corporate lawyer (J.D., Benjamin N. Cardozo School of Law) and worked as an associate at Kirkland & Ellis in M&A. Transitioned to startups (co‑founder/COO of Rowgatta, later founder/CEO of Noba) and joined Pareto Holdings as Chief of Staff and Partner where he helped build the investing and venture studio teams; has held board/advisor roles at several early-stage companies.

enrichment.personal_bio: M.D., M.S.E.; founder of Ascendant BioCapital and a managing partner on J.P. Morgan’s Life Sciences Private Capital team. Former investment professional at OrbiMed and a former neurological surgery resident at Columbia University Medical Center. Educated at Johns Hopkins (BS, MSE) and Stanford (MD).
enrichment.career_background: Gaurav Gupta trained in biomedical engineering (Johns Hopkins) and medicine (Stanford), completed residency training in neurological surgery at Columbia, then moved into life‑sciences investing (OrbiMed). He founded Ascendant BioCapital (around 2020) and joined J.P. Morgan’s Life Sciences Private Capital team as a co-managing partner in 2022.

enrichment.personal_bio: Early-stage investor who served as a Venture Associate and Senior Associate at Capital Factory (2022–2023). Co‑founder of the Texas Black Founders Network and former founder/operator of consumer B2B startup Guzo. Has also worked as a venture scout at NOEMIS Ventures and began his career in banking at Wells Fargo.
enrichment.career_background: Joshua (JT) Taylor has worked across venture and startup roles in Texas. He held Venture Associate and Senior Associate positions at Capital Factory (2022–2023), served as a venture scout at NOEMIS Ventures, and later took on roles including Venture Partner at South Loop Ventures and Director at Fifth Star Funds. He co‑founded the Texas Black Founders Network and previously co‑founded the startup Guzo; his early career included financial‑analyst roles at Wells Fargo.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Titanium Ventures, where he leads consumer-tech investing with a focus on esports/gaming, social, e‑commerce, fintech and vertical SaaS. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, he has sourced and led investments in companies including FitOn, Skillz, Sleeper and Super.com. Educated at University College London.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Titanium Ventures (formerly Telstra Ventures) in 2014 and serves as a General Partner leading the firm’s consumer investing efforts. Earlier experience includes technology investment banking and corporate development roles; holds an undergraduate degree from University College London.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer technology (esports/gaming, social, e‑commerce), fintech, web3/crypto and vertical SaaS; invests across seed through growth with emphasis on post-product-market-fit opportunities.

enrichment.personal_bio: Senior Investment Director at Prosperity7 Ventures and Managing Director at Aramco Ventures (North America). Over 25 years of experience across venture investing and investment banking with a focus on energy and enterprise technologies. Serves on industry boards including the National Renewable Energy Laboratory and has led investments such as SiFive, Taulia, SignalWire, Callsign and Wasabi.

Joined Saudi Aramco Energy Ventures (Aramco Ventures) in 2013 and is listed as a Senior Investment Director/Managing Director there; joined Prosperity7 Ventures as a Senior Investment Director in 2021. Active on corporate and research boards related to energy and technology.
enrichment.investment_focus: Energy, enterprise technology, fintech, industrial and deep technology, AI & robotics, cybersecurity; early- to growth-stage venture investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Tom Bedecarré (January 17, 1956 – March 29, 2025) was co‑founder and longtime CEO of AKQA and served as President of WPP Ventures. He led WPP Ventures' early strategic investments (notably stakes in Muzy and Refinery29), and later taught and mentored at Stanford University. Bedecarré was known for bridging Silicon Valley technology and advertising and for mentoring startup founders and students.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder of Citron Haligman Bedecarré (1990) and co‑founder/CEO of AKQA (CEO through ~2016); AKQA was acquired by WPP in 2012. Served as President of WPP Ventures (Silicon Valley) from 2012 to 2015, identifying strategic digital and content investments. After transitioning from agency leadership he served as an adjunct lecturer and mentor at Stanford and held board/advisor roles with several startups and nonprofits. Education: BA Stanford University; MBA Kellogg School of Management, Northwestern University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Strategic corporate investments in digital media, content & publishing; mobile and social platforms; marketing/advertising technology; early‑stage and growth-stage opportunities that strengthen agency capabilities.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Lattice Ventures and experienced early-stage investor. Former General Manager of the USV Network at Union Square Ventures and founder of startups including gtrot (acquired by Groupon) and VetsinTech NYC. BA in Marketing and International Business from NYU Stern; active in blockchain/Web3, fintech, and community-driven startups.
enrichment.career_background: Brittany Laughlin began her career in product and small-business roles at American Express, founded travel startup gtrot (acquired by Groupon) and VetsinTech NYC, then joined Union Square Ventures as General Manager of the USV network. She co-founded Lattice Ventures (partner) to invest in seed and early-stage companies and has held roles in the Blockstack/Stacks ecosystem and related foundations. She holds a BA from NYU Stern and has written and spoken on investing, community, and token-based ecosystems.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / early-stage venture; blockchain/Web3, fintech, marketplaces, developer & platform tools, community/network-effect businesses

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and managing partner at Greatscale Ventures and founder & chairman of FP Complete. Former Microsoft engineering leader and technology adviser to CEO Bill Gates; inventor on multiple patents and holds degrees in computer science and cognitive psychology. Based in La Jolla, California.
interests: Future of work / gig economy platforms
enrichment.career_background: Aaron Contorer is a technology executive and investor who served as a Microsoft engineering manager (including general manager of Visual C++ and adviser to Bill Gates), co‑founded Contorer Computing and contributed to early Internet software work at NCSA, and later founded FP Complete. He co‑founded Greatscale Ventures to invest in early‑stage, people‑focused tech companies and has held CxO and board roles at multiple startups and nonprofits.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage technology: health & wellness, consumer fintech and gig‑economy platforms, learning & training, and software/AI.

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal on Bain Capital Ventures’ Ventures team based in New York who focuses on growth‑stage application software and fintech. Joined BCV in 2022 after working as an associate consultant at Bain & Company and has co‑authored BCV investment insights and founder stories.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Bain Capital Ventures in 2022 and is a Principal on the Ventures team in New York. Prior roles include Associate Consultant at Bain & Company and an investment‑banking summer analyst role at Citi. Graduated summa cum laude from Dartmouth College with a BA in economics and English.
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth‑stage application software and fintech (United States & Europe)

enrichment.personal_bio: Angel investor and VentureSouth member based in Cary, North Carolina. Active in Southeast early-stage investing (reported check sizes ~$5K–$20K) and a participant in local angel programs including the Triangle Tweener Fund. Professional background in project/program management within medical device and healthcare operations. Holds an MBA and certifications including PMP and Six Sigma Green Belt.
enrichment.career_background: Senior project/program manager with experience in medical device and regulated healthcare operations (listed as Senior Project Manager at Teleflex). Active angel investor and VentureSouth member since 2021; involved with regional angel initiatives such as Triangle Tweener Fund. Education includes an MBA (Wake Forest University) and executive coursework at MIT Sloan (as listed on professional profiles).

enrichment.personal_bio: Senior Associate at Kapor Capital (joined full-time in 2021 after a 2019 summer associate role). He has a background in financial services and a stated interest in fintech and consumer health/digital health. Adam holds a B.A. in Economics from Yale and an MBA from MIT Sloan.
enrichment.career_background: Worked as an investment-grade corporate bond trader in Jefferies’ Fixed Income division in New York, then at a NYC startup accelerator, and served as finance manager at fintech startup Pando. Joined Kapor Capital as a Summer Associate in 2019 and became a full-time member of the investment team in 2021. Education: B.A. Economics, Yale University; MBA, MIT Sloan School of Management.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture investor with experience as a venture analyst at Plug & Play and later as an associate at Five Four Ventures. Educated in Materials Science & Engineering at Cornell University with a background in hardware engineering and systems design. Focuses on early-stage (pre-seed/seed) opportunities in IoT, consumer internet and enterprise software.
enrichment.career_background: Worked as Venture Analyst at Plug and Play Tech Center (listed 2019–2021) and as an Associate at Five Four Ventures (listed from 2021). Earlier roles include Head of Hardware at Spect Technologies and internships/early roles at Laconia Capital Group, Mucker Capital and Entrepreneurs Roundtable; B.S. in Materials Science & Engineering from Cornell University.

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal on the Salesforce Ventures Impact Fund, focused on enterprise software with an impact lens across climate tech, edtech, workforce development, financial inclusion, and digital health. Previously worked in impact investing at Amplify Capital and MaRS and began her career in public policy. Holds a BA from McGill University and an MBA from Yale School of Management. Based in San Francisco, CA.
enrichment.career_background: Started in policy and communications (including roles at a think tank, the US Senate and President Obama’s campaign), moved into impact investing at MaRS and Amplify Capital, and joined Salesforce Ventures in 2019 to help stand up its Impact Fund; promoted to Principal/Director of the Impact Fund in 2021. Regularly authors Salesforce Ventures perspectives on portfolio and impact topics.
enrichment.investment_focus: Impact-focused enterprise software: climate tech, edtech and workforce development, financial inclusion, digital health; invests across stages from seed to growth.

enrichment.personal_bio: Adrianna Ma is Operating Partner at Index Ventures, responsible for firm operations and facilitating the investment and fundraising process. She previously served as a managing director at General Atlantic, managing partner at Fremont Group, and began her career in tech M&A at Morgan Stanley. Adrianna holds degrees (B.S., M.Eng.) from MIT and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Adrianna has 20+ years in finance and investing: early career as a tech M&A banker at Morgan Stanley, a decade as an investor at General Atlantic (leading growth-stage technology investments), later managing partner roles at Fremont Group and Haleakala Holdings, and joining Index Ventures in 2020/2021 as COO/Operating Partner. She also serves on several institutional and nonprofit boards (e.g., MIT Investment Management Company, Council on Foreign Relations).
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth-stage technology and growth equity (Series A–B), enterprise software/SaaS, later-stage investments and board/service roles, with emphasis on fundraising and capital partnering.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Relay Ventures based in Toronto. Oversees early-stage investments in mobile software, payments and connected-device companies. Previously a management consultant at BearingPoint and PwC; graduate of the Schulich School of Business (York University) and a Kauffman Fellow.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Relay Ventures in 2008 and was promoted to partner; sources and oversees direct investments and board/observer roles across the firm’s portfolio. Prior to Relay, worked in management consulting (BearingPoint, PwC) on retail banking, payments and loyalty programs. Educated at York University (Schulich) and is a Kauffman Fellow.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage investments in mobile software, fintech, urbantech/proptech and sportstech

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal at JAZZ Venture Partners based in San Francisco. Former member of the Emerson Collective Health team with an academic background in neuroscience (Brown University) and clinical informatics (Stanford MCiM). Works at the intersection of biotech, digital health, and human performance.
enrichment.career_background: Amanda Way studied neuroscience at Brown University and completed Stanford Medicine’s Master of Clinical Informatics Management (MCiM). She previously worked on health investing at Emerson Collective and joined JAZZ Venture Partners as a Principal focusing on healthcare, biotech, and human-performance companies. She has also been involved with early-stage health and digital therapeutics companies and public-facing health initiatives.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at Tau Ventures, a seed fund focused on applied AI. Formerly a principal at Samsung NEXT and an investor at Norwest; co‑founder of HealthIQ. Holds a BS and MS from Stanford and an MBA from Harvard.
enrichment.career_background: Amit Garg co‑founded Tau Ventures (seed fund) in 2019 and is Managing Partner. Prior roles include Principal at Samsung NEXT (seed investments including nuTonomy), investor at Norwest, co‑founder of HealthIQ, and product/analytics roles at Google. Academic credentials include a BS and MS from Stanford and an MBA from Harvard.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and CEO of Whisper (Whisper.ai), which builds AI-powered hearing systems. Former Head of Product for Messenger Core at Facebook. Serves in Sequoia Capital’s Scout program for early-stage deals.
enrichment.career_background: Andrew Song studied mathematics and computer science (University of Waterloo). He led Messenger Core product at Facebook (Head of Product), co‑founded Whisper in 2017 and serves as its CEO, and has participated in Sequoia Capital’s Scout program since 2018.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage investments in AI/ML, digital health/medical devices, consumer hardware and product‑led consumer software

enrichment.personal_bio: Seasoned technology executive and board director. Founder & CEO of BusinessExcelleration and a limited partner/advisor (partner-level affiliation) with Tandem Capital. Serves on public and private boards including Ribbon Communications, Liquidity Services, and PriceSmart.
enrichment.career_background: Beatriz V. Infante is a four-time CEO and longtime Silicon Valley operator (former SVP at Oracle). She led Aspect Communications and later served as CEO of VoiceObjects, ENXSuite and Sychron. Since 2009 she has run BusinessExcelleration (strategy consultancy) and has held board and advisor roles across public and private tech companies; she has been a limited partner/advisor to Tandem Capital.
