enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Greatscale Ventures and former senior product leader. Held executive product/technology roles at Microsoft (Microsoft Teams), VMware, and Expedia. Advises early-stage companies, with a focus on SaaS, travel/lodging, messaging and creator-economy products.
enrichment.career_background: Bill Bliss is a longtime product and platform executive who moved into venture investing. His corporate roles include SVP/Product at Expedia, VP Product at VMware, and founding/platform architect roles on Microsoft Teams. Since 2020 he has served as a Venture Partner at Greatscale Ventures, working with the firm’s early-stage portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed / Series A) — SaaS, travel & lodging, messaging & media/content, creator-economy/digital coaching. Typical check sizes noted at ~$100K–$5M (target ~$1.5M).

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at the Berkeley SkyDeck Fund and former startup operator. Co-founded and served as CEO of Eucl3D (a 3D‑printing startup) and is a UC Berkeley alumnus. Focuses on sourcing and supporting early‑stage, university‑linked founders across hardware, biotech, AI, and enterprise software.
enrichment.career_background: Startup operator turned venture investor. Co‑founded Eucl3D and held operator roles at multiple early companies before joining Berkeley SkyDeck Fund as a partner/principal. At SkyDeck he leads sourcing and portfolio work for accelerator companies and follow‑on rounds; holds a BA from UC Berkeley.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed/accelerator) investments in hardware, deep tech, biotech & digital health, AI/ML, and enterprise software; focus on university founders and academic spinouts.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at 50 Partners and former PayPal executive. Held senior PayPal roles including General Manager France and VP, Global Merchant Go‑to‑Market. Co‑founder of AddicTrip and has served on boards such as Artefact.
enrichment.career_background: Engineering graduate from École Centrale Paris who worked at Bain & Company, co‑founded travel site AddicTrip, joined PayPal in 2010 and held a series of senior product, commercial and regional leadership roles (including GM France and VP Global Merchant Go‑to‑Market). Later became a partner at 50 Partners and has held board/advisory roles (e.g., Artefact, Attestation Légale).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed–Series A) FinTech and payments, travel and consumer/e‑commerce; GTM and partnerships-focused investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Chris Kim is co‑founder and managing partner at Union Labs, a DeepTech seed fund. He was previously CTO and head of product at August Home (acquired by Assa Abloy) and has managed cybersecurity and consumer e‑commerce products at companies including eBay and Bank of America. He holds a BA in Physics from Williams College and began his career in management consulting.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and managing partner at Union Labs (founded 2018), investing in and building early‑stage DeepTech companies. Prior roles include CTO and head of product at August Home (smart locks/video; acquired by Assa Abloy), product and security work at eBay and Bank of America, and early consulting at Monitor Group. Educated at Williams College (BA, Physics).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage DeepTech: Industrial & Consumer IoT, AI/ML, Cybersecurity, Robotics/Autonomy, Climate Tech, Manufacturing

enrichment.personal_bio: Healthcare investor who worked as Senior Associate on OCA Ventures’ digital health team (focused on diagnostics and medical devices). Prior roles include strategic finance at Genentech and management consulting at Accenture. In 2023 she joined Laerdal Million Lives Fund as a Principal focused on life‑saving health technologies.
enrichment.career_background: Dana began her career in management consulting at Accenture, worked in growth/incubation roles and strategic finance (Genentech), and entered VC via Towerview/Venture Fellow roles. She was a Venture Capital Associate and later Senior Associate for OCA Ventures (healthcare/digital health deal team, 2019–2023) and joined Laerdal Million Lives Fund as Principal in 2023. She holds a BSE in Biomedical Engineering from Duke University and an MBA from University of Chicago Booth School of Business.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed through Series B; sectors: digital health, diagnostics, medical devices/medtech, health‑tech and tech‑enabled healthcare services (primarily US & Canada).

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at UP.Partners and an engineering leader with a history of senior technical roles in mobility and aerospace. Previously held leadership/CTO roles at Volansi and senior engineering positions at Airbus, Amazon (Prime Air) and others; co‑founder/CTO of Gallatin AI (logistics software). Educated at the University of Zurich.
enrichment.career_background: Swiss‑trained engineer (University of Zurich) who helped build Amazon Prime Air and later led technical teams at Flatiron/Volansi/Airbus and other mobility companies. Transitioned into venture as a Venture Partner at UP.Partners (joining the firm’s venture partner network in 2021) while co-founding Gallatin AI and advising mobility startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed to Series A) investments enabling multi-dimensional mobility (air, ground, sea, space) — drones, eVTOL/aircraft, autonomy, logistics, hardware+software deeptech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur, investor, and startup ecosystem builder. Co-founder & CEO of OpenFor.Co and co-founder/leader at Co-Capital.co; Managing Director for Founder Institute in Japan/Korea/Taiwan. Focuses on pre-seed/seed investing, partnership-led go-to-market, and cross-border startup scaling.
enrichment.career_background: 12+ years building startups, accelerators, and investor networks across the U.S., Europe and East Asia. Co-founded and leads OpenFor.Co (partnership accelerator), helped operate Founder Institute chapters in Japan/Korea/Taiwan as Managing Director, and runs Co-Capital.co to back earliest-stage, traction-validated startups. Advises governments, corporations and founders on GTM, partnerships, and fundraising.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage startups (SaaS, enterprise, deep tech); partnership-led GTM and traction-first investing; emerging markets to Silicon Valley cross-border deals.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Innogen Capital. Co‑founder/leader of Seed Community and SNBX; serves on boards including Seed Communities and Patronato Grupo FUSAL. Bachelor’s degree in Business/Managerial Economics – Entrepreneurship from Bentley University.
enrichment.career_background: Fernando Morán is a managing partner at Innogen Capital and a co‑founder of Seed Community and SNBX. He has experience in community management, entrepreneurship education (including teaching roles), business development, and angel investing, and serves on several non‑profit and startup boards. He holds a bachelor’s degree from Bentley University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early‑stage technology startups across Latin America (Central America, Mexico, Andean and Southern Cone). Sector focus includes fintech, healthtech, AI/data, proptech, logistics and marketplaces, with emphasis on proven business models and social impact.

enrichment.personal_bio: Ian Taylor is a venture investor who served as an Investment Partner at Pear VC (2019–2022) and joined Sequoia Capital’s ecosystem/platform team in 2022. He holds graduate degrees from Stanford GSB and Durham University and has a background in strategy and commercial due diligence. His work focuses on supporting early-stage founders and founder ecosystems.
enrichment.career_background: Ian began in commercial due diligence at OC&C (2014–2016), worked in strategy at British Patient Capital (2016–2018), joined Pear VC as an Investment Partner (2019–2022), and moved to Sequoia Capital in 2022 in an ecosystem/platform role. He completed graduate studies at Stanford GSB and holds engineering degrees from UC Berkeley and Durham University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage investments; early-stage founder support (consumer internet and enterprise/SaaS).

enrichment.personal_bio: Former founding partner at Flight Deck Capital and previously a principal at New Enterprise Associates (NEA). Focused on fintech and enterprise software investing; has worked on both private growth and public equity strategies. Holds a bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering from Stanford University.
enrichment.career_background: Began in engineering and product roles, worked as a business analyst at McKinsey, served as a principal on NEA’s technology/fintech practice, and was a founding partner at Flight Deck Capital where he led fintech and software investing; later joined Khosla Ventures (public reports).
enrichment.investment_focus: Fintech, enterprise software (SaaS), payments and marketplaces; late-stage / growth and hybrid public/private TMT investing.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investment Partner / General Partner at Chapter One Ventures focused on early-stage companies. Former tech lead for platform manipulation at Twitter with a background in data science and professional sports betting. Based in London and active in writing about AI and venture topics.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Chapter One's investing team and serves as an Investment/General Partner. Previously the technical lead for Twitter's platform-manipulation team (fake account detection, coordinated online harm, investigations) and earlier worked as a professional sports bettor on a team led by Haralabos Voulgaris. Holds undergraduate degrees from Boston College.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / seed-stage investments in AI/ML, data & infrastructure, developer tools, SaaS, fintech, blockchain; emphasis on platform integrity and product-driven founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and startup operator based in the Salt Lake City area. Director of Strategic Partnerships at Forecastr and founder of Founders N' Funders and The Startup Stack. Active angel investor and listed as an investor associated with Convoi Ventures and other early-stage companies. Regularly advises and mentors founders on fundraising and go-to-market.
enrichment.career_background: Jeff Erickson is a founder, advisor and angel investor who leads Strategic Partnerships at Forecastr. He founded Founders N' Funders and The Startup Stack, has served as an advisor to multiple startups, and previously built and exited consumer businesses (including a consumer goods company that scaled rapidly and appeared on the Inc. 500 list). He is active in the Utah startup ecosystem.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / Utah-focused startups; consumer tech, fintech, SaaS

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at Amasia, a thesis-driven VC focused on climate and sustainability via behaviour change. Former trader/investor at Goldman Sachs, Mercuria and Korean National Investments; earlier entrepreneur and touring musician. Kauffman Fellow and advisory board member for organisations including the Choson Exchange and the Institute for Carbon Management (UCLA).
enrichment.career_background: Started as a founder of music, internet and e‑consulting businesses, then worked in trading and portfolio roles at Merck (systems), Korean National Investments, Goldman Sachs and Mercuria. Co‑founded Amasia in 2013 and has led/co‑led investments and board roles in multiple startups; active in nonprofit advisory and fellowship networks (Kauffman Fellows, YPO).
enrichment.investment_focus: Software‑enabled companies focused on climate & sustainability (behaviour‑change thesis); typical stages: Seed to Series B; business models: enterprise SaaS, consumer subscription, marketplaces; cross‑border/global expansion.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner at rali_cap (RaliCap), an early-stage fintech fund focused on emerging markets. Operates as a product and go-to-market operator; also serves in senior product strategy roles at SAP SuccessFactors. Active investor in B2B/API-first fintech, Web3, and travel-tech deals.
enrichment.career_background: Product-marketing and GTM background with senior roles at Juvo and Boku; co‑founded Rally Cap (now rali_cap) to invest in emerging-market fintech; later moved into product strategy leadership at SAP SuccessFactors while remaining a partner at the firm.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) B2B and API-first fintech in emerging markets (Africa, Latin America, South/Southeast Asia); select climate-tech and travel-tech investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal at Flybridge based in New York. Focuses on software for foundational industries (climate, real estate, construction, supply chain) and SMB tooling; also a GP at The MBA Fund and founder of Deco Ventures. Holds an MBA from Wharton and a BA from Vassar College.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Flybridge part-time while completing an MBA at Wharton and later became a full-time investment principal. Prior roles include Director of Business Development at WeWork, investment roles at Underscore VC and Plum Alley Investments. Serves as a General Partner at The MBA Fund and founded Deco Ventures; educated at Vassar College (BA) and The Wharton School (MBA).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed/Series A) software and AI investments — vertical/SMB SaaS, proptech & construction, climate & supply chain software, creator economy/web3

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner and General Partner of Pioneer Bio+Health Fund, investing in early-stage biotechnology, medtech, life sciences and healthcare. Previously co‑founded Voyage Biomedical (YC S19), a medtech startup acquired by Penumbra. Trained as a mechanical engineer and bioengineer (Clemson; UC Berkeley/UCSF).
enrichment.career_background: Leads the Pioneer Bio+Health Fund at Pioneer Fund, focusing on seed/early-stage bio & health investments. Prior roles include co‑founder and CTO of Voyage Biomedical (YC S19, acquired by Penumbra), engineering lead at Cradle Healthcare Company, and entrepreneur-in-residence/mentor in university startup programs. Educational background in mechanical engineering and bioengineering (Clemson; UC Berkeley/UCSF).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage biotechnology, life sciences, medtech and healthcare (seed/YC-focused investments)

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and founder based in New York. Previously an investor/analyst at Primary Venture Partners (2021–2022) with a focus on climate technology and enterprise software; later served as Entrepreneur-in-Residence at the Energy for Growth Hub and founded startup projects. Schwarzman Scholar (Tsinghua University), BA from Williams College, and listed as a member of Harvard Business School’s Class of 2025.
interests: Economic development & alternative financing for developing countries
Small island developing states (SIDS) / Caribbean focus
enrichment.career_background: Worked in early-stage investing at Primary Venture Partners (investor/analyst, 2021–2022). Prior roles include finance/financial-rotational analyst at Microsoft (supporting corporate carbon tax and carbon-offset portfolio) and Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence at the Energy for Growth Hub; has founded startups and fellowship projects. Education includes an MS in Global Affairs (Schwarzman Scholar, Tsinghua) and a BA in Economics (Williams College); reported as an MBA student at Harvard Business School (Class of 2025).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed to early-stage (Seed–Series A); climate technology, enterprise software (B2B SaaS), Web3/blockchain, and ventures focused on developing-country finance and SIDS

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor who served at Salesforce Ventures (listed 2021–2024) and is based in San Francisco. Currently an MBA candidate at Harvard Business School (started 2024). Background in investment banking (Stifel, J.P. Morgan) and enterprise software investing, with work on blockchain/Web3 deals such as Blockdaemon.
enrichment.career_background: Worked as an Investor at Salesforce Ventures (2021–2024). Prior roles include investment banking analyst positions at Stifel and J.P. Morgan. Education includes a BS from NYU Stern and an MBA candidacy at Harvard Business School beginning in 2024.
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise software (SaaS), data & infrastructure, FinTech, Web3/blockchain; stages: Seed through Series A (typical sweet spot ~$5M).

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at 11 Tribes Ventures who joined as the firm’s first hire and leads sourcing and diligence. Known for a founder-first approach that allocates resources to founder wellbeing. Graduated from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill as a Morehead‑Cain Scholar and has been recognized on Forbes 30 Under 30 in Venture Capital.
interests: Early-stage, post-revenue investing (seed / early Series A)
enrichment.career_background: Chapple joined 11 Tribes as employee #1 and helped grow the firm through Fund I deployment and Fund II fundraising. She serves as the firm’s “front door,” leading sourcing, diligence, and post-investment founder support; has led Fund II investments including Alloy, Legal Karma, GoNanas, NuTrād, LeaseUp, and Circadian Risk.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage venture (seed to early Series A) in post-revenue, capital-efficient founders; purpose-driven founders and companies in non-traditional VC geographies with emphasis on founder resilience and organizational health.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor at Trammell Venture Partners (TVP) based in Austin, Texas, focused on Bitcoin-native startups and technical diligence. Previously worked in investment roles at Greenspring Associates and MassVentures and publishes writing on VC and crypto topics. Active in angel investing and TVP’s seed/early-stage deal activity.
enrichment.career_background: Matt began in venture as an investment analyst at Greenspring Associates, later worked as an investment analyst at MassVentures and served as a board observer with Baltimore Angels. He joined TVP as a senior analyst and has held roles including Investment Operations Lead, participating in TVP’s seed- and early-stage investments in Bitcoin, applied AI, and security.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage startups focused on Bitcoin-native technologies (Bitcoin protocol stack & Lightning), applied AI, and security/privacy technologies

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder & CEO of Gen Z VCs, a global community for Gen Z investors, founders, and operators. Previously worked in growth equity and early-stage VC (General Atlantic and Lerer Hippeau) and was named to Forbes 30 Under 30. Focuses on Gen Z consumer and technology trends, community building, and mentorship.
enrichment.career_background: Meagan Loyst founded Gen Z VCs in 2020 and now runs the community full-time. She began her investing career at General Atlantic (growth equity) and later joined Lerer Hippeau as the youngest associate; she left to scale Gen Z VCs and pursue advisory, speaking, and consulting work. Education includes a bachelor’s from Boston College and study at Saïd Business School, University of Oxford (MBA program).
enrichment.hometown: Long Island, New York, United States
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed) technology and consumer startups, especially companies and founders building for Gen Z and creator-led / community-driven businesses.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Griffin Gaming Partners and co-founder/chair of Howso (formerly Diveplane). Former president of Epic Games (2002–2012) and founder of Scion Studios. Holds a Ph.D. in computer science and works on explainable/responsible AI and gaming-related ventures.
enrichment.career_background: Mike Capps is a long-time games industry executive and entrepreneur who led Epic Games as president, founded Scion Studios (acquired by Epic), and later co-founded Diveplane (rebranded Howso) to build explainable AI. He holds advanced degrees (including a Ph.D.) in computer science, has served on multiple corporate boards, and currently advises and invests in gaming and AI startups through Griffin Gaming Partners.
enrichment.investment_focus: Gaming (studios, content, platforms, infrastructure), early-to-growth stage venture investing; explainable and ethical AI

enrichment.personal_bio: Mike Swift (often styled “Swift”) is co‑founder and CEO of Major League Hacking (MLH) and an investment partner at The Community Fund. He focuses on building developer and education communities and was named to Forbes 30 Under 30 (Education).
enrichment.career_background: Swift co‑founded Hacker League (acquired) and later co‑founded Major League Hacking, where he serves as CEO. He previously worked as a developer evangelist at SendGrid and has served as an investment partner at The Community Fund, focusing on early‑stage, community‑centric companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) community‑driven companies, especially those centered on developers, education/work and community‑first business models.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Magma Partners based in West Palm Beach, FL. Former Executive Director at Goldman Sachs and Managing Director (Head of Latin America) at Valkyrie, with partner/advisor roles at Duxx Investimentos and EBRD. Three-time technology entrepreneur and angel investor with involvement in fintech and insurtech.
enrichment.career_background: Currently a Venture Partner at Magma Partners. Prior roles include Executive Director (Goldman Sachs), Managing Director/Head of Latin America (Valkyrie), Partner (Duxx Investimentos), Senior Advisor (EBRD), Partner (InsurTech Venture Partners) and Chief Investment Officer at FinTech Portfolio. Also a serial technology entrepreneur and angel investor.
enrichment.investment_focus: FinTech, InsurTech, marketplaces and early-stage Latin America-focused startups

enrichment.personal_bio: Natalya Bailey is a deep‑tech founder and investor who co‑founded Accion Systems (in‑space electric propulsion) and holds a Ph.D. from MIT. She serves as an Investment Partner at XFactor Ventures and invests in hardware, hard‑science and AI startups, with a focus on women‑led teams. She is also a cofounder of Squawk AI and mentors aerospace and deep‑tech founders.
enrichment.career_background: Dr. Bailey co‑founded Accion Systems (ion/electrospray propulsion) and served in executive and technical leadership roles there; she completed a Ph.D. in aeronautics/astronautics at MIT and holds an M.S. from Duke and a B.S. in aerospace engineering. She has worked in strategy and fractional executive roles (including work with Bloom Energy and Curated Innovation), sits on industry and nonprofit boards, mentors aerospace fellows, and is an investment partner at XFactor Ventures focusing on early‑stage deep‑tech investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed / Seed; deep tech and hardware (space/propulsion); hard science and engineering; AI/GenAI; women‑founded startups

enrichment.personal_bio: Paul Condolora is a Los Angeles–based media executive and operator who has worked across franchise development, digital media and the creator economy. He was COO of Next 10 Ventures (a creator-focused venture group) and later served as COO at ProGuides; he is the founder of consulting firm Electric Lunch. His background includes senior digital roles at Turner/Cartoon Network and Warner Bros. (co‑head, Harry Potter global franchise development).
enrichment.career_background: Condolora has 20+ years in media and digital product leadership. He held senior digital and consumer-product roles at Turner Broadcasting (Cartoon Network/adult swim) and Warner Bros. (co‑head, Harry Potter global franchise development), was COO of Next 10 Ventures (2018–2020) where he helped build operations and participated on the investment committee, served as COO of esports platform ProGuides (2021), and founded Electric Lunch, a consultancy for media startups and creators.
previous_investments: Fan Controlled Football (Fan Controlled Sports & Entertainment)
enrichment.investment_focus: Creator economy; video content & IP; e‑commerce and creator commerce products; community/platform products and services; seed / early‑stage investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Partner Emeritus at Spark Capital; longtime finance and operations executive who oversees the firm’s finance, limited partner relations and human resources. Former CFO of Charles River Ventures and a Certified Public Accountant with a BBA from UMass Amherst. Born and raised in Massachusetts.
enrichment.career_background: Paul Conway began his career in public accounting, served as Chief Financial Officer at Charles River Ventures for over a decade, and co‑founded Spark Capital in 2005. At Spark he has managed day‑to‑day operations including finance, LP relations and HR; he holds a BBA from UMass Amherst and is a CPA.

enrichment.personal_bio: Student at Indiana University Bloomington and Venture Scout at LvlUp Ventures. Active in early-stage scouting with sector interests in Education, MarTech, Web3/Crypto and FinTech. President of INgineering at IU and founder of ConTracker; publishes a Substack on venture and tech topics.
enrichment.career_background: Venture Scout at LvlUp Ventures (since 2022). President of INgineering at Indiana University (since 2023). Founder of ConTracker (2020–2021) and contributor to campus VC and engineering programs; has held software engineering and product-management fellow roles and maintains an active GitHub and personal portfolio.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed to Series A); sector focus includes Education, MarketingTech, Web3/Crypto and FinTech; scout-driven deal sourcing and evaluation.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at E2MC Ventures and a serial entrepreneur in the satellite and space sector. Co‑founder/CEO of Almagest Space and former senior executive at Loral Skynet; has founded or led companies including Protostar, HeliosWire and Ramaspace.
interests: Space technology and the space economy
enrichment.career_background: Raghu Das is a long‑time satellite and space industry executive and entrepreneur. He co‑founded Protostar (owner/operator of GEO satellites), helped build HeliosWire/Sirion Global (acquired by EchoStar), led roles at Loral Skynet, and has served as director/advisor for multiple space firms; he joined E2MC as a partner and is co‑founder/CEO of Almagest Space.
enrichment.investment_focus: Space technology (satcom, in‑orbit systems, data/ground networks); seed and early‑stage venture investing; accelerator/market entry support

enrichment.personal_bio: Operator-turned-investor; associate at Rebel Fund (listed 2020–2024) working with YC-focused seed deals and founder of MoxieGTM (GTM software/services). Background in go-to-market, enterprise sales and early-stage startups.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in GTM and enterprise sales roles at startups (Hustle, CrowdAI) and founding teams (Ocurate); served as Associate at Rebel Fund (seed investing, 2020–2024) and later founded MoxieGTM. Holds a bachelor’s degree from the University of North Carolina at Charlotte (profile listings).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage startups; focus areas include Web3/Blockchain & Crypto, Travel & Lodging, Gaming/eSports, and SaaS / GTM-stage companies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Director of Touchdown Ventures (now part of Cerity Partners Ventures). Experienced in corporate venture capital and corporate innovation; previously Principal at Comcast Ventures and held roles at Comcast Interactive Media, Sony Pictures and Lehman Brothers. Holds an MBA from Wharton and a BA from UC Santa Barbara; based in San Francisco.
interests: AI / machine learning and emerging technologies
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Touchdown Ventures in 2014 to provide “venture capital as a service” for corporations and has led the firm’s San Francisco practice. Prior experience includes seven years at Comcast Ventures (principal/strategy), business development roles at Comcast Interactive Media and Sony Pictures, and early career investment banking at Lehman Brothers. Serves on industry/nonprofit boards and speaks on CVC and corporate innovation.
enrichment.investment_focus: Corporate venture capital (VCaaS) — partners with corporations to establish and manage CVC programs; sector focus includes SaaS/enterprise software, AI/ML, consumer products/CPG, healthtech, IoT and cybersecurity.

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal at Lewis & Clark Ventures with over a decade of technology investing experience. Previously a Principal at Moderne Ventures and a founding member of Assurant Ventures; began his career at Bain & Company. Holds an MBA from Wharton and a B.S. in Electrical Engineering from Georgia Tech. Lives in Atlanta.
enrichment.career_background: Rohan began his career as a consultant at Bain & Company, joined Assurant as a founding member of Assurant Ventures (focusing on proptech, fintech and autotech) and later served as a Principal at Moderne Ventures. He joined Lewis & Clark Ventures as Principal in June 2023 and works on late-seed to Series A B2B software investments. He holds an MBA from Wharton and a BS in Electrical Engineering from Georgia Tech.
enrichment.investment_focus: Late seed through Series A B2B software; typical initial checks ~$2M–$3M; focus on founders and companies outside traditional coastal venture centers.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investment Partner at Western Technology Investment since 2011. Former entrepreneur and operator — founder/CEO of scanR and co‑founder of Flint Mobile — with prior corporate development roles at Internet Pictures (iPIX) and business/finance roles at Intel. Holds a BS in Finance and Economics from San Jose State University.
interests: Corporate development, M&A and venture finance
enrichment.career_background: Joined WTI in 2011 as an Investment Partner. Prior to WTI he founded and led startups (including scanR as CEO and Flint Mobile as co‑founder), served as VP of Business Development at iMediation, SVP of Corporate Development at Internet Pictures (iPIX), and held venture, finance and strategic planning roles at Intel. Educated at San Jose State University (BS, Finance & Economics).
enrichment.investment_focus: Venture debt and growth capital for revenue-generating technology and life sciences companies; flexible debt and equity structures for early-to-growth stage companies. Typical investment sizes typically range from $250,000 to over $25 million.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Stage 2 Capital focused on infrastructure software and developer-facing platforms. Previously a vice president at Bessemer Venture Partners where he worked on developer platforms, data infrastructure and ML tooling. Holds dual bachelor’s degrees and a master’s in Materials Science & Engineering and a B.S. in Economics from the University of Pennsylvania.
enrichment.career_background: Started in engineering and technical roles before moving into tech investment banking at Morgan Stanley and product management at Viagogo. Joined Bessemer Venture Partners in 2015 and was promoted to vice president (profiled by Bessemer in 2021); in September 2023 he joined Stage 2 Capital as a partner. Educated at the University of Pennsylvania (summa cum laude; MS and BS in Materials Science & Engineering; BS in Economics/Wharton).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage B2B software with emphasis on infrastructure software, developer platforms, data/ML infrastructure and developer tools (Seed–Series A)

enrichment.personal_bio: Operator-turned-investor focused on consumer product and marketplace startups. Cofounded Bib + Tuck (fashion marketplace), served in strategy roles at Rokk3r Labs and has acted as an investor/advisor/partner at Level Ventures. Founder of Sublime/Startupy and an active angel investor and writer on product, design and founder-focused topics.
enrichment.career_background: Studied at Brown University (BA); began career in consumer/retail investment banking (Barclays), then cofounded Bib + Tuck (sold in 2015). Later served as Head of Strategy at Rokk3r Labs, has been an investor/advisor/partner at Level Ventures, and more recently founded Sublime/Startupy while continuing angel investing and writing.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed — Series A) consumer and marketplace startups; e-commerce/DTC, marketplaces and re-commerce, proptech, insurtech, wellness/family tech, and founder-led consumer products

enrichment.personal_bio: Shekar Ayyar is CEO of Arrcus and a venture partner at NTT Venture Capital. He previously served as EVP and GM for VMware's Telco & Edge Cloud business and led strategy and corporate development at VMware. He sits on the board of Altair and has advised/served on boards including Cohere, Puppet and MobiledgeX.
enrichment.career_background: Experienced technology executive and operator: former EVP & GM (Telco & Edge Cloud) and EVP of Strategy & Corp. Dev. at VMware; CEO of Arrcus; venture partner at NTTVC; board member/advisor to enterprise and infrastructure companies. Holds a Ph.D. in electrical engineering (Johns Hopkins) and an MBA (Wharton).
enrichment.investment_focus: Cloud & networking infrastructure, telco/edge (5G), enterprise software; typically early to growth-stage (seed to Series B) with advisory/M&A support

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Interlace Ventures and Chief Strategy Officer at Avise. Previously VP Finance & Strategy at ShopShops and an associate at Oliver Wyman. Experienced in finance, operations and building social/video commerce and commerce-infrastructure products.
enrichment.career_background: Graduated from The Wharton School (Huntsman Program). Began her career in operations and consulting, including roles at Warby Parker and Oliver Wyman, then moved into operator roles in commerce technology (ShopShops) and fintech (Avise) before joining Interlace Ventures as a venture partner to advise and source early-stage commerce investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) commerce and retail technology: e-commerce platforms, marketplaces, commerce infrastructure, retail SaaS, and consumer-facing commerce experiences.

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal at Sageview Capital based in Palo Alto; joined the firm in 2017 and works on growth-stage investments. Previously an Associate at Pine Brook Partners and an investment banking analyst at J.P. Morgan. Holds a B.S. in Finance from Arizona State University and lives in Menlo Park, CA.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Sageview Capital in 2017 and serves as a Principal in the Palo Alto office. Prior experience includes growth-stage investing at Pine Brook Partners and earlier work as an investment banking analyst at J.P. Morgan. Graduated summa cum laude with a B.S. in Finance from Arizona State University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth equity in software and tech-enabled businesses (SaaS, cloud, fintech, martech, edtech).

enrichment.personal_bio: Timothy Wolf Starr is a partner at LOUD Capital and a managing partner for the Pride Fund, a LOUD joint venture focused on LGBTQ+ founders. He has led regional community-building initiatives in Columbus (founder of Small Business Beanstalk / Connects Columbus) and runs venture programs through Atlas/Venture Atlas. His investing work emphasizes early-stage deals with an impact and inclusion lens.
enrichment.career_background: Starr founded Small Business Beanstalk (later rebranded to Connects Columbus), has led community and venture programs through Atlas/Venture Atlas, and serves as a partner at LOUD Capital. He is a managing partner of the Pride Fund (a LOUD-linked fund focused on LGBTQ+ founders) and has advised/served on boards and angel groups in the Columbus ecosystem.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage venture (seed–Series A); healthcare / digital health; lodging/hospitality and mobility; impact-focused funds (LGBTQ+ founders, DEI)

enrichment.personal_bio: Tim Singer was a Principal on the Corporate Venture Capital team at National Grid Partners, where he supported sourcing, diligence and deal execution across the firm’s energy and climate-tech portfolio. He worked on investments spanning AI for utilities, asset-monitoring and OT security and previously held roles at the California Energy Commission, Rocky Mountain Institute and served in the U.S. Peace Corps. He holds a Master of Environmental Management (Duke), an MBA (UNC Kenan‑Flagler) and a BS in Aquatic Biology (UC Santa Barbara).
enrichment.career_background: Singer began his career in environmental and energy roles (including the U.S. Peace Corps and the California Energy Commission), worked at Rocky Mountain Institute’s Business Renewables Center, completed concurrent MEM and MBA degrees, then joined National Grid Partners (summer MBA intern 2019; senior associate 2020; promoted to principal 2022) to lead corporate-VC investing in grid and climate technologies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Corporate venture investing in technologies for the energy transition: Future Electric Networks, customer-facing energy solutions, efficiency through computing/AI, and decarbonizing gas/networks.

enrichment.personal_bio: Materials scientist and early-stage investor focused on semiconductors, integrated photonics and sustainability. Ph.D. in Physical Chemistry and Materials Science from Harvard (Ph.D. 2022). Served as an Associate on M Ventures' Technology team (joined Feb 2022; left role reported Apr 29, 2025). Based in Boston.
enrichment.career_background: Tobias Egle holds a BSc and MSc in Chemical Engineering from Karlsruhe Institute of Technology and a Ph.D. from Harvard University in Physical Chemistry and Materials Science. He was a venture fellow at Yard Ventures before joining the Technology team at M Ventures in February 2022, where he focused on semiconductor and integrated-photonics investments and served as board observer/member for portfolio companies; reports indicate he left M Ventures in April 2025. He is based in Boston.
enrichment.investment_focus: Technology investments (M Ventures technology team): semiconductors, integrated photonics, data-center infrastructure, advanced materials and sustainability.

enrichment.personal_bio: Tomas Barreto is an engineering leader and angel investor who served as a scout for Sequoia Capital. He co‑founded Okay (CTO), which was acquired by Stripe, and previously served as VP of engineering at Box and Checkr. He advises and has invested in early‑stage developer tools, fintech, and health startups.
enrichment.career_background: Tomas spent over a decade at Box in multiple engineering leadership roles, later served as VP of Product & Engineering at Checkr, co‑founded Okay (acquired by Stripe in 2023) and served as a scout for Sequoia Capital. He has advised 20+ startups (including Loom, Modern Treasury and Oura) and works with early‑stage founding teams on engineering, hiring and operational scaling.
enrichment.investment_focus: Developer tools & engineering productivity; Enterprise SaaS; FinTech infrastructure

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of Hawke Media, Hawke Ventures and Hawke Capital. Operator‑turned‑investor focused on early‑stage commerce enablement, MarTech and AdTech; known for operational leadership, GTM and scaling revenue for portfolio companies.
enrichment.career_background: Tony Delmercado co‑founded Hawke Media (marketing agency) and helped launch Hawke Ventures and Hawke Capital. He previously held operational leadership roles (including COO at Fame Wizard) and founded 1099.me. His work centers on operator‑led investing, GTM execution, and applying agency channels to support portfolio company growth.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage investments in commerce enablement, MarTech, AdTech (seed to Series A; ~$50k–$2M ticket sizes)

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur, educator, and angel investor based in Greater Boston. Founder and executive director of YouthCITIES and a longtime mentor at MIT Venture Mentoring Service. Member of Beacon Angels (since ~2013) and co-founder of the "A Seat at the Table" initiative focused on leadership representation.
enrichment.career_background: Started in telecom and finance roles, then founded and ran a video-game software/middleware company for more than a decade. Later founded YouthCITIES to teach entrepreneurship to youth, has mentored at MIT VMS for many years, and invests informally via angel groups (Beacon Angels, TBD Angels). Holds a Bachelor of Science from the University of Massachusetts Amherst.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed / seed / Series A) tech and life-sciences: education technology, gaming/eSports, SaaS, and medical/health innovation.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner and Chief Financial Officer at Beliade with a background in accounting, tax, finance and operations across private and public markets. Prior roles include Lendlease, Och‑Ziff and Tishman Speyer. Holds a B.S. and MAcc in Accounting from the University of Tennessee. Based between New York and Nashville.
enrichment.career_background: Whitney Williams is Partner & CFO at Beliade (formerly M3 Ventures), joining the firm in a senior finance role and now overseeing financial and operational functions for the investment platform. Before Beliade she was Senior Finance Manager at Lendlease (Nashville), Real Estate Tax Advisor at Och‑Ziff and worked in tax/transaction groups at Tishman Speyer and PwC. She holds a B.S. and MAcc in Accounting from the University of Tennessee.
enrichment.investment_focus: Health-forward consumer brands (CPG, apparel, clean beauty, F&B); first institutional rounds / Seed–Series A; omni-channel DTC and retail expansion.

enrichment.personal_bio: William “whurley” Hurley is a technology entrepreneur and investor based in Austin, Texas. He is founder & CEO of Strangeworks and co‑founder & General Partner at Ecliptic Capital. He previously founded Chaotic Moon and Honest Dollar (each acquired) and served at Goldman Sachs; he is active in quantum computing standards work at IEEE and is a CERN & Society ambassador.
enrichment.career_background: Whurley has over two decades in technology and startups: early R&D roles at Apple and IBM; co‑founder of Symbiot and Chaotic Moon (acquired by Accenture); founder of Honest Dollar (acquired by Goldman Sachs) and later Managing Director at Goldman Sachs; founder & CEO of Strangeworks (quantum computing); and co‑founder/General Partner at Ecliptic Capital. He also serves in IEEE standards roles, is an Eisenhower Fellow and a CERN & Society ambassador.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed–Series A); sectors: quantum computing/deep tech, fintech, enterprise software, cybersecurity, climate/energy & advanced materials, life sciences/medtech

enrichment.personal_bio: Healthcare investor with a background in venture building and healthcare investing. Previously served as Principal at Redesign Health and Vice President at Norwest Venture Partners; co‑founder and partner at Brighton Health Partners. Based in Denver, Colorado.
enrichment.career_background: Zach Gonzales is a healthcare investor focused on building and scaling healthcare companies. He worked in investment banking at Raymond James (HCIT coverage), was Vice President at Norwest Venture Partners (2015–2020), served as Principal at Redesign Health (around 2020–2021) and co‑founded Brighton Health Partners in 2021. He holds a B.A. from the University of Denver and participates in community/philanthropic investing through Social Venture Partners Denver.
enrichment.investment_focus: Healthcare (provider services, managed care, HCIT, behavioral health); early-stage venture and company formation.

enrichment.personal_bio: Former investor at Bow Capital who has worked in venture and strategic finance. Prior roles include TMT investment banking at Lazard and pricing/analytics at Wayfair; later worked in strategic finance at Whatnot. Holds degrees from Harvard (A.B. and S.M.).
enrichment.career_background: ZiZi Zhang studied at Harvard (A.B.; S.M.), worked on pricing and data teams at Wayfair (2016), then in TMT investment banking at Lazard (2017–2020). She joined Bow Capital as an investor (listed on profiles 2020–2022) and subsequently held strategic finance and advisory roles at companies including Whatnot and as an independent advisor.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed–Series B); sectors: Consumer internet/marketplaces, Enterprise software/SaaS, AI/ML, Biotechnology & healthcare, Robotics/automation

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Ulu Ventures focused on seed-stage consumer investing. Former partner at Unshackled Ventures (2015–2022), early team member at FWD.us, and founder/president of LatinxVC. Elected to the Orange County (FL) School Board in 2022; studied at UC Berkeley.
interests: Immigrant & Latinx founders; diversity in VC
enrichment.career_background: Maria began her career in public policy at FWD.us, joined Unshackled Ventures in 2015 where she participated in 65–75+ investments, and in 2022 joined Ulu Ventures as a partner leading Seed Consumer investing. She is founder/president of LatinxVC and serves on the Orange County Public Schools board.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage consumer and technology startups, with emphasis on diverse and immigrant founders

enrichment.personal_bio: Seasoned asset-management executive and entrepreneur. Founder/partner in reinsurance and venture firms; previously Head of Rates Markets for ING Investment Management (Americas). Graduate of Washington University in St. Louis and holds the CFA designation.
enrichment.career_background: Has led trading and asset-management businesses for 25+ years, served as Senior Vice President and Head of Rates Markets at ING Investment Management (Americas), and was a founding partner of Weisshorn Reinsurance (later Somerset Re) and Portage Equity. He founded a water-technology venture firm and is the principal of Sage Asset Management. Education: Washington University in St. Louis; CFA charterholder.
enrichment.investment_focus: Genetic & epigenetic editing; synthetic biology.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor based in Pittsburgh who has served as a Senior Investment Associate at Innovation Works and has experience across financial services and early-stage investing. Previously worked in data & analytics and product roles at MSCI, Broadridge and Mellon. Graduated from Lafayette College and is a CFA charterholder.
enrichment.career_background: Experienced investor and operator with roles investing at Innovation Works (Senior Investment Associate) and product/analytics roles at MSCI, Broadridge and Mellon. Holds a BA in Mathematics & Economics from Lafayette College and is a CFA charterholder; has focused on early-stage seed investments and helping portfolio companies with fundraising and board observation.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / early-stage investments in fintech and financial services, data & analytics and product/SaaS; regional focus in Pittsburgh / Southwestern Pennsylvania; interest in deep tech and healthcare/medical devices.

enrichment.personal_bio: Executive Vice President / Investment Executive at Bolster Ventures and member of its investment committee. Former CEO of MakerBot and COO at Techstars, now advising and mentoring early-stage founders and serving on boards. Focuses on helping CEOs scale through hands-on mentorship and operational leadership.
enrichment.career_background: Jenny Lawton is a longtime operator-turned-investor who built and led companies (co‑founder of Net Daemons; owner of independent bookstores; President/CEO of MakerBot) and later served in senior operating roles at littleBits and Techstars. She founded Old School Venture to advise scaling startups and currently serves as Executive Vice President / Investment Executive at Bolster Ventures, where she participates on the investment committee and mentors CEOs; she has also held board and advisor roles (including Glowforge and Sphero).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed to post‑Series A co‑investments (typical $75K–$125K checks) in Bolster Prime client startups; emphasis on founders who prioritize CEO/team development and mentorship.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing/Founding Partner at Type One Ventures, focused on space and deep‑tech investing. Grew up in a Lebanese family in Latin America and studied International Affairs & Economics at Florida State University. Serves on the boards of Space Forge and Gravitics.
enrichment.career_background: Began his career as a licensed financial advisor at Morgan Stanley, then founded and mentored startups and incubators in Latin America. In 2019 he co‑founded Type One Ventures to back early‑stage companies in space, robotics, AI and longevity; he currently leads investments and sits on multiple portfolio company boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed/Series A) Space, DeepTech, Robotics, AI, in‑space manufacturing and longevity

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial founder turned operator and early-stage investor. Founded Polis/Knoq (acquired Dec 2020) and Fan Rewards/Squads (acquired Oct 2023), serves as a Founder Partner at 186 Ventures, and has participated in angel/pre-seed rounds such as Ability.ai. Also listed as leading creative experimentation at Ramp in public bios.
enrichment.career_background: Kendall Hope Tucker founded Polis (later Knoq) and led it through acquisition in 2020, then co‑founded Fan Rewards (aka Squads), which was acquired in 2023. She joined 186 Ventures as a Founder Partner and has been active as an angel/investor and advisor to consumer startups; public bios also list a product/creative role at Ramp. Tucker holds undergraduate study at Columbia University and has spent time studying at Oxford (visiting).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / Seed stage; consumer internet and creator-economy products; AI & marketing automation; product-led growth startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Page One Ventures based in the San Francisco Bay Area. Founder and former CEO of Skymind and Pathmind, and previously a journalist at The New York Times and Bloomberg. Focuses on early-stage deals in B2B SaaS, data/AI, deep tech and life sciences.
enrichment.career_background: Former journalist (The New York Times, Bloomberg), later head of communications/recruiting at FutureAdvisor. Co‑founded Skymind (YC W16) and later founded Pathmind; held operational roles including at Clipboard Health. Joined Page One Ventures as a Venture Partner in 2022.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed/pre-seed) investments in deep tech, life sciences and B2B software—particularly data/infra and AI.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of Launch House and a general partner / managing partner at Launch House Ventures (House Capital). Founder & CEO of Micro (an email/CRM/productivity startup); previously a product manager at Google and Clearbit. Writes and runs the tech newsletter Homescreen and is an active angel investor at pre‑seed/seed stages.
enrichment.career_background: Brett co‑founded Launch House (a membership community and venture arm House Capital) and serves as a GP / managing partner for its venture activity. He founded and leads Micro (an email/CRM/productivity startup), previously held product roles at Google and Clearbit, and helped create Accenture Ventures. He publishes the Homescreen newsletter and is active as an angel investor focused on pre‑seed and seed deals.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed stage; sectors include Web3/Crypto, B2B SaaS & enterprise, AR/VR, social & messaging, and creator/founder communities.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner at Metagrove Ventures, an early-stage fund linking Silicon Valley and ANZ/SEA. Former operator and engineering/product leader with experience across startups and corporates; hosts The Prompt podcast and founded Argon Labs. Holds dual degrees (BEng Hons; BBus) from University of Technology Sydney.
interests: Early‑stage (pre‑seed / seed) startups scaling between US and ANZ
enrichment.career_background: Barry has worked in engineering, product and growth roles at organisations including CSIRO, BAE Systems, Cochlear, Sensity Systems (acquired by Verizon), Skylo (SoftBank‑backed) and Verizon. He founded Metagrove Ventures (2022) to invest across Australia, New Zealand and the US, and later founded Argon Labs (technical content agency). He also hosts The Prompt podcast and mentors startups (including Techstars).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed to seed investments in industrial and enterprise technology across Australia/New Zealand, Southeast Asia and the US — sectors include industrial/logistics/supply‑chain, construction, digital health and foundational software; technology enablers include AI/ML, robotics, automation, and IoT.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at S28 Capital and co‑founder & founding CTO of PagerDuty. He focuses on early‑stage B2B and developer‑focused startups, especially products for software and operations engineers. Holds a B. Soft Eng (University of Waterloo) and an M.Sc. (University of Toronto).
interests: Early‑stage B2B software startups with strong product focus
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded PagerDuty and served as its founding CTO, scaling the product and engineering org and designing the initial high‑availability architecture. After leaving full‑time operational roles he has advised at Y Combinator and invested/mentored startups through s28 Capital as a venture partner.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage B2B software (seed/Series A), developer tools and infrastructure, products aimed at software and operations engineers

enrichment.personal_bio: Trans-disciplinary entrepreneur, educator and investor focused on high-impact technology innovation. Holds a Ph.D. from Purdue University, completed executive education at Harvard, and has been a senior pre-seed leader at Elevate Ventures. Active advisor and board member to multiple startups; recognized as a Kauffman Foundation Global Scholar and NSF fellow.
enrichment.career_background: Dr. Landon Young earned his Ph.D. from Purdue University and completed executive education at Harvard. He has held multiple roles at Elevate Ventures (director of university initiatives, executive director of entrepreneurial programming, and Vice President/Head of Pre-Seed) and co-founded or founded startups and advisor platforms (e.g., LeadSigma, Business Donation Advisors, World Help Solutions). He has served as an NSF graduate research fellow and a Kauffman Global Scholar and serves on several startup boards and advisory teams.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed & seed-stage investments in high-impact technology startups (AI, IoT, SaaS), plus interest in AgTech, hardtech and life-sciences adjacent companies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Ro Bhatia is a SaaS executive and angel investor based in San Francisco. He was appointed CEO of PlanHub effective January 31, 2022 and is listed as an investor with Singh Capital Partners. He holds an MS in Computer Software Engineering from San Jose State University.
enrichment.career_background: Currently CEO of PlanHub (effective Jan 31, 2022). Prior senior roles include COO/leadership positions at Vaadin and sticky.io and executive/product roles at Thryv, The Home Depot, Yahoo, eBay, VMware and Google. Active as an angel investor in early-stage SaaS, marketplace and payments-related startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed & Seed-stage startups; SaaS, Marketplaces, Payments/FinTech, Direct-to-Consumer, Future of Work

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and finance executive with ~30 years of experience. CFA charterholder and former Managing Director of Techstars Stockholm. Joined Levels in 2024 as Deputy CEO / General Partner at Levels Invest and Managing Director for Corporate, Strategic & Business Development at Levels Venture Studio, focusing on accelerating early-stage ventures and international scaling.
enrichment.career_background: Has held senior roles across public markets and early-stage investing, including Managing Director at Techstars Stockholm, General Partner at Fairglobe Fund, portfolio manager roles at Scoggin/Scoggin Capital, and earlier positions at Morgan Stanley, Janus, Lazard and D.E. Shaw. Educated at Columbia University and Oxford; CFA charterholder.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed to seed / early-stage investments and venture-studio co-founding in SaaS, FinTech, ClimateTech / Cleantech, PropTech and other digital ventures, with emphasis on Nordic and international market expansion.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and operator focused on early-stage hard-tech and climate companies. Former Principal at Bleu Capital where he led investments across manufacturing, energy and systems-of-production sectors; earlier growth roles at Ara Labs. Educated at Wharton; based in Miami.
enrichment.career_background: Wharton-educated investor and operator. Early career growth and operations roles at Ara Labs (formerly Cargo). Served as Investment Associate then Principal at Bleu Capital, leading early-stage investments in climate and production-focused companies; later joined ImmuneCo (MoldCo) as Head of Growth while continuing angel/deal activity.
enrichment.hometown: Grew up in France; born in Singapore
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed to Series A); sectors include systems of production, climate/energy, manufacturing & materials, and supply-chain; typical check $150K–$500K.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investment professional at OCA Ventures focused on fintech and core technologies. Joined OCA in 2019 and has worked on deal teams including Curate, Livly, and GrayMatter Robotics. Previously vice president at Zemco (a family office) and held finance roles at Harter Investment Strategies, WTAS, and KPMG. Holds a BS in Finance and Accountancy from DePaul University.
enrichment.career_background: Joined OCA Ventures in 2019 and works on early-stage investments focused on core technologies and fintech. Prior to OCA, served as vice president at Zemco (a family office) where he focused on direct investments; earlier roles include finance positions at Harter Investment Strategies, WTAS, and KPMG. Educational background: BS in Finance and Accountancy from DePaul University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed–Series A/B) investments in fintech, consumer and enterprise software, and core technologies; US & Canada; typical check sizes ~$1M–$3M.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Steamwork Ventures, focused on helping early‑stage founders scale operations. Former COO of a Los Angeles SEC‑registered RIA and founder of Practical Activation (fractional COO/operations consultancy). Active mentor and former Tech Coast Angels due‑diligence committee member.
enrichment.career_background: Marshall Smith is General Partner and co‑founder of Steamwork Ventures (founded 2021). He previously served as COO of a Los Angeles SEC‑registered investment advisory firm, founded Practical Activation (fractional COO / operations consulting), and has served as an angel investor and due‑diligence committee member with Tech Coast Angels. He is a mentor at Preccelerator and holds a B.S. in Finance from the University of Rhode Island.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed / mature seed) investments in HealthTech, FinTech/wealth, Sustainability/ClimateTech, IoT and B2B SaaS; emphasis on operational support and device+service+data business models.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Mindful Venture Capital based in the San Francisco Bay Area. Seasoned C‑level operator and founder with a long background in telecom, internet and digital/media businesses and multiple corporate exits. Serves on boards/advisory roles (e.g., FanVestor) and focuses on early‑stage technology investing.
enrichment.career_background: Venture Partner at Mindful Venture Capital (since 2021). Previously a partner at Altus Alliance and held executive/founder roles at companies including LWAN Solutions, Comsolo and ANOB World; involved in exits and commercial transactions with larger carriers (e.g., TCG/AT&T, Netcom). Holds a background in finance and marketing (studied at California State University, East Bay) and has served on boards such as FanVestor/EdenLedger.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑Seed to Series A technology investments with emphasis on applied behavior design and AI; areas include fintech, digital health, enterprise SaaS, cybersecurity, blockchain/crypto and infrastructure.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor at Mucker Capital with prior experience in corporate strategy, entrepreneurship, and consulting. Background includes a global strategy role at Bayer, founding a digital health startup, and earlier research/consulting roles in Taiwan and Europe. Holds graduate degrees in molecular photonics and an MBA.
enrichment.career_background: Investor at Mucker Capital (MuckerLab/Mucker Capital) since ~2017, focused on sourcing and supporting pre-seed to Series A software and health-related startups. Prior roles include Head of Global Strategy at Bayer (worked across Germany, Taiwan, China), founder of a digital health startup (2015–2017), researcher at National Taiwan University, and early-career consulting at McKinsey & Company. Education includes an M.Sc. in molecular photonics (École Normale Supérieure Paris‑Saclay) and an MBA (Collège des Ingénieurs).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed, Seed, Series A; sectors: HealthTech / biotech, FinTech, logistics/supply-chain tech, B2B & consumer software

name: Scott Nissenbaum
firm: Ben Franklin Technology Partners of Southeastern Pennsylvania

enrichment.firm_name: Ben Franklin Technology Partners of Southeastern Pennsylvania
enrichment.personal_bio: President & CEO of Ben Franklin Technology Partners of Southeastern Pennsylvania. Formerly Chief Investment Officer and COO at Ben Franklin; led the launch of the GO Philly/GO PA funds. Holds a BS in finance from Penn State and an MBA from Saint Joseph's University.
enrichment.career_background: Finance and venture professional with roles across investing, operations and fund formation. Joined Ben Franklin as Chief Investment Officer in 2016, served as COO, and became President & CEO in 2021. Has raised capital for multiple funds (including GO Philly / GO PA), overseen 200+ early-stage investments, and served on several private/public boards. Education: BS (Penn State), MBA (Saint Joseph’s University).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage technology (IT/software, digital health, life sciences, medical devices, advanced manufacturing); regional venture funds (GO Philly / GO PA); cleantech/carbon-related projects.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and community builder formerly on the investment team at Republic. Founded the Z-List (a curated startup roundup) and has served in roles focused on founder community, events, and early-stage consumer deal flow. Based in New York; studied at Columbia University.
enrichment.career_background: Columbia University graduate who joined Republic in 2020 and held roles including Investment Associate, Senior Investment Associate and Head of Founder Community (tenure at Republic reported through 2024). Founder of The Z List; active angel investor and organizer of founder events; has participated in All Raise (NYC steering committee) and venture fellowship programs.
enrichment.hometown: Born in Singapore; raised in Hong Kong
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer & retail startups; consumer internet; early-stage (pre-seed/seed/Series A); angel and scout investments; community-driven/crowdfunded financings

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner, Regional Leadership at Antler US. First hire on Antler’s US expansion; leads portfolio management and regional operations for Antler’s U.S. residencies. Based in Boulder, Colorado.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Antler in 2019 as an early member of the US team, helped launch Antler residencies and offices in New York, Austin and Boulder, and served as Head of Portfolio for Antler US. Previously built and scaled ventures across financial services, apparel and technology and served as Director of Financial Programs at Start Small, Think Big.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / day-zero and early-stage investing (US & global); sector-agnostic with emphasis on fintech, healthtech, AI, and enterprise software.

enrichment.personal_bio: Technology-focused investor and operator who served as Chief Technology Advisor (2020–2021) and Technology Principal (2021–2023) at Airbus Ventures. Lecturer and research affiliate at MIT, publisher of The End Effector, and co-host of the Tough Tech Today podcast. General Partner at WFS Group and founder/operator of several frontier-tech ventures.
enrichment.career_background: Performed applied R&D for defense-related nonprofits before founding and operating multiple startups. Served on Alphabet X’s Rapid Evaluation Team, advised and led technical investment strategy at Airbus Ventures (Chief Technology Advisor → Technology Principal), and holds teaching/research roles at MIT while running WFS Group and publishing The End Effector.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage deep tech and aerospace-related startups (space, autonomy, advanced materials, manufacturing systems, electrification, sensing)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Propellant Ventures, a Chicago-based seed fund that backs Midwest pre-seed and seed B2B startups. Previously a Principal at Bascom/Alumni Ventures and long-time organizer in the Chicago startup ecosystem (Founder Institute director); also an adjunct faculty member at DePaul University.
enrichment.career_background: Jason Jacobsohn founded Propellant Ventures (2020) and serves as its Managing Partner. He was previously Principal at Bascom Ventures/Alumni Ventures Group, founded Reliable Venture Partners, and has run the Chicago chapter of Founder Institute; he also teaches entrepreneurship as an adjunct at DePaul University. Education: MBA, DePaul University; BBA, University of Wisconsin–Madison.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage, tech-enabled B2B startups (healthtech, fintech, edtech, supply chain, future of work, IIoT); Midwest-focused; typical initial checks $25,000–$500,000.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Core Innovation Capital focused on fintech that expands access to homeownership and improves financial outcomes for low- and moderate-income families. Formerly worked in M&A and private capital at GCA Advisors and is a Princeton University graduate. Based in Los Angeles and active in real estate investing. citeturn1search0turn1search1
enrichment.career_background: Joined Core Innovation Capital after work in GCA Advisors' M&A and Private Capital practices, with a partial focus on fintech; rose through roles at Core to Partner. Princeton University graduate; works on early-stage investments that blend financial returns with social impact. citeturn1search1turn1search0
