enrichment.investment_focus: Life‑sciences therapeutics (primarily oncology and immuno‑oncology), cell & gene therapies, and company formation / early‑to‑growth stage biotech investing.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at TO VC focused on climate and food systems investing. Former Chief Investment Officer and co‑founder of to.org; built and led the Groupe Mimran family office investment program. Holds a BA in Sociology from Princeton University and works at the intersection of sustainable finance, impact investing, and agriculture.
enrichment.career_background: Arieh co‑founded TO VC and serves as Managing Partner, having previously co‑founded to.org in 2015 and served as its Chief Investment Officer. He built and directed the Groupe Mimran family office investment program and has advised foundations and family offices on governance and strategy. He holds a BA in Sociology from Princeton and has been involved in initiatives in sustainable finance and academic collaborations (University of Zurich, MIT Sloan).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed–Series B) climate-focused investing in food systems, energy systems, and carbon removal; impact / sustainable finance.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner (Product Development) at RallyCry Ventures and co‑founder & CEO of Cloaked. Experienced software developer and product leader who has founded and sold startups and works on consumer privacy, product design, and education-focused nonprofit work. Educated at Babson College and Olin College (certificate).
enrichment.career_background: Arjun has ~11+ years in software development, product design and startups. He co‑founded Hey! HeadsUp (acquired), co‑founded JINN, served as a senior technology advisor at Creative Chaos and has worked with MIT STEP/MIT Media Lab projects. He is co‑founder & CEO of Cloaked and serves as Partner, Product Development at RallyCry Ventures; he also runs a nonprofit focused on building schools.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed / seed stage, product & early‑stage technology startups (software, SaaS, consumer privacy, enterprise SaaS, analytics, games)

enrichment.personal_bio: Senior Advisor at Kapor Capital (joined 2021) and co‑founder of Walden Venture Capital (1974). Career VC investor who has led 100+ technology and consumer investments, including multiple IPOs and M&A exits. Educated (BS, MBA) at the University of California, Berkeley.
enrichment.career_background: Art Berliner founded Walden Venture Capital in 1974 and has served as a long‑time managing director there. He co‑founded Walden International and Walden Israel to support technology investing in Asia and Israel, has sat on numerous portfolio boards, and previously held research, sales and corporate finance roles at Sutro & Company. He joined Kapor Capital as a Senior Advisor in 2021 and holds a BS and MBA from the University of California, Berkeley.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage technology and consumer startups; FinTech; EdTech; consumer, retail & e‑commerce

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founding Managing Partner and Chairman at Borderless Capital, a Web3‑focused investment manager. Entrepreneur‑turned‑VC who previously founded Enrich and 11‑11 Ventures and has been involved in early investments in projects such as Algorand and Helium. Serves as Executive Chairman at Emrit and works across Algorand and broader blockchain ecosystems.
enrichment.career_background: Arul Murugan is an entrepreneur and venture investor. He founded Enrich (Oracle procurement SaaS) in 2003 and led it through growth and an exit, then launched 11‑11 Ventures before co‑founding Borderless Capital in 2018 (originally Algo Capital). He has led and co‑led investments in multiple blockchain and crypto projects and holds an engineering degree from Madurai Kamaraj University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage and venture investments in Web3/blockchain (Algorand ecosystem), DePIN and decentralized infrastructure, crypto native finance/DeFi, NFTs, and select enterprise SaaS.

enrichment.personal_bio: Los Angeles–based venture investor and former Starburst Aerospace dealflow lead. Served as Global Dealflow Manager at Starburst Aerospace and as an investor at Starburst Ventures; later co‑founded/partnered at Generational Partners. Holds a BA in Economics from UCLA.
enrichment.career_background: Worked at Starburst Aerospace (Global Dealflow Manager / Analyst), invested through Starburst Ventures (pre-seed to Series A), and is a founder/partner at Generational Partners; background includes startup scouting, accelerator operations, and sourcing/diligence for aerospace and industrial tech deals. Educated at UCLA (BA, Economics).
enrichment.investment_focus: Aerospace & defense, space technology; deeptech/industrial tech; early-stage (pre-seed to Series A).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and general partner at Tofino Capital, an early-stage VC focused on emerging and frontier markets. Senior advisor/senior fellow at the Atlantic Council’s Africa Center, adjunct faculty at Georgetown, and co-author of The Next Africa. Holds an MBA from Wharton and an MA from Georgetown University.
enrichment.career_background: Aubrey Hruby co-founded Tofino Capital (2018) after a career advising and facilitating investment into Africa, including serving as Managing Director at the Whitaker Group and co-founding InsiderPR and the Africa Expert Network. She advises investors and corporates on Africa market strategy, teaches at Georgetown, and serves as a senior advisor/fellow at the Atlantic Council and a transaction lead at the Palladium Group.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed/pre-seed) technology companies in emerging/frontier markets (sub‑Saharan Africa focus); B2B SaaS, fintech, logistics and marketplaces.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Lead Edge Capital based in the firm’s Santa Barbara office. Leads investments in software, internet and technology-enabled services and serves as a board director/observer for portfolio companies including Artera, LaunchDarkly, Nucleus and Workiz. Previously an analyst with BRM Group in Tel Aviv; summa cum laude graduate of the University of Pennsylvania.
enrichment.career_background: Partner on Lead Edge’s investment team (joined the firm in the early 2010s), where he leads and sources growth-stage investments in software, internet and tech-enabled services. Prior to Lead Edge he worked as an analyst with the BRM Group in Tel Aviv. He is a national board member of the Birthright Israel Foundation and is based out of Lead Edge’s Santa Barbara office.
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth-stage investments in software, internet and tech-enabled services; flexible capital (minority, buyout and secondary positions) across private and public companies.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner / Partner at Hashed focused on global web3 investments. Former software engineer at Amazon Web Services (IoT & Robotics), founder of a last-mile logistics startup, Carnegie Mellon alumnus. Active in investing and ecosystem-building for blockchain protocols, gaming/metaverse, and infra projects.
enrichment.career_background: Baek Kyoum Kim is a Partner (General Partner-level) at Hashed where he leads and sources investments in metaverse, gaming, protocol infrastructure, and broader web3 adoption. Prior to Hashed he was a software engineer at Amazon Web Services (IoT & Robotics), founded a last-mile logistics startup, and has participated in programs including the Google Lunar XPrize; he holds degrees from Carnegie Mellon and has written Hashed’s public investment posts and blog entries.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and growth-stage web3/blockchain: protocol infrastructure (Layer-1/Layer-2, ZK), DeFi and infrastructure tooling, NFT/gaming & metaverse studios, developer platforms and crypto-native consumer apps.

enrichment.personal_bio: Senior Managing Partner of Pfizer Ventures and Vice President, Worldwide Business Development at Pfizer. Has led Pfizer’s corporate venture investing since joining the company in 2007 and is based in New York. Recognized in the corporate venturing community (GCV Powerlist; lifetime achievement award recipient).
enrichment.career_background: Ph.D. in microbiology and immunology (Medical College of Pennsylvania/Drexel). Early career in immunology at SmithKline & French Research Laboratories, then president of SR One (GSK’s corporate VC) in the 1990s, followed by a partner role at EuclidSR before joining Pfizer in 2007 to run its venture investing activities.
enrichment.investment_focus: Primarily U.S.-focused corporate venture investing across therapeutics (inflammation & immunology, oncology, internal medicine, anti-infectives, vaccines), with interest in platform technologies, diagnostics, drug delivery and pharmaceutical services; emphasis on early-stage and syndicate participation.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑Founder, President and Managing Partner at Human Capital, a San Francisco–based venture firm for engineers. Stanford BS in Computer Science. Raised in Istanbul and works on building engineering talent networks and investing in early‑to‑growth stage startups.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Human Capital (2015) and serves as President and Managing Partner, leading the firm’s work with engineering‑led founders and portfolio strategy. Graduated from Stanford (Computer Science); previously founded Sites by Hand and co‑founded student/social entrepreneurship initiatives at Stanford. Has guided hundreds of engineers on career and hiring strategy.
enrichment.investment_focus: Multi‑stage venture investing with emphasis on engineering‑led companies across fintech, enterprise/AI/cloud infrastructure and healthtech; early and growth stages.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and former CEO of Next 10 Ventures, a venture group focused on the creator economy. Former global director of top creator partnerships at YouTube. Based in the Los Angeles area and active in investing, incubating and co-founding creator-focused startups.
enrichment.career_background: Benjamin Grubbs spent 18+ years in internet and media roles at Yahoo!, eBay, Turner Broadcasting and Google/YouTube (served as global director, head of top creator partnerships). He founded Next 10 Ventures in 2018 to invest in and incubate creator-focused startups and has since co‑founded/partnered on companies including Creator+ and Kollyde; later became a partner at Creator Capital.
enrichment.investment_focus: Creator economy; early-stage (pre-seed/seed) investments in video/content, creator tools/platforms, e-commerce and community products for creators

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal on Broadview Ventures’ Biopharma team; responsible for sourcing, diligence, deal execution and portfolio management for early-stage life-science companies. Serves on boards and as observer for Broadview portfolio companies. Previously a consultant at Monitor Deloitte and holds undergraduate degrees (Biological Sciences and Financial Economics, magna cum laude) from Columbia University.
enrichment.career_background: Benjamin supports Broadview’s investment activities on the Biopharma team, including identification and screening of opportunities, due diligence, negotiation of deal terms, and portfolio company board involvement (listed board and observer roles include HAYA Therapeutics, Alveron Pharma, IsomAb Bio, AtaCor Medical, and Cardiosense). Prior to Broadview he was a Consultant at Monitor Deloitte advising biotechnology, pharmaceutical and medical device clients. He earned undergraduate degrees in Biological Sciences and Financial Economics, magna cum laude, from Columbia University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed/Series A) investments in cardiovascular and neurovascular disease technologies across therapeutics (small molecules, biologics), cell/gene therapies, medical devices (implantable/interventional/monitoring), and diagnostics.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at A* Capital, an early‑stage venture firm based in San Francisco. Former Partner at Coatue Management and previously worked in private equity and management consulting. Stanford BA (History).
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and General Partner at A* Capital. Prior to A*, Siegel was a partner at Coatue Management (investing in companies including DoorDash, Instacart and Ramp), earlier worked in private equity at Altamont Capital Partners and began his career as a consultant at Boston Consulting Group. He holds a B.A. in History from Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage technology (marketplaces, enterprise SaaS, consumer internet, AI, fintech); Seed to Series A

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Amiti Ventures, an Israel‑focused deep‑tech VC. Previously held VP/GM roles at AudioCodes leading North America sales, product marketing, operations and M&A. Holds an MBA from Georgetown University and serves on boards of multiple portfolio companies.
enrichment.career_background: Ben Rabinowitz founded Amiti Ventures in 2010 and leads the firm’s investments in Israeli early‑stage deep‑tech companies. Before founding Amiti he served in senior commercial and operating roles at AudioCodes (VP & GM for North America), leading sales, product marketing, operations and M&A. He holds an MBA from Georgetown University and has served on the boards of several portfolio companies including Valens, Siklu and Amimon.
enrichment.investment_focus: Israeli early‑stage deep tech (seed/Series A) with emphasis on semiconductors, automotive tech, AI/ML and high‑performance compute, cybersecurity, and tech‑bio/quantum.

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal at Hatteras Venture Partners supporting new portfolio diligence, existing portfolio strategy, and firm operations. Ph.D. in molecular cell biology (Washington University in St. Louis), former postdoctoral fellow at the National Institute of Environmental Health Sciences, and currently CEO of Altis Biosystems.
enrichment.career_background: Ben earned a B.E. in biomedical engineering from Vanderbilt University and a Ph.D. in molecular cell biology from Washington University in St. Louis, followed by a postdoctoral fellowship at NIEHS. He joined Hatteras in 2016 and has progressed to a principal role; he has held operating roles at Tune Therapeutics and is CEO/board member at Altis Biosystems while serving as a board observer/director for multiple Hatteras portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments in biopharmaceuticals, medical devices, diagnostics, and healthcare IT/digital health

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner at Step Function VC, an early-stage firm focused on infrastructure software. Previously a Partner at Bain Capital Ventures and a senior advisor there; serves or has served on several enterprise software boards. Based in Boston, MA, he focuses on first checks into technical founders building data/AI infrastructure, developer tools, and security.
enrichment.career_background: Lehmann spent roughly a decade investing in early-stage enterprise software at Bain Capital Ventures, then launched Step Function (founded 2022/2023) to lead first checks into infrastructure-focused startups. He has held board and board-observer roles at multiple companies (including Hazelcast) and acts as an active founder-facing investor and advisor to technical founding teams.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) infrastructure software: data & AI infrastructure, developer tools, cybersecurity, and platform/OSS-backed enterprise tooling.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and Partner at G20 Ventures and a long-time venture investor and GP at Advanced Technology Ventures. Formerly President of Lucent Technology’s Cellular & PCS Wireless Networks division, with senior roles at AT&T and Bell Labs. Holds an M.B.A. from Columbia, an M.S. from Stanford, and a B.S. from Cornell.
enrichment.career_background: Veteran technology executive who led Lucent’s $5B cellular and PCS wireless networks business after senior product and marketing roles at AT&T and Bell Labs. Transitioned to venture investing around 2000, serving as a General Partner at Advanced Technology Ventures and co-founding G20 Ventures in 2013; serves on multiple portfolio boards across enterprise software, AI, security, and energy.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Series A) enterprise software and East Coast startups; sweet spot ~$2–5M rounds. Prefers technology risk over pure consumer plays; invests across cloud, AI, cybersecurity and select energy/web3 opportunities.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Habitat Partners (the venture arm associated with Red Antler) and Partner / Chief Business Officer at Red Antler. Previously worked in venture and business development roles at Lerer Hippeau and Spanfeller Media. Holds a BA from Princeton University.
enrichment.career_background: Started his career in investment-analyst roles in real-estate/alternative investments, then held investment/associate roles at Lerer Hippeau. Later served in business development and leadership roles at Red Antler (including Chief Business Officer) and is a founding/executive partner of Habitat Partners, focusing on early-stage investments tied to Red Antler's creative expertise.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed to Series A) investments in consumer brands, B2B software, frontier tech and fintech/insurtech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Senior Partner at McCarthy Capital based in Boston. Joined McCarthy Capital in 2008 with more than 25 years of investment and investment-banking experience. Manages the firm’s Boston office, participates on the Investment Committee and focuses on evaluating, executing and overseeing private equity investments.
enrichment.career_background: Bob Emmert joined McCarthy Capital in 2008. He has over 25 years of experience in investment and investment banking, manages operations of McCarthy’s Boston office, raises investment capital, evaluates and makes private investments and provides management oversight of portfolio companies. He is a member of the firm’s Investment Committee and holds a B.S. in Finance from Georgetown University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Lower middle‑market private equity: recapitalizations, growth equity and management buyouts across business services (including technology‑enabled services, SaaS/software, IT services), communications, financial services and consumer products.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at PTC Crypto (Palm Tree Crew’s crypto/creator-economy arm). Co‑founder of Fleek and an early team member of Balanc3 at ConsenSys. Focuses on consumer Web3, NFTs and creator-economy projects and is a long‑time NFT collector.
interests: NFTs and crypto art (music & content NFTs)
enrichment.career_background: Brett Shear is a crypto founder and investor. He co‑founded Balanc3 (a ConsenSys project), later co‑founded Fleek (web3 developer platform) and since 2021 has served as Managing Partner of PTC Crypto / Palm Tree Crew’s crypto investment practice. Education listed on public profiles includes a Master of Taxation (Fordham Gabelli School of Business) and a bachelor’s degree in accounting (Florida State University).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage consumer, entertainment and crypto/Web3 — especially creator economy, NFTs, NFT infrastructure, web3 social and decentralized web tooling.

enrichment.personal_bio: Brett Zbar, MD, is Managing Director and Global Head of Life Sciences at General Atlantic (joined 2020). He previously served as Managing Director at Foresite Capital and as a Partner at Aisling Capital, and earlier worked at McKinsey & Company. He holds an M.D. from Harvard Medical School and a B.A. from Yale University.
enrichment.career_background: Dr. Zbar has focused on multi-stage life sciences and biopharma investing across company building, growth financings and board work. Before joining General Atlantic in 2020 he was a Managing Director at Foresite Capital and a Partner at Aisling Capital; earlier he was a senior member of McKinsey & Company’s Pharmaceuticals & Medical Products practice. He has served as a board member or observer for multiple biopharma and healthcare companies and participates in industry and academic advisory roles.
enrichment.investment_focus: Life sciences and biopharmaceuticals; growth-stage healthcare and therapeutics; biotech and healthcare technology

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Alumni Ventures; leads Chestnut Street and Triphammer funds. Seasoned venture investor with prior roles at New York Ventures (Managing Director), Peacock Fund (NBCUniversal), Arbitron (VP Strategy & Corporate Development), GE Capital and Bain & Co. Holds an MBA from Wharton and a BS in Industrial Engineering from USC.
enrichment.career_background: Over 20 years in venture and private equity across public- and private-sector investing. Served as Managing Director of New York Ventures, VP of Strategy & Corporate Development at Arbitron (now Nielsen Audio), Managing Director at the Peacock Fund (NBCUniversal), and earlier roles at GE Capital and Bain & Co. Currently managing Alumni Ventures’ alumni-focused funds (Chestnut Street, Triphammer). Education: Wharton MBA; BS, USC.
enrichment.investment_focus: Alumni-focused venture funds (early to growth stage); enterprise & cloud software, IoT, robotics/automation, semiconductors, healthcare/therapeutics

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Lead Edge Capital based in the firm’s London office, where he leads sourcing and diligence for growth‑stage technology investments. Joined Lead Edge in 2017 after working on the investment team at JMI Equity. Holds a B.A. in Psychology from Amherst College.
enrichment.career_background: Brian joined Lead Edge in 2017 and focuses on sourcing and diligencing growth‑stage technology investments. He previously worked on the investment team at JMI Equity and has earlier experience with Kantar Retail and the software company Nudger. He serves as a board member or board observer at Holistiplan, Level Access, and LiveView Technologies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth equity in software, internet, and tech‑enabled services (minority and buyout investments, typical check sizes in the growth‑equity range).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and Managing Partner at Will Ventures, focused on early-stage investments that leverage sport as a lens. Previously VP at Blue Star Innovation Partners and a founding member / Director of Product & Research at Sports Innovation Lab; earlier product manager at MC10. Holds a BA in Economics from Harvard University and played varsity football; from East Windsor, New Jersey.
enrichment.career_background: Brian co‑founded Will Ventures and leads sourcing and portfolio work for the firm. Before Will Ventures he executed growth‑equity investments at Blue Star Innovation Partners and held product and research leadership roles at Sports Innovation Lab and MC10. He studied economics at Harvard and has a background across sports, fitness, healthcare and related technologies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed, seed, Series A) investments in sports technology, health & wellness / digital health, consumer and media startups; uses sports as an identification and commercialization lens.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director at Next Play Ventures who coaches and invests in early‑stage founders alongside Jeff Weiner. Former VP and Chief of Staff at LinkedIn, where he helped run strategy, operations, and the Microsoft integration. Holds BSE and MSE in Industrial & Operations Engineering from the University of Michigan.
enrichment.career_background: Began his career as a consultant at McKinsey & Company, joined LinkedIn in 2012 in Business Operations and served for years as Chief of Staff (VP) to the CEO and Executive Chairman, leading strategic initiatives and the post‑Microsoft integration. Since 2020 he is Managing Director at Next Play Ventures; he has served on the board of Boys & Girls Clubs of the Peninsula and is a Fellow of the Aspen Institute.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed–Series A) startups in enterprise/SaaS, consumer internet, marketing technology and Web3/crypto; emphasis on founder coaching and operational scaling.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director and Head of Strategic Partnerships at Closed Loop Partners. Leads investor partnerships, industry partnerships, partner communications and special projects. 20+ years working on sustainability from the local food movement to the circular economy. Holds a BA in Sustainable Development from the University of Wisconsin–Madison.
enrichment.career_background: Bridget has spent two decades building movements and partnerships to advance sustainable consumption and circular systems. Prior to joining Closed Loop Partners in 2014 she held leadership roles at RecycleBank, Purpose PBC, myActions and Fair Food; at Closed Loop she helps build the firm’s investment, innovation and infrastructure work while leading external affairs and partnerships.
enrichment.investment_focus: Invests across venture, growth equity, private equity and catalytic capital in circular-economy solutions — sustainable consumer goods, reuse/refill and packaging, advanced recycling and recovery infrastructure.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at XEIA Venture Partners and founder of Empath Ventures. CFA charterholder with a background in quantitative portfolio management and machine learning; hosts podcasts on psychedelics and Human 3 topics.
interests: AI/ML for drug discovery and health
enrichment.career_background: Brom Rector is a founding partner of XEIA Venture Partners and the founder of Empath Ventures. He previously worked as a portfolio manager and quantitative researcher (including at Crabel Capital Management) and was an early hire at Turning Wheel Capital. He is a CFA charterholder and holds a Master’s degree in Computer Science with an emphasis on machine learning from Georgia Tech; he also hosts industry-focused podcasts on psychedelics and neurotech.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) life sciences and healthtech: psychedelic medicine, neurotech/BCIs, AI/ML-enabled drug discovery, genetic medicine and longevity.

enrichment.personal_bio: President and co‑founder of Capital Factory. Former founding team member and seed investor at Fixd Repair (acquired by ANGI) and founding director of the UT Dallas Seed Fund and Blackstone LaunchPad. Adjunct faculty at the University of Texas at Dallas, with an MBA from UT Arlington.
enrichment.career_background: Bryan is a business development and investment professional who manages Capital Factory's venture and accelerator operations across Texas. He founded Chambers Venture Capital, helped launch Fixd Repair, established the UT Dallas Seed Fund and Blackstone LaunchPad, and serves as an adjunct professor teaching venture capital and experiential entrepreneurship.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early‑stage technology companies (software, insurtech/home services); accelerator-driven investments focused on Texas and dual‑use/deep‑tech opportunities.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner and Managing Director at Wildcat Venture Partners who focuses on FinTech, EdTech, quant marketing and elder-care technology; also a General Partner at Mohr Davidow Ventures. Former founder and CEO of Agile Software; holds a BBA and MBA from the University of Texas at Austin. citeturn0search0turn3search4turn0search5
enrichment.career_background: Serial entrepreneur and investor: founded and served as CEO of Agile Software (led IPO and subsequent acquisition activity), later joined Mohr Davidow Ventures in 2007 and is a Founding Partner/Managing Director at Wildcat Venture Partners. Serves on/advises academic business programs including UT Austin McCombs and Santa Clara University Leavey School. Holds a BBA and MBA from the University of Texas at Austin. citeturn0search5turn0search4turn0search0
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage B2B/B2B2C technology: FinTech, EdTech, enterprise SaaS, quant marketing; platforms enabling alternative credit, payments and insurance; post-K12 education and elder-care tech. citeturn0search0turn0search1

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor who served as Principal at QED Investors (joined 2020), focused on fintech and early-stage investments across the US and Latin America. Former fintech operator (Head of Operations at Nubank; Senior Manager, Product & Business at Earnin) and holds an MBA from Stanford Graduate School of Business.
enrichment.career_background: Served as Principal at QED Investors (joined 2020) working on early-stage fintech deals; previously Head of Operations at Nubank (led a 300+ person operations team), Senior Manager of Product & Business at Earnin, and Senior Associate at Redpoint e.ventures. Earlier roles include consulting and investment banking experience; MBA from Stanford GSB and B.A. from FGV. (Joined Construct Capital as an early-stage investor in 2024.)
enrichment.investment_focus: FinTech (consumer finance, payments, lending, embedded finance); early-stage (seed to Series A); US and Latin America

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at F-Prime Capital focused on healthcare and health IT. Former founding team member and CFO of athenahealth (1997–2010). Adjunct lecturer on entrepreneurial finance and health policy at Harvard.
enrichment.career_background: Carl Byers was on the founding team of athenahealth and served as CFO from 1997 to 2010, leading the company through multiple financings and its 2007 IPO. He later joined F-Prime Capital as a partner, serves on multiple healthcare company boards, and teaches entrepreneurial finance and health policy as an adjunct at Harvard. He holds a B.A. from Wesleyan University and completed mid-career studies at Harvard Kennedy School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Healthcare and health IT (digital health, health services/platforms, data interoperability, AI-enabled healthcare)

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Interlock Partners, focused on early-stage, transformative technology investments. Former CEO of Travelocity Global and Academic Partnerships, previously President of Gilt Groupe and CMO at Expedia. Serves on public and private boards including Copart, Cint AB, Waste Connections and Plex. Educated at Princeton University (summa cum laude) and Harvard Business School (Baker Scholar).
enrichment.career_background: Began in strategy consulting with The Boston Consulting Group, then held senior marketing and operating roles at Expedia and Hotels.com. Later served as President of Gilt Groupe, CEO of Travelocity Global, and CEO of Academic Partnerships, and was a senior adviser to Bain Capital’s TMT group before becoming Managing Partner at Interlock Partners. Has held multiple public-company board seats and audit committee roles.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage technology: marketplaces, e‑commerce/recommerce, consumer internet, enterprise SaaS & data platforms, edtech, marketing/advertising tech (seed through Series A).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of The Angels' Forum, a Silicon Valley angel group she formed in 1997. 30+ years in investing and corporate roles; teaches angel investing and board governance in Stanford continuing education. Runs/co-founded related Halo Funds and has served on advisory boards and industry groups.
interests: Capital-efficient, disruptive technologies and business models
Board governance, mentoring and investor education
enrichment.career_background: Started in banking and corporate marketing (First Bank Systems, Motorola, Xerox), held executive roles in professional services (Arthur Young/Ernst & Young, Coopers & Lybrand/PricewaterhouseCoopers), founded Sands MarketingPlus, launched The Angels' Forum in 1997 and subsequently co-founded the Halo Funds; teaches at Stanford and serves on several advisory boards. Holds a B.A. from the University of Iowa.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed to Series A) Bay Area companies across technology (enterprise software, consumer internet), life sciences and medical devices; prefers capital-efficient, disruptive business models.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at McKesson Ventures who invests in healthcare technology at the intersection of drug development and digital health. Over 20 years of healthcare experience across clinical trials, corporate strategy, and digital health; based in the Boston area. Holds an MBA from UC Berkeley (Haas) and a BS in Biology from UMass Amherst.
interests: AI & data analytics for life sciences
enrichment.career_background: Began her career managing oncology clinical trials in pharma/biotech, held roles in McKesson corporate strategy and business development, served as VP of Strategy & Business Development at Omada Health, and joined McKesson Ventures in 2017 (promoted to partner in 2020). Education: MBA, Haas School of Business (UC Berkeley); BS in Biology, University of Massachusetts Amherst.
enrichment.investment_focus: Healthcare technology: clinical trial tech, digital therapeutics, digital pharmacy, digital supply chain, oncology care, consumer health, AI/data analytics for life sciences

enrichment.personal_bio: Chad Sanderson is CEO & Co‑founder of Gable.ai and a scout for Sequoia Capital. He is a data leader focused on data quality, data contracts and data infrastructure, and previously led data platform/product teams at Convoy and Microsoft. He is based in Seattle, Washington.
enrichment.career_background: Chad Sanderson is the CEO and co‑founder of Gable.ai (a data change-management/data contracts platform). He previously led the data/platform product team at Convoy and held roles at Microsoft, Oracle, Sephora and others. Sanderson has served as a Sequoia scout, operates the Data Quality Camp community, is an author (O'Reilly project on data contracts) and is active as an angel/limited partner in data infrastructure startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage / scout investments in data infrastructure, data services, data quality, and machine‑learning/AI platforms

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at TSVC (TSV Capital), based in Los Altos, CA. Former founding-team member at NetScreen and executive at EPIN Tech and Easyway. Focuses on early-stage deep-tech investments including Physical AI, robotics, hardware and healthtech.
enrichment.career_background: Seasoned engineer-entrepreneur and investor. Co-founder/founding-team roles include NetScreen and EPIN Technologies; served as VP at Easyway and has worked on high-speed rail technology initiatives. Currently a General Partner at TSVC, with board roles and portfolio involvement in multiple early-stage deep-tech and healthtech companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / pre-seed and early-stage deep tech: Physical AI (robotics, autonomy), hardware & sensors, medical devices/healthtech, enterprise software and cybersecurity.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Director of VentureSouth and Executive Director of Venture Carolina. Based in South Carolina, he is a serial entrepreneur turned early‑stage investor focused on building angel infrastructure and investor education in the Southeast.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded VentureSouth (formerly South Carolina Angel Network) and serves as Managing Director; also Executive Director of Venture Carolina. Prior roles include principal of The Banks Group, portfolio manager at CertusBank, and founder/CEO of companies such as PanelTech Building Systems and WilBanks Financial Solutions. Holds a BS in Business Administration from Newberry College.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (angel/seed/Series A) startups in the Southeastern United States; industry‑agnostic but technology‑driven with emphasis on healthcare/medical devices and enterprise software.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at S3 Ventures since 2010. Focuses on early-stage enterprise software and healthcare technology investments and serves on multiple portfolio company boards. Holds an MBA from the McCombs School of Business (UT Austin) and a BS in Finance from the University of Mississippi.
enrichment.career_background: Joined S3 Ventures in 2010 and is a General Partner. Previously worked at Harbert Private Equity Funds (Harbert Management Corporation) analyzing and structuring LBOs, and earlier was a commercial portfolio manager at Regions Bank. Education: MBA, McCombs School of Business (UT Austin); BS in Finance, University of Mississippi.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed to Series B; Business Technology (enterprise software), Digital Experiences, Healthcare Technology

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Tercera, a growth equity and advisory firm focused on cloud professional services. Serial entrepreneur with 25+ years in technology and services; co‑founder and former CEO of Appirio (acquired by Wipro in 2016). Serves on multiple boards and writes on services and cloud ecosystems.
enrichment.career_background: Chris began his career at Grainger, held senior services leadership at webMethods, and co‑founded Appirio (served as CEO until its acquisition by Wipro in 2016). He later served as a venture partner at GGV Capital and in 2020 founded Tercera to provide capital, counsel and connections to founder‑led cloud services firms. He holds board roles in several portfolio companies and is involved in consumer ventures (e.g., SipTequila/Compoveda) and other private businesses.
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth equity and advisory for founder‑led, people‑centric cloud professional services (analytics, data, automation, security/identity, enablement and managed services); partner‑centric/ISV ecosystems and scaling services businesses.

enrichment.personal_bio: Christopher B. Hollenbeck is a co‑founder and long‑time managing director of Granite Ventures (managing director since 1998). He holds a B.A. in American Studies from Stanford University and previously worked in venture and corporate finance at Hambrecht & Quist. Hollenbeck has served on multiple portfolio company boards and later held senior finance roles including EVP/CFO at Smule and CFO at Griffin Gaming Partners.
enrichment.career_background: Hollenbeck began his finance career in Hambrecht & Quist's venture and M&A groups, co‑founded and served as Managing Director at Granite Ventures (1998–2017+), and has taken board and operating finance roles at portfolio companies (including Smule and HireVue). In later years he has held senior finance positions (EVP/CFO roles) and advisory/investor roles in gaming and consumer apps.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage technology (enterprise software/SaaS, cloud infrastructure, mobility, digital media/gaming)

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner of Castor Ventures at Alumni Ventures with 30+ years in venture capital, product development, and sales engineering. At AV he has helped build Castor Ventures across multiple fund vintages and has deployed over $100M into companies from seed to growth. He holds an SB in Electrical Engineering from MIT and an MBA from UC Berkeley (Haas).
enrichment.career_background: Prior to Alumni Ventures, Sklarin was Vice President at Edison Partners and held business development roles at biomedical venture accelerator BioEnterprise and early-stage firm Chrysalis Ventures; earlier in his investing career he sourced and executed seed investments at JumpStart. At AV he leads Castor Ventures (an MIT-focused fund) and has also been involved with AVs Deep Tech-focused activity.
enrichment.investment_focus: MIT/alumni-focused venture funds; enterprise software and mobile; deep tech (AI/hardware); healthtech/biomedical; early through growth-stage investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Chris Stern is Corporate Vice President and Managing Director, Head of Trimble Ventures at Trimble. He leads Trimble’s corporate venture capital activities, focusing on strategic investments that align with Trimble’s construction, agriculture, geospatial and transportation businesses. He previously founded and served as CEO of Spacient Technologies, which was acquired by Trimble. He holds a MS from UCLA and a BS from Loyola Marymount University (reported).
enrichment.career_background: Stern founded Spacient Technologies (acquired by Trimble in 2006) and later joined Trimble in strategy and corporate development. In 2021 he became head of Trimble Ventures, Trimble’s $200M corporate venture arm, and leads strategic partnerships, investments and startup engagement. He also serves in advisory and board roles with university industry boards and organizations (reported affiliations include Loyola Marymount University, UCLA advisory roles, OpenOceans and advisor roles with venture groups).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early- and growth-stage startups in construction, agriculture, geospatial and transportation; AI, autonomy/robotics, mapping & positioning, modeling/visualization and sustainability.

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal at NewView Capital with investment and operations experience across stages and geographies. Focuses on fintech, enterprise SaaS and digital health. Previously invested at Atomico and worked in corporate finance at Google after starting her career at UBS. Holds a Bachelor of Commerce from the University of Melbourne.
enrichment.career_background: Started at UBS in Sydney and New York advising on capital raisings and M&A, moved to Google (Corporate Finance) in Mountain View, then invested at Atomico in London (led Peakon). Joined NewView Capital as Principal (joined early 2020) where she sources and leads investments primarily in fintech, SaaS, and digital health.
enrichment.investment_focus: Fintech, enterprise SaaS, digital health; mid-to-growth-stage investments (primary, secondary, and portfolio acquisitions)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Magnetic Ventures (founded 2018). Former Managing Director at Foresite Capital with earlier operating roles at Roche and Sanofi. Serves on boards including Relation Therapeutics, Weave Bio, Terrain Bioscience and Amydis. Focuses on early-stage companies at the intersection of life sciences and deep technology.
interests: AI/ML for drug discovery and biology
enrichment.career_background: Christine began her career at Roche working on diagnostics and product launches, later held commercial/product roles at Sanofi, and moved into startups and investment (including Genomic Health). She was a Managing Director at Foresite Capital (joined 2011; left 2017) before founding Magnetic Ventures in 2018; she now leads the firm’s seed and early-stage investing and sits on multiple portfolio company boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed–Series A investments at the interface of life sciences and deep technology (AI/ML, multi-omics, drug discovery, precision medicine, software tools and tech-enabled services).

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at IGNIA (joined 2011) who focuses on managing portfolio companies and sourcing/evaluating early-stage investments for Latin America. Prior roles include leadership at EF Education First, Google, the Guggenheim Foundation (Mexico) and The Parthenon Group. She holds a BA from Duke University, an MBA from Harvard Business School, and is a Kauffman Fellow.
interests: Women in VC and investor diversity
enrichment.career_background: Joined IGNIA in 2011 and was named Partner in 2018; at IGNIA she leads deals, supports portfolio company strategy and operations, and represents the firm on multiple boards. Earlier she ran marketing and sales operations for EF Education First in Mexico, worked on international growth at Google, served as Managing Director of the Guggenheim Foundation in Mexico, and was a Senior Associate at The Parthenon Group. Education: Duke University (BA) and Harvard Business School (MBA).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and partner at Placeholder, a New York‑based venture firm focused on cryptoassets and decentralized information networks. Former Blockchain Products Lead at ARK Investment Management. Co‑author of the book "Cryptoassets: The Innovative Investor’s Guide to Bitcoin and Beyond" (2017). Based in New York City.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Placeholder in 2017 to invest in early‑stage tokenized networks and protocol infrastructure. Before Placeholder he led ARK Invest’s Next Generation Internet / blockchain efforts and later focused on blockchain products. He is a published author on crypto investing and has engaged in board/advisory roles for protocol teams and projects.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage investments in decentralized information networks and token‑based protocols — cryptoassets, protocol infrastructure, Layer‑1/Layer‑2 and Web3 developer tooling; emphasis on tokenomics and long‑term network value accrual.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner and Managing Director at Trammell Venture Partners, based in Austin, Texas. Focuses on early-stage, Bitcoin-native infrastructure, security/privacy technologies, and applied AI. Holds an MBA (IE Business School) and has served as a board observer and board member for several Bitcoin infrastructure firms.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and Managing Director of Trammell Venture Partners (TVP) since 2016, where he helped launch the TVP Bitcoin Venture Fund series. Active in the Texas blockchain policy community (Texas Blockchain Council), has served as board observer for Kraken and Unchained Capital and as a board member of Voltage; mentors at Techstars and Capital Factory. Educational background includes an International MBA from IE Business School and undergraduate study at the University of Nevada.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments in Bitcoin-native protocol stack, Lightning/Bitcoin infrastructure, security & privacy technologies, and applied AI

enrichment.personal_bio: Christopher de Souza, PhD, MBA is Director on the Biopharma team at Broadview Ventures based in Boston. He focuses on early-stage translational investments in cardiovascular and neurovascular disease and serves on multiple portfolio and industry boards. He previously held R&D and business development roles in industry including Novartis and SkyePharma.
enrichment.career_background: Dr. de Souza trained in physiology (PhD) and holds an MBA; he began his industry career at Novartis (senior scientist; Director, Strategic Alliances), served as VP of Business Development at SkyePharma US, ran a business development consulting practice, and is now Director (Biopharma Team) at Broadview Ventures with portfolio and board responsibilities.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / Series A focus on cardiovascular and neurovascular indications (heart failure, structural heart, arrhythmias, peripheral vascular, stroke) across therapeutics, devices, diagnostics and digital health; preference for translational investments from pre-clinical through clinical proof-of-concept; global geography (North America, Europe, Israel).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑Founder & Managing Partner at Autism Impact Fund (AIF), where he leads operations, deal sourcing, and portfolio support. Serves on boards of several portfolio companies and focuses on scaling tech‑enabled care, diagnostics, and therapeutics for autism and related neurodevelopmental conditions. Founded AIF after his youngest child was diagnosed with autism. Holds an MBA from Case Western Reserve and a BA from Denison University; resides in Winter Park, Florida.
enrichment.career_background: Over a decade leading venture and middle‑market equity investing and portfolio value creation. Prior roles include Managing Director at RBG Capital (family office), co‑founder of Anslinger Capital (legal‑cannabis investment vehicle), and earlier work in Hyatt’s Global Real Estate & Development Finance group. Co‑founded AIF to apply venture capital approaches to autism innovation and sits on multiple portfolio company boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage and growth investments addressing autism and related neurodevelopmental and behavioral health conditions across biology/diagnostics, therapeutics, health‑tech platforms, and care‑delivery businesses.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner and General Partner at Lowercarbon Capital who leads the firm’s early-stage climate investments. Previously a partner at Lowercase Capital and served in the Obama White House Office of Digital Strategy. Harvard College graduate and named to Forbes 30 Under 30 (2017).
interests: Clean energy (including fusion and advanced power)
enrichment.career_background: Clay Dumas is a founding partner at Lowercarbon Capital, where he sources and supports ambitious climate startups. He also partners at Lowercase Capital and previously served in the White House Office of Digital Strategy. His background includes political organizing and campaign work, and he graduated from Harvard College.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and growth climate technology (decarbonization, carbon removal, clean energy, industrial & agricultural decarbonization); founder-led, science/engineering-first startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner and founder of Era Ventures, a venture firm focused on technology and business models that reimagine the built environment. Former Venture Partner at Bain Capital Ventures and co-founding partner at MetaProp; previously President of Warburg Realty. citeturn3view0turn6search2turn1search5

SaaS & AI applied to physical assets
enrichment.career_background: Founded Era Ventures and leads the firm’s investing, fundraising and strategic efforts; launched Era Ventures Fund I (initial $88M) to back startups reshaping how we build, manage and transact real assets. Prior roles include Venture Partner at Bain Capital Ventures, co-founding partner at MetaProp, President of Warburg Realty; earlier work at BCG and with the International Rescue Committee. citeturn6search0turn6search2turn3view0

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder, Managing Director and General Partner at Cultivation Capital. Former founder of Foot Healers (sold to private equity in 2007) and Professor of Practice & Academic Director for Entrepreneurship at Washington University in St. Louis (retired 2019). Holds a B.A. from Washington & Lee University and an MBA from Washington University in St. Louis.
enrichment.career_background: Started in enterprise sales at IBM, founded and led Foot Healers (exit to private equity in 2007), then served as a professor and academic director for entrepreneurship at Washington University in St. Louis before co‑founding Cultivation Capital. At Cultivation he invests in and serves on boards of multiple early‑stage companies and participates in regional economic development and university nonprofit boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed–Series A/B); sectors include life sciences & health tech, software/SaaS, agriculture/food tech, geospatial/proptech; typical initial check size ~$100K–$3.5M.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner on Next47’s Palo Alto investment team; joined Next47 in 2018. Focuses on IT infrastructure, cybersecurity, robotics and connected devices. Previously worked in Morgan Stanley’s Technology Group and holds a BSc in Symbolic Systems from Stanford University.
enrichment.career_background: Colton joined Next47 in 2018 and is a Partner on the firm’s Palo Alto investment team where he leads and supports investments in infrastructure, security and robotics-related startups. Prior to Next47 he worked on M&A and IPO transactions in Morgan Stanley’s Technology Group in New York. He holds a BSc in Symbolic Systems from Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: B2B enterprise software — IT infrastructure, cybersecurity, robotics & connected devices, developer/platform engineering tools; early-to-growth stage enterprise investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at True Beauty Ventures, a sector‑specialized venture fund for beauty, wellness and personal care. She has ~15–18 years of combined investing, operating and advising experience in CPG with the last decade focused on beauty. Sits on multiple portfolio boards (e.g., maude, Crown Affair, Moon Juice) and is publicly vocal about increasing access to capital for female and BIPOC founders. First‑generation Cuban American who grew up in Miami.
interests: Founder diversity & equitable access to capital
enrichment.career_background: Previously an analyst in consumer & retail investment banking at UBS and an investor at Tengram Capital and L Catterton; held operating leadership roles in beauty and wellness including GM/COO at Clark’s Botanicals and roles at Laura Geller Beauty and Equinox. Graduated magna cum laude from Duke University. Co‑founded True Beauty Ventures in 2020 to deploy sector expertise into emerging growth beauty brands.
enrichment.investment_focus: Beauty, personal care and wellness (seed to emerging growth/Series A–C); typical equity check ~$1–5M; emphasis on omnichannel consumer brands, strong unit economics and differentiated product narratives; prioritizes female and minority founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Adjuvant Capital based in New York. Physician (MD) with an MBA from Columbia University and a BS in Economics from Brigham Young University. Has invested in healthcare companies for over 16 years and served on multiple company boards focused on diagnostics, devices, and therapeutics for global health.
enrichment.career_background: Curt LaBelle is a physician-investor with an MD and MBA from Columbia and a BS in Economics from Brigham Young University. He is a Venture Partner at Adjuvant Capital and has served as Managing Director at Tullis Health Investors and Vice President at Investor Growth Capital. LaBelle is President/Managing Partner of the Global Health Investment Fund and has served on boards or as an observer for multiple healthcare companies with several strategic exits.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-to-growth stage life sciences targeting global public health: neglected/high-burden infectious diseases, antimicrobial resistance, vaccines, diagnostics, therapeutics, and maternal/newborn health.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner at Prime Movers Lab, a venture firm that backs breakthrough scientific startups. Previously founding CEO of Tachyus and OpenGov. Holds a BS in Mathematics from Stanford University (2011).
enrichment.career_background: Dakin Sloss is an entrepreneur and investor who founded Prime Movers Lab in 2018 to finance and coach science-driven inventors. Before Prime Movers Lab he was founding CEO of Tachyus (prescriptive analytics for energy) and co‑founder/CEO of OpenGov; he serves or has served on multiple portfolio company boards and holds a BS in Mathematics from Stanford.
enrichment.investment_focus: Breakthrough scientific startups (energy, transportation, infrastructure, manufacturing, human augmentation, agriculture); primarily early-stage (seed and Series A) science-driven hardware, biotech, and deep-tech investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and General Partner at Conexo Ventures (Boston). Repeat fintech entrepreneur and operator — co‑founder of LoopPay, Roam Data and Way Systems; former EVP/Head of Business Development at Samsung Pay and earlier roles at Nokia, PayPal and Gemalto. President and co‑founder of firmly.ai and holds an MBA from MIT Sloan.
enrichment.career_background: 25+ years in payments, telecom and security. Held executive roles including General Manager (Gemplus/Gemalto South America), Head of NFC at Nokia, Head of POS Partnerships at PayPal, and EVP Business Development at Samsung Pay. Co‑founded multiple startups (Way Systems, Roam Data, LoopPay) with corporate exits; now invests and advises through Conexo Ventures while leading firmly.ai.
