enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Visible Hands, a Boston‑based pre‑seed accelerator and VC that backs underrepresented founders. Former associate at Summit Partners and financial analyst at Goldman Sachs. Holds an MBA from Wharton and an MPA from Harvard Kennedy School; BA from Brandeis. Serves on the boards of The Posse Foundation and American Student Assistance and has been an EIR at MIT designX.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and General Partner at Visible Hands (founded 2020). Previously an associate at Summit Partners and a financial analyst at Goldman Sachs. 교육: BA from Brandeis University; MBA from The Wharton School; MPA from Harvard Kennedy School. Has held roles as Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence at MIT designX and venture advisor at Yale’s Tsai Center; serves on national nonprofit boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed‑stage startups (cohort/accelerator sourced); fintech, healthtech, climate/cleantech; companies led by underrepresented founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: Daniel Gottlieb, MBA, is Director (Medtech) at Broadview Ventures, based in Boston. He has ~20 years of experience across medical devices and biotechnology, focusing on early-stage investing, portfolio management, and corporate development. He holds a BA from the University of Pennsylvania and an MBA from the Tuck School of Business at Dartmouth.
enrichment.career_background: Daniel has ~20 years of experience in large-company and startup roles across medical devices and biotech. Prior positions include Vice President, Corporate Development at Proteon Therapeutics, marketing roles at Abbott Vascular, and work in Guidant’s Compass corporate venture/business development group. He joined Broadview’s medtech practice and focuses on new investments, portfolio oversight and long‑term portfolio strategy.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed/Series A) investments in cardiovascular and neurovascular therapeutics, medical devices (implantable, interventional, monitoring), diagnostics and related digital health technologies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Former OpenView investment VP/Partner who supported expansion-stage B2B software investments (notably Highspot, optimize.health, Postscript, project44 and Zipwhip). University of Chicago alum (ABs and an MBA). Prior experience includes Touchdown Ventures, Hyde Park Angels and roles at Target; later joined Stage 2 Capital as a partner.
enrichment.career_background: Daniel Heck earned undergraduate degrees in History and Economics and an MBA from the University of Chicago. He worked in merchandising/analytics roles at Target, moved into venture with Hyde Park Angels and Touchdown Ventures, joined OpenView (VP → Partner) where he focused on expansion-stage enterprise software, and later became a partner at Stage 2 Capital. He has served on/led investments in go‑to‑market and logistics-oriented software companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Expansion-stage B2B software (SaaS); product-led growth, go-to-market and enterprise/vertical software (logistics, digital health, fintech).

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Decibel Partners focusing on early-stage enterprise software. Works with founders building next-generation ML/AI, cloud infrastructure and cybersecurity companies. Previously an investor at Battery Ventures and named to Forbes 30 Under 30 (Venture Capital).
enrichment.career_background: Dan is a Partner at Decibel Partners investing in pre-seed through Series A enterprise software (cloud, data/AI, security). Prior to Decibel he was a Vice President at Battery Ventures where he led investments including Databricks, Sumo Logic, Contrast Security and InfluxData. Earlier roles include corporate development at VMware and technology investment banking at UBS. He graduated from the University of California, Berkeley and was named to Forbes 30 Under 30 (Venture Capital).
enrichment.hometown: a small town outside Munich, Germany
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage enterprise software: cloud infrastructure, data/AI, developer tools and cybersecurity

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner, CEO and CIO of 10T Holdings and founder of 1RoundTable Partners. Veteran macro investor with ~30 years of experience who moved into growth equity investments in the digital asset ecosystem. Regular speaker on macroeconomic and crypto topics; serves on multiple company boards.
enrichment.career_background: Former macro-focused portfolio manager and analyst at Tiger Management, Duquesne Capital Management, Steinhardt Management Co., and SAC Capital Advisors. Founded DTAP Capital (2003), co‑founded Gold Bullion International and the Agricultural Company of America (AGCoA), and later launched 10T Holdings to invest in mid-to-late-stage crypto and blockchain companies. Graduated Phi Beta Kappa from Brown University (BA ’90, MA ’91) and serves on the Board of Trustees of the Lawrenceville School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth equity investments in mid-to-late-stage Digital Asset Ecosystem (crypto exchanges, blockchain infrastructure, NFT/metaverse businesses, and next‑gen financial services).

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Madrona Venture Group and AI researcher; Professor Emeritus at the University of Washington and General Manager & Chief Scientist for Semantic Scholar at the Allen Institute for AI. Co‑founded Netbot, AdRelevance, and Nimble Technology; works at the intersection of applied AI, ML and human‑centered computing.
enrichment.career_background: Daniel S. Weld is a long‑time AI researcher and entrepreneur. He served as a professor at the University of Washington (Thomas J. Cable/WRF Professor), co‑founded multiple companies (Netbot, AdRelevance, Nimble Technology), joined Madrona as a Venture Partner in 2001, and leads Semantic Scholar as General Manager & Chief Scientist at the Allen Institute for AI.
enrichment.investment_focus: Applied AI and machine learning; human-centered AI / HCI; early‑stage technology startups (seed & Series A), intelligent applications

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and former Principal at Salesforce Ventures (2018–2022). Co-authored Salesforce Ventures writing about Klue and quoted on Salesforce Ventures' Cogito investment. Educated at Dartmouth College and the University of Oxford. Currently Senior Director, S Ventures at SentinelOne (verified public profiles).
enrichment.career_background: Worked in investment banking (Goldman Sachs, William Blair), then in venture capital at Norwest Venture Partners before joining Salesforce Ventures as Principal (2018–2022). Publicly credited on Salesforce Ventures investments (e.g., Klue, Cogito). Currently leads S Ventures at SentinelOne in a corporate VC role focused on security and AI.
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise software (SaaS), go-to-market / sales enablement, data & infrastructure, security and generative AI (corporate VC and growth-stage investments)

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director at Syngenta Group Ventures (joined 2012), focused on agri-food technology, life sciences and digital/precision-ag investments from seed to growth equity. Former General Partner at Intersouth Partners and over a decade in the pharmaceutical industry (Johnson & Johnson, Pharmacia/Pfizer). Holds a B.S. from the U.S. Military Academy (West Point) and an MBA from Duke University; served as a U.S. Army officer.
enrichment.career_background: David spent 14 years in the pharmaceutical industry in senior marketing, sales and new‑product roles (Johnson & Johnson, Pharmacia/Pfizer), then was a partner at Intersouth Partners for seven years before joining Syngenta Group Ventures as Managing Director in 2012. He has served as a board member or observer for multiple venture‑backed companies across agtech and life sciences and holds degrees from West Point (BS) and Duke (MBA); he previously served as an Army officer in the 82nd Airborne and 2nd Infantry Division.
enrichment.investment_focus: Agriculture & food technology; agtech, biologicals and crop inputs; agrifintech and supply‑chain marketplaces; digital/precision agriculture and life‑science investments; stage range: seed through growth equity (including Series A–C).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and longtime executive at ThirdLove, an e‑commerce intimates brand. Former partner at Sequoia Capital and ex‑Google analytics lead. Active angel investor with personal investments across consumer, hardware, biotech, and enterprise startups.
enrichment.career_background: David Spector co‑founded ThirdLove and has served in senior leadership roles there; prior to ThirdLove he worked at Google (commerce/analytics) and was a partner at Sequoia Capital focused on e‑commerce, consumer internet and analytics. He is an active angel investor and has served on industry boards (including the IAB); he holds an MBA from MIT Sloan and a BA from Tulane University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer internet, e‑commerce and retail (early‑stage/angel), analytics and data‑driven product

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Longwood Fund focused on creating and investing in early‑stage biotechnology companies. Serial biotech company founder and operator — has served as founding CEO or chair of several Longwood portfolio companies (e.g., Pyxis Oncology, Photys Therapeutics, Be Biopharma). Former Chief Innovation Officer and co‑founder of PureTech Health. Holds an MBA from University of Chicago Booth School of Business and a BA in biology from Cornell University.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and Chief Innovation Officer at PureTech Health; founding CEO or co‑founder of multiple biotech companies (including Vor Biopharma, Pyxis Oncology, Photys Therapeutics, Be Biopharma, Carbon Biosciences, Vedanta Biosciences, resTORbio). Prior experience in strategy consulting at Boston Consulting Group and Vertex Partners and R&D at P&G Pharmaceuticals. Education: MBA (Chicago Booth) and BA in biology (Cornell).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage biotechnology (seed/Series A), company creation and operating‑led venture building; therapeutics (oncology, cell & gene therapy, immunology/microbiome).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Co‑Head of Venture Capital at 10X Capital. Founder of Growth Technology Partners (acquired by 10X) and former partner at Flight Ventures; earlier co‑founder of isocket and RoomHunt. Has led 10X investments including Robinhood, Headspace and DraftKings; holds a BS from Indiana University and an MBA from Dartmouth (Tuck) and is reported to be pursuing a master’s in psychology at Harvard.
enrichment.career_background: Venture investor and entrepreneur — founded Growth Technology Partners (general partner), served as partner at Flight Ventures, and joined 10X Capital via the GTP acquisition to become General Partner / Co‑Head of Venture Capital and COO/Head of Origination on certain 10X vehicles. Prior to VC he co‑founded startups isocket and RoomHunt. Education: BS (Indiana University — Kelley) and MBA (Dartmouth — Tuck).
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer‑oriented software and technology (FinTech, consumer internet, SaaS/EdTech, healthcare/life sciences); early‑to‑growth stage venture investments and partnerships with institutional capital.

enrichment.personal_bio: Dr. Debbie Lin is a corporate venture investor focused on digital health and strategic partnerships. She served as Executive Director for Boehringer Ingelheim Venture Fund leading North American digital-health investments and has held business-development and medical-affairs roles across Boehringer Ingelheim. She is (or has been) Vice President / Head of Strategic Partnerships at Caris Life Sciences and holds a Ph.D. in pharmacogenomics/bioinformatics from UCSF.
enrichment.career_background: Dr. Lin has worked across strategy, corporate development, health economics/outcomes and venture investing. She led Boehringer Ingelheim Venture Fund’s North American digital-health strategy and investments and has held global corporate-development and field medical roles at Boehringer Ingelheim. She has also served in strategic partnerships/partnerships leadership at Caris Life Sciences, taught/mentored at UCLA Anderson and advised accelerator programs. Education includes a Ph.D. from UCSF and graduate degrees from Stanford and UCLA.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage investments in digital health and diagnostics; therapeutics-focused biotech (immuno-oncology, regenerative medicine, infectious diseases); digital biomarkers and translational/clinical technologies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Experienced retail and e-commerce executive; served as President, North American Stores & Online at Staples and later CEO of Barnes & Noble. Founder of CityPark Investments, investing in and advising seed/early-stage companies focused on retail tech, e-commerce, and socially responsible consumer businesses. Serves on/has served on several corporate boards and advisory teams.
enrichment.career_background: Built a 28+ year retail career at Staples rising to President, North American Stores & Online; later served as COO and then CEO at Barnes & Noble. Holds a B.S. in Management from New York University and completed the Advanced Management Program at Harvard Business School. Currently leads CityPark Investments, providing capital, board/advisory support, and consulting to startups in retail, e-commerce and retail technology.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / early-stage investments in retail, e-commerce, retail technology (AR/omnichannel), consumer goods and socially responsible/impact-focused companies

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Santé Ventures and serial life-science entrepreneur. Founder of Apollo Endosurgery and co‑founder of Chrysalis BioTechnology; previously founded SparkMed Advisors. Holds an M.S. in Engineering Management from Stanford and a B.S. (honors) in Aerospace Engineering from the University of Texas at Austin.
interests: Early‑stage company formation and venture creation
Commercialization and go‑to‑market for life sciences
enrichment.career_background: Dennis McWilliams is a life‑science entrepreneur turned investor focused on commercializing medical technologies. He founded Apollo Endosurgery and co‑founded Chrysalis BioTechnology, later founding SparkMed Advisors. He joined Santé in 2019 as a venture partner and was later named a Partner; he serves on multiple startup boards and as an advisor to early‑stage medtech and biotech companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage MedTech, Biotech, and HealthTech (seed through Series A), with emphasis on medical devices, therapeutics/drug discovery, and digitally‑enabled healthcare solutions.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor focused on early-stage healthcare and life sciences. Formerly an associate/senior analyst at Santé Ventures (joined 2018), later joining Frist Cressey Ventures in 2022; prior experience in investment banking at Citi. Graduated B.B.A., Texas Christian University.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Santé Ventures in 2018 and worked on early-stage healthtech, medtech, and biotech investments; served at Santé for ~4 years. Prior to Santé he was an investment banking analyst/senior analyst in Citi’s Financial Institutions Group. In 2022 he joined Frist Cressey Ventures (listed as Principal/Vice President on public profiles). Educated at Texas Christian University (B.B.A.).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage medtech, biotech and healthtech (seed/Series A); health IT and digital health.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director at RiverVest Venture Partners (joined 2019), focused on life‑sciences venture investing, fundraising, and investor relations. Former president & CEO of JDRF and CEO of Divergence, Inc.; previously led M&A and investor relations at Monsanto. Holds an A.B. from Brown University and an MBA from the Wharton School.
enrichment.career_background: Started in M&A at Lazard Freres; served ~10 years as CEO of biotech Divergence, which was acquired by Monsanto; held investor relations and head of M&A roles at Monsanto; was president & CEO of JDRF (2014–2019) before joining RiverVest as Managing Director in 2019, where he focuses on investment strategy, due diligence, fundraising and investor relations.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑ to late‑stage life sciences (biopharma & medical devices); patient‑focused therapeutics; company strategy, M&A, fundraising; building regional innovation ecosystems.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Co‑Managing Director of Green Bay Ventures and co‑founder/chairman emeritus of New Enterprise Associates (NEA). Early investor in companies including Apple and 3Com; longtime venture investor and board member across multiple technology firms. Collector and patron of time‑based media art (the Kramlich Collection). Died February 1, 2025.
enrichment.career_background: Began his venture career as a general partner at Arthur Rock & Co. (1969), co‑founded New Enterprise Associates (NEA) in 1978 and later co‑founded Green Bay Ventures. Served as NEA chairman/board member, held board/advisory roles at multiple companies and organizations, and led investments that became large public or acquired companies. Holds a B.S. from Northwestern University and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed/Series A/B) enterprise and industrial technology — applied AI, data and infrastructure; B2B software; sector applications in manufacturing, energy, transportation, logistics and real‑world infrastructure.

enrichment.personal_bio: Donna Harris is a serial entrepreneur and early-stage investor. She is founder & CEO of Builders + Backers and a co‑founder / General Partner of 1776 Ventures, and has served as Managing Director of the Startup America Partnership. Harris is active on boards and in ecosystem development work focused on expanding access to entrepreneurship.
enrichment.career_background: Donna Harris co‑founded 1776 in 2013 and has served as a General Partner at 1776 Ventures. She founded Builders + Backers (venture studio and investment vehicle) and previously served as Managing Director of the Startup America Partnership. Harris sits on multiple advisory boards and is an active angel investor; she holds a B.S. from Central Michigan University, an MBA from the University of Michigan Ross School of Business, and an honorary Doctor of Laws from American University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early‑stage investments in govtech, fintech, smart cities/transportation, education, health and energy; global focus with emphasis on regulated or impact-driven sectors.

enrichment.personal_bio: Douglas (Doug) Reed, MD is a General Partner at Hatteras Venture Partners (joined 2007) with 20+ years of healthcare venture investing. He focuses on biopharmaceutical and medical-technology investments and serves on multiple portfolio company boards. He holds an MD and BA from the University of Missouri–Kansas City and an MBA from Wharton.
enrichment.career_background: Dr. Reed earned a B.A. and M.D. from the University of Missouri–Kansas City, completed a diagnostic radiology residency at the University of Washington and a neuroradiology fellowship at the University of British Columbia, and held faculty positions at the University of Washington and Yale. He also holds an MBA in Finance and Healthcare Administration from the Wharton School. Prior to Hatteras he worked in venture investing at Vector Fund Management and SR One and served as VP of Business Development at NPS Pharmaceuticals and GelTex Pharmaceuticals.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments across the health care continuum: biopharmaceuticals, medical devices, diagnostics and healthcare IT (human medicine).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of Fiat Growth and General Partner at Fiat Ventures. Focuses on early‑stage fintech that improves financial access and inclusion, bringing operator experience in growth, partnerships and marketplace scaling. Raised in East Oakland and previously led marketplace and growth roles at Steady and other firms.
enrichment.career_background: Drew Glover co‑founded Fiat Growth (2019) and co‑founded Fiat Ventures (2021), where he serves as a General Partner. Earlier roles include VP of Marketplace at Steady and business development / director roles at Namely, Fjord and Portal A. He also serves as an advisor to several fintech startups and has lectured at UC Berkeley.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage fintech focused on financial access and inclusion; embedded payments and payments infrastructure; operator‑led growth/partnership plays

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO/Partner of AccelR8 Ventures, an impact fund focused on accelerating reduction and sequestration of greenhouse gases. Former long‑time Bain Capital partner who ran Bain Capital’s European private equity business. Based in the Boston area and active on nonprofit and higher‑education boards.
interests: Just economic transition and climate policy
enrichment.career_background: Dwight Poler began in M&A at Morgan Stanley, worked at Bain & Company, and joined Bain Capital in 1994. He opened and led Bain Capital’s European private equity business for ~18 years, deploying substantial equity across multiple funds; he retired from full‑time duties in 2018 and remains a Senior Advisor to Bain. Since then he founded AccelR8 to invest in early‑stage climate and sequestration technologies and serves on several nonprofit and institutional boards (e.g., Amherst College, The Boston Foundation, MIT Media Lab advisory roles).
enrichment.investment_focus: Climate tech / cleantech; advanced materials; sustainable carbon reduction & sequestration; early‑stage venture (seed and Series A); impact investing (just economic transition)

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture investor who led U.S. venture and growth investing at Mousse Partners. Spent over a decade at Mousse in roles from Investment Professional to Director and has participated in venture and growth-stage deals across consumer, marketplaces and agtech. Educated A.B. in Economics from Princeton University.
enrichment.career_background: Worked at Mousse Partners from the early 2000s through at least the mid-2010s, holding titles including Investment Professional, Vice President and Director; led venture/growth investing for the firm in the U.S. and served on boards such as Harvest Automation. Holds an A.B. in Economics from Princeton University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Venture and growth-stage investments (U.S.), with emphasis on consumer & e-commerce, agtech/horticulture, hardware/robotics and marketplaces

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at First Star Ventures and founding Managing Director at Angelini Ventures. PhD (Computer Science) from Leiden University with an early career in genomics (participated in human genome annotation). Senior roles include data science/bioinformatics at Dana-Farber and leadership of the Life Sciences business at Health Catalyst; serves on boards and as advisor to biotech and deep‑tech startups.
enrichment.career_background: Elia Stupka is a scientist‑turned‑operator and investor with 20+ years across academic, clinical and industry settings. He began in genomics (part of early human genome annotation teams), held research leadership roles in Europe and Asia, served as Director of Genomics & Computational Biology at Boehringer Ingelheim, led data science at Dana‑Farber Cancer Institute, and ran the Life Sciences business at Health Catalyst before moving into venture roles (Venture Partner at First Star Ventures, founding Managing Director at Angelini Ventures).
enrichment.investment_focus: Frontier computing and deep‑tech applied to life sciences and AI: AI/ML, computational biotechnology (techbio), data science/bioinformatics; typically pre‑seed/seed/early‑stage investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Emily Man is a venture investor focused on fintech and B2B/enterprise software. She was Vice President on Redpoint’s early-growth team and has invested in companies including Ramp and FloQast. In August 2023 she joined Primary Venture Partners as a fintech-focused partner.
enrichment.career_background: Emily Man earned a B.A. in Financial Economics from Columbia University. She began her career as a public-markets analyst at Point72, helped build Point72 Ventures, then served as Vice President on Redpoint Ventures’ early-growth team where she led fintech and growth investments. She joined Primary Venture Partners as a fintech partner in August 2023.
enrichment.hometown: Grew up across Indiana (USA), Shanghai, and Beijing.
enrichment.investment_focus: Fintech and financial infrastructure; B2B / enterprise & vertical SaaS; payments and embedded finance; early-growth stages (Series A–B)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Director of Arkitekt Ventures, an early-stage VC focused on Health & Bio. Trained neuroscientist (Ph.D., Columbia) with an MBA from Harvard Business School. Active early-stage investor and board observer in companies advancing digital health, biotech and neurotech.
enrichment.career_background: Dr. Enke Bashllari founded Arkitekt Ventures in 2017 and leads the firm’s early-stage investments in Health & Bio. She holds a Ph.D. from Columbia University and an MBA from Harvard Business School, has served as a board observer (e.g., Nanite), and is active as an investor and advisor across clinical care, health IT and biotech startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage Health & Bio (Pre-seed / Seed / Series A) — digital health, biotech, neurotech, healthcare delivery, and health IT.

enrichment.personal_bio: Private / angel investor active since the 1990s, focused on fintech, AI and mobile/enterprise software. Founder of Active Starts and co‑founder/general partner at Convergence Partners; has participated in multiple seed and early‑stage rounds. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area (location listed on public profiles).
enrichment.career_background: Professional investor for 25+ years. Previously a general partner at Convergence Partners and Managing Director of U.S. VC funds at BANEXI; earlier experience in transactions and restructuring at PARGESA/Lambert and M&A at Bankers Trust/Deutsche Bank. Founded Active Starts to run a professional angel program and has served on boards/advisory roles for several portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: FinTech, AI/ML, mobile & enterprise software; primarily seed and early-stage angel investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Geonetric and an active angel investor; led Geonetric from 1999–2016 and has invested in 40+ companies via regional accelerator programs. General Partner at ISA Ventures, leading the firms efforts to fund and scale Iowa-based startups across multiple sectors. Also a founder of NewBoCo/Iowa Startup Accelerator and a mentor in the Midwest startup ecosystem.
enrichment.career_background: Founded and led Geonetric (1999016). Founded New Bohemian Innovation Collaborative (NewBoCo) and Iowa Startup Accelerator; served as Executive Director and later Board Chair. Founding General Partner of ISA Ventures (multi-stage, Iowa-focused VC) and listed as Partner at Novy (venture studio) beginning 2023. Has served on the board of Scrum Alliance and other regional organizations.
enrichment.investment_focus: Iowa-based early-stage, scale-up and expansion companies (typical check $25Kor pre-seed/seed up to $1M); sector focus includes biotechnology, healthcare/medical technologies, education tech, engineering & automation, agriculture/food/bioprocessing, insurance & finance technologies, and transportation & logistics.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Contrary, a San Francisco–based venture firm that focuses on identifying and investing in early-career talent and early-stage technology companies. Contrary has been an early backer of companies including Ramp, Anduril, DoorDash and Vise. Tarczynski was named to Forbes 30 Under 30 (Venture Capital).
interests: Research and publishing on tech trends
enrichment.career_background: Eric Tarczynski founded Contrary (launched 2016/2017) and serves as its Managing Partner; the firm combines a scouting/talent network, in-house research, and seed/early-stage investing. Before Contrary he was an early employee at Kamcord and co‑founded a student payments startup; he also publishes Contrary Research and related publications.
enrichment.investment_focus: Talent-driven, early-stage technology investing (pre-seed/seed through Series A); sectors include fintech, enterprise software, consumer internet, and frontier/defense tech; primary geographies North America and India.

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial entrepreneur and co-founder of High Alpha; former founder/CEO of iGoDigital (acquired by ExactTarget/Salesforce) and former VP of Product at Salesforce Marketing Cloud. Based in Indianapolis, he is an operating partner at High Alpha and serves on multiple startup boards. Active angel investor focused on B2B software companies.
enrichment.career_background: Eric Tobias is a co-founder and operating partner at High Alpha (founded 2015). He previously founded and led multiple startups (including iGoDigital) to exits, served as VP of Product at Salesforce Marketing Cloud, and now invests in and sits on boards of early-stage software companies. He holds a B.A. from Indiana University and is based in Indianapolis.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage B2B SaaS and enterprise software (seed to Series A); product-led enterprise applications and go-to-market scale

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of WestRiver Group, Erik Anderson is a global innovation leader, investor and philanthropist who builds and funds companies across technology, experiential entertainment, decarbonization and life sciences. He has led multiple SPACs in the decarbonization sector and holds board roles including Chairman of Hyzon Motors and a seat on Solid Power; he has also served as Vice Chairman of Callaway/Topgolf. Anderson has held executive and investment roles at Singularity Group, Matthew G. Norton Co., Frazier and Goldman Sachs.
enrichment.career_background: Erik Anderson founded WestRiver Group in 2002 and serves as its CEO, leading thematic investments and company-building across technology, experience, decarbonization and life sciences. He has led SPAC transactions focused on decarbonization, served as Executive Chairman of Topgolf, holds leadership roles at Singularity Group and ONEHOPE, and previously worked at Frazier (partner), Matthew G. Norton Co. (CEO) and Goldman Sachs (VP). He holds degrees from Stanford University and Claremont McKenna College.
enrichment.investment_focus: Technology; Experience/experiential entertainment; Decarbonization/clean energy; Life sciences/biotech & digital health

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Indicator Capital, based in California and São Paulo. 25+ years in technology and venture capital with senior roles at Intel/Intel Capital, IBM and Lucent; holds an MBA from University of Chicago (Booth) and a BS in Electronic Engineering from Poli‑USP. Leads Indicator's value‑creation methodology and Silicon Valley operations.
enrichment.career_background: Early career included roles at IBM and Lucent, and founding an internet incubator (South‑Net). Spent over a decade at Intel/Intel Capital in investment and business development roles across Latin America before co‑founding Indicator Capital, where he focuses on deep‑tech and IoT investments and hands‑on portfolio value creation.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage deep tech and IoT investments (seed to Series A); connectivity, edge AI, industrial IoT and smart cities.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Uncle Nearest Premium Whiskey (launched 2017) who built the brand to honor Nathan “Nearest” Green. Founder of the Nearest Green Foundation and creator of the Uncle Nearest Venture Fund to back minority- and women-owned spirits brands. Author and board member (Endeavor); previously an entrepreneur in events, hospitality and real estate.
interests: Investing in BIPOC- and women-founded beverage brands
enrichment.career_background: Entrepreneur and author who launched Uncle Nearest after researching Nathan “Nearest” Green’s history; built Nearest Green Distillery in Shelbyville, TN and an all-female leadership team, founded the Nearest Green Foundation, and established Uncle Nearest Ventures (a $50M pledge to invest in minority- and women-owned spirits/consumer brands). Previously founded FEW Entertainment and Grant Sidney Inc., and serves on corporate and industry boards.
previous_investments: Domaine Saint Martin (Grande Champagne estate, Cognac)
enrichment.investment_focus: Spirits & alcoholic beverages; consumer food & beverage brands; minority- and women-owned founders; corporate venture/growth-stage consumer investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director and founder of Aristos Ventures, a Dallas-based VC focused on early-stage technology companies in Texas. Has led investments in companies including Theatro, Nimbix, JamKazam, CloudCoreo (acquired by VMware) and others. Holds an MBA from Southern Methodist University and a BS in Mechanical Engineering from Texas Tech University.
enrichment.career_background: Founded Aristos Ventures in 2012 after leading early-stage technology investments for the ORIX Texas Technology & Infrastructure Fund. Previously worked at GLP Advisors (a Sevin Rosen affiliate), co-founded TAC Portfolio Advisors, and served as CFO/Associate at Silver Creek Ventures. Earlier career includes engineering and management roles at Cisco, Monterey Networks, Flextronics, Yotta Networks, Boehringer Mannheim, Alcatel‑Lucent and DSC Communications.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage, capital-efficient technology companies (primarily Texas) in SaaS/cloud infrastructure, web-based applications/information services, security, and mobile enrichment; seed to Series A.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Hatteras Venture Partners who advises and supports companies serving the healthcare market. Over 30–35 years of executive experience across healthcare, financial services and manufacturing. Former SVP of Operations and Strategic Development and CIO at Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina; former CEO of RealMed and former COO of AlignCare.
enrichment.career_background: Experienced healthcare operator and advisor: retired SVP (Operations & Strategic Development) and CIO from Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina; served as CEO of RealMed (managed sale to Availity), COO of Community Care of North Carolina Services, and COO of AlignCare; now a Venture Partner at Hatteras providing strategic and operational support to portfolio companies.
previous_investments: Community Care of North Carolina Services
enrichment.investment_focus: Biopharmaceuticals, medical devices, diagnostics, healthcare IT; seed and early-stage healthcare investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Former city transportation commissioner and urban mobility entrepreneur. Co‑founder of CityFi and author of Start‑Up City; served as a Special/Venture Partner at Fontinalis and as Executive Director of the U.S. Joint Office of Energy & Transportation (2022–2025). Advises and boards multiple mobility and urban tech startups.
enrichment.career_background: Started in the cycling and shared‑mobility sector (Bikes USA, Zipcar), founded On The Fly and CityFi, served as Director of DDOT (Washington, D.C.) and Commissioner of CDOT (Chicago), then moved to the private/venture sector as a Special/Venture Partner at Fontinalis Partners and advisor/board member to mobility startups; served as Executive Director of the U.S. Joint Office of Energy & Transportation (2022–2025).
enrichment.investment_focus: Next‑generation mobility and transportation technology; urban mobility, micromobility, shared mobility; typically seed–Series A and early‑stage investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at Quona Capital, where he leads the firm’s India and Southeast Asia investment strategy. Experienced investor focused on fintech and financial inclusion with prior roles at Accion Frontier Investments, Lok Capital and Unitus; co‑founded Travelguru. Holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and engineering/management degrees from IIT‑BHU and IIM Calcutta.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at Quona (since 2014), previously led Accion Frontier Investments in Asia, was a General Partner at Lok Capital and Asia Director at Unitus; helped lead Greylock Partners’ entry into India, co‑founded Travelguru, and began his career at Infosys.
enrichment.investment_focus: Fintech and fintech adjacencies in emerging markets (India, Southeast Asia, Latin America, Africa, MENA); payments, lending, SME finance, insurtech and embedded finance; growth and growth‑stage venture investments (Series A–B and follow‑on).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and CEO of Roofstock, a marketplace and platform for single-family rental (SFR) investing. Known for helping institutionalize SFR as an asset class after prior leadership roles at Starwood Waypoint/Waypoint Homes, ZipRealty and KSL Resorts. Holds a BA in Economics from Northwestern University and an MBA from Stanford Graduate School of Business.
enrichment.career_background: Seasoned operator and founder with decades in real estate, hospitality and tech. Previously served as co-CEO of Starwood Waypoint Residential Trust (public REIT), CEO of Waypoint Homes, CFO/President at ZipRealty (led IPO), and leadership roles at KSL Resorts, Joie de Vivre and GreenVolts before co-founding Roofstock in 2015.
enrichment.investment_focus: PropTech and the single-family rental ecosystem; early-stage (seed/pre-seed) investments and strategic investments in real-estate, hospitality and related fintech/marketplace startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Senior Vice President / Head of Nasdaq Ventures. Over 20 years of private equity, venture and strategic direct investment experience, previously a Managing Director at Morgan Stanley. Holds an M.B.A. from Columbia Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Leads Nasdaq’s corporate venture arm (Nasdaq Ventures), directing minority growth investments that align with Nasdaq’s strategic priorities. Prior roles include Managing Director, Global Head of Principal Strategic Investments at Morgan Stanley and earlier venture/private equity work; has held board and board‑observer roles at multiple market-technology and fintech companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed through late-stage minority investments in fintech, market infrastructure, data & analytics, blockchain/digital assets, AI, and regtech (strategic alignment with Nasdaq business units).

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at OpenView Venture Partners (joined 2007). Former Executive Vice President of North American Sales at Oracle (1990–2003). Advises expansion-stage SaaS and enterprise software companies on go-to-market, scaling and operational execution.
enrichment.career_background: George Roberts spent 13 years at Oracle, most recently as Executive Vice President of North American Sales, and earlier held executive roles at System 5 and Applied Data Research. Since 2003 he has made private investments and served on multiple software company boards; he joined OpenView as a Venture Partner in 2007 to focus on expansion-stage, go-to-market heavy investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Expansion-stage B2B software (SaaS/cloud), go-to-market and sales-led scaling, product-led growth, enterprise software and vertical/digital health

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Chairman of Capital Factory, Gordon Daugherty is a bestselling author, startup advisor and longtime angel/VC investor. He has served on multiple company boards and advisory teams and is active teaching founders (Founders Academy) and mentoring via his Shockwave Innovations practice. He is a native Texan and holds a B.S. in Computer Science from Baylor University.
enrichment.career_background: Gordon co‑founded Capital Factory (Austin) and leads investments, mentorship and founder education there. He runs Shockwave Innovations (advisory/content), has held executive roles at companies including NetQoS and VCON, and has served on boards or as advisor to firms such as Apptronik, SwimTopia and Riskpulse. He has authored a book on startup fundraising and has been involved in hundreds of early‑stage investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage technology startups (seed–Series A); fundraising and go‑to‑market/customer acquisition; technology‑agnostic accelerator investments

enrichment.personal_bio: President of Baird Capital. Oversees strategic, operational and organizational activities for Baird’s direct private investment business and chairs the investment committee for the firm’s venture and global private equity funds. Previously a principal at One Equity Partners and founder/CEO of The Pangaea Group; holds a B.A. from Colgate University and an MBA from Kellogg School of Management.
enrichment.career_background: Has served as President of Baird Capital and a member of Baird’s Executive Committee. Prior roles include principal at One Equity Partners and founder/CEO of The Pangaea Group (international consulting focused on China). Active on advisory boards including Team IMPACT and the Private Equity Alumni Council at Kellogg. Education: B.A. in economics and Asian studies (Colgate University) and MBA (Kellogg School of Management).
enrichment.investment_focus: Venture capital, growth equity and global private equity focused on founder‑led, lower‑middle‑market B2B technology & services businesses; selective healthcare and fintech; support for international expansion (U.S., U.K., Asia).

enrichment.personal_bio: Early-stage investor and operator focused on consumer brands. Co‑founder and General Partner at Touch Capital; previously worked at Apple (London), PCH International, and on the early-stage team at Index Ventures. Founded the retail concept School of the Digital Age and has advised UK government bodies on digital industrialisation and economic justice.
enrichment.career_background: Grace began her career at Apple in London, served in global retail strategy at PCH International, and worked on early‑stage investments at Index Ventures and an advisory group for entertainers and athletes. She founded School of the Digital Age and in 2022 co‑founded Touch Capital, where she invests in food, beverage, pet and personal care brands.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer brands (food, beverage, pet, personal care); early‑stage to growth consumer CPG; founder & retail go‑to‑market support

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner and co-founder of Anorak Ventures. Entrepreneur-turned-venture investor focused on early-stage, disruptive technology; has worked with or invested in dozens of seed-stage companies including Oculus, Flexport, Anduril, Mux and Rec Room. Based in Los Angeles / San Francisco with an international investment scope.
enrichment.career_background: Previously co‑founded and served as co‑CEO of the UK retail chain Pure, then served in marketing roles at Scaleform (acquired 2011), Autodesk (Game Technology Group) and Glassdoor (acquired 2018) before founding Anorak Ventures to invest in pre-seed and seed-stage technology companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage investments in VR/AR, robotics, autonomous systems, computer vision, AI/deep learning, 3D/spatial tech and hardware-enabled services; international scope.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner and founder of Bascom Ventures (an Alumni Ventures fund). Managing Partner at Alumni Ventures since 2017 with 100+ investments across early-to-late stage companies. Holds a B.S. in Mechanical Engineering from the University of Wisconsin (’86) and an MBA from Duke University�Fuqua (’91).
enrichment.career_background: Experienced corporate and startup executive: former President & CEO of 2D2C, VP Corporate Development and Acting Division President at Woodhead Industries, Director of Corporate Development at Tenneco, and financial analyst roles at AlliedSignal. Founded Bascom Ventures and runs multiple Alumni Ventures funds, focusing on sourcing UW-alum founders and co-investing alongside top-tier VCs.
enrichment.investment_focus: UW-alumni-founded companies; stage-agnostic (pre-seed to pre-IPO); sector-agnostic with emphasis on technology, biotech/healthcare, and industrial/hardware.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Tiger Global Management based in New York. Leads private-investment activity across robotics, logistics, enterprise software and consumer internet. Holds an MBA from Harvard Business School (reported).
enrichment.career_background: Partner at Tiger Global Management where he sources and leads private-equity and venture investments across hardware, software and logistics sectors. Profile records list multiple led investments in robotics, fulfillment and enterprise companies; education reported as an MBA from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Robotics & automation; logistics/fulfillment; enterprise software; consumer internet/marketplaces; growth-stage private investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at MBX Capital, an early‑stage venture firm focused on healthcare, life sciences, and environmental health. Teaches health and biotech investing at Yale School of Management. Former COO of FundRx with prior roles at Bain & Company and Morgan Stanley. Education includes an MPH (Yale School of Public Health) and undergraduate degrees from Duke University.
interests: Impact / effective altruism and philanthropic pledges
enrichment.career_background: Gurdane co‑founded MBX Capital and serves as a Managing Partner, holding board roles at multiple portfolio companies. Previously he was COO and co‑founder at FundRx and worked as a consultant at Bain & Company and in public finance at Morgan Stanley. He is on the faculty at Yale School of Management (teaching health and biotech investing) and holds an MPH from Yale and undergraduate degrees from Duke; he is a Kauffman Fellow and was a Lord Rothermere Scholar at Oxford.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage healthcare and life sciences (biotech, diagnostics, clinical platforms) and environmental health addressing root causes of illness.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Portage Ventures based in Paris, investing in early-stage and growth-stage fintech. Focuses on insurtech, regulated financial businesses and financial-services infrastructure. Former CEO of Open CNP and Head of Private Equity at CNP Assurances; holds an Executive MBA from HEC Paris.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Portage as a Partner to lead European sourcing and investments. Previously founded and served as CEO of Open CNP (the corporate venture arm of CNP Assurances); served as Head of Private Equity at CNP (managing a reported €7.5bn AUM) and earlier led investments for Ecureuil Vie. Has chaired the AFIC LPs club and is a member of Level 20. Educated at HEC Paris (Master’s and Executive MBA).
enrichment.investment_focus: Fintech — insurance (insurtech), consumer & SMB finance, wealth & asset management, enablers/payments; seed to growth-stage (seed–Series C); Europe & UK focus.
