enrichment.investment_focus: Clean technology, healthcare/biotech and information technology; multi‑stage (early through growth) venture and growth equity investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner on Baird Capital’s U.S. Venture (Technology & Services) team; joined Baird Capital in 2014 and was promoted to Partner in 2021. Serves as a board member of companies including ChurnZero, SourceDay, Apica and FullContact and is based in Chicago.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Robert W. Baird’s organization in research and investment-banking roles, moved to Baird Capital in 2014 to focus on Technology & Services venture investments, and was promoted to Partner in 2021. Prior to Baird Capital she worked in equity research, investment banking and business development; she holds a B.S. in Management & International Business from Indiana University and an MBA from Wharton (University of Pennsylvania).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early- and growth-stage B2B SaaS and enterprise technology; Technology & Services (U.S. venture)

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at f7 Ventures. Former early Facebook employee (one of the first 100), later served as COO at Premise Data and COO/Chief Business Officer at Atrium. Harvard BA; board director at mPharma and founding partner of f7 Ventures.
enrichment.career_background: Joanna joined Facebook in 2006 and spent ~9 years building teams across user operations, site integrity, product operations and launching Facebook India. After Facebook she served as COO at Premise Data and Atrium, was an EIR at Social Capital, and is a founding partner and General Partner at f7 Ventures, where she focuses on early‑stage investments and operator support.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and pre‑seed investments in Future of Work, consumer utility and health/consumer tech; operator‑led teams.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Emergence Capital focused on early-stage enterprise SaaS and AI infrastructure. Holds an MBA from The Wharton School and dual degrees from UC Berkeley. A second‑generation immigrant who prioritizes backing founders from underrepresented backgrounds.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Emergence Capital in 2012 and is a General Partner leading investments in enterprise software and AI infrastructure. Previously a Senior Associate at American Capital and an Associate at McKinsey & Company. Education: MBA, The Wharton School; BA and BS, University of California, Berkeley.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage enterprise SaaS, industry cloud, and enterprise AI (AI infrastructure); go-to-market and sales scaling.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Accolade Partners, a Washington, D.C.-based venture and growth equity fund-of-funds. Previously a managing director at Alex. Brown & Sons and the first CFO of its ABS Ventures affiliate. Holds an MBA from Stanford GSB and a BA from Smith College. Serves on the board of Rockefeller University and the Yellowstone Community Foundation.
interests: Supporting women-led and diverse fund managers
enrichment.career_background: Joelle Kayden founded Accolade Partners in 2000 after an 18-year career at Alex. Brown & Sons where she served as CFO of ABS Ventures and later as a Managing Director running the Venture Capital Services Group. At Accolade she has led the firm’s strategy allocating to top-tier venture, growth equity and blockchain funds and has overseen multiple fund closings and dedicated vehicles for diverse and women-led managers.
enrichment.investment_focus: Fund-of-funds investing in venture capital, growth equity and blockchain funds with a primary sector focus on technology and healthcare; selective direct co-investments; emphasis on women-led and diverse managers.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner and Chairman of Peterson Partners and a consulting professor at Stanford Graduate School of Business since 1992. Former CEO of Trammell Crow Company and former chairman of JetBlue Airways; long-time board director and investor. Author on leadership and entrepreneurship.
enrichment.career_background: Built a career in real estate and private investing: served in senior leadership at Trammell Crow Company before founding Peterson Partners, has taught at Stanford GSB since 1992, and has held board and chair roles at companies including JetBlue, FranklinCovey, Packsize and others.
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth-oriented private equity, venture capital and search funds; sector focus on software, business services, consumer & retail, healthcare, transportation and industrial.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Quona Capital focused on fintech for inclusion in emerging markets, based in Cape Town. Joined Quona in 2016 as a Venture Partner and became Partner in January 2018; he has led consumer finance, insurance and mobile lending initiatives in Africa and previously worked at Goldman Sachs and a Swiss Re subsidiary. citeturn1view0
enrichment.career_background: Joined Quona Capital in 2016 as a Venture Partner and promoted to Partner in January 2018. Prior to Quona he spent 10+ years building consumer finance, insurance and fintech businesses in Africa, including launching an automated mobile-only unsecured loan product; earlier career roles include Goldman Sachs and a Swiss Re subsidiary; holds a Bachelor of Economics from Stellenbosch University. citeturn3search6
enrichment.investment_focus: Fintech for inclusion; consumer finance & digital lending; embedded finance; insurance/insurtech; emerging markets (Africa, Latin America, India, MENA).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Hatteras Venture Partners, responsible for the firm’s investments in healthcare and life‑science information technology and overall fund operations. Previously founder and CEO of E‑Comm (acquired by XcelleNet) and ran the services division at XcelleNet until its acquisition by Sterling Commerce. Serves/has served on multiple portfolio boards and observers. Holds an A.B. from Harvard University.
enrichment.career_background: John co‑founded Hatteras Venture Partners in 2000 after a career as a technology entrepreneur and a decade in politics and public policy. He founded and was CEO of E‑Comm, Inc., which was acquired by XcelleNet; he then led XcelleNet’s services division through its acquisition by Sterling Commerce. At Hatteras he leads investments in healthcare and life‑science information technology, serves on multiple portfolio company boards and observers, and is active in regional public‑private organizations and nonprofit boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Healthcare & life‑sciences (healthcare IT, clinical research infrastructure, digital health, biopharma, medical devices & diagnostics); seed and early‑stage investing.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at Helium-3 Ventures, a New York–based venture firm. Focuses on seed and early/growth-stage investments across energy, space, robotics/hardware and e-commerce. Public investor profiles list multiple portfolio companies led or co-invested by Helium-3.
enrichment.career_background: Founding Partner at Helium-3 Ventures (founded 2021) and active in sourcing and leading early-stage investments. Other prior roles and education are not consistently documented in public profiles.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early/growth-stage startups in energy & climate, space, robotics/hardware, deep tech, e-commerce and fintech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Author and investor; founder and General Partner of Wild Ventures. Led early investments and pre-launch advising for consumer health brands including Thrive Market, Primal Kitchen, Magic Spoon and LMNT. Author of The Paleo Manifesto and co-author of Spartan Fit. Based in Austin, Texas.
enrichment.career_background: Founder and General Partner at Wild Ventures (seed/early-stage fund focused on consumer health). Previously authored The Paleo Manifesto and co‑authored Spartan Fit; has served as advisor or board member to multiple consumer health companies (including pre-launch advising for Thrive Market, Primal Kitchen, Kettle & Fire, Magic Spoon) and studied history at Harvard.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage consumer health: food & beverage and wellness CPG, consumer health tech, D2C/influencer-driven distribution

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Noodle; veteran EdTech entrepreneur who previously founded The Princeton Review and 2U. Active angel investor and board member in education-technology organizations. Based in New York City.
interests: Online degree programs and OPM models
enrichment.career_background: John Katzman founded The Princeton Review in 1981, later co-founded 2U (launched 2008), and created The Noodle Companies (Noodle) around 2010–2013, where he serves as CEO. He has authored books on education, served on several nonprofit and company boards (e.g., Carnegie Learning, Renaissance Learning, Woodrow Wilson Foundation), and has invested in multiple early-stage education companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: EdTech and higher-education startups (seed to Series A), learning platforms, enrollment/retention services

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner at Lakehouse Ventures, a NYC-based pre-seed/seed VC. Formerly worked in investment banking and portfolio management at Brown Brothers Harriman, Credit Suisse, GoldenTree, and AB Bernstein. Leads investments in consumer-facing products, marketplaces, and early-stage health and fintech startups. Serves on boards including Knaq, Mixlab and Aurie.
enrichment.career_background: John Neamonitis founded Lakehouse Ventures (founded 2016/2017) after ~10 years in investment banking and portfolio management (Brown Brothers Harriman, Credit Suisse, GoldenTree Asset Management, AB Bernstein). He co‑founded WorkOf and now focuses on leading pre‑seed and seed investments and serving on boards/observer roles for portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / Seed — consumer products, consumer health, e‑commerce, fintech/financial services, food & beverage, education, marketplaces

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner of Geodesic Capital and former U.S. Ambassador to Japan (2009–2013). Previously CEO and Senior Partner at Wilson Sonsini Goodrich & Rosati. Serves on the board of Salesforce and holds advisory roles with the Toyota Research Institute and Centerview Partners.
interests: Deep tech and national‑security technologies (space, robotics, cybersecurity)
Japan market entry and international expansion
enrichment.career_background: John V. Roos co‑founded Geodesic Capital in 2015 to connect Silicon Valley and Japan. He served as U.S. Ambassador to Japan from 2009–2013 and prior to that was CEO and Senior Partner at Wilson Sonsini Goodrich & Rosati. He is a board director at Salesforce and holds advisory roles with Toyota Research Institute and Centerview Partners.
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth‑stage and later‑stage technology companies (enterprise software, data/AI infrastructure); deep tech and national‑security relevant startups (space, robotics, cybersecurity); facilitating Japan market entry and U.S.–Japan commercial partnerships.

enrichment.personal_bio: John Serafini is a venture partner on Shield Capital’s investment committee and the CEO and co‑founder of HawkEye 360. He is a West Point graduate, former U.S. Army infantry officer, and holds an MBA and MPA from Harvard.
enrichment.career_background: Serafini served as a U.S. Army infantry officer before earning degrees from Harvard Business School and the Harvard Kennedy School. He was Senior Vice President at Allied Minds where he led formation and financing of multiple dual‑use technology companies, founded/co‑founded several startups, and since 2015 has been CEO of HawkEye 360. He joined Shield Capital as a venture partner and investment committee member to support early‑stage national security and frontier tech investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage and seed venture investing in AI, autonomy, cybersecurity, space and other dual‑use national security technologies

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of Redpoint Ventures (1999) and partner emeritus with a focus on product innovation and design. Works with companies building consumer and enterprise applications of software; has supported security, infrastructure and semiconductor-related businesses. Serves on cultural and university boards and has been part of the Golden State Warriors ownership group.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Redpoint in 1999 and has served as a partner; earlier roles include general partner at Brentwood Venture Capital and work at Hewlett‑Packard and the Stanford Smart Product Design Laboratory. Advises Stanford engineering, is a trustee of SFMOMA, and holds B.S. and M.S. degrees in engineering plus an MBA from Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed through growth‑stage investments in consumer and enterprise software, cloud infrastructure, developer/platform tools and security.

enrichment.personal_bio: Jonah Goodhart is a New York–based entrepreneur and angel investor. He co-founded WGI Group and co-founded and served as CEO of Moat (acquired by Oracle). He currently co-runs Montauk Labs and invests in early-stage technology companies, particularly in adtech and media.
enrichment.career_background: Jonah began building internet businesses at Cornell (Colonize.com), was a founding investor in Right Media, co-founded Smarter Ad Group, and co-founded Moat (served as CEO; acquired by Oracle). He is a founding partner of WGI Group (seed/early-stage fund) and co-founder of Montauk Labs; he sits on several boards and advises adtech/media startups. He studied at Cornell University (B.A.).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage technology investments (adtech, enterprise SaaS, consumer internet, media/publisher tech)

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner of Entrepreneurs Roundtable Accelerator (ERA) and co‑founder of Remarkable Ventures. Former entrepreneur (co‑founder of Music123 and MusicGremlin, the latter acquired by SanDisk) and early‑stage investor and advisor. Holds an A.B. in Social Studies magna cum laude from Harvard University.
enrichment.career_background: Started his career at McKinsey & Company, then co‑founded Music123 and later MusicGremlin (co‑CEO), which was acquired by SanDisk. Since 2011 he has been a venture investor and operator: co‑founder and Managing Partner at ERA and co‑founder/Managing Partner at Remarkable Ventures (including Remarkable Ventures Climate). Serves on New York State’s Innovation Venture Capital Fund advisory committee and the Board of Overseers at Beth Israel Medical Center.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) technology startups via accelerator-driven investments; consumer & enterprise software, media/digital products; climate/clean‑tech (Remarkable Ventures Climate)

enrichment.personal_bio: Product-oriented B2B go-to-market executive and angel investor. Chief Operating Officer at Vidyard (joined 2023) and serves as a Venture Advisor at Relay Ventures. Former senior sales leader at LinkedIn and earlier roles at Google and AOL; sits on several private company boards.
enrichment.career_background: Jonathan Lister is COO of Vidyard (appointed January 2023) and is listed as a Venture Advisor at Relay Ventures. He spent over a decade in senior sales and go-to-market roles at LinkedIn (including VP, Global Sales Solutions) and previously held leadership roles at Google Canada and AOL. Lister has acted as an angel investor and served on boards/advisory councils for companies such as Panasas and Service Inspired Restaurants.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / early-stage B2B SaaS, SalesTech / Martech, digital media; advisor roles for early-stage startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of DealerSocket and former CEO who remains a strategic investor and active board member. Based in San Clemente, California. Angel investor with recorded investments in companies such as Alleva and Filevine.
interests: SaaS/CRM and sales automation for dealerships
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded DealerSocket (circa 2000/2001) and served as CEO until transitioning to strategic investor and board member in 2017. Holds board roles or has been involved with Filevine, GUIDEcx, Model Match, enerflo and Automotive Broadcasting Network. Educated at Brigham Young University (BS and Master’s in accounting/information systems).
enrichment.investment_focus: Automotive technology; dealership SaaS (CRM, DMS, inventory & sales tools); early-stage/angel investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Product and operations leader focused on applied AI in healthcare. Vice President, Generative AI and Head of Tempus One at Tempus; also a venture partner/advisor and angel investor. Educated at the University of Michigan (BA) and Northwestern University (MS).
enrichment.career_background: Early Tempus team member who built and led product and clinical data programs (Director of Product → Senior Director Operations → VP, Generative AI / Head of Tempus One). Co-founder of WÜF (IoT consumer product), adjunct lecturer at Northwestern, inventor on issued patents, and active advisor/angel investor and venture partner (including Good Growth Capital and Great North Ventures).
enrichment.investment_focus: Stage: Seed–Series A; Sectors: digital health and precision medicine, generative AI / ML, enterprise SaaS, XR/consumer tech, IoT & hardware.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and Managing Partner at Quona Capital, where he leads the firm’s Latin America investment strategy. He is a seasoned investor and entrepreneur with 25+ years of experience in Latin America, previously co-founding Acesso (prepaid financial services) and managing Darby Technology Ventures. His work focuses on fintech solutions serving underserved consumers and small businesses.
enrichment.career_background: Jonathan Whittle co-founded Quona Capital in 2015 and serves as a Managing Partner leading Latin America investments. Prior roles include Managing Director, Frontier Investments Group at Accion (2014–2015), co‑founder & CEO of Acesso Soluções de Pagamentos (2010–2013), and Head of Darby Technology Ventures (2002–2011). Earlier in his career he was part of the founding teams of Diveo and Optiglobe (now Tivit).
enrichment.investment_focus: Fintech for financial inclusion in emerging markets — payments, lending, embedded finance; early to growth-stage venture investments (Seed through Series A/B).

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at VMG Partners focused on diligence, deal execution and portfolio oversight for branded consumer companies. Bay Area native raised in Marin County; attended UC Berkeley. Works primarily with natural/organic food, beverage and wellness brands.
enrichment.career_background: Joined VMG Partners in 2012 and was promoted to Partner (announced 2020). Previously an associate at Castanea Partners and an analyst at Harris Williams. Holds a BS from the University of California, Berkeley.
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth equity/private equity in branded consumer products (food & beverage, wellness/nutrition, beauty/personal care, pet), DTC and consumer-facing technologies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner, Head of Investment Team and COO at Geodesic Capital. Covers the FinTech sector and supports growth-stage technology companies expanding into Japan/Asia. Previously an investment banker with Greenhill & Co. (Tokyo & New York) and J.P. Morgan; also served in business development at Crowley Technologies. Holds an MBA (Wharton) and an A.B., magna cum laude (Harvard); fluent in Japanese.
enrichment.career_background: Founding member and partner at Geodesic Capital where he leads the investment team and operates as COO. Prior to Geodesic he spent over a decade in investment banking at Greenhill & Co. and J.P. Morgan, has experience in growth capital and buyout private equity, and served as Director of Business Development at Crowley Technologies. Educated at Harvard College (A.B., magna cum laude) and the Wharton School (MBA, with honors).
enrichment.investment_focus: FinTech and growth-stage/later-stage technology companies; helping startups expand into Japan and broader Asian markets.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑Founder and General Partner at Embedded Ventures. Co‑founder and Executive Chairman of Zoo (formerly KittyCAD) and founding CTO of Relativity Space. BS in Aerospace Engineering from the University of Southern California; based in the greater Los Angeles area.
enrichment.career_background: Jordan Noone co‑founded Relativity Space (served as founding CTO) and later co‑founded Embedded Ventures in 2020 to invest in early‑stage deep tech startups. He also co‑founded Zoo (hardware design tools) and has engineering experience at SpaceX, Blue Origin and Hughes Research Laboratories. He holds a BS in Aerospace Engineering from USC and remains active with USC’s Rocket Propulsion Lab.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage deep tech focused on space operations, digital engineering, and advanced manufacturing (including dual‑use/national‑security‑capable technologies).

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner on Redpoint’s early-stage team; joined Redpoint in 2021 and focuses on enterprise software including developer tools, AI, security, and cloud infrastructure. Holds a BS and MS from Stanford University and previously worked at early-stage roles across startups and at C3.ai, Palantir and RelateIQ. Active as a board observer / seed investor across multiple infrastructure and AI startups.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Redpoint in 2021 (Principal, later promoted to Partner in 2023) to invest in Seed/Series A enterprise companies. Prior roles include forward‑deployed solutions and engineering/product positions at C3.ai, Palantir and RelateIQ, and operating/investor roles at small startups; holds BS and MS from Stanford (Computer Science and Management Science & Engineering).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and Series A enterprise software (developer tools, infrastructure, AI, security, and SaaS)

enrichment.personal_bio: Joseph (Joe) Lau is co‑founder and CTO of Alchemy and a founding partner of Alchemy Ventures, the corporate venture arm that backs Web3 startups. He co‑founded the social app Down To Lunch and is an active angel investor in blockchain and developer‑tool startups. He holds undergraduate and graduate CS degrees from Stanford University.
enrichment.career_background: Cofounder and CTO of Alchemy (blockchain developer platform). Previously co‑founded Down To Lunch and held engineering roles at companies including Pinterest, Google and LinkedIn. Educated at Stanford University (BS and MS, Computer Science). Involved in launching Alchemy Ventures to invest in Web3 founders.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage Web3 and blockchain infrastructure, developer tools & APIs, crypto protocols and wallets

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and angel investor based in Austin, TX. Co‑founder and former CMO of GigKloud and has worked in product marketing and business development roles. Served as Entrepreneur-in-Residence at Starta Ventures (Feb 2019–Mar 2020) and has angel investments including Equally and effa.
enrichment.career_background: Marketing and operator-turned-angel: co‑founded GigKloud (CMO), held product marketing and business development roles (including Kargo), served as Entrepreneur-in-Residence at Starta Ventures, and acts as an angel investor and advisor to consumer and marketplace startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) startups; marketplaces, consumer/e-commerce, SaaS/enterprise; diversity & underrepresented founders

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Muditā Venture Partners. Former CTO/COO at education company ThinkCERCA and earlier roles at Greenline/TradeHelm and Deloitte. Focuses on education and mission-driven investments and mentors at Chicago's 1871.
enrichment.career_background: Experienced operator-turned-investor with senior technology and strategy roles across consulting, fintech, education and software companies. Held leadership positions at Greenline/TradeHelm, served as CTO/COO at ThinkCERCA, and now leads investing and portfolio work at Muditā; also serves on/advises several portfolio boards and mentors at 1871.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage, post-revenue B2B SaaS; sectors include EdTech, FinTech, PropTech, AI/ML and enterprise software.

enrichment.personal_bio: Vice President at Energy Foundry focused on early-stage investments in energy and cleantech. Holds a B.S. from UC Berkeley and has prior experience with NRDC (Princeton in Asia fellowship) and an energy-efficiency startup. Works on sourcing, diligence, and portfolio support for climate/energy startups.
enrichment.career_background: Judy Li earned a Bachelor of Science from University of California, Berkeley (environmental science / environmental economics & policy, minor in energy resources). She completed a Princeton in Asia fellowship with NRDC in Beijing, worked at an energy-efficiency startup, and joined Energy Foundry in 2016, progressing through platform and investment roles to a leadership position on the investment team.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed to Series A) investments in energy, clean technology, climate tech, grid and storage, and energy hardware & software.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Everly Health (Everlywell) and Venture Partner at NextGen Venture Partners. Based in Austin, Texas, she serves on the board of Headspace and invests in early-stage healthcare and consumer-health startups. Holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and a BA from Vanderbilt University.
enrichment.career_background: Julia Taylor Cheek began her career in management consulting, held strategy roles including Director of Strategy & Operations at the George W. Bush Institute and VP, Corporate Strategy at MoneyGram, and founded Everlywell (now Everly Health) in 2015. She joined NextGen Venture Partners as a Venture Partner in 2016 and sits on the board of Headspace, investing personally in multiple healthtech startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early‑stage investments in digital health, consumer health/diagnostics, and healthcare‑enabled consumer platforms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor, founder and operator with 30+ years of experience in early-stage technology and consumer companies. Founder and Managing Director of Cascade Seed Fund; has launched multiple angel/fund vehicles and managed investments across the Pacific Northwest. Frequently serves as advisor, mentor and speaker in regional startup and entrepreneurship programs.
enrichment.career_background: Julie Harrelson founded Cascade Angels (now Cascade Seed Fund) and co‑launched Cascade Seed Fund with Robert Pease. She has been a tech executive, founder and investor across multiple startups (some acquired by Earthlink and Time Warner), manages multiple funds, and serves on regional advisory boards and accelerator programs supporting entrepreneurship in Oregon and the PNW.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage investments in software and consumer brands, primarily in the Pacific Northwest (typical initial checks ~$100k–$250k).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑Founder & Managing Partner at Magnify Ventures, an early‑stage VC focused on the care economy. Previously launched and led the venture investment portfolio and strategy at Pivotal Ventures. Kauffman Fellow and frequent speaker on purpose‑driven and gender‑lens investing; based in Los Angeles.
enrichment.career_background: Spent over a decade as an investor and advisor to institutional family offices, foundations and mission‑focused organizations, including launching and leading Pivotal Ventures’ venture capital investment portfolio and strategy. Co‑founded Magnify Ventures in 2020 to invest in early‑stage companies reimagining life, work and care for families. Kauffman Fellow and member of All Raise.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed / Series A) investments across the care economy: parenting & family, aging & longevity, household optimization, and future‑of‑work solutions.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Visible Hands, a pre‑seed VC and accelerator that supports underrepresented founders. Former Vice President of Economic Growth at the Greater Boston Chamber of Commerce and Executive Director of City Awake. Based in Boston, MA.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Visible Hands in 2020 and serves as General Partner. Previously led economic growth initiatives at the Greater Boston Chamber of Commerce (VP, Economic Growth) and directed City Awake, a regional program for emerging talent. Educated at Brandeis University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed investments via an accelerator/fellowship model, prioritizing founders from underrepresented backgrounds; sector-agnostic with portfolio companies in consumer, B2B/SaaS, health, fintech, education, AI, and marketplaces.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Ribbit Capital based in New York. Previously worked at Social Capital, Raptor Capital and Goldman Sachs; holds the CFA designation and a BBA from the University of Notre Dame. citeturn0search1turn0search3
enrichment.career_background: Started his career in event-driven roles at Goldman Sachs, later worked as an event-driven PM at First New York, was an investor at Raptor Capital, served briefly as a partner at Social Capital in 2021, and joined Ribbit Capital as a General Partner in December 2021. citeturn0search1turn0search3turn0search2
enrichment.investment_focus: Fintech (payments, lending, insurance), crypto & blockchain, financial infrastructure / enterprise finance. citeturn1search12turn1search2

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Partner at Adjuvant Capital based in New York. Previously worked at the Global Health Investment Fund, Metalmark Capital, and Greenhill & Co. Graduated with honors from NYU Stern.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Adjuvant Capital to invest in life‑science technologies addressing high‑burden public health challenges. At the Global Health Investment Fund he led/co‑managed investments including Themis (acquired by Merck), Univercells, Atomo Diagnostics and Access Bio. Earlier roles include Metalmark Capital (healthcare investing) and Greenhill & Co. (biopharma M&A). Serves on/has supported several portfolio company boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Life sciences / global public health — vaccines, infectious-disease therapeutics, diagnostics and medical devices; typically Series A–C and growth investments with emphasis on access in emerging markets.

enrichment.personal_bio: Kam Ghaffarian is a serial entrepreneur and engineer who founded and leads IBX, an innovation and investment firm focused on deep technology. He co-founded multiple space and energy companies, including Axiom Space, Intuitive Machines, X-energy and Quantum Space, and previously founded government‑services firm Stinger Ghaffarian Technologies (SGT).
interests: Interstellar research and long‑term space exploration
enrichment.career_background: Kam Ghaffarian began his career in technical and management roles at Lockheed Martin, Ford Aerospace and Loral before co-founding Stinger Ghaffarian Technologies (SGT) in 1994 and growing it into a large NASA contractor (sold in 2018). He later founded IBX and co-founded or chaired several deep‑tech companies—X‑energy, Intuitive Machines, Axiom Space, Quantum Space and PTX—while supporting philanthropic efforts such as the Limitless Space Institute and the Emerging Light Foundation.
enrichment.investment_focus: Next‑generation space (LEO/cislunar infrastructure), advanced nuclear/clean energy, engineering services and deep technology

enrichment.personal_bio: Early-stage investor who was part of Octopus Ventures’ investing team (New York). Focuses on seed–Series B opportunities across consumer and enterprise tech, including AR/VR, marketplaces and future-of-work companies. Based in New York; previously worked in product/operations and financial analysis and is active in product/design communities.
enrichment.career_background: Worked as an early-stage investor at Octopus Ventures (joined 2018; listed with the firm in multiple public profiles). Prior to VC he held roles in product and operations and worked in financial analysis (including J.P. Morgan) and early-stage product/retail businesses; education and profile listings include Fordham University and the University of Sydney.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed to Series B; sectors: consumer & consumerized enterprise, marketplaces/e‑commerce, AR/VR, future of work, enterprise SaaS

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial entrepreneur, investor, company builder and mentor; co‑founder and Managing Director at Velvet Sea Ventures. Previously co‑founded and served as COO of Buddy Media and founded GOLF.com (sold to Time Warner). Earned a B.A. in Economics from Dartmouth College and has received Silicon Alley recognition and the Frances Hesselbein Leader of the Future Award.
enrichment.career_background: Kass Lazerow is a co‑founder and Managing Director of Velvet Sea Ventures and serves on its investment committee. She was co‑founder and COO of Buddy Media (acquired by Salesforce) and earlier founded and ran GOLF.com (sold to Time Warner). Her background centers on building and scaling digital media and consumer internet businesses and providing operational support to founders.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed‑to‑growth stage, operator‑led investments across sectors with emphasis on consumer internet, digital media, gaming, Web3/NFTs and enterprise software.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Maven Clinic, a digital clinic for women and families. Investment partner at XFactor Ventures; former early‑stage investor at Index Ventures and former journalist (The Economist, The New Yorker). Educated at the University of Michigan (BA) and the London School of Economics (MSc). Based in New York City.
interests: Supporting female founders / gender equity in VC
enrichment.career_background: Kate (Katherine) Ryder founded Maven Clinic in 2014 and serves as its CEO. Prior to Maven she worked as an early‑stage investor at Index Ventures and as a journalist for The Economist and The New Yorker; in 2009 she assisted Hank Paulson on his memoir. She holds a B.A. from the University of Michigan and an MSc from the London School of Economics and is based in New York.

enrichment.personal_bio: Long-time First Republic Bank executive who joined the firm in 1985 and served in senior finance and operating roles, including President (2007–2015) and later Vice Chair. Since transitioning from day-to-day management she has focused on corporate board service, angel investing and civic work in San Francisco.
interests: San Francisco civic and housing initiatives
enrichment.career_background: Early career as an associate at McKinsey & Company and finance roles at PMI Group, then joined First Republic at its founding in 1985 as CFO. She progressed through senior operating roles, served as President from 2007–2015 and subsequently as Vice Chair, and in recent years has focused on director roles, angel investing and civic leadership.
enrichment.investment_focus: Financial services and wealth management; fintech and tech-enabled services; early-stage angel investments; real estate

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner (Partner Emeritus) at Wildcat Venture Partners. Early-stage investor focused on AI/ML-enabled platforms for retail, marketplaces and workforce automation. Formerly at Mohr Davidow Ventures and Vantage Partners.
enrichment.career_background: Katherine Barr is a founding partner of Wildcat Venture Partners. She previously served as a general partner at Mohr Davidow Ventures and began her career as a senior negotiator at Vantage Partners; earlier roles include product and marketing management at HSA and ACCESS. She has served on multiple boards and advisory councils and holds degrees from McGill University and Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage B2B and B2B2C technology (digital health, enterprise SaaS, retail/e‑commerce, marketplaces); AI/ML and workforce automation (robotics).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of Everywhere Ventures (formerly The Fund) and SHOWFIELDS; early employee at Warby Parker and former Chief Brand Officer at Hinge. Currently co‑founder & CEO of pet brand Oh Norman!. Active in early‑stage, community‑driven investing and consumer product startups.
enrichment.career_background: Katie Hunt began at Warby Parker (operations & social media), led brand at Hinge as Chief Brand Officer, then co‑founded SHOWFIELDS and The Fund (now Everywhere Ventures). She later co‑founded and became CEO of Oh Norman!, and remains involved in Everywhere’s pre‑seed investing and founder community initiatives.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and CEO of Boosted Commerce. Serial entrepreneur who previously co-founded Voi (VOI Technology), Break Media, OnePage and Billpoint; has served on public company boards including VNV Global and formerly Grubhub and The Meet Group. Holds a B.A. and M.A. from Stanford University.
interests: Consumer packaged goods (CPG) / DTC brand scaling
enrichment.career_background: Keith Richman is a serial entrepreneur and investor. He co-founded Boosted Commerce (co-founder & CEO) after earlier founding/co-founding companies including Billpoint (acquired by eBay), OnePage (acquired), Break Media (co-founder & CEO until 2013) and Voi (VOI Technology). He has held board roles at VNV Global and has served on the boards of Grubhub and The Meet Group; he holds a B.A. and M.A. from Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: E-commerce, consumer packaged goods (CPG) and DTC brands; acquisition-led scaling (Amazon FBA & Shopify); marketplace and mobility businesses

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at fama Ventures and founding partner of fama PR. Based in the Boston area and active in seed/early-stage technology investing and technology PR. Attended Ithaca College.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and founding partner of fama PR (since ~2002) and general partner at fama Ventures (since 2021). Combines public‑relations and go‑to‑market expertise with early‑stage venture investing, supporting portfolio companies on positioning, messaging and fundraising.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early‑stage technology companies (notably cybersecurity, AI/ML, marketplaces and SaaS)

enrichment.personal_bio: Engineer-turned-angel investor with a history of technology commercialization and board roles in deep-tech and climate-tech companies. Formerly a partner at Firelake Capital and a technology ventures director/partner in the Imperial Innovations/Touchstone/IP Group ecosystem. Stanford B.S., M.S. and MBA.
enrichment.career_background: Kelsey Lynn Skinner is an engineer by training (Stanford B.S., M.S., MBA) who spent a decade in Silicon Valley in new-technology roles and early-stage investing, later joining Imperial Innovations/Touchstone and IP Group as a technology ventures director/partner. She has held board and investor roles in companies spun out of university research and has focused on materials, energy, cleantech and connected-device technologies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) investments in deep tech, materials science, clean energy/cleantech, IoT/connected devices and enterprise software

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at FusionX Ventures and former founder/CEO of ClearAccess (acquired by Cisco). Experienced operator in IoT and connected-device software with a background in leading startups to exit. Holds an MBA from Stanford and works with founders on product, go-to-market and scaling hardware+software companies.
enrichment.career_background: Ken Hood began his career at The Boston Consulting Group and later held sales and executive roles at Jetstream, Paradyne and 3Com. He founded ClearAccess (sold to Cisco) and served in leadership at Cisco on connected‑home software; he is now Managing Partner at FusionX Ventures, focusing on early-stage companies that fuse hardware, software and cloud.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed–Series A) investments in hardware, IoT and cloud-enabled smart machines; industrial and medical device companies with recurring B2B revenue models.

enrichment.personal_bio: Ketan Patel, M.D., is a partner (listed as Managing Partner on some profiles) at F-Prime Capital Partners. He is a physician-turned-investor who joined the firm in 2007 and focuses on therapeutics and medical device investments. He holds an M.D. and MBA from Tufts University and completed undergraduate studies at Rutgers University.
interests: Early-stage company formation and clinical translation
enrichment.career_background: Dr. Patel trained in internal medicine and worked clinically at VA Boston, Weill Cornell/NewYork-Presbyterian and Memorial Sloan Kettering before moving into healthcare consulting at Leerink Swann. He joined F-Prime (formerly Fidelity Biosciences) in 2007 and has led and served on boards of multiple biopharma and medtech companies while investing across early and growth stages.
enrichment.investment_focus: Healthcare — therapeutics, biotechnology and medical devices (early through growth-stage investments); pharmaceuticals and clinical-stage development.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Kombo Ventures, a Los Angeles–based venture builder and talent/brand incubator. Co‑founder of consumer brands including Glamnetic, Insert Name Here (INH Hair) and Wakeheart. Active angel investor focused on consumer, entertainment and creator‑economy companies.
enrichment.career_background: Kevin Gould founded Kombo Ventures in 2012 and has built the firm as a hybrid talent management, brand incubation and investment vehicle. He previously worked at William Morris Endeavor and has co‑founded multiple consumer brands (Glamnetic, INH Hair, Wakeheart). Gould is an active angel investor and was a founding investor/partner in Beautycon.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑to‑mid stage consumer and entertainment companies; direct‑to‑consumer brands, e‑commerce/retail, creator/influencer partnerships and talent‑led businesses (seed through Series A).

enrichment.personal_bio: Kevin A. Mayer is a co‑founder and managing partner at Smash Capital and co‑CEO of Candle Media. He is a former senior executive at The Walt Disney Company who led Direct‑to‑Consumer strategy (including the launch of Disney+) and briefly served as CEO of TikTok and COO of ByteDance. Mayer invests in and advises companies in consumer internet, media, gaming, and the creator economy.
enrichment.career_background: Longtime media and strategy executive who ran Disney's Direct‑to‑Consumer and international businesses, led major M&A and the launch of Disney+, then served briefly as CEO of TikTok/COO of ByteDance. He co‑founded Candle Media and Smash Capital and sits on/has advised multiple boards in media and tech.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer internet, software & technology (growth/later‑stage); media & streaming; gaming & esports; creator economy

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Selva Ventures, an early-stage VC focused on consumer health & wellness brands. Previously a partner on CircleUp Growth Partners and a private equity investor at TPG; began his career in investment banking at Barclays. Serves on/observes multiple portfolio company boards.
enrichment.career_background: Kiva Dickinson founded Selva Ventures in 2019 and leads deal sourcing and execution for the firm. Prior to Selva he was a Partner at CircleUp Growth Partners (led Series B investments including Nutpods and Liquid I.V.), before which he worked in private equity at TPG in San Francisco and began his career in consumer-focused investment banking at Barclays in Los Angeles.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed & Series A consumer brands (health, wellness, beauty, branded CPG); primarily US & Canada.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Glasswing Ventures focused on early-stage enterprise AI and frontier technology. Former Head of Data Science at SocialFlow with a BA from Mount Holyoke College and an MBA from Northwestern University (Kellogg). Serves as board director and observer across multiple Glasswing portfolio companies and is active in mentoring and diversity initiatives in VC.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Glasswing in 2019 and was promoted through Associate → Senior Associate → Principal before becoming Partner in 2023. Previously Head of Data Science at SocialFlow and an analyst in strategy/analytics at Digitas. Holds a BA (cum laude) from Mount Holyoke College and an MBA with honors from Northwestern (Kellogg). Active as a board director (e.g., Retrocausal, Kusari) and board observer for several portfolio companies and leads Glasswing Ignite, a cross-university VC mentorship initiative.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage enterprise AI and frontier technology (enterprise software, cybersecurity, manufacturing/built-world AI, data infrastructure and AI-native marketplaces).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of REMUS Capital; early-stage investor focused on applied AI and healthcare. Co-founder and former CEO of Presto Automation; chairs or sits on boards of multiple portfolio companies. Educated at MIT (SBs in Materials Science & Management Science).
enrichment.career_background: Founded REMUS (2008) while at MIT and has led early investments and board roles across enterprise AI, healthcare, and agtech. Previously worked at McKinsey & Company and J.P. Morgan; co‑founded and served as CEO/Chairman of Presto Automation. Holds dual SB degrees from MIT and is a graduate of Phillips Academy Andover.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Pre-seed to Series A) investments in Applied AI (voice/visual), enterprise automation, healthcare/medtech, and adjacent AgTech and enterprise software sectors.

enrichment.personal_bio: Advisor at Alpaca VC and Head of Partnerships at Watershed. Former Partner, Market Development at Andreessen Horowitz and Head of Travel Partnerships at Uber; held partnership and business development roles at Facebook and 1stdibs. MBA, Stanford University; BS, University of Arizona.
enrichment.career_background: Kristin Thayer is a senior operator who advises early-stage startups and VC firms on partnerships, GTM and marketplace strategy. Her career includes partnership leadership at Facebook (Olympics partnerships), a market-development role at Andreessen Horowitz, Head of Travel Partnerships at Uber, senior roles at 1stdibs, and current Head of Partnerships at Watershed. She holds an MBA from Stanford and a BS from the University of Arizona.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed, Series A); marketplaces, commerce, proptech/real-world commerce, fintech, vertical SaaS, and companies where strategic partnerships and go-to-market are core advantages.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner on Echo Health Ventures' strategic investment team focused on healthcare and health-IT startups, based in Seattle. Holds an MBA from the University of California, Berkeley and a BA (magna cum laude) from Claremont McKenna College. citeturn2view0turn5search5
enrichment.career_background: Joined Echo Health Ventures in 2017 and supports all aspects of the investment process including sourcing, diligence, transaction execution and portfolio support. Previously a Vice President in Cascadia Capital’s Healthcare Technology & Services group and has earlier experience at Pathway Capital Management and Merrill Lynch’s healthcare investment banking group. Serves/served on boards and as board observer for multiple Echo portfolio companies. citeturn2view0turn4search3
enrichment.investment_focus: Healthcare IT and digital health (tech‑enabled services, behavioral health, precision medicine, care delivery/value‑based care)

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Contrary (joined 2022), where he leads seed-to-growth investing and helped build the firm’s later-stage practice. Previously a growth investor at TCV and held investing roles at Coatue and Index Ventures. Publishes the Investing 101 newsletter and frequently speaks on AI and venture topics.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in growth and venture roles at TCV, Coatue, and Index/Index Ventures before joining Contrary as a General Partner in 2022 to lead later-stage and Series A investing. Educational background includes Brigham Young University and the University of Cambridge.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early- to growth-stage technology investments (AI, cybersecurity, enterprise software, fintech).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Paradox Capital and chief marketing officer at Wander. Former Head of Brand Marketing at Opendoor and Head of Marketing at Fast. Hosts the Paradox Podcast and invests at seed/pre-seed in consumer and developer-focused startups.
enrichment.career_background: Kyle Tibbitts is a marketer‑turned‑investor who co-founded Paradox Capital to back founders outside Silicon Valley. He runs the Paradox Podcast and leverages his operator background to advise portfolio founders on product, marketing and go‑to‑market.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage checks into consumer marketplaces, travel/hospitality, proptech, marketplaces/SaaS, and founder-led growth/marketing teams.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding CEO and Global Managing Partner of Next47, a corporate-backed VC focused on enterprise deep tech. Invests in AI/ML, vertical SaaS, robotics, mobility and other deep‑tech enterprise systems. Author of Anticipate Failure and a Kauffman Fellow; holds an MBA (INSEAD/Wharton).
enrichment.career_background: Previously founded and led Hewlett Packard Pathfinder (HPE’s corporate venturing effort) and worked in strategy and corporate development at Cisco (led acquisitions including Meraki and Starent). As an investor/executor he has been involved with exits and investments such as Adallom, HortonWorks and Mesosphere before founding Next47 in 2016.
