enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑Founder and General Partner at Emmeline Ventures, focused on investing in early‑stage, female‑founded companies. Former CEO and current Chairwoman of Sahara Reporters and co‑founder of the Civic Media Lab. Brings 12+ years of operations and startup experience across media, health, and impact investing.
enrichment.career_background: La Keisha is a co‑founder and General Partner of Emmeline Ventures (founded 2022). Prior roles include Managing Director at NLA Ventures, CEO and later Chairwoman of Sahara Reporters, co‑founder/executive of the Civic Media Lab, and researcher/founder activity at Harvard (Berkman Klein Center and Harvard Innovation Lab). She has led operations and fund/portfolio work across healthcare, sustainability, fintech, and media.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed investments in female‑founded, tech‑enabled startups focused on women’s health, women’s wealth/fintech, and products/services that enable cleaner/safer living.

enrichment.personal_bio: Laura Deming is a New Zealand–born venture capitalist who founded The Longevity Fund to back early-stage companies working on aging and life-extension. She began laboratory work in biogerontology as a child, attended MIT as a teenager, and was a Thiel Fellow before launching the fund. She has led an accelerator and later initiatives (age1) focused on founder-led longevity companies.
enrichment.career_background: Deming moved from New Zealand to the U.S. to pursue aging research, worked in academic labs (including Cynthia Kenyon's), enrolled at MIT at a young age, accepted a Thiel Fellowship, and founded The Longevity Fund in 2011 to invest in longevity-focused startups. She has run an accelerator (AGE1), helped launch successor fund efforts (age1), and holds founder/board/advisor roles in several portfolio companies and ventures.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed to early-stage biotechnology and therapeutics targeting aging and age-related disease (geroscience, senolytics, gene editing, translational longevity platforms).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of WestCap and former CFO of The Blackstone Group and Airbnb. Holds a B.A., J.D., and M.B.A. from Georgetown University and focuses on investing in technology-enabled businesses and marketplaces.
enrichment.career_background: Over a 25+ year career Tosi has been both an operator and investor: senior finance and operating roles at Merrill Lynch (COO/CFO), The Blackstone Group (CFO), and Airbnb (CFO), then founded Weston Capital Partners (now WestCap) in 1997 and serves as its Managing Partner. He sits on boards including Hopper, FLYR and GoodLeap and is active in private-market investing and philanthropy; he earned BA, JD and MBA degrees from Georgetown University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Technology-enabled marketplaces; fintech and financial services (payments); growth / late-stage venture and private equity; private-markets technology.

enrichment.personal_bio: Joined QED Investors as a Partner in 2019; focuses on fintech with an emphasis on Latin America and payments/commerce. Previously held senior roles at Capital One and holds an MBA from Stanford and a B.A. from the University of Virginia. In July 2023 she joined QuintoAndar as VP of Fintech / GM of QuintoCred. citeturn0search5turn1search5
enrichment.career_background: Spent ~15 years in financial services including senior operating and growth-ventures roles at Capital One; joined QED Investors as Partner in 2019 where she led fintech and international (Latin America) investments and served on multiple portfolio boards; transitioned to QuintoAndar in 2023 to lead fintech/credit operations. citeturn0search5turn0search3turn5search4
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage fintech (seed–Series B); payments, credit/lending, commerce; Latin America.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Mischief, an early‑stage VC based in San Francisco. Previously founded Dote (Gen‑Z shopping app) and has been an active angel investor in companies such as Faire and Modern Fertility. Early career roles include Product Manager at Pocket Gems and Associate Consultant at Bain & Company. Graduated from Dartmouth College and grew up in Alaska.
enrichment.career_background: Lauren co‑founded Mischief (launched 2021) and invests at seed/Series A primarily in software startups. She was founder & CEO of Dote (2014–2020), earlier worked as a product manager at Pocket Gems and as an associate consultant at Bain & Company, and has angel investments dating back to 2017. She is based in San Francisco and holds a BA from Dartmouth College.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage software (seed & Series A); consumer products and marketplaces; fintech & payments; SaaS; crypto/web3; healthcare

enrichment.personal_bio: Leo de Luna is a venture investor with 20+ years of experience across corporate VC, traditional VC and secondaries. He co‑founded and led the U.S. investment team at M12 (Microsoft’s venture fund), served as a managing partner at Ponte Partners, and joined Tribeca Venture Partners as a partner in 2022. He holds an MBA from UC Berkeley Haas and a BBA from the University of Texas at Austin.
enrichment.career_background: Leo de Luna has held senior roles across corporate and independent venture firms. He co‑founded and ran M12’s U.S. investment effort (Managing Director), worked in secondary and private markets (including Ponte Partners), and served as a principal at Split Rock Partners; earlier roles include Saints Capital, St. Paul Venture Capital, AMD and Lehman Brothers. Education: MBA (UC Berkeley, Haas) and BBA (University of Texas at Austin).
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise SaaS and growth-stage companies; secondary transactions and LP/direct portfolio acquisitions; sectors include digital health, cybersecurity and fintech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at IGNIA Partners and former Mars executive. Over 25 years at Mars, including Regional President for Petcare Latin America; joined IGNIA in 2011. Serves on corporate boards and focuses on growth, operations and brand-building in Latin America.
enrichment.career_background: Leon Kraig is a longtime consumer-products executive who spent 25+ years at Mars (including Regional President, Petcare Latin America) before joining IGNIA in 2011 as a partner/venture partner. He has served on boards and investment committees (e.g., Alsea, Industrias AlEn, Grupo Proeza, Proeza Ventures, Niagara Bottling) and holds degrees from Universidad Iberoamericana, Cornell University, and an MBA from the University of Minnesota.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage, tech-enabled startups addressing fundamental pain points in Latin America (focus areas: fintech, healthtech, e-commerce, marketplaces, SaaS)

enrichment.personal_bio: Lew Cirne is a technologist and entrepreneur best known as the founder of New Relic and Wily Technology. He is a Strategic Limited Partner at Four Rivers Group and has a long track record in application performance management, SaaS, and enterprise software.
enrichment.career_background: Lew Cirne studied computer science at Dartmouth College and held engineering roles at Apple and Hummingbird before founding Wily Technology (sold to CA). He later served as an Entrepreneur-in-Residence at Benchmark and founded New Relic in 2008, where he was CEO until 2021 and then served in board/executive roles. He is currently a Strategic Limited Partner at Four Rivers Group and has served on nonprofit boards such as CURE International.
enrichment.investment_focus: SaaS and enterprise software (observability/APM, developer tools, cloud infrastructure); invests across seed to expansion/growth-stage software companies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Life-science investor and board director at Northpond Ventures focusing on R&D tools, molecular diagnostics and precision medicine. Holds a Ph.D. in molecular and systems pharmacology (Emory University) and a B.S. from Tsinghua University. Previously worked in corporate/business development at Illumina and in strategic marketing at NanoString; started her career in life-sciences consulting.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Northpond Ventures (principal -> director) and focuses on investments and board work in enabling life‑science technologies and diagnostics. Prior roles include Associate Director, Corporate & Business Development at Illumina; strategic marketing/business development at NanoString; and management consulting in life‑sciences at L.E.K. Consulting. Education: Ph.D., Emory University; B.S., Tsinghua University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Life sciences and biotechnology (R&D tools, molecular diagnostics, precision medicine/therapeutics), environmental sciences and emerging technologies; typically invests from seed through early growth (Series A/B).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner of Able Partners, Lisa Blau is an early-stage investor focused on consumer health and wellness. She co-founded VitalJuice, helped launch Portero, and serves on several nonprofit boards; she holds a BA from Duke and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder of VitalJuice (acquired by Tasting Table) and early team/marketing at Portero; began her career as a producer at CNN. Founding Partner (since ~2016) and Chairperson at Able Partners, active angel/VC investor in health & wellness consumer businesses; board member of The New York Public Library, KIPP New York, and Mount Sinai Parenting Center. Education: B.A., Duke University; MBA, Harvard Business School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage consumer & wellness brands (health, wellness, care economy, connection & community); typically seed to Series A.

enrichment.personal_bio: Healthcare investor and advisor with 30+ years in venture and operating roles. Listed as a Venture Partner at Aphelion Capital and serves in senior roles including Managing Partner at American Heart Association Ventures and founder of Venture Valkyrie Consulting. Former general partner roles include Psilos Group and healthcare lead at GE Ventures.
enrichment.career_background: Lisa Suennen has worked across healthcare investing, operations and consulting for over three decades. She has held GP/partner roles at Psilos Group and GE Ventures, has led or advised multiple venture funds, served in executive roles at healthcare companies (e.g., Canary Medical, Merit Behavioral Care), founded Venture Valkyrie Consulting and co-founded CSweetener, and holds board/advisory roles with several health-tech organizations and programs.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early- and mid-stage medical devices and digital health; capital-efficient products and services that improve patient outcomes and lower system cost.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at AllerFund, a VC focused on food-allergy innovation. Experienced in commercializing early-stage healthcare technologies with prior roles at the New York Stem Cell Foundation, Ascent Biomedical Partners, Johnson & Johnson and McKinsey. Holds a BA (University of Pennsylvania) and an MBA (Harvard Business School).
enrichment.career_background: Strovink has led strategy and commercialization for early‑stage health technologies—serving as Chief Strategy Officer at the New York Stem Cell Foundation, Principal at Ascent Biomedical Partners, holding strategic and marketing roles at Johnson & Johnson, and beginning her career at McKinsey. She co‑founded/paired with AllerFund to invest in companies addressing food allergies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed/Series A) investments in food allergy–focused companies and adjacent health/foodtech sectors (therapeutics, medical devices, diagnostics, digital health, consumer products).

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at First Round Capital (San Francisco) since 2023. Former co-founder & CEO of WayUp (launched 2014; raised >$40M; exited/merged in 2021) and Visiting Group Partner at Y Combinator. Angel investor since 2016 with early-stage bets in Ramp, Scale AI and Ro.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in product marketing at Google before co-founding WayUp, where she served as CEO for seven years, raised venture capital and led the company through an exit in 2021. Began angel investing in 2016, later served as a Visiting Group Partner at Y Combinator (supporting 100+ startups) and joined First Round Capital as a Partner in 2023 focused on hands-on support for early-stage founders.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and pre-seed investments across enterprise/B2B SaaS, AI, fintech and healthtech; founder-first, GTM-heavy, hands-on early-stage partnering

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director on Redpoint’s growth / early‑growth team. Joined Redpoint in 2020 after several years at Battery Ventures and focuses primarily on enterprise software at the application and infrastructure layers, partnering with companies mostly at the Series B–C stage. Hosts a technology podcast and has been named to Forbes 30 Under 30 and the Midas Brink lists.
enrichment.career_background: Previously an investor at Battery Ventures (focused on enterprise software growth investments). Earlier experience in investment banking at Spurrier Capital Partners and Deutsche Bank. Holds a BS from Washington and Lee University, where he played varsity men’s lacrosse.
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise software (applications and infrastructure); growth‑stage investments (Series B and Series C).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner at Kaya Ventures, an early-stage firm focused on health and wellness. Harvard MBA with a BA from The University of Texas at Austin. Active angel and VC investor in consumer, digital health, and women’s-health focused startups (portfolio/angel activity noted at 30+ companies).
enrichment.career_background: Relationship-driven investor and operator with prior roles including Managing Director/General Partner at CircleUp, VP at Victress/Visible-type consumer VC roles, and management consulting at Oliver Wyman; began her career in operations at Apple and The Walt Disney Company. As a GP and early team member at consumer funds she has managed institutional capital (sources state she has overseen >$150M in AUM).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed); women’s health, digital health, consumer wellness, care economy; future of work

enrichment.personal_bio: Ex-founder turned VC investor who worked at Lakestar as a senior associate focused on fintech and crypto/Web3. Based in London and fluent in multiple languages. Previously invested at Speedinvest and worked on growth at Fru.pl; founded and exited language‑school businesses in Poland (acquired 2016).
enrichment.career_background: Founded and ran language‑school businesses in Poland (acquired 2016), then held growth and operational roles (including Fru.pl). Transitioned to VC with roles at Seedrs and Speedinvest, and worked at Lakestar as an early & growth‑stage investor (focused on fintech and crypto/Web3, seed–Series B).
enrichment.investment_focus: Fintech; Web3 / blockchain; marketplaces and network‑effects businesses; early through growth stages (seed–Series B).

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing General Partner & Chief Investment Officer at Fuel Venture Capital. CFA charterholder with a background in public markets and hedge-fund portfolio management who moved into venture investing. Born and raised in Vietnam; holds a B.S. in Financial Economics and Mathematics from Centre College.
enrichment.career_background: Born and raised in Vietnam, Maggie Vo began her investment career at Prudential Vietnam Fund Management and later worked at Prudential Property Investment Managers in Singapore. She moved to the U.S., served as Portfolio Manager at Blue Shores Capital (global long/short equity), then joined Fuel Venture Capital in 2018 and rose to Managing General Partner & CIO, leading due diligence, valuation and portfolio oversight. She is a CFA charterholder and Centre College alumna.
enrichment.investment_focus: Fintech, payments, marketplaces, enterprise SaaS, entertainment tech and AI; early- to later-stage (Seed–Series B), global investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Angel Invest and Head of the Venture Capital/Startups team (Global PE & VC Practice) at Salesforce. Former CEO/co-lead of Ada’s List and senior international leader at Civitas Learning. Early-stage investor focused on B2B AI and enterprise startups; active across Europe and the US.
enrichment.career_background: Mara Larson-Richard is an operator-turned-investor with roles spanning politics, startups and education technology. She has served in senior international and growth roles at Civitas Learning, co-led Ada’s List as CEO, founded and exited a startup, and later moved into investing and advising hundreds of early-stage teams. She joined Angel Invest as a partner and leads Salesforce’s VC/Startups practice (Launchpad) focused on helping AI-enabled companies scale.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed & Seed (Europe-focused); AI/ML, enterprise SaaS, FinTech, crypto, climate/deep tech; active angel checks (~€100–125k)

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing partner / CEO of Emil Capital Partners (ECP Growth) who leads the firm’s North America venture and growth investing in consumer brands. Over 20 years of experience across automotive, investment banking and private equity; holds an M.S. from Technische Universität Berlin and an MBA from Columbia Business School; based in Connecticut.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Emil Capital (ECP) in 2011 and today leads the firm’s venture & growth activities in North America. Prior roles include operational positions at Daimler AG, investment banking/advisory in Sydney and work at a multi-billion‑dollar distressed private equity firm in New York. Has served as CEO or board member of multiple portfolio companies (e.g., Cheribundi, NextFoods/GoodBelly) and is resident in Greenwich, Connecticut.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and growth-stage consumer brands (CPG, food & beverage), retail & digitized commerce, consumer tech, beauty/personal care and pet products

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Igah Ventures with more than twenty years of consulting, investment and operating experience. Formerly a partner at GP Investments and later served as CEO of Sascar and CEO of PDG. Holds a B.S. in Mechanical‑Aeronautical Engineering from Instituto Tecnológico de Aeronáutica (ITA) and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Spent ~15 years at GP Investments leading investments and board work before moving to operating roles in 2011 (led acquisition and growth of Sascar, later sold) and serving as CEO of PDG. Co‑founder/partner in e.Bricks/e.Bricks Ventures and is a Managing Partner at Igah Ventures, a São Paulo‑based VC investing in Seed through Series B.
enrichment.investment_focus: Stages: Seed, Series A, Series B. Sectors: B2B SaaS, fintech, healthtech/telemedicine, marketplaces/e‑commerce, IDTech, construTech and other technology‑enabled businesses in Brazil.

enrichment.personal_bio: Marketing and communications executive and investor. Cofounder of The OutCast Agency (1997) and operating partner / head of marketing at Andreessen Horowitz (joined 2010; partner emeritus). Member of the Broadway Angels angel group and active as an adviser to early-stage technology founders.
enrichment.career_background: Margit co‑founded The OutCast Agency in 1997 and led its growth before joining Andreessen Horowitz in 2010 to build the firm’s marketing and communications function. She advises portfolio founders on PR, brand and go‑to‑market strategy; serves on several boards and trustee bodies; and is a member of the Broadway Angels angel investing group.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage / angel investments in information technology and software; advising founders on marketing, communications and brand strategy.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding and Managing Partner of SteelSky Ventures, a venture fund focused on improving access, care, and outcomes in women’s health. Serial entrepreneur and investor who speaks regularly on health innovation and equity. Holds a B.S. in Information Systems from Wake Forest University and an MBA (Finance & Entrepreneurship) from NYU Stern.
enrichment.career_background: Founded and leads SteelSky Ventures, which invests across consumer health, digital health, medical devices and healthcare infrastructure to improve women’s health outcomes. Previously held product and marketing leadership roles (including at Schweiger Dermatology Group) and founded consumer-facing startups during college. Active as a speaker, advisor, and fellow in healthcare and venture communities.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed & Series A) investments across women’s healthcare and related infrastructure: consumer health, digital health/telemedicine, diagnostics and medical devices, retail therapeutics and health delivery models focused on access and outcomes.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at Infinity Ventures, an early‑stage fund focused on fintech and commerce enablement. Former venture investor at PayPal Ventures and Dorm Room Fund with prior growth equity experience at Napier Park (Ten Coves) and investment banking at Barclays. Born and raised in the Bronx, NY; MBA from Yale School of Management.
enrichment.career_background: Mario co‑founded Infinity Ventures in 2021 and leads investments across B2B fintech and commerce enablement. He previously worked at PayPal Ventures (principal), Dorm Room Fund, Napier Park Global Capital (growth equity) and began his career in investment banking at Barclays. He is a Kauffman Fellow (Class 27) and holds a BBA from Baruch College and an MBA from Yale SOM.
enrichment.investment_focus: B2B fintech and fintech infrastructure; commerce enablement; invests pre‑seed through Series A (early‑stage)

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Bain Capital Ventures focused on fintech and application SaaS; previously a partner on Index Ventures' San Francisco team. Former head of business strategy & finance at Stripe and earlier worked in private equity at GI Partners and investment banking at Goldman Sachs. UC Berkeley (Haas) graduate and a certified sommelier.
enrichment.career_background: Mark Fiorentino is a venture investor and former operator. He helped build business strategy and finance at Stripe (2015–2019), worked in private equity at GI Partners and began his career in investment banking at Goldman Sachs. He joined Index Ventures' San Francisco team as a partner focused on fintech and application SaaS, and in 2025 moved to Bain Capital Ventures as a partner targeting fintech, AI-native apps and vertical SaaS.
enrichment.investment_focus: Fintech; application SaaS (vertical/industry-specific SaaS); early to growth-stage investments (seed through growth).

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Forward Deployed VC. Former Palantir forward-deployed engineer and early Palantir investor; founded FDVC Fund I in 2022. Focuses on mission-critical technology for defense, energy, industrials, and AI.
enrichment.career_background: Spent ~11 years as a Forward Deployed Engineer at Palantir (founding member of their defense team), deploying to Afghanistan, Iraq and the Horn of Africa and contributing to products including Forward, Mobile and Project Maven. Began angel investing in 2010 (including Palantir Series D), attended YC investor programs, and launched Forward Deployed VC (Fund I) in 2022.
enrichment.investment_focus: Mission-critical sectors (defense, energy, industrials/manufacturing, AI); seed and early-stage investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Markus Warmuth, M.D., is CEO of Monte Rosa Therapeutics and a physician-scientist with a background in oncology drug discovery. He previously led drug-discovery teams at Novartis and was CEO of H3 Biomedicine; he has served as a Venture Partner affiliated with Versant Ventures and has held board seats at several biotech companies.
enrichment.career_background: MD from Ludwig-Maximilians-Universität München. Held senior discovery roles at the Genomics Institute of the Novartis Research Foundation and Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research, served as CEO of H3 Biomedicine, was an Entrepreneur-in-Residence at Third Rock Ventures, and is CEO of Monte Rosa Therapeutics; has served as a Venture Partner associated with Versant Ventures and holds multiple biotech board positions.
enrichment.investment_focus: Biotechnology; drug discovery platforms (molecular glues/protein degraders); oncology and precision medicine; early-stage company creation

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO (Managing Partner) of Beliade, a New York– and Nashville‑based investor focused on consumer brands. Launched Beliade in 2015 and leads investment sourcing, portfolio management and growth strategy. Previously held roles in entertainment and brand development at Creative Artists Agency and Relativity Media, and began his career in investment banking.
enrichment.career_background: Founder and Managing Partner of Beliade since 2015, leading the firm’s growth strategy and portfolio operations across multiple funds. Prior to Beliade he was an executive at Creative Artists Agency (CAA), served at Relativity Media overseeing endorsements/licensing, and started his career in investment banking (Ladenburg Thalmann) and private equity/SPAC activity. Profiles list study at George Mason University and Western Michigan University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage to growth equity investments in U.S. consumer brands (DTC and omni‑channel) across apparel, beauty/personal care, food & beverage, wellness and retail.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director at McCarthy Capital (joined 2014) based in Omaha, NE. Originates and evaluates private investments and provides portfolio oversight. Holds an MBA from University of Chicago Booth School of Business and a BS in Finance & Accounting from University of Nebraska–Lincoln.
enrichment.career_background: Joined McCarthy Capital in 2014 as an investment professional; responsibilities include sourcing, structuring and managing private equity and growth investments. Prior to McCarthy he worked in a business and consumer services investment banking group and held management/finance roles in business services, real estate and banking. Education: MBA (University of Chicago Booth) and BS in Finance & Accounting (University of Nebraska–Lincoln).
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth equity and middle-market recapitalizations; emerging growth investments (firm-level focus: majority/minority equity investments and emerging growth investments).

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at IA Capital Group (joined 2018) who sources and manages venture and growth investments in insurtech and fintech. Serves on boards or as observer for portfolio companies including Certificial, Delos Insurance, Driver Technologies, Health Gorilla and LiftForward. Previously Principal at Fenway Summer Ventures, Associate at Lightyear Capital and analyst at Citigroup; holds an MBA from Columbia Business School and a BA from Princeton University.
interests: Enterprise B2B SaaS for financial services
enrichment.career_background: Matt Perlman is a Partner at IA Capital Group where he sources, evaluates and executes investments and sits on the firm’s investment committee. Prior roles include Principal at Fenway Summer Ventures (venture investing in fintech), Associate at Lightyear Capital (private equity focused on financial services) and analyst in Citi’s Financial Institutions Group. He holds an MBA from Columbia Business School and a BA from Princeton University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Insurtech and fintech investments (Seed–Series B); payments & financial infrastructure, P&C and life/health insurtech, lending/capital markets and wealth/retirement tech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Product-focused founder and angel investor. Co‑founder of Nest, founder & CEO of Mill, and co‑founder of Incite (Incite Ventures/Incite.org). Previously an early Apple engineer on iPod/iPhone/iPad software.
enrichment.career_background: Matt Rogers holds BS and MS degrees from Carnegie Mellon University. He began his career at Apple working on iPod, iPhone and iPad software, co‑founded Nest (led product/engineering), and later founded Mill (food‑waste prevention) and co‑founded Incite to invest in mission‑driven startups, nonprofits, and advocacy initiatives.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed to Series A) mission‑driven investments focusing on climate/clean‑tech, sustainable consumer products, and civic/nonprofit advocacy.

enrichment.personal_bio: Matt Sechrest is a venture partner at Sky9 Capital and the founder/managing partner of North Equity. He previously founded multiple SaaS companies and was a founding member of E*TRADE Venture Capital after starting his career in tech M&A at Goldman Sachs. He is an advisor to the conservation nonprofit Re:wild and holds a BA from Dartmouth College.
enrichment.career_background: Founder and Managing Partner of North Equity (AI-focused investment firm); Venture Partner at Sky9 Capital. Prior roles include founding/leading multiple SaaS companies, founding member of E*TRADE Venture Capital (corporate VC), and earlier tech M&A work at Goldman Sachs. Serves as an advisor/on the global council for Re:wild.
enrichment.investment_focus: AI (vertical AI, seed-stage); Enterprise SaaS; early-stage/seed investments; acquisition capital and AI-powered rollups

enrichment.personal_bio: Experienced investor and investor-relations executive who served as Head of Atlassian Ventures and previously led investor relations and strategy roles at Atlassian and LinkedIn. Co-founder of GenPurpose and Long-Term Value Advisors with a focus on purpose-driven, long-term value creation. Background includes equity research at Capital Group and an MBA from Presidio Graduate School.
enrichment.career_background: Matt Sonefeldt has held senior IR and strategy roles at Atlassian (VP Investor Relations; VP Strategy & Business Operations; Head of Atlassian Ventures) and was previously VP of Investor Relations at LinkedIn. Earlier in his career he worked in equity research at Capital Group. He co-founded GenPurpose and Long‑Term Value Advisors and has engaged in early-stage investing focused on the Atlassian/cloud ecosystem.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and growth-stage companies that integrate with Atlassian cloud products (Marketplace apps, collaboration/workflow, ITSM, developer tools and SaaS platforms)

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Baukunst, a pre‑seed venture collective. Former Vice President on the investment team at Allied Minds and early partner at Bolt. Holds an MS from MIT and a BS from Tufts; based in Somerville, Massachusetts.
enrichment.career_background: Matt Thoms is a co‑founder and General Partner at Baukunst (fund I launched 2022). He spent multiple years as VP of investments at Allied Minds, was a partner at Bolt, and has been a founding‑team operator/CEO at several early tech startups. He focuses on leading first checks for design‑and‑engineering‑led founders.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed investments in design‑driven hardware/physical‑digital products, enterprise & B2B software, and climate/energy technology.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Dover; previously co‑founder/COO of Zinc. Serves (or has served) as a General Partner at Alloy Fund and as a Senior Venture Partner at Pioneer Fund. MIT computer science graduate active in seed‑stage investing.
enrichment.career_background: Max Kolysh graduated from MIT (Computer Science). Early roles included engineering and consulting (Palantir, Groupon, Oliver Wyman). He co‑founded Zinc (COO), founded Dover (CEO), and has held venture roles including General Partner at Alloy Fund and Senior Venture Partner at Pioneer Fund; he also invests as an angel at seed stage.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / pre‑seed investments in biotech & healthcare, AI and enterprise software, consumer tech and early‑stage web3/crypto.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director at Longitude Capital focused on venture growth investing in medical technology and life sciences. Previously held strategy, finance and operating roles at Cardinal Health and began his career in Deloitte’s Life Sciences Strategy practice. Serves on the boards of Kestra Medical and Polares Medical and has been a board observer for several medtech and digital health companies. Holds a BSE in Biomedical Engineering from Duke University.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Longitude Capital in 2016 after roles at Cardinal Health (strategy, finance, marketing) and Deloitte Consulting. Promoted to Principal in 2020 and is currently listed as a Managing Director; leads and advises investments across medtech, digital health and biotech, and serves as board director or observer for multiple portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Medical devices, biotechnology and digital health; venture growth / growth-stage and commercial-stage investments (Series A and later), active board involvement and corporate development support.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Threshold Ventures based in New York who leads new investments and supports the firm’s portfolio companies. Previously an investor at First Round Capital and Chief of Staff at Thrive Global; began her career at J.P. Morgan. Holds a BA in Economics from the College of the Holy Cross and lives in New York City.
enrichment.career_background: Megan joined Threshold (initially as a principal) to expand the firm’s New York presence and now serves as a partner focused on early-stage deals and portfolio support. Before Threshold she invested at First Round Capital, served as Chief of Staff at Thrive Global, and held business management and investor roles at J.P. Morgan. She graduated from the College of the Holy Cross with a BA in economics.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed–Series A); digital health and healthcare; enterprise and vertical SaaS; developer tools and productivity software.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor focused on B2B software and vertical SaaS. Joined Lerer Hippeau from Soma Capital after earlier roles at Vista Equity Partners and AIG. Yale University graduate (BS, Economics & Psychology).
enrichment.career_background: Began investing career after graduating from Yale; roles include Global Strategy & M&A analyst at AIG (2015–2016), private equity analyst/associate at Vista Equity Partners (2016–2020), investor at Soma Capital (2020–2021), and Investor/Associate at Lerer Hippeau (June 2021–June 2023). Later joined 645 Ventures (investment role beginning 2023).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed/Series A) investments in B2B software and verticalized SaaS; interested in fintech, digital health and future-of-work companies; primarily US/Canada.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Blackhorn Ventures focused on climate and industrial decarbonization. Previously Managing Director of URBAN‑X (MINI/BMW) and a founding partner of the C3/Climate Capital syndicate; active in early‑stage climate, energy and urban infrastructure investing and acceleration.
enrichment.career_background: Micah led URBAN‑X (MINI/BMW) where he built a 70+ company portfolio, served as Strategic Advisor for Innovation at NYSERDA leading the NY Prize microgrid program, and was Director of Innovation & Entrepreneurship at NYU Tandon (launched the Urban Future Lab). He is a core faculty member for NSF I‑CORPS, founded an early mobile games company in China, and serves on several climate and nonprofit boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (Seed / Series A) climate and industrial technology: energy & grid software, mobility and transportation, built environment / proptech, supply‑chain/logistics efficiency, and AI/digital infrastructure for decarbonization.

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal at TCG focused on consumer and media investments. Previously Senior Monetization Manager at Smule and a senior associate at Adams Street Partners; started her career as an analyst at GCA Savvian. Serves on the boards of Lovevery and Sketchy and is a board observer at Food52. Holds a BA in Economics from Princeton University.
enrichment.career_background: Joined TCG in 2019 and has served in investor roles rising to Principal. Before TCG she worked at Adams Street Partners (consumer/software investments) and GCA Savvian (technology M&A/financing), and worked in monetization roles at Smule. Active on boards for portfolio companies including Lovevery and Sketchy and served as a board observer for Food52.
enrichment.investment_focus: Sports; media & content; consumer internet and marketplaces — growth-stage and consumer-focused brands and platforms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner focused on Healthcare Growth at SV Health Investors. Joined SV in 2014 and specializes in digital health and healthcare technology services after 20+ years in growth equity investing. Holds an AB in Engineering Sciences from Dartmouth College and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Began his career at IBM in healthcare and education roles, then worked as an investment banker at Broadview International. Spent nearly a decade at Summit Partners rising to General Partner, and was a General Partner at Edison Partners heading healthcare IT investments before joining SV in 2014; promoted to Managing Partner in 2018. Has served on multiple public and private boards with several IPOs and numerous M&A exits.
enrichment.investment_focus: Digital health; healthcare growth equity (provider/payer technology & services); medtech; therapeutics & biotechnology

enrichment.personal_bio: Early-stage investor focused on cybersecurity. Spent five years on YL Ventures’ investment team leading deal sourcing, board/observer roles and CISO advisory programs. Previously worked in Goldman Sachs investment banking and at an early-stage startup. Holds an MBA from University of Chicago Booth and a BA from Fordham University.
enrichment.career_background: Joined YL Ventures in July 2019 and was promoted to Principal/Partner where he led investments, U.S. team operations and the firm’s CISO advisory/network and served as board member/observer for multiple startups. Prior to VC he worked in Goldman Sachs’ Investment Banking Division and at an early-stage startup. In 2024 he joined Forgepoint as a Partner (previous YL role verifiable).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage cybersecurity (B2B/enterprise); value-add Go-to-Market and CISO/advisor-led customer introductions

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Partner at AgFunder with 25+ years of experience in food & agriculture, venture investing, environmental sustainability and law. Co‑founder/executive director of the GROW AgriFood Impact Accelerator. Holds an LL.B and an LL.M (International Environmental Law) from the University of Sydney.
enrichment.career_background: Michael Dean co‑founded AgFunder and serves as a Partner focused on agrifood technology investing. Prior to AgFunder he was a founding partner of SeedRock Capital Partners / SeedRock Africa Agriculture and has a legal background advising on environmental and large‑scale development projects. He also co‑founded the GROW AgriFood Impact Accelerator and is active on several agrifood boards and advisory roles.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed–Series A agrifood technology (AgTech & FoodTech); deep tech including AI, robotics and biotech; sustainable and impact‑focused food & agriculture solutions.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at In-Q-Tel (IQT) based in Austin, Texas. Formerly Managing Director at LG Technology Ventures and Managing Partner at Bandgap/Alara-related vehicles; has a background in semiconductors and corporate venture investing. Holds advanced technical and business degrees reported from MIT.
enrichment.career_background: Investment partner at In-Q-Tel since 2021, focused on sourcing and scaling commercial technologies for national-security applications. Prior roles include Managing Director, LG Technology Ventures (corporate VC) and leadership/board roles at Bandgap Ventures and Guggenheim-related investment vehicles; earlier technical and R&D roles in semiconductor companies and service as a U.S. Air Force research officer. Education reported at MIT (multiple advanced degrees).
enrichment.investment_focus: Commercial technologies for national-security use: cybersecurity, enterprise software/SaaS, analytics/AI, microelectronics/semiconductors; typically early-stage to Series A strategic investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial entrepreneur and early-stage investor. Founder and Managing Partner of Heroic Ventures, founder and executive chairman of Reputation.com, and CEO/founder of Modelcode.ai. Known for work on online reputation management, digital privacy, and applied AI; author and occasional Harvard Law lecturer.
interests: Applied AI in Israel and Silicon Valley
enrichment.career_background: Michael Fertik is a founder‑operator turned VC: he co‑founded Reputation.com (now executive chairman), launched Heroic Ventures (managing partner) to lead formation and first‑money investments, and founded/operates Modelcode.ai. He holds a J.D. from Harvard Law School, is named on multiple patents, and has written and appeared widely on privacy, tech, and business topics.
enrichment.investment_focus: Formation / first‑money and early‑stage investments; software, AI, hardware, and life‑sciences startups (primarily Silicon Valley and Israel)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Skillshare and Otis (Otis was acquired by Public). Founder/partner at Turing Capital, a crypto-focused angel fund. Angel investor with public-listed and early-stage positions in companies such as Notion and Polkadot; former early employee at Behance and Hot Potato.
enrichment.career_background: Serial entrepreneur and angel investor. Co‑founded Skillshare (education platform) and Otis (fractional alternative-assets marketplace); Otis was acquired by Public in 2022. Early product roles at Behance and Hot Potato. Runs Turing Capital (crypto angel fund) and publishes on startup/strategy topics. Education: B.A. in Economics (University of Virginia) and M.S. in Advertising (VCU Brandcenter).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage / angel investments focused on crypto/Web3 and founder-led startups; also interested in hard tech, AI, consumer marketplaces, creators, and longevity/biotech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial entrepreneur and investor based in New York. Founded Buddy Media and University Wire; served as Chief Strategy Officer at Salesforce after Buddy Media's acquisition. Active angel/back‑stage investor and co‑founder of Velvet Sea Ventures.
enrichment.career_background: Mike Lazerow is the founder of Buddy Media (acquired by Salesforce) and University Wire. After Buddy Media he served as Salesforce's Chief Strategy Officer. He founded Lazerow Ventures (family/co‑investment vehicle) and is a co‑founder/managing partner at Velvet Sea Ventures; he has been an active angel investor and board member in a range of digital media, SaaS, gaming and consumer startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage technology companies (digital media, SaaS, consumer brands, gaming, Web3/NFTs)

enrichment.personal_bio: Dr. Michael Rome is Managing Director and Head of Therapeutics Investing at Foresite Capital. He joined the firm in 2016 and leads the therapeutics investment practice across private and public markets. He holds a Ph.D. in Biochemistry from Caltech and a B.S. from UCLA.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Foresite Capital in 2016 and now leads the firm’s therapeutics investing practice; promoted to Managing Director in 2020. Prior roles include analyst at DAFNA Capital Management and research/scientist positions in early-stage drug development. Holds a Ph.D. in Biochemistry from Caltech (NSF fellow) and a B.S. from UCLA; serves on multiple biotech boards and has led/co-led numerous therapeutics investments and exits.
enrichment.investment_focus: Therapeutics/biopharma (oncology, inflammation, precision medicine); company formation, M&A and structured financings; investments across private and public markets (growth & late-stage).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Northpond Ventures, a science‑driven venture capital firm. Physician‑scientist and investor (M.D., Ph.D., CFA) with prior role as co‑founder and managing partner at Sands Capital Ventures. Holds degrees from UCLA (BS), University of Chicago (MD/PhD) and an MBA from UMass Amherst.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and CEO of Northpond Ventures (founded 2018). Previously co‑founded and served as managing partner at Sands Capital Ventures. Serves on multiple company boards and holds academic appointments as a visiting scholar/adjunct professor at institutions including Harvard, MIT and Stanford. Trained as a physician and surgeon with fellowship training at Harvard Medical School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Biotechnology, diagnostics, digital health, deep‑science platforms and life‑science tools

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner and co‑founder of Regeneration.VC, an early‑stage venture fund focused on consumer climate tech and the circular economy. Former founder/operator of The Playlist Generation and co‑founder of Creative Space; founder of Ponvalley, an environmental family‑office initiative. Relocated from Santa Barbara to Amsterdam to support the firm’s European expansion.
enrichment.career_background: Michael Smith co‑founded Regeneration.VC in 2020 and serves as a General Partner investing in seed and Series A consumer climate startups. Previously he ran marketing and digital for Smith Broadcasting, founded The Playlist Generation (background music provider) and co‑founded Creative Space (adaptive reuse real estate). In 2015 he launched Ponvalley (environmental initiative/family office) and holds board/advisor roles with several climate and circular economy organisations.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage consumer climate tech focusing on circular economy solutions: materials & packaging, sustainable consumer brands/products, and reuse/reverse‑logistics (Seed–Series A).

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Optum Ventures based in Boston who invests in and supports emerging healthcare companies. Previously a principal at PJC and worked in EY’s Transaction Advisory Services group. Graduated summa cum laude from Bentley University and passed all three CFA exam levels; active in local non-profits and competes in triathlons.
enrichment.career_background: Started in EY’s Transaction Advisory Services, moved into venture at PJC as a principal supporting early-stage tech companies, and is now a Partner at Optum Ventures where he focuses on investing in and commercializing healthcare technology across stages.
enrichment.investment_focus: Digital health and healthcare-focused technology (value-based care, enterprise healthcare software, enabling infrastructure and fintech); stage-agnostic from seed to growth.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Social Starts and a long-time media and Internet start-up executive. Co-founder/former executive at several publishing and tech companies (including founding editor of PC Magazine). Author of multiple books and host of the Inception podcast. Based in San Francisco and also Managing Partner of Joyance Partners.
enrichment.career_background: Over four decades in technology journalism, product testing, startups and venture investing. Early career included founding/editorial roles at Ziff-Davis (PC Magazine), content leadership at SoftBank conferences, and CEO roles at companies such as Olive Software, Inman News and Zinio. Later served as a partner at Redleaf and now leads investing at Social Starts and Joyance Partners; has consulted for Bloomberg, Reuters and AARP and authored multiple books.
enrichment.investment_focus: Moment-of-inception and Series A investments in media, marketing analytics, social platforms, mobile commerce, IoT, and health/biotech (early-stage).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Co‑CEO of FitLab and a managing partner at FitLab VC. Investor‑operator focused on fitness and sport‑lifestyle brands, leading acquisitions across digital apps, equipment, studios and events. Previously worked in private equity/venture roles and founded technology companies; holds degrees from UC Berkeley and Wharton.
enrichment.career_background: After early roles in investment banking and private equity, Melby founded and exited consumer technology companies before joining New Evolution Ventures to acquire and operate fitness brands (including roles supporting UFC Gym). In 2019 he co‑founded FitLab to acquire and operate a portfolio of fitness businesses and serves on/works with portfolio companies such as Freeletics, Momentous, Fitplan, Electric and Ragnar.
enrichment.investment_focus: Invests in and builds fitness & sport‑lifestyle companies — digital fitness apps, consumer fitness products & equipment, boutique studios and mass‑participation events.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director at Sutter Hill Ventures (joined 2008). Founding investor and served as Snowflake's founding CEO (part-time) in its early years; long-time board director at Snowflake and several private companies. Former founding CEO at Pure Storage and co-founder of Epinions and Bix; MBA from Harvard Business School. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area.
interests: AI/ML for developer productivity and products
enrichment.career_background: Seasoned operator-turned-VC: early career at Credit Suisse First Boston and McKinsey, co-founded Epinions and Bix, held product/marketing leadership roles at VERITAS and Yahoo, joined Sutter Hill Ventures in 2008, and has since incubated and led several portfolio companies (served as founding CEO at Pure Storage and Snowflake). Has also lectured at Stanford Graduate School of Business and serves on multiple boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage enterprise technology: cloud infrastructure & data platforms, cloud security, enterprise SaaS/analytics, AI-enabled developer tools, and deep-tech/energy materials.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Bridge Investments focused on legal-technology and enterprise software. Former President of Thomson Reuters’ legal business with extensive experience in strategy, M&A, marketing and leadership development. Serves as board chair or director at multiple legal-tech companies and runs Joplin Consulting as an advisor to PE sponsors.
enrichment.career_background: Suchsland spent ~15 years in senior executive roles at Thomson Reuters, finishing as President of the legal business. He later founded Joplin Consulting to advise private equity sponsors, and has served as Venture Partner at Bridge Investments and The LegalTech Fund. He holds board and chair roles (e.g., SurePoint, KLD/Ontrack) and has been involved in multiple legal‑tech exits and investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Legal technology and vertical enterprise SaaS; early to growth-stage software investments (Seed–Series B); board and M&A advisory support.
