enrichment.investment_focus: Growth/expansion capital in technology-enabled services and software; sectors include communications, insurance technology (insurtech), financial technology (fintech) — typical check sizes reported in public sources ~ $5–15M; geographic focus on the U.S. Southeast and Texas.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner & Chief Operating Officer at SV Health Investors who leads the firm’s medtech and medical device investing. Former long-time Boston Scientific executive (including COO and Group President roles). Appointed Chief Executive Officer and Co‑Chairman of Pulse Biosciences in January 2025. Holds a BA from Fairfield University and an MBA from Boston College.
enrichment.career_background: Over 35 years in global medical technology and corporate leadership. Spent ~15 years at Boston Scientific in senior operating roles (including COO, Group President Cardiovascular, President Cardiology and President International), earlier held commercial roles at C.R. Bard and Kendall. Joined SV in 2009 (Venture Partner), became Partner in 2011 and was promoted to Managing Partner & COO in 2014, where he heads the firm’s medical device investments and serves on multiple public and private boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Medtech and medical devices; healthcare growth equity; medtech convergence fund investing in cardiovascular and surgical technologies

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of One Planet Group; serial entrepreneur who co-founded AutoWeb and Reply.com (Buyerlink). UC Davis graduate and author; active angel investor and startup incubator operator focused on combining business performance with social impact.
enrichment.career_background: Payam Zamani co-founded AutoWeb in the 1990s (IPO 1999) and later launched Reply.com (rebranded as Buyerlink). In 2015 he founded One Planet Group, a hybrid private equity/operating firm that owns and invests in technology and media businesses; he has served on advisory boards and invested in multiple startups and became Chairman & CEO of Inspirato in 2024. He holds a BS from UC Davis (1994).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage technology startups (mobility, education, healthtech, environmental solutions); mission-driven/impact investments; media & adtech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture partner at Pioneer Fund and Head/MD of Fintech Partnerships, Commercial Banking at JPMorgan Chase. Former operating partner at PayPal Ventures and SVP of Innovation at Wells Fargo; founder of micro‑investing startup SparkGift. Active angel investor in early‑stage fintech, payments and crypto startups.
enrichment.career_background: Peggy Mangot leads fintech partnerships at JPMorgan Chase (joined May 2022). Previously she was Operating Partner at PayPal Ventures (2020–2022), SVP/GM of Innovation at Wells Fargo (led the Greenhouse app), and held payments/partnership roles at Google and Visa. She founded SparkGift (YC) and has served on fintech boards and as an angel investor. Educated at Indiana University (BS) and Loyola University Chicago School of Law (JD).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage startups (pre‑seed to Series A) in FinTech/payments, Web3/crypto, enterprise applications and consumer internet

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director at Pivotal Life Sciences and Managing Partner at Pivotal bioVenture Partners (based in San Francisco). Joined Pivotal in 2017 after a long tenure at Novo Ventures; earlier worked at McKinsey. Holds an M.Sc. in Engineering from the Technical University of Denmark and a post‑graduate degree in mathematical modelling in economics.
enrichment.career_background: 20+ years in life‑science venture investing and company boards. Prior roles include Senior Partner at Novo Ventures (2001–2017) and consultant at McKinsey & Company; has served on boards of public and private biotech and medtech companies and leads investments from company creation through mid/late clinical stages.
enrichment.investment_focus: Therapeutics‑focused life sciences (drug discovery, biologics, small molecules), medical devices and diagnostics; invests across company creation to mid/late clinical stages (seed through growth).

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Paladin Capital Group who focuses on investments in technology-driven companies. Has worked with early‑stage technology companies since 2000. Previously was Vice President at Core Capital Partners and an associate at FBR Technology Venture Partners; began his career as a consultant at Dean & Company. Holds an A.B. in Physics with honors from Harvard University.
enrichment.career_background: Entered venture investing in 2000 at FBR Technology Venture Partners. Served as Vice President at Core Capital Partners where he led software and infrastructure investments (including SilverStorm Technologies and RulesPower Corp.), has held multiple board and chair roles (e.g., Racemi, Unitrends, Damballa, BA Insight), and is a Venture Partner at Paladin Capital Group.
enrichment.investment_focus: Technology-driven companies with emphasis on cybersecurity, digital/digital‑infrastructure resilience, enterprise software and cloud; early‑stage through growth‑stage investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Philip M. Bilden is Founder and Managing Partner at Shield Capital, a venture firm investing in AI, autonomy, cybersecurity and space for commercial and national-security customers. He was a co-founding member and long-time leader at HarbourVest Partners, where he established and ran the firm’s Asia business. Bilden has served on corporate and nonprofit boards including Huntington Ingalls Industries and the Naval War College Foundation, and previously served in U.S. Army Reserve military intelligence. He holds a BS from Georgetown University School of Foreign Service and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Co-founding member and Managing Director at HarbourVest Partners (established and led the Asia business); retired senior advisor at HarbourVest (2016). Co-founded Shield Capital and serves as Managing Partner overseeing investment strategy, fund governance and strategic partnerships. Served on the board of Huntington Ingalls Industries (including as chair of its cybersecurity committee) and on multiple national-security and education boards; prior service in U.S. Army Reserve (military intelligence). Educated at Georgetown School of Foreign Service (BS) and Harvard Business School (MBA).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage, national-security-focused investments in artificial intelligence, autonomy, cybersecurity, and space (commercial-to-defense / dual-use technologies).

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Haymaker Ventures, focused on early-stage fintech investing. Previously a long-time investor at Thiel Capital and earlier worked in investment banking. Holds a B.A. from Harvard and an M.B.A. and Ph.D. from the Wharton School (University of Pennsylvania).
enrichment.career_background: Phin Upham is the Managing Partner of Haymaker Ventures. He spent nearly a decade investing in fintech at Thiel Capital and earlier worked in investment banking at Morgan Stanley, Rothschild and Lazard. He holds a B.A. from Harvard and an M.B.A. and Ph.D. from the Wharton School (University of Pennsylvania).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage fintech (Seed–Series A); payments and financial infrastructure; financial software & AI; insurtech; embedded finance

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Across Capital Partners focused on growth equity investments in software across the US and Latin America. Over a decade of investing experience with prior roles at Vulcan Capital, Summit Partners and UBS; co-founder/venture partner at ONEVC. Holds a BS in Business Administration from Indiana University (Kelley School of Business).
enrichment.career_background: Growth-equity investor and operator with roles at Vulcan Capital, Summit Partners and UBS early in his career. Co-founder/venture partner at ONEVC and currently General Partner at Across Capital Partners; serves on or has served on boards including Nelogica and QI Tech.
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth equity in software/SaaS companies across the United States and Latin America; supporting cross-border scaling and growth-stage (Series A–C) investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Seasoned executive and VC; co‑founder/partner at Mundi/Alma Mundi funds and Senior Advisor/Partner at Tidal Partners. Former CEO of DHL Global Forwarding EMEA and senior executive at Alcatel‑Lucent and Monitor Group. Holds an MA from Yale and a BSFS from Georgetown.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and managing partner of Alma Mundi / Mundi Ventures (ALM I & II) since 2015; earlier Senior Partner at Monitor Group; held senior commercial and strategy roles at Alcatel‑Lucent (EVP/President, Asia‑Pacific; Global Head of Strategy) and served as CEO of DHL Global Forwarding EMEA. Sits on multiple startup boards and advisory groups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage to growth B2B technology (insurtech, healthtech, fintech), climate/deeptech, with emphasis on founders from the Hispanic/diaspora ecosystem.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Keiretsu Forum and a managing partner/founder of Keiretsu Capital. 30+ years of experience in finance, real estate and marketing; co‑founder of Diablo Valley Bank and former Managing Director at Kennedy‑Wilson. Holds a BA from University of California, Berkeley and a graduate degree from Saint Mary’s College of California.
enrichment.career_background: Randy Williams founded Keiretsu Forum in 2000 and later co‑founded Keiretsu Capital. He has a multi‑decade background in finance, real estate and marketing, including roles as co‑founder/director of Diablo Valley Bank, President of Pacific Union Commercial Brokerage, founder of LaMorinda Bank and Managing Director at Kennedy‑Wilson. He also established the Keiretsu Forum Charitable Foundation and is active in investor education and angel syndication.
enrichment.investment_focus: Co‑investment funds and syndication across health‑tech/biotech, fintech, cleantech, IT/AI and real estate; seed through later‑stage co‑investments (Keiretsu Capital fund strategies).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Sleeping Bear Capital, a founder‑first private equity firm based in San Francisco. Former co‑founder and CEO of Chute (YC‑backed marketing SaaS) and former Chairman of Adaptive Energy. Focuses on acquiring orphan or aging venture‑backed technology, e‑commerce, and business‑services companies and is an active angel investor.
enrichment.career_background: Ranvir Gujral founded Sleeping Bear Capital to provide growth capital and liquidity to business‑unit spinouts and aging venture‑backed companies. He previously co‑founded and led Chute (sold to a PE firm in 2018), served as Chairman of Adaptive Energy, and has worked in investment roles earlier in his career. He holds a BBA from the University of Michigan (Ross School of Business).
enrichment.investment_focus: Founder‑first private equity investing in business‑unit spinouts and aging/orphan venture‑backed technology, e‑commerce, and business services; also active angel investing (seed to growth stages).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and managing partner of E2MC (Earth-to-Mars Capital), a space-focused early-stage venture capital firm. Co‑founder and CEO of Prometheus Life Technologies and host of the Space Business Podcast. Author of a book on the space economy and lecturer on space entrepreneurship and finance. Holds CFA and has academic credentials from Wharton, PUC‑Rio and the International Space University.
enrichment.career_background: Former investment-banking and hedge‑fund professional and fintech entrepreneur in Brazil; later founded E2MC to invest in space startups globally. Teaches courses on the space economy at institutions including ISU and EPFL, serves on ISU governance, hosts a widely‑distributed podcast, and holds CFA/FRM charters and degrees from the Wharton School, PUC‑Rio (machine learning), and the International Space University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / pre‑seed and early‑stage investments in space technology and adjacent deep tech (satellite communications, remote sensing, launch, in‑orbit services, spacecraft hardware, microgravity manufacturing, space biotech); global mandate.

enrichment.personal_bio: Razmig Hovaghimian is an entrepreneur and angel investor who is a Partner at Graph Ventures. He co-founded Viki (acquired by Rakuten), co‑founded the Embrace neonatal device initiative, and founded Hoodline; he has made angel investments in startups including PicsArt, Envoy and Houseparty. He holds an MBA from Stanford and is based in San Francisco.
enrichment.career_background: Razmig built and led consumer media businesses (co‑founder & CEO of Viki; founder of Hoodline/Pixel Labs), served as a senior executive and board observer at Rakuten after Viki’s acquisition, co‑founded the Embrace neonatal device nonprofit, and invests/operates as a Partner at Graph Ventures and in sports‑tech initiatives (Matchday, Play Time).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed / pre‑seed) startups in consumer internet and media/content, marketplaces, AI/ML, sports & gaming, and developer/product tools.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner and COO at Neotribe Ventures who co‑leads the firm’s $90M Ignite growth-stage fund and runs the firm’s New York presence. Previously spent ten years at J.P. Morgan Asset Management; is a CFA charterholder and Cornell University graduate. citeturn1search1turn3search2turn3search3
enrichment.career_background: Spent ~10 years at J.P. Morgan Asset Management (roles across New York, London, Frankfurt) including time in the Private Equity Group; joined Neotribe in 2021 as a Partner to co-manage the Ignite Fund. citeturn3search5turn1search1
enrichment.hometown: West Virginia (grew up in a small coal‑mining town). citeturn3search5
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-to-growth stage venture investments (Seed through Series B+); deep‑tech sectors including enterprise software, AI/ML, enterprise security, computational biology, and cleantech. citeturn1search3turn1search1

enrichment.personal_bio: Reid Huber, Ph.D., is a Partner at Third Rock Ventures (joined 2018) who focuses on company formation, development and strategy in life sciences. He was a founding member of Incyte’s scientific team and served as Executive Vice President and Chief Scientific Officer prior to joining Third Rock.
enrichment.career_background: Reid Huber has over two decades of biotech R&D and leadership experience. He joined Incyte in 2002 as a founding scientific team member and rose to Executive Vice President & Chief Scientific Officer, leading discovery efforts that advanced numerous clinical programs; earlier roles include DuPont Pharmaceuticals and Bristol-Myers Squibb. He earned a Ph.D. in Human Molecular Genetics from Washington University School of Medicine and completed postdoctoral training at the NIH before joining Third Rock Ventures in 2018.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage life-sciences company creation and build; therapeutics (especially oncology/hematology); disease genetics and data-driven drug discovery; translational medicine.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner and CIO at Stratos Technologies (founded 2016), an early-stage venture firm focused on Web3 and crypto. Previously a Research Associate at Sanders Capital. Holds dual B.S. degrees in Applied Mathematics and Mechanical Engineering from Southern Methodist University and an M.S. in Quantitative Finance from MIT.
enrichment.career_background: Founded Stratos in 2016 and leads the firm’s investment activity in crypto, DeFi and related infrastructure. Prior to Stratos he was a research associate at Sanders Capital. Educated at Southern Methodist University (BS) and MIT (MS, Quantitative Finance).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed / Series A) investments in Web3, DeFi, blockchain infrastructure, layer‑2 networks, and tokenized real‑world assets.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Vision Ridge Partners, a sustainable real‑assets investment firm he started in 2008. Former Managing Director at The Baupost Group and co‑founder/CEO of Bright Automotive. Active on boards and industry organizations focused on electrification and clean energy. Graduated magna cum laude from Washington and Lee University.
interests: Renewable electricity generation and energy infrastructure
enrichment.career_background: Reuben Munger founded Vision Ridge Partners in 2008 to invest in sustainable real assets across energy, transportation and agriculture. Prior to Vision Ridge he was a Managing Director at The Baupost Group, a consultant to TPG, and an investment banker at James D. Wolfensohn, Inc. He co‑founded Bright Automotive and serves on multiple corporate and non‑profit boards (e.g., RMI, Electrification Coalition, League of Conservation Voters).
enrichment.investment_focus: Sustainable real assets (energy, transportation, agriculture) with emphasis on electrified mobility, renewable energy generation, charging & infrastructure, and the built environment.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Juniper Advisory (healthcare M&A) and active angel investor affiliated with NextGen Venture Partners' venture partner network. Based in Chicago; holds an MBA from Northwestern University (Kellogg). Sits on investment committees and teaches/lectures on hospital M&A and related topics.
enrichment.career_background: Started as an analyst at Morningstar and an associate at Morgan Stanley, earned an MBA from Northwestern (Kellogg), and has spent 2009–present at Juniper Advisory where he is a Partner advising nonprofit hospital systems on M&A. He also serves on investment committees (e.g., Purple Arch) and is an active angel investor in early-stage startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Healthcare (hospital M&A), digital health/health IT, FinTech; seed and early-stage (angel/seed) investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Reza Zadno, PhD, is a medical‑device entrepreneur, operator and investor. He served as a Venture Partner/Advisor at InterWest Partners (starting 2012) and has held CEO roles at Avedro (2016–2020) and PROCEPT BioRobotics (since 2020). He founded Visiogen and co‑founded PercuSurge and has extensive board and executive experience in ophthalmology and other medtech sectors.
enrichment.career_background: Dr. Zadno holds an M.Sc. and Ph.D. from École Nationale Supérieure des Mines de Paris. He co‑founded PercuSurge (acquired by Medtronic) and founded Visiogen (acquired by Abbott Medical Optics), served as Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence and venture partner at several VC firms, and later led Avedro through IPO and acquisition before joining PROCEPT BioRobotics as President & CEO. He has served on multiple public and private boards and is listed as an inventor on numerous U.S. patents.
enrichment.investment_focus: Healthcare / medtech (medical devices, ophthalmology, surgical robotics); early‑to‑growth stage venture investments and operator-led commercialization

enrichment.personal_bio: Veteran life‑sciences investor and company builder; co‑founder and Managing Partner at Cure Ventures. Previously led investments and served on boards at Omega Funds and MVM Life Science Partners. Educated at Harvard College (A.B.) and Harvard Business School (M.B.A.).
enrichment.career_background: Over 30 years in life sciences investing and corporate development. Held senior roles at Omega Funds (Managing Member/President), MVM Life Science Partners (US head), and earlier at Saunders Karp & Megrue and LEK Consulting; also served as SVP/Chief Business Officer for an oncology biopharma before co‑founding Cure Ventures in 2021.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed‑stage life sciences: de novo company formation and therapeutics (drug discovery, oncology, medtech); genetic validation and operator‑led company building.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and CEO of Quantstamp, a blockchain security and smart‑contract audit firm. Listed as a Venture Partner / Portfolio Founder at Pioneer Fund. Previously worked as an algorithmic/quantitative software engineer at Tower Research Capital; holds a BS from Cornell University.
enrichment.career_background: Founded Quantstamp and serves as its CEO, leading product and security strategy for smart‑contract audits and Web3 security services. Prior to Quantstamp he worked in algorithmic/high‑frequency trading (Tower Research Capital). Active angel/seed investor and board/advisor for multiple crypto and Web3 startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed–Series A) investments in Web3/crypto and blockchain security, plus consumer SaaS, gaming, AI and fintech (frequently invests in YC‑backed founders).

enrichment.personal_bio: Robert Berendes, Ph.D., is an Executive Partner focused on sustainability in agriculture and nutrition. He chairs Indigo Agriculture and serves on the boards of Inari and Invaio Sciences, advising Flagship’s agtech and bio-agriculture ventures. Berendes has prior executive experience at Syngenta and was a partner at McKinsey; he holds a doctorate in biophysics.
interests: Corporate venturing, M&A and strategic business development
enrichment.career_background: Berendes began his career as a process engineer at Procter & Gamble, was later a partner at McKinsey & Company (co‑leading the European Chemical Practice), and held multiple senior roles at Syngenta including Global Head of Business Development and interim Head of R&D. He co-owns a-connect (Switzerland), has served as an Operating Director at Paine & Partners, joined Flagship in 2014 and became an Executive Partner in 2019, focusing on founding and scaling sustainability and agriculture ventures. He holds a diploma in chemistry from the University of Cologne and a Ph.D. in biophysics from the Max Planck Institute/Technical University of Munich.
enrichment.investment_focus: Sustainability-focused agriculture and nutrition: early-stage agtech and agricultural biotechnology (plant microbiome and microbial solutions); board-level operational and strategic support.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Ballast Point Ventures since 2010 with a focus on technology-enabled business services and Software-as-a-Service companies. Serves on multiple portfolio company boards and as a board observer. Prior experience in leveraged finance and private equity; educated at Princeton University (BA) and Tuck School of Business at Dartmouth (MBA).
enrichment.career_background: Joined Ballast Point Ventures in 2010. Previously an Associate at Wachovia Capital Partners (private equity) and an Analyst in the Leveraged Finance Group at Wachovia Securities. Holds a BA from Princeton University and an MBA from Tuck School of Business at Dartmouth.
enrichment.investment_focus: Technology-enabled business services, SaaS; Healthcare and healthtech; Consumer products & services; Software

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Inspiration Ventures. Over 30 years founding and leading technology startups and now investing at seed/early stages. Serves as director/advisor on multiple portfolio boards. Holds a BS in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science from UC Berkeley.
enrichment.career_background: Robert Fanini co‑founded Inspiration Ventures (2007) and is a managing/general partner. Prior to VC he founded and led multiple technology companies (including Capital Technologies, Foglight Software, SiteROCK and GroundWork) and currently advises or sits on boards for several portfolio companies. He holds an EECS degree from the University of California, Berkeley.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments in software, SaaS, AI and select fintech/marketplace opportunities.

enrichment.personal_bio: Rob (Robert) Olson is a data and operations executive who served as Partner & Head of Data Strategy at M13. He helped build M13’s data practice and led investments including Pinata, Banyan and Visor. In February 2024 he left M13 to become Chief Operating Officer at PINATA. He previously built the centralized data organization at DigitalOcean and holds a BA from Princeton University.
enrichment.career_background: Built and led centralized data teams at DigitalOcean (Director, Data & Analytics), joined M13 in 2019 as Partner & Head of Data Strategy where he ran the firm’s data practice and supported sourcing/diligence; served on boards/led deals for portfolio companies; in February 2024 transitioned to an operating role as Chief Operating Officer at PINATA.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed, Series A) investing in consumer & B2B software: future of work, commerce/e-commerce infrastructure, fintech/money, health, AI, and Web3/crypto.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director at Cascade Seed Fund; 25+ years as a software executive, founder and seed-stage investor. Launched Cascade Seed Fund with Julie Harrelson and leads the firm’s Pacific Northwest seed investing from Bend, Oregon.
interests: Seed / pre-seed software and consumer brands
Access to essential services (health, education, financial)
enrichment.career_background: Former founder and product leader across multiple venture-backed startups; ex-CEO of LoopFuse (acquired), former VP of Marketing at Gist (acquired by BlackBerry), began his career at Accenture. Holds a BBA in Finance from the University of Georgia and an MBA from the University of Tennessee.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed & seed-stage investments in software and consumer brands; thematic focus on Enterprise/B2B orchestration, Transformation of Work, Elevated Consumer Experiences, and Access to Essential Services; geographic focus on the Pacific Northwest and emerging U.S. entrepreneurial hubs.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Third Point Ventures since June 2000. Longtime board director with portfolio experience across semiconductors, enterprise software, security, and data companies. Holds a multi-discipline engineering degree from the University of California, Berkeley.
enrichment.career_background: Robert Schwartz has served as Managing Partner of Third Point Ventures (the VC arm of Third Point LLC) since June 2000. He previously spent 23 years as President of RF Associates North, a communications semiconductor manufacturer’s representative firm. At Third Point Ventures he leads and sits on boards for multiple investments across enterprise software, networking, security, and semiconductor companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage through growth-stage investments in enterprise and infrastructure software, cloud-native and observability tools, cybersecurity, semiconductors and hardware, data & analytics/AI, fintech and mobility/cleantech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner (Managing Director) at Proeza Ventures, a LatAm‑established early‑stage VC focused on mobility. Over 15 years advising M&A transactions (~US$6.5B) and several years investing in early‑stage mobility startups. Holds a BA in Economics from Tecnológico de Monterrey and an MBA from NYU Stern; reported CFA charterholder.
enrichment.career_background: Led investment strategy and portfolio management at Proeza Ventures; previously Chief Investment Officer at PSM (impact fund), M&A Director at Fimecap, Vice President (Americas Corporate Finance) at BBVA Bancomer and Senior Associate in Credit Suisse���'s M&A Technology group. Experience includes structuring/closing multiple venture investments and advising on middle‑market M&A.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed to Series A) investments across the mobility value chain — industrial tech, smart components, new vehicles/EVs, MaaS, logistics & digital data services; primary focus on the Americas, opportunistic in Western Europe and Israel.

enrichment.personal_bio: Seasoned venture investor with 25+ years focused on clean energy, climate and sustainability. Co‑founder and investment lead for Amazon’s $2B Climate Pledge Fund (launched 2020) and currently Managing Partner at Propeller VC. Experience includes leading the Alexa Accelerator and prior roles at Nth Power and as founder of Shuddle.
enrichment.career_background: Rodrigo has led corporate and VC investing in climate and energy for over two decades. He co‑founded and led investments for Amazon’s Climate Pledge Fund (2020–2023), ran Amazon’s Alexa Fund and Alexa Accelerator, was a partner at Nth Power (energy tech VC), and founded Shuddle. He holds an MBA from UC Berkeley Haas and a BA from Middlebury College and is now Managing Partner at Propeller VC.
enrichment.investment_focus: Invests in climate technologies across transportation, energy storage, sustainable aviation, carbon measurement/removal, and ocean/blue‑economy solutions; typical stages: seed to Series A.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and partner at Avalancha Ventures and founder/chairman of Kuspit (Mexico's first fully online brokerage). Longstanding background in finance and venture investing, with prior roles in investment banking and alternative-asset management. Holds an MS in Operations Research from Stanford University and an undergraduate engineering degree from Universidad de las Américas Puebla.
enrichment.career_background: Co-founded Avalancha Ventures (2015) and Kuspit Casa de Bolsa (2010); serves as managing/operating partner at Avalancha and founder/chairman at Kuspit. Background includes roles in investment banking and alternative investments and board/advisor positions at portfolio companies; educated at Universidad de las Américas Puebla (BS) and Stanford University (MS).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) fintech, payments and financial services; technology-driven software startups in Latin America (primary) and select U.S./Brazil opportunities.

enrichment.personal_bio: Seasoned finance executive and board director. Operating Partner Emeritus at Lead Edge Capital and Chief Financial Officer at Benchling; independent board member at HubSpot and Amplitude. Former CFO of NetSuite with prior leadership roles at Hyperion and SAP. Based in San Francisco.
interests: Board governance and audit committee work
enrichment.career_background: Ron Gill is a finance executive focused on scaling high-growth technology companies. He served as Chief Financial Officer of NetSuite, held senior finance roles at Hyperion and SAP, was an Operating Partner at Lead Edge Capital, and serves on the boards of HubSpot, Amplitude and Benchling. He holds a M.I.B.S. from the University of South Carolina and a B.A. from Baylor University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth-stage enterprise software and SaaS; scaling finance and operations for high-growth tech companies; board-level governance and audit oversight

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder & CEO of Closed Loop Partners, an investment firm focused on building the circular economy. Former Deputy Commissioner of Sanitation, Recycling and Sustainability for New York City and co‑founder/CEO of RecycleBank. Adjunct professor at Columbia Business School and author of The Waste‑Free World. Holds an MBA from Columbia Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Began his career at Deloitte, co‑founded and served as CEO of RecycleBank (2003–2010), then served in the Bloomberg administration as NYC Deputy Commissioner of Sanitation, Recycling & Sustainability. In 2014 he co‑founded Closed Loop Partners and serves as its CEO; he has also been an adjunct professor at Columbia Business School and is the author of The Waste‑Free World.
enrichment.investment_focus: Circular economy investments across venture capital, growth equity, private equity and project finance (plastics & packaging, textiles & apparel, food & organics, circular technology, recycling & recovery infrastructure)

enrichment.personal_bio: CEO and co‑founder of ZenBusiness. Former founding CTO of HomeAway. Partner, mentor and angel investor at Capital Factory and member of several nonprofit and corporate boards.
enrichment.career_background: Technology executive and entrepreneur: founding CTO of HomeAway (2005–2015), VP of Engineering at Excite, co‑founder & CEO of ZenBusiness (2016–present), and partner/mentor at Capital Factory. Serves on boards including the Santa Fe Institute and American National Bank of Texas; holds a B.S. in Computer Science from the University of Texas at Austin.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed/Series A) software and SaaS companies, with emphasis on SMB platforms, marketplaces, HRTech and Real Estate/PropTech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at R-Squared Ventures and former CEO & co‑founder of Loop Commerce. Led Loop through a 2018 acquisition by Synchrony and later served as GM/SVP at Synchrony; holds an MBA from Columbia Business School and is based in the Silicon Valley / Los Altos area.
enrichment.career_background: Entrepreneur-operator turned investor: co‑founded and ran Loop Commerce (CEO), scaled the company and exited to Synchrony in 2018, then served in senior roles at Synchrony before co‑founding R‑Squared Ventures in 2021. Prior roles include senior business development and sales leadership; active angel investor, board member and advisor.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage investments (seed/early VC) in Fintech, Enterprise/SMB SaaS and AI, plus marketplaces and e-commerce enablement; focus also includes vertical-specific tech (TaxTech, LegalTech, InsureTech).

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and early-stage investor; co‑founder and former CEO of Magento. Founding partner at R-Squared Ventures and active board member/advisor across commerce and SaaS startups. Known for angel and seed investments in e-commerce, marketplace, and fintech companies.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded and served as CEO of Magento (commerce platform). Since leaving Magento he has been an investor and advisor to early‑stage companies and is a founding partner of R‑Squared Ventures, where he focuses on seed and early rounds in commerce, SaaS, fintech and marketplace businesses; he also co‑founded BookOutdoors and holds board/advisor roles at multiple startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise/SMB SaaS; E‑commerce enablement; Fintech; Marketplaces; AI; vertical-specific technologies (TaxTech, LegalTech, InsureTech)

enrichment.personal_bio: Rumi Morales is a partner and board member at Outlier Ventures and an investor focused on the convergence of Web3, blockchain, and advanced computing. She previously led CME Ventures (CME Group) and held senior roles at Goldman Sachs and Digital Currency Group. Morales is based in Chicago and holds a BA from Wellesley College and an MBA from NYU Stern.
enrichment.career_background: Morales has worked in venture and corporate investing across North America, Europe and Asia. She led CME Ventures (the strategic investment arm of CME Group), served in senior roles at Goldman Sachs, worked on venture and growth investing at Digital Currency Group, and joined Outlier Ventures as a Partner and Board Member. She also serves as an operating/advising partner to enterprise technology funds and sits on several nonprofit and industry boards. Morales received her undergraduate degree from Wellesley College and an MBA from NYU Stern.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and growth investments in Web3/blockchain, digital assets, AI/ML, quantum and next‑generation computing, and enterprise financial infrastructure.

enrichment.personal_bio: Scientist, biotech entrepreneur and investor. Co‑founder and CEO of Wild Earth; partner at Babel Ventures and managing partner at Sustainable Food Ventures. Former co‑founder and Program Director at IndieBio and former head of life sciences at the XPRIZE Foundation. Focuses on consumer biotech, cellular agriculture and synthetic biology investments.
enrichment.career_background: Ryan Bethencourt is a scientist and entrepreneur who has led and built biotech and food startups and accelerators. He co‑founded IndieBio, served as head of life sciences at XPRIZE, co‑founded Berkeley Biolabs and Counter Culture Labs, and is currently CEO of Wild Earth while serving as a partner at Babel Ventures and managing partner at Sustainable Food Ventures.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage consumer biotechnology and synthetic biology; cellular agriculture and food tech (plant-based and cell-based); deep‑tech/pre-seed and seed investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and data scientist who served as Partner and Data Scientist at Tribe Capital, contributing to the firm’s quantitative diligence work (Magic 8-ball reports). Previously built quantitative market-intelligence at Lyft and held early data roles at Coursera and Partners Group. Holds an MBA from Yale School of Management and a BA in computational mathematics from Rice University.
enrichment.career_background: Ryan George worked as a Data Scientist and later Partner at Tribe Capital, where he authored quantitative diligence reports and contributed to the firm’s data-science underwriting. Before Tribe he built quantitative market-intelligence at Lyft, held data roles at Coursera, and worked at Partners Group. He holds an MBA from Yale School of Management and a BA in computational mathematics from Rice University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed to growth-stage technology companies; emphasis on AI and data-driven enterprise software, Web3/crypto, and space/aerospace infrastructure.

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial entrepreneur and investor; co‑founder of Omnisio (acquired by Google) and Parsable. Managing Partner at Electric Ant, an early‑stage operator fund, and former part‑time partner at Y Combinator. Holds an M.S. in Electrical Engineering from Stanford and undergraduate degrees from the University of Sydney.
enrichment.career_background: Ryan Junee is a founder‑operator and investor who has started multiple technology companies (including Omnisio, Inporia, Parsable, RxDefine/Ostro) and served as a part‑time partner at Y Combinator. He is Managing Partner at Electric Ant (founded 2021), has advised accelerator programs (Startmate, 500 Startups, StartX), and holds an M.S. in Electrical Engineering from Stanford and bachelor’s degrees from the University of Sydney.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage technology and crypto (web3) investments; operator‑led/founder‑friendly seed and pre‑seed deals.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Lowercarbon Capital who leads the firm’s work on carbon removal. Previously led Stripe’s carbon removal procurement program and helped build Stripe Climate’s partnerships. Former founder/product designer (Finish) and co‑founder of education startup Volley. Grew up in Boulder, Colorado and is currently based in New York City.
enrichment.career_background: Ryan Orbuch is a Partner at Lowercarbon Capital focusing on carbon removal. Before Lowercarbon he led procurement for Stripe Climate, building partnerships and expert review processes for carbon removal purchases. Earlier in his career he co‑founded the education app Finish (Apple Design Award winner) and the startup Volley, and worked as a product manager and software engineer.
enrichment.investment_focus: Climate tech — carbon removal and emissions reduction; energy and industrial decarbonization; early-stage (Seed–Series A) deep‑tech startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor focused on data infrastructure, developer tooling and AI/ML who was part of Dell Technologies Capital's investment team. After DTC he moved to Unusual Ventures and later joined SignalFire. Holds a BA from Northwestern University.
enrichment.career_background: Worked as a data engineer at Magnetar Capital (~2016–2018), joined Dell Technologies Capital as an investor (2018–2023), then moved to Unusual Ventures (joined 2023) and later became a Principal at SignalFire (joined 2024).
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise & cloud infrastructure, data & analytics, developer tools, AI/ML, cybersecurity

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Partner at Jump Capital, based in Chicago. Former operating partner at Tarsus and head of consumer moving at SIRVA, with early career roles in GE management programs. Holds a BS in Chemical Engineering (University of Rochester) and an MBA from Northwestern Kellogg. Focuses on RegTech, compliance/risk, data governance and modernizing legacy enterprise functions.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Jump Capital in 2012 and invests in early‑stage companies across fintech, application software and infrastructure. Prior to Jump he held operating and investment roles including operating partner at Tarsus and head of consumer moving at SIRVA; began his career in GE management programs. Educational background: BS Chemical Engineering (University of Rochester) and MBA (Northwestern Kellogg).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage fintech, B2B application software (SaaS), infrastructure software; emphasis on RegTech, compliance, data governance and modernizing enterprise operations.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and CEO of Vouch, a technology‑first business insurance provider for startups. Previously co‑founded and led Funding Circle U.S.; holds an MBA and MS from Stanford University and a BA (magna cum laude) from Brown University.
enrichment.career_background: Seasoned operator and angel investor who co‑founded Vouch (2018) to build digital insurance for high‑growth startups. Earlier he co‑founded Endurance Lending Network and led Funding Circle U.S. through scaling and IPO-related activity. Prior experience includes roles in corporate development, private markets investing and strategy consulting; educated at Brown and Stanford (MBA, MS).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early‑stage (Seed/Series A) investments in insurance, fintech, payments, marketplaces and startup infrastructure

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner and member of the Investment Committee at Brighton Park Capital. Joined BPC in 2019 after investing roles at JMI Equity and as Co‑Founder/Principal of Elsewhere Partners; began his career at Bain & Company. Holds a degree in Finance, Economics & Strategy from Washington University in St. Louis.
enrichment.career_background: Sam Kentor is a Partner and Investment Committee member at Brighton Park Capital (joined 2019). Prior to BPC he was a Principal and co‑founder at Elsewhere Partners and held investing roles at JMI Equity; he began his career at Bain & Company. He focuses on investing in founder‑led enterprise software and growth‑stage technology companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Founder‑led, growth‑stage enterprise software and SaaS; healthcare and tech‑enabled services.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director and CTO at Sutter Hill Ventures. Former senior infrastructure engineer and advisor at Twitter (joined via Bagcheck acquisition) and former Chief Technologist at Yahoo. Early engineer at WebLogic/BEA and co‑founder/CEO of Bagcheck and Gauntlet Systems. Holds an MS in Physics from Northwestern University and a BS from Worcester Polytechnic Institute.
enrichment.career_background: Long‑time technologist turned investor: early server engineer at WebLogic/BEA, co‑founder/CEO of Gauntlet Systems and Bagcheck (acquired by Twitter), later Chief Technologist at Yahoo and senior infrastructure engineer/advisor at Twitter, then joined Sutter Hill Ventures where he invests in and advises infrastructure, developer tooling and cloud companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise infrastructure, observability, developer tools/platforms, databases and cloud security

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at F-Prime Capital Partners focused on enterprise technology and cybersecurity. Former CTO at LogMeIn and later CTO roles at Profitero and Richmond Global Sciences. Active angel investor and startup mentor with a background in building large-scale SaaS products and engineering organizations.
enrichment.career_background: Sandor Palfy holds a master’s degree in Computer Science from Budapest University of Technology and Economics. He spent over a decade at LogMeIn, rising to CTO and leading identity and remote-management product portfolios (including LastPass). After LogMeIn he served as CTO at Profitero and Richmond Global Sciences and has served as a Venture Partner at F-Prime (and later Eight Roads), advising portfolio companies on technology and engineering scale.
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise technology and cybersecurity; SaaS and cloud infrastructure; AI/ML and developer tools; early-stage through growth-stage (seed to Series A/B).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑Founder and Managing Partner at S4S Ventures, focused on early-stage investments in marketing and advertising technology. Former WPP executive who led global strategic development and platform partnerships; MBA from Columbia Business School and adjunct lecturer. Serves on several boards and is a board member of Human Rights First.
enrichment.career_background: Longtime marketing and media executive at WPP where she led strategic development, partnerships and venture activity with major platforms (Google, Meta, Snap, TikTok, Amazon). Co‑founded S4S Ventures in 2022 to invest in martech, adtech, data and emerging digital media; holds an MBA from Columbia Business School and has served as a board director/observer for multiple venture-backed companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage martech, adtech, data & identity technology, creative/connected media, programmatic CTV and emerging digital media

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and Managing Director at Energy Foundry, focused on early-stage energy and cleantech investing. Previously led a government advisory practice for clean-tech startups at Wilson Sonsini and held roles at GE Energy and GaiaTech. Holds an MBA from University of Chicago Booth and a BA from Emory University.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and Managing Director at Energy Foundry (Chicago), where she leads investment activity and portfolio company support. Prior to Energy Foundry she co‑managed Wilson Sonsini’s government advisory practice for clean‑technology startups, helping clients secure >$300M in non‑dilutive funding; earlier roles include GE Energy and environmental consulting at GaiaTech. Serves on accelerator investment committees and as an executive‑in‑residence at Chicago Booth.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage cleantech and energy (seed to Series A): energy storage, grid/software, renewables, energy efficiency, hardware + enterprise energy solutions.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and media/tech executive. Served as Managing Director/Partner at Glasswing Ventures, leading investments in early-stage AI, marketing technology and B2B marketplaces. Former CEO/President in major media groups and active board director.
enrichment.career_background: More than 20 years in media and marketing services: led Carat Interactive and Isobar (President), served as CEO of Aegis Media North America, and later moved into venture investing and board roles. Has served on boards/advisory roles for companies including Ziff Davis, Narrative I/O, Celtra and SocialFlow. Holds a BA from the University of Vermont.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage investments in AI-native software, marketing technology/digital media, and B2B marketplaces (pre-seed to Series A)

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Astor Perkins and a serial entrepreneur and keynote speaker. Focuses on deep‑tech investments related to human survival, including space, climate/sustainability, longevity and advanced computing. Author of "Strive" and has over 20 years of product, strategy and startup experience.
enrichment.career_background: Over 20 years as an operator, founder and investor. Former CEO of Amyx+ and founder/co‑founder of several startups; has held senior product and strategy roles in corporate settings and serves as a public speaker and author. Currently chairs and manages investments at Astor Perkins.
enrichment.investment_focus: Deep tech and "human survival" sectors — space, defense, climate & sustainability, longevity/biotech, AI/autonomy and quantum computing; invests across stages from pre‑seed to later rounds.

enrichment.personal_bio: Special Advisor at Lead Edge Capital and founder/managing partner of Eastern Advisors with 20+ years in technology investing. Former portfolio manager at Kingdon Capital. Holds an M.I.A. from Columbia SIPA and a B.A. from College of the Holy Cross (Watson Fellow).
interests: Growth equity for software & internet businesses
enrichment.career_background: Founder and Managing Partner of Eastern Advisors (founded 2003); Founder and Special Advisor at Lead Edge Capital; previously a portfolio manager for Asia-Pacific at Kingdon Capital. Serves/has served on multiple company boards and advisory roles; educated at Columbia University (M.I.A.) and College of the Holy Cross (B.A., Watson Fellowship).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage venture and growth-stage investments in software, internet, SaaS and tech-enabled services.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and Managing Partner at Everywhere Ventures; veteran early-stage investor and author of The Fuzzy and the Techie. Focuses on global pre-seed investing across fintech, health, and future-of-work startups. Previously worked at Google and Facebook and served as a Presidential Innovation Fellow at the White House. citeturn2view0turn1search0turn1search5
enrichment.career_background: 15+ years in venture capital; formerly Partner at Mohr Davidow Ventures and Venture Partner / roles at Compound and Metamorphic Ventures. Co-founded Two Culture Capital and co-manages Everywhere Ventures. Served as a Presidential Innovation Fellow and has written for and spoken widely about the intersection of liberal arts and technology. citeturn3search2turn1search2
enrichment.investment_focus: Global pre-seed and seed investing (typical check $50k–$250k); sector focus: money (fintech), health, and work. citeturn2view0

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Ballast Point Ventures (since 2011) who focuses on technology-enabled business service companies with a particular emphasis on Software-as-a-Service (SaaS). Serves on boards including Abacode, SPOTIO, Keen Decision Systems and Viirtue. Prior to BPV he worked in technology investment banking at Raymond James. Holds a BSBA in Finance (UCF) and an MBA (Rollins College).
enrichment.career_background: Joined Ballast Point Ventures in 2011 and sources and manages growth equity and later-stage venture investments, primarily in software and tech-enabled services. Prior role: three years in the Technology Investment Banking Group at Raymond James working on M&A and capital raises. Education: BSBA (Finance), University of Central Florida; MBA, Crummer Graduate School of Business at Rollins College.
enrichment.investment_focus: SaaS and technology-enabled business services; growth/later-stage venture and growth equity (primarily companies in the Southeast U.S. and Texas)

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Castle Island Ventures focused on financial market infrastructure, consumer fintech, and applications built on public blockchains. Serves on boards/observerships for portfolio companies including Félix, Eaglebrook Advisors, Beam and TYB. Previously a Principal at Highland Capital Partners and an investor at Pomona Capital; began his career in investment banking at Bank of America Merrill Lynch. Holds a BA in Economics from Vanderbilt University.
enrichment.career_background: Sean Judge is a General Partner at Castle Island Ventures (early-stage VC focused on public blockchains). Prior to Castle Island he was a Principal at Highland Capital Partners, an investor at Pomona Capital (New York and Hong Kong), and began his career covering financial institutions as an investment banker at Bank of America Merrill Lynch. He holds a BA in Economics from Vanderbilt University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Public blockchains; blockchain infrastructure and applications; financial market infrastructure; consumer fintech; early-stage (Seed/Series A/B) investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at TTV Capital focused on early-stage fintech. Oversees legal, regulatory and financial operations for the firm and serves on multiple portfolio boards. Former VP of Finance & General Counsel at an Atlanta startup; MBA (Emory), JD (University of San Diego), BS (U.S. Naval Academy).
interests: Financial services for the gig economy
enrichment.career_background: Joined TTV as a summer associate in 2002 and returned in 2005; currently a partner with two decades+ of venture experience. Prior to TTV he was VP of Finance and General Counsel at an Atlanta technology startup. Education: B.S. in Economics (U.S. Naval Academy), J.D. (University of San Diego), MBA (Goizueta Business School, Emory). Longtime leader in Atlanta’s fintech community (Technology Association of Georgia/TAG roles).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage fintech (payments, embedded finance, fintech infrastructure, regtech/compliance, fintech-enabled B2B SaaS)

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Lobby Capital and founder/operator with a background scaling consumer and SaaS products. Co‑founder of Evite, former President & CTO of SurveyMonkey, and co‑founder & CEO of Gixo (acquired by Openfit). Currently CEO & co‑founder of HomeBoost and serves on the boards of Redfin and Voltus.
enrichment.career_background: Selina co‑founded Evite, served in senior product/engineering roles at Ticketmaster Europe, and was President & CTO of SurveyMonkey (2009–2016). She co‑founded Gixo (acquired by Openfit), served as Openfit’s Chief Digital Officer, and is currently CEO & co‑founder of HomeBoost. She is a venture partner at Lobby Capital and holds board seats at Redfin and Voltus. She earned a BS in Computer Science from Stanford University and is based in San Francisco.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer & small‑business services; SaaS and marketplaces; early‑stage/seed; climate/home energy

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and General Partner at 6th Man Ventures and co‑founder & CEO of StayTuned. Former Global Head of Media Apps, Android / Google Play. Stanford-trained engineer with an MBA from Harvard; active angel and web3 investor focused on early-stage crypto and developer infrastructure.
enrichment.career_background: Started in investment banking, worked in venture at Globespan, corporate development at Sony Music, then led media partnerships for Android/Google Play. Co‑founded StayTuned (CEO) and 6th Man Ventures (Co‑founder & GP), and serves on/has advised multiple startups in media, healthcare and crypto. Education: Stanford (BS/MS engineering) and Harvard Business School (MBA).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage Web3/crypto (pre-seed to Seed/Series A); DAOs & DeFi primitives; metaverse / AR‑VR; developer infrastructure and consumer/web3 applications.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor focused on early-stage B2B SaaS and enterprise cloud companies. Joined High Alpha in 2019 and was promoted to Principal (later listed as Partner), leading deal sourcing, diligence and board/observer roles. Previously worked in technology investment banking at Pacific Crest Securities and in private equity/venture roles at Goldman Sachs. Graduate of Purdue University Krannert School of Management and a Kauffman Fellow.
enrichment.career_background: Began his investment career in technology-focused roles at Goldman Sachs and Pacific Crest Securities. Joined High Alpha in 2019, where he led early-stage investments, served as board observer for multiple portfolio companies, and was promoted to Principal (and later listed as Partner). Known for investments in supply‑chain, compliance and other enterprise SaaS businesses; later moved into a role at Moderne Ventures (as listed in public profiles).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage B2B SaaS and enterprise cloud software (Seed and Series A), with emphasis on supply‑chain, compliance, DevOps/IT operations and other enterprise workflows.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Carya Venture Partners and co‑founder of Sanas and Observe.AI. Serial operator in contact‑center and speech AI with a background scaling enterprise SaaS teams and GTM. Active angel and micro‑fund investor focused on early‑stage B2B deep‑tech and AI startups.
interests: Diversity & inclusion in global workforce (language bias)
enrichment.career_background: Sharath co‑founded Observe.AI (voice AI) and later joined Sanas as a co‑founder/executive; he is a General Partner at Carya Venture Partners (micro VC focused on seed/pre‑seed AI/deep tech). Prior roles include sales and GTM leadership at Unbxd, Practo and Akamai; he has participated in Y Combinator and holds a technical degree from Visvesvaraya Technological University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) B2B deep tech & AI — speech/NLP, contact‑center/CX AI, enterprise SaaS; GTM/customer scaling

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and early-stage investor; co‑founder and CEO of VNDLY (acquired by Workday in 2021). Joined Bowery Capital as a Venture Partner in 2021 and joined Sierra Ventures as a Partner in April 2024, working with SaaS and enterprise software founders.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded VNDLY in 2017 and led the company through a 2021 acquisition by Workday; subsequently served as General Manager for Workday VNDLY. Earlier roles include corporate strategy and digital/ecommerce positions at Kroger and Citi. Active angel investor, board member/advisor and venture partner across multiple SaaS startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed–Series A) B2B SaaS and marketplaces; enterprise applications and HR/vendor-management platforms; AI & data for enterprise

enrichment.personal_bio: Sheldon Lewis is a co-founder and Managing Partner at Blueprint Equity and is listed as an investor associated with Mana Ventures. He focuses on growth-oriented enterprise software and fintech investments and participates in seed to growth-stage financings. Previously he led corporate development at PayLease and worked on the investment team at Mainsail Partners.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and Managing Partner of Blueprint Equity (founded 2018). Prior roles include Senior Vice President, Corporate & Business Development at PayLease, investment team member at Mainsail Partners, and early-career analyst in technology investment banking at Piper Jaffray. Holds a B.A. in Finance and an M.S. in Accounting from the University of Colorado Boulder; serves on multiple portfolio company boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and growth-stage technology investments (enterprise SaaS, AI-enabled software, fintech/payments, proptech/real-estate analytics)

enrichment.personal_bio: Product leader and advisor who helped build Stripe's early product efforts (notably Stripe Connect and Stripe Terminal) and previously held product roles at Google, Twitter, and Yahoo. Founder of High Leverage Labs; teaches product courses, advises startups, and invests as an angel.
enrichment.career_background: Experienced product manager and leader who scaled product teams and developer-facing products across Yahoo, Google, Twitter, and Stripe (credited with early work on Connect and Terminal). Since leaving full-time operator roles he founded High Leverage Labs, runs cohort courses and coaching for PMs, serves as an advisor, and is an active angel investor.
enrichment.investment_focus: Angel / early-stage (pre-seed �Series A); fintech & payments, developer platforms/APIs, SaaS and enterprise software, marketplaces, productivity tools

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and CEO of Squire, a vertical SaaS payments and POS platform for barbershops. Yale Law graduate who previously practiced as a corporate attorney. Serves as an investment partner at The Community Fund and is an active angel investor and speaker in the startup ecosystem.
enrichment.career_background: LaRon earned a J.D. from Yale Law School and began his career as a corporate attorney (including M&A work). In 2015 he co‑founded Squire and has served as its CEO since; he later joined The Community Fund as an investment partner and has participated in angel and partner investments in early-stage companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed investments in community-driven companies, with emphasis on consumer/marketplace, vertical SaaS for SMBs, and fintech/financial-services products for small businesses.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture investor and board director who invests for The Community Fund and has been a partner at Pritzker Group Venture Capital. Former founder of Pickie and VP of Product/Head of Mobile at RetailMeNot. Focuses on consumer and marketplace businesses and invests at early stages. Based in Chicago.
enrichment.career_background: Sonia studied mechanical engineering (University of Michigan) and earned an MBA from Harvard Business School. She began her career in engineering and finance, co‑founded Pickie (acquired by RetailMeNot), led mobile/product at RetailMeNot, and later joined Pritzker Group Venture Capital as a partner. She invests as part of The Community Fund and serves on multiple company boards and as a board observer.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) consumer and marketplace companies; community-driven startups; founder-led businesses (with interest in female and Midwest founders)

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Blockchain Capital who leads the firm’s research efforts on crypto and blockchain investments. CFA charterholder with a B.A. in Business Economics from UC Santa Barbara. Frequently quoted in industry press and holds board/advisor roles in portfolio companies.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Blockchain Capital in February 2017 and was promoted to partner; leads the firm’s research and investment analysis across tokens and equity. Previously Vice President, Equity Research at Needham & Company (authored early Wall Street blockchain research) and worked at ETF.com. Holds the CFA charter and a BA in Business Economics from UC Santa Barbara. Serves on/has served on boards or as an advisor to portfolio companies (e.g., Blocknative, Radar/Radar Relay).
enrichment.investment_focus: Web3 / crypto (protocols, infrastructure), decentralized & centralized finance, crypto-native consumer and gaming; invests both in tokens and equity across seed to growth stages.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at TSVC (TSV Capital) leading the firm’s healthcare practice. 30-year technology operator and two‑time founder with senior product, engineering and M&A roles at Ticketfly and Juniper Networks. Board member at companies including Vervoe and Medrio. Holds an M.S. in Electrical Engineering from Stanford and a B.S./B.A. from Rice University.
enrichment.career_background: Spencer Greene is a General Partner at TSVC (joined ~2020) where he leads healthcare investing. He previously co‑founded and served as CTO of GreenLight Workforce Solutions, was SVP Product & Engineering at Ticketfly, and worked in strategy/M&A and product roles at Juniper Networks. He serves on boards including Vervoe and Medrio and has been active in seed and Series A investing.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed/Series A) investments in Healthtech, DeepTech (Physical AI), and enterprise/SaaS startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Bain Capital Crypto who has led the firm’s crypto investments since joining Bain in 2016. Interests span protocol infrastructure (L1s, scaling, privacy) and end-user applications (DeFi, DAOs, games). Previously an early employee at Turbonomic (acquired by IBM).
enrichment.career_background: Joined Bain Capital in 2016 and has led the firm’s crypto investing efforts, co‑leading the Bain Capital Crypto platform. Prior to Bain he was an early employee at Turbonomic where he built the Strategy & Operations team; earlier worked in IBM corporate strategy. He holds a degree in economics from Clark University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Protocols and infrastructure (L1s, scaling, privacy/ZK), middleware and tooling, DeFi primitives, DAO/governance and crypto-native consumer/enterprise applications; invests across seed through growth stages.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Director of Vida Ventures (since 2017). Previously an investment professional at Third Rock Ventures and an investor at TPG; earlier worked in healthcare investment banking and biomedical research. Holds a B.S. and M.S. from Stanford and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and Managing Director at Vida Ventures (2017–present). Prior roles include Principal at Third Rock Ventures (focused on new company formation and early-stage investments), Associate at TPG Capital, and healthcare investment banking analyst at Credit Suisse. Trained in biology (B.S., M.S., Stanford) with biomedical research experience and an MBA from Harvard Business School; serves on multiple life‑science company boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and company-formation-focused life sciences and therapeutics investing (broad modalities including biologics, gene & cell therapy, and small molecules)

enrichment.personal_bio: Stéphane Bancel is the president and founding CEO of Moderna (since 2011) and a Special/Venture Partner at Flagship Pioneering (joined 2013). He is a life‑sciences executive with prior leadership at bioMérieux and operational roles at Eli Lilly. He serves on several boards and advises Flagship portfolio companies.
enrichment.career_background: Bancel trained as an engineer and holds an MS in chemical engineering and an MBA. He held roles at Eli Lilly (including managing director, Belgium; global manufacturing strategy) before serving as CEO of bioMérieux (2007–2011). He became Moderna’s CEO in 2011 and joined Flagship as a partner in 2013; he also serves on boards of several Flagship‑founded or affiliated companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Originates and incubates life‑sciences companies; focuses on biotechnology, therapeutics, health technologies, agtech/sustainability and early‑stage company creation.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at The Artemis Fund, a women‑led venture firm that leads seed rounds for female founders. Former Managing Director of the Houston Angel Network and holds an MBA from Rice University. Focuses on investing in early‑stage fintech, commerce enablement and care‑economy startups led by women.
enrichment.career_background: Campbell co‑founded The Artemis Fund in 2019 and serves as a General Partner. Prior to Artemis she was Managing Director of the Houston Angel Network, led Houston Exponential’s investment committee, and previously worked in government relations and executive recruiting. She holds a B.S. in political science from Spring Hill College and an MBA from Rice University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early‑stage investments in female‑founded, tech‑enabled companies (fintech, commerce enablement, care‑tech)

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Portage Ventures since 2016, running the firm’s North America investment team. Based in New York and a first-generation Canadian with a B.Comm. from Queen’s University. Focuses on consumer fintech, payments, fintech infrastructure and crypto/Web3.
