Previously worked in global supply chain and procurement at Tesla and Apple, served as Chief of Staff at Backbone Systems, and has been an active angel investor. Education: BS in Management Science & Engineering and MBA from Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed investments in B2B technology transforming traditional industries across the U.S./Mexico corridor (supply‑chain, logistics, vertical SaaS, fintech infrastructure, enterprise AI).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Swizzle Ventures, a Seattle-based early-stage fund focused on women’s health and wealth. Former growth operator and executive (including COO at Bamboo) who built growth programs for consumer startups. Raised Swizzle Fund I (closed at $6.6M) to invest in pre-seed and seed companies addressing caregiving, healthcare, and financial health for women.
enrichment.career_background: Jessica Kamada is a growth operator turned VC. She spent multiple years leading growth and revenue programs at Bamboo (including COO), advised startups as a growth consultant, and was part of early teams at consumer marketplaces before founding Swizzle Ventures in 2023 to back companies serving women across pivotal life stages.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed investments (U.S.) in women’s health, caregiving, and financial health; typical checks $100,000–$200,000.

enrichment.personal_bio: Terrance Orr is a venture partner at NextGen Venture Partners and a venture builder/advisor focused on early-stage startups. He has served as an Operating Partner-in-Residence at Mach49 and held EIR/advisory roles with SAP.iO, Techstars, Republic and others. Orr advises startups on product, go-to-market, and fundraising and is active in founder mentorship and ecosystem development.
enrichment.career_background: Orr is an operator-turned-investor with experience at Dell Technologies (intrapreneurship and post-merger integration), entrepreneur-in-residence roles (SAP.iO, Republic), accelerator experience with Techstars, and venture-building/operating roles at Mach49. He works as an advisor and mentor to early-stage companies and participates in investor networks and initiatives supporting underrepresented founders.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed) investments in enterprise and B2B software: vertical AI, SMB/enterprise SaaS, B2B marketplaces, and supply chain & logistics technologies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner at Mythos Ventures, an early-stage VC focused on prosocial AI and "AGI‑proof" companies. Previously co‑led AGI deployment strategy and worked in strategic communications at DeepMind, and led growth at Upstart. Yale University graduate.
enrichment.career_background: Vishal Maini is the founder and managing partner of Mythos Ventures (founded 2023), which writes pre-seed and seed checks into AI‑native, prosocial technologies. Prior to Mythos he held growth roles at Upstart and served in strategic communications and as co‑lead for AGI deployment strategy at DeepMind. He studied at Yale University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage startups focused on AI/ML (AGI‑proof companies), prosocial technologies, robotics/automation, and frontier biotech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Elsa Capital, an early-stage fund focused on fintech and AI. Former Stripe product/strategy and finance leader and public-markets investor at Fidelity. Stanford GSB MBA and dual BS from the University of Pennsylvania; CFA charterholder. Based in San Francisco; grew up in Beijing, China.
enrichment.career_background: Sarah Fu began her career in technology investment banking at Morgan Stanley, later worked as a public-equity investor at Fidelity overseeing financial and business services investments, then held product, strategy and finance leadership roles at Stripe during significant growth. She co-founded and served as CEO of a fintech startup (YC), and in 2024 founded Elsa Capital to invest in early-stage fintech and AI companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) fintech and AI — vertical GenAI applications for financial & professional services; embedded finance, CFO stack, B2B payments, wealth-tech.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at 1004 Venture Partners focused on healthy aging and longevity technologies. 15+ years of experience in entrepreneurship and life‑sciences investing; has invested in 20+ emerging life‑science companies and supported multiple acquisitions. Holds an MBA from Duke University (Fuqua School of Business).
enrichment.career_background: Soyoung Park is a General Partner at 1004 Venture Partners, investing in early‑stage companies that advance healthy aging. Over a 15+ year career she has worked across medtech, biotech and health‑tech, participated in more than 20 investments and contributed to multiple corporate exits. She holds an MBA from Duke University (Fuqua) and frequently mentors and speaks at life‑science and longevity conferences.
enrichment.investment_focus: Healthy aging / longevity; healthtech & age‑tech; medtech & biotech; healthcare infrastructure; early‑stage investments (pre‑seed to Series A)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of XIFAQ, a startup incubator and innovation hub launched in 2017. Serial entrepreneur and early-stage angel investor based in Atlanta, Georgia, with experience mentoring and advising founders across deep-tech and frontier sectors.
enrichment.career_background: Affaque Ahmed founded XIFAQ in 2017 after over 15 years building companies across automobile, IT, food and tech sectors. He runs XIFAQ as an incubator/co‑work space and mentors founders, offering acceleration, go‑to‑market and fundraising support while also participating in angel investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage startups (incubation/acceleration); deep‑tech (AI, robotics, space‑tech), climate tech; Web3 and frontier technologies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Frontiers Capital, an early‑stage firm focused on frontier technologies. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, he invests in deep‑tech categories including AI, machine learning, quantum computing, AR/VR and blockchain. Holds a BS from IIT Delhi and an MBA and JD from Northwestern University (Kellogg/Pritzker).
enrichment.career_background: Ajay Singh previously served in venture roles including senior director at Samsung NEXT (co‑lead on the Q Fund) and investment roles at Siemens’ venture group, US Renewables Group and Terawatt Ventures; earlier in his career he held product/ML roles at GE. He co‑founded Frontiers Capital (founded 2021) and is listed as a General Partner there.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage deep tech (AI, machine learning, quantum computing, AR/VR, blockchain/Web3); pre‑seed through Series A

enrichment.personal_bio: Angel investor based in Palo Alto, CA with a portfolio of early-stage startups (Signal reports ~16 companies and several exits). Typical check size reported $50K–$100K. Holds an MBA from California State University, East Bay.
enrichment.career_background: Active angel investor focused on seed and early-stage rounds. Public profiles list investments including Ahura AI, Propy, Zelos Gaming and Acquired.io; education includes an MBA from California State University, East Bay. Reported base of operations is Palo Alto, California.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments in B2B SaaS and enterprise software; big data/analytics; cybersecurity; proptech; marketplaces and e‑commerce.

enrichment.personal_bio: Bryan Kim ("BK") is a partner at Andreessen Horowitz (a16z) who invests primarily in consumer and app‑layer AI. He focuses on how AI reshapes productivity, creation, consumer health, and social experiences. Previously he held leadership roles at Snap and was CFO at Bungalow; he was also a founding GP at operator-led seed fund Uncommon Projects. He holds a BA from Carleton College and an MBA from Columbia Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Started in investment banking at Credit Suisse, moved into product/growth and finance leadership at Snap during its hyper-growth and IPO, served as CFO of Bungalow, was a founding general partner at Uncommon Projects, and joined Andreessen Horowitz as a partner (investing in consumer & app-layer AI).
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer and app-layer AI; early-stage consumer apps (seed through Series A/B), creator tools, social/connection products, and consumer health

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at GGW Ventures and founder/CEO of Go Global World. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, he builds startup communities, mentors founders, and invests in software startups. Background includes roles at GSD Venture Studios and Philip Morris International.
enrichment.career_background: Serial entrepreneur and operator now focused on connecting founders and investors: founder & CEO of Go Global World (a platform and community for startups and VCs), managing partner at GGW Ventures (the venture arm), former Partner & VP of Global Business Intelligence at GSD Venture Studios, and previously held global roles at Philip Morris International; adjunct lecturer and mentor at business schools (e.g., Skolkovo).
enrichment.investment_focus: Software companies (late seed / Series A), post-revenue (targeting teams with traction and ~$1M+ ARR); typical check ~ $300K; prefers US-incorporated startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: David S. Miller, Ph.D. is Co‑Founder & Managing Partner at Clean Energy Ventures. An engineer by training and a research affiliate at MIT Sloan, he has 20+ years of technology startup and seed‑stage investing experience and has served on multiple clean‑energy company boards. He lives in Newton, Massachusetts.
enrichment.career_background: Dr. Miller co‑founded Clean Energy Ventures after serving as Executive Managing Director of the Clean Energy Venture Group. He previously founded and led Quantum Telecom Solutions (acquired by a Lucent division) and served in Lucent’s New Ventures Group. He holds SB, SM and PhD degrees from MIT and is a Research Affiliate and advisory board member at MIT Sloan.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage climate tech / clean energy (seed & Series A) — hardware‑oriented advanced energy technologies and business‑model innovations with quantifiable GHG impact

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner and founder of DataPower Ventures, investing in early-stage data and AI startups. Former product and data leader with roles at Google and SingleStore; host of the HumAIn podcast and active community builder in the data + AI ecosystem.
enrichment.career_background: David Yakobovitch founded DataPower Ventures and serves as its General Partner. He previously led product and data initiatives at Google (Global Product Lead) and SingleStore (Senior Manager, Technical Enablement), and has worked as a data science instructor and principal data scientist at organizations including General Assembly and Galvanize. He also hosts the HumAIn podcast and runs community programs for the data/AI ecosystem.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage investments in applied AI, machine learning, data infrastructure/analytics, AI-driven SaaS, and deep technology startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at The Artemis Fund, which leads seed rounds for female and diverse founders. Former Wall Street investment banking and sales/trading professional with a B.E. in Mechanical Engineering from The Cooper Union. Co‑founder of the Monarq incubator and active board observer/member for multiple portfolio companies.
enrichment.career_background: Murakhovskaya spent over a decade in tech M&A, commodities sales and trading, and hedge‑fund/markets roles (including Lehman Brothers, Macquarie and Tullett Prebon). In 2019 she co‑founded The Artemis Fund to lead seed investments in fintech, commerce and care; she previously co‑founded the Monarq incubator and runs fund financials and investment risk at Artemis.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early‑stage investments in fintech, commerce/e‑commerce infrastructure and care/care‑tech, prioritizing women and underrepresented founders.

enrichment.firm_name: Black Ops Ventures (Black Operator Ventures, LLC)
enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and managing/general partner at Black Ops Ventures, a seed fund that backs Black‑led tech startups. Founder & CEO of Pilotly, a market‑research platform for media and content, and co‑founder of Transparent Collective. Serial entrepreneur with prior ventures including Ubi Video and GroupFlix; holds a BSE in Electrical Engineering from the University of Michigan.
enrichment.career_background: James Norman is a serial founder turned investor. He founded early media/OTT companies (Ubi Video, GroupFlix), later launched Pilotly (consumer insights for content) and co‑founded Transparent Collective to support underrepresented founders. In 2020–2021 he co‑founded Black Operator Ventures (Black Ops) to lead seed investments in Black‑led technology companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed‑stage investments in Black‑led tech startups (focus includes media/OTT, consumer tech, fintech and enterprise software)

enrichment.personal_bio: Jeffrey Finer, M.D., Ph.D., is a Venture Partner at Third Rock Ventures (joined 2016) and co‑founder & CEO of Septerna. He trained at MIT (BS Chemistry & Biology) and Stanford (M.D./Ph.D. in Biochemistry) and has 30+ years in drug discovery, translational medicine, and biotech company creation. He has held R&D leadership roles at Cytokinetics, Five Prime Therapeutics, and Theravance and serves on boards including Maze, Ambys, and Strateos.
enrichment.career_background: Trained M.D./Ph.D. (Biochemistry) at Stanford and B.S. (Chemistry & Biology) at MIT; completed residency training in Internal Medicine (Stanford) and Ophthalmology (Massachusetts Eye & Ear/Harvard). Held R&D leadership roles (Director, Drug Discovery Technologies at Cytokinetics; VP Discovery at Five Prime; VP Research Technology at Theravance). Joined Third Rock as a Venture Partner in 2016, co-founded Septerna and transitioned to full‑time CEO, and has served on multiple biotech boards (Maze, Ambys, Strateos).
enrichment.investment_focus: Biotechnology — drug discovery and development (small molecules, GPCRs); translational medicine; platform technologies; early-stage company creation.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Cultivation Capital focused on software and geospatial technology companies. Former SVP, Field Operations at Guidewire with prior executive roles at Fortify, EqualLogic, Ariba, and PTC. Serves on boards of multiple private software companies including Monitaur, Sfara, Swell Social, and Salesvue.
enrichment.career_background: 20+ years in executive sales and general management at early-stage and category-defining technology companies (PTC, Ariba, EqualLogic, Fortify), served as SVP Field Operations at Guidewire, and is now a General Partner at Cultivation Capital where he leads investments and board work for software and geospatial startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise software (SaaS); Geospatial technology; Early-stage (Seed & Series A)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder‑turned‑investor and Managing Partner at Chaotic Capital. Focuses on seed and early‑stage startups that help people and organizations adapt to complexity and chaos. Previously co‑founded Coutorture Media and playAPI and was co‑founder & CEO of Stowaway Cosmetics (acquired).
enrichment.career_background: Julie Fredrickson is a New York–based entrepreneur and investor. She co‑founded Coutorture Media (acquired), founded playAPI, and was co‑founder & CEO of Stowaway Cosmetics (now part of WIN Brands Group). She is the managing partner of Chaotic Capital, a seed‑stage fund that invests in companies addressing personal flexibility, organizational agility, systemic arbitrage (crypto/finance), and climate/planetary risk. Education: University of Chicago.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed & early‑stage startups that increase resilience and optionality in chaotic systems — personal flexibility, organizational agility (SaaS/dev tools), crypto/compute infrastructure & systemic arbitrage, and climate adaptation.

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal at VMG Partners focused on the intersection of consumer brands and the technologies that power them. Grew up in a first-generation immigrant family and was raised in St. Louis. Holds an MBA from MIT Sloan and previously worked in venture and investment roles at OpenView and J.P. Morgan.
interests: Brand building & go-to-market for consumer brands
enrichment.career_background: Previously an investor at OpenView and an analyst/associate at J.P. Morgan. Joined VMG Partners as a Principal (technology/VMG Catalyst team) and has been involved in VMG investments such as Mantra Health; holds a board seat/active involvement with Mantra Health. Educational background includes an MBA from MIT Sloan and an undergraduate degree from Boston College.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer brands and consumer technology (commerce enablement, digital commerce, brand-building tools); growth/expansion-stage investments supporting brand and commerce infrastructure.

enrichment.personal_bio: Lip-Bu Tan is founder and chairman of Walden International and founding managing partner of Walden Catalyst Ventures. He served as CEO of Cadence Design Systems (2009–2021) and was appointed CEO of Intel in March 2025. He is a longtime technology investor focused on semiconductors, AI, cloud/edge infrastructure and data security.
enrichment.career_background: Founded Walden International in 1987 and grew it into a cross-border venture firm focused on Asia–US technology investments. Served as Cadence Design Systems CEO from 2009 to 2021 and executive chairman through 2023; has held board roles at Credo Technology Group, Schneider Electric and (as of 2025) Intel. Education: B.S. in Physics (Nanyang University/NTU), M.S. in Nuclear Engineering (MIT) and an MBA (University of San Francisco).
enrichment.hometown: Born in Muar, Johor, Malaysia; raised in Singapore.
enrichment.investment_focus: Semiconductors and components; cloud/edge infrastructure; AI/machine learning; data management & security; early-stage deep tech

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at RiSo Capital with 30+ years in technology and IP licensing. Former managing director of Microsemi India and CEO of Qualcore Logic. Holds an MS (EE) from NYU and an MBA from Louisiana State University. Based in Silicon Valley.
enrichment.career_background: Senior technology executive and investor with more than three decades of experience across engineering, marketing, sales, business development and field/customer engineering. Led Microsemi's India engineering and marketing operations (built a 300+ team in Hyderabad) and served as CEO of Qualcore Logic; now a partner at RiSo Capital focused on early-stage B2B startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) B2B startups in AI, cloud/SaaS, IoT, robotics and enterprise sectors (logistics, health, fintech, cleantech); semiconductor/IP-related opportunities.

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal at Newtype Ventures and early-stage investor focused on food & agtech and consumer startups. Former operator and founder with roles at SideChef, ScoreBeyond and other tech companies; active in Harvard alumni entrepreneur networks and women-in-VC initiatives.
enrichment.career_background: Milena has worked as an operator, founder and investor. She co-founded a gourmet food retail concept, held growth and business-development roles at companies including SideChef and ScoreBeyond (acquired by LinkedIn), and has invested with funds such as Germin8 Ventures and Portfolia before joining Newtype Ventures as Principal. She holds graduate study at Harvard and an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business (and a BS from USC).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed & Seed; early-stage investments across Food & AgTech, consumer/CPG, and mission-driven tech (also interested in EdTech & HealthTech)

enrichment.personal_bio: Peter H. Diamandis is an American entrepreneur, physician and engineer. He is a co‑founder/partner at BOLD Capital Partners and the founder and executive chairman of the XPRIZE Foundation. He has co‑founded or helped start 20+ companies across space, longevity and exponential technologies.
enrichment.career_background: Diamandis trained as an engineer and physician (degrees from MIT and an M.D. from Harvard Medical School). He founded the XPRIZE Foundation and co‑founded Singularity University and BOLD Capital Partners, and has co‑founded and led multiple companies in space, health and longevity; he focuses on building and funding ventures that leverage exponential technologies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage and growth investments in exponential technologies: longevity/biotech, healthtech, AI/software, space/aerospace and frontier physical technologies.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner on the a16z Growth investing team focused on AI and enterprise technology. Previously a vice president at TA Associates and an early-stage investor at DCM Ventures and Radicle Impact; began her career at BCG and Morgan Stanley. Holds a BA in Economics from Harvard and an MBA from Stanford GSB.
interests: Generative AI / AI for the enterprise
enrichment.career_background: Sarah Wang is a General Partner on Andreessen Horowitz's Growth team, where she leads and partners with growth-stage enterprise and AI companies. Prior to a16z she was VP at TA Associates (served on the ZoomInfo board), and earlier worked in venture at DCM Ventures and Radicle Impact and in consulting and capital markets at BCG and Morgan Stanley. She holds a BA from Harvard and an MBA from Stanford GSB.
enrichment.investment_focus: AI and enterprise technology; growth-stage investments across enterprise, fintech, consumer internet, crypto/web3, and bio+healthcare

enrichment.personal_bio: Austin-based operator-turned-angel investor and venture partner. Founder and former CEO/Chair of Offers.com (sold to Ziff Davis, Dec 2015). Focuses on early-stage technology companies, digital strategy and performance marketing, and startups with large digital revenue potential.
enrichment.career_background: Serial entrepreneur and product/marketing executive with 30+ years in internet and software businesses. Founded Vertive and Offers.com (CEO until 2015 acquisition), has been an active advisor/mentor at Capital Factory and Techstars, and serves as an investor and venture partner supporting seed-stage startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / early-stage (B2B) — B2B SaaS, Healthtech, Fintech, Data infrastructure, Robotics; emphasis on companies with scalable digital business models.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Next47 based in Palo Alto who joined the firm in 2017. Focuses on sourcing and supporting investments in enterprise IT, cybersecurity, and robotics. Previously served as Managing Partner at In-Q-Tel and worked at BCG; holds an MBA from Stanford and a BS in Finance from the University of Virginia.
enrichment.career_background: T.J. Rylander is a General Partner at Next47 (joined 2017) focused on enterprise infrastructure, security, robotics and connected devices. Before Next47 he was Managing Partner at In-Q-Tel (IQT), where he led investments in enterprise software, security and data-center technologies (including Cloudant, Platfora and IPOs for FireEye, Cloudera and Pure Storage). Earlier roles include consulting at BCG and finance positions in energy and telecom; he holds an MBA from Stanford GSB and a BS in Finance from the University of Virginia.
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise IT, cybersecurity, robotics and industrial/connected devices; data management & analytics; enterprise software — early to expansion-stage investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Engineer, product designer and investor. Led development of the iPod and early iPhone hardware, founded Nest, and now runs an investment/advisory practice (Future Shape / Build Collective). Focuses on deep‑tech and climate‑oriented hardware and biomanufacturing startups.
enrichment.career_background: Tony Fadell is a computer engineer and entrepreneur who led Apple’s iPod organization and contributed to early iPhone hardware before founding Nest (CEO, 2010–2016). After Nest he launched Future Shape (now Build Collective) to invest in and advise deep‑tech startups; he serves on industry boards (including Arm) and is the author of BUILD. He holds a BS in Computer Engineering from the University of Michigan and is named on hundreds of patents.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage deep tech and hardware (climate tech, biomanufacturing, semiconductors, robotics, mobility and industrial/consumer hardware).

enrichment.personal_bio: Aaron Hurst is a Seattle-based social entrepreneur and venture partner at Social Impact Capital. He founded the Taproot Foundation and Imperative, co‑founded Board.Dev, and authored The Purpose Economy. He focuses on purpose-driven work, nonprofit governance, and scaling social impact.
interests: pro bono service and skills-based volunteering
enrichment.career_background: Founder of the Taproot Foundation (2001) and Imperative (2013); co‑founder and executive chair of Board.Dev (2023); listed as a Venture Partner at Social Impact Capital. Author of The Purpose Economy and longtime speaker/adviser on purpose and social impact.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and Series A investments in impact-driven sectors (food systems, climate/clean tech, health, social systems and consumer)

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at 6th Man Ventures focused on web3/blockchain investing. Previously worked in venture roles at Allstate Strategic Ventures and Red Beard Ventures and held corporate finance roles at Deloitte. Educated at the University of South Carolina (BS) with fall study at Saïd Business School, Oxford. citeturn4view0turn5search1
enrichment.career_background: Began in corporate finance at Deloitte, moved into venture investing with Allstate Strategic Ventures, was a partner at Red Beard Ventures, and joined 6th Man Ventures as a Partner (joined 6MV in 2022). citeturn5search1
enrichment.investment_focus: Web3 / blockchain, crypto, developer infrastructure, DePIN, gaming/NFTs; early-stage (seed–Series A). citeturn4view0

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director at WestRiver Group and President of Singularity University. Joined WRG in 2015 and focuses on investments in experience and technology; helped build Topgolf through its growth and sale to Callaway. Serves on or observes multiple portfolio company boards.
enrichment.career_background: Joined WestRiver Group in 2015 and has been a leader on the firm’s investment team, focusing on experience and technology. Worked closely on the buildout and financing of Topgolf (including acquisitions of Protracer and WGT Media) and helped raise substantial capital for portfolio growth. Serves as President of Singularity University (since 2023) and holds board or board-observer roles at companies including Liquor Laboratory, The Listening Room Café, Talespin Reality Labs, and ONEHOPE. Education: M.A. in Finance (Claremont McKenna College) and B.A. in Mathematical Economics (Whitworth University).
enrichment.investment_focus: Experience & entertainment technology; experiential venues; digital health & life sciences; early-stage and growth-stage venture investing

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at The Equity Alliance who focuses on investing in emerging VC fund managers and select early-stage companies. Former scout for Vamos Ventures and venture architect at BCG Digital Ventures; worked ~7 years in healthcare informatics consulting. Holds an MBA from MIT Sloan and a BA from Brown University.
enrichment.career_background: Adam Kiki-Charles joined The Equity Alliance after roles as a Venture Scout for Vamos Ventures and a Venture Architect (MBA intern) at BCG Digital Ventures. Before venture, he spent roughly seven years as a healthcare informatics consultant and has held other operational and campaign roles. He holds an MBA from MIT Sloan and a BA from Brown University and works on both fund commitments and select direct co-investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Invests in emerging VC fund managers (women & people of color) and selectively co-invests in early-stage startups (seed–Series B); sector focus includes FinTech, SaaS, Media/Entertainment and technologies for human empowerment and sustainability; primarily US-focused (New York/Los Angeles).

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner / Venture Partner (US) at Woodstock Fund focused on infrastructure, DeFi and gaming applications. Former IBM digital assets and blockchain lead with prior roles in Watson AI and Walmart integration. Advises Outerlands Capital and operates projects in the crypto/Web3 space.
enrichment.career_background: Adam Mastrelli is a Venture Partner (US) at Woodstock Fund and has ~10 years of experience at IBM leading digital assets, blockchain and Watson AI initiatives (including IBM Digital Assets & Banking Solutions and IBM Blockchain Ventures). He advises Outerlands Capital and has founded/operated crypto-focused projects and collectives supporting fundraising, deal sourcing and portfolio support.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early and growth-stage Web3 (Infrastructure, DeFi, gaming/NFTs, tokenization and protocol layers)

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal at LvlUp Ventures where he manages fund operations, investment analysis, and the firm’s venture scout program. Co‑founder of a stealth-mode cryptocurrency mining company. Holds a B.S. in Economics from Occidental College and organizes/hosts startup events and pitch competitions.
enrichment.career_background: Serves as Principal at LvlUp Ventures focusing on sourcing and supporting early-stage startups, fund operations, and running the firm’s scout program. Previously co‑founded a stealth cryptocurrency-mining company and has a background combining investment analysis and engineering; educated at Occidental College (B.S., Economics).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed to Series A; industry-agnostic with emphasis on Web3/crypto, gaming/eSports, consumer, AI/ML, and FinTech; firm-level average check size reported in public materials around $150K–$250K.

enrichment.personal_bio: Associate at AXA Venture Partners (AVP) based in New York. Focuses on growth-stage / growth equity investments across enterprise software, consumer internet, digital health and fintech. Previously worked at EY-Parthenon and holds a degree from Princeton University.
enrichment.career_background: Joined AXA Venture Partners as an associate (joined circa 2020). Prior experience includes roles at EY-Parthenon (Associate / Senior Associate). Graduated from Princeton University (School of Public and International Affairs).
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth equity; enterprise software; consumer internet; digital health; fintech; Series B / growth-stage investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Physician-turned-entrepreneur and investor. Co‑founder/CEO of Dryvebox and co‑founder/CEO of Medumo (acquired by Philips); earlier co‑founder of Picmonic (acquired). Serves as a General Partner at MAGIC Fund.
enrichment.career_background: Adeel Yang, MD trained at the University of Arizona (MD) and participated in Y Combinator. He co‑founded Picmonic and Medumo (both exits), served in a business leadership role at Philips after Medumo’s acquisition, and is currently co‑founder & CEO of Dryvebox while serving as a General Partner at MAGIC Fund and a venture partner at Pioneer Fund.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed/Series A); sectors: digital health, education (EdTech), consumer & sports tech; primary geography: North America

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder & CEO of Helium Health and founder & Managing Partner at MAGIC Fund. Former engineer at Goldman Sachs, eBay and PayPal; holds degrees from Morgan State University and Johns Hopkins University. Invests in and supports early‑stage, founder‑led startups with a focus on healthtech and emerging markets.
enrichment.career_background: Adegoke “Goke” Olubusi co‑founded Helium Health (2016) and serves as its CEO. He previously built payment systems at Goldman Sachs, eBay and PayPal. Olubusi founded and manages MAGIC Fund, an early‑stage global VC collective; he studied engineering and management at Morgan State University and Johns Hopkins University and has been featured in Forbes and TechCrunch.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed‑stage, founder‑led startups (global); sectors include healthtech, fintech, developer tools, SaaS and e‑commerce, with emphasis on emerging markets.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor focused on the Digital Asset Ecosystem (DAE). Previously an Investment Analyst, Crypto at Republic Capital; now principal at 1RoundTable Partners / 10T. Graduated from Emory University (B.A. Economics, 2020).
enrichment.career_background: Worked in blockchain research and GTM at ConsenSys and Chainalysis before joining Republic Capital as an Investment Analyst (crypto), where he focused on deal sourcing, diligence and portfolio strategy for DAE investments. Listed as Principal/Associate at 1RoundTable Partners and 10T after Republic Capital.

She holds an MBA from Stanford Graduate School of Business and a Stanford undergraduate degree.
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth-stage and later-stage investments in consumer internet, software, gaming/e‑sports, marketplaces and fintech; typical check size reported at roughly $100K–$5M (sweet spot ~ $1.5M).

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at McCarthy Capital since 2008 based in Omaha, NE. Originates and evaluates investments and oversees portfolio companies. Prior experience in corporate audit and pension consulting; holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and a BS in Actuarial Science from the University of Nebraska–Lincoln.
enrichment.career_background: Joined McCarthy Capital in 2008 and serves as a partner focused on sourcing, structuring and managing private investments. Before McCarthy he worked in corporate audit and pension consulting. Educational background includes an MBA from Harvard Business School and a BS in Actuarial Science from the University of Nebraska–Lincoln.
enrichment.investment_focus: Lower‑middle‑market companies (recapitalizations, growth equity, management buyouts); sectors include software/SaaS, business services, consumer and specialty industrials.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture capital research associate at ARK Invest supporting the ARK Venture Fund. Previously an early employee and VC analyst at Sweater Ventures. Has interned at Techbuzz and Alta Ventures and holds a Certificate in Entrepreneurship from the University of Utah.
enrichment.career_background: Joined ARK Invest in November 2023 as a Venture Capital Research Associate supporting ARK Venture. Prior to ARK, Prather was an early employee and analyst at Sweater Ventures. He has internship experience at Techbuzz and Alta Ventures and has worked with startups on fundraising and go-to-market strategy. Education includes a Certificate in Entrepreneurship from the University of Utah.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed–Series A venture investments across fintech, consumer, SaaS, digital health and AI; focused on retail/democratized VC platforms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner at Alix Ventures, focused on early-stage life science startups (TechBio) that advance therapeutics, diagnostics, and bio-economy infrastructure. Creator of BIOS, a content and community platform for life-science innovators. Previously worked with Liquid 2 Ventures, co‑founded Pareto Life Sciences (YC), and held early roles at Clara Health. Named to Forbes 30 Under 30 (Venture Capital).
enrichment.career_background: Chas founded Alix Ventures to back early-stage life-science companies engineering biology. His background includes entrepreneur roles (co‑founder of Pareto Life Sciences, Y Combinator), early operations/business development at Clara Health, and venture experience supporting healthcare investments at Liquid 2 Ventures. He studied at the University of Notre Dame.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage life sciences (TechBio): therapeutics, diagnostics, discovery/production infrastructure; pre-seed to Series A.

enrichment.personal_bio: Senior director of strategic business development at National Instruments and co‑founder/former CEO of BEEcube (acquired by NI). Active angel investor and listed member of the Berkeley Angel Network. Holds B.Sc., M.Sc. and Ph.D. degrees in Electrical Engineering & Computer Science from UC Berkeley.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded BEEcube (acquired by National Instruments in 2015) and subsequently joined NI in product and strategic business development roles, rising to senior director. Has participated in industry consortia (OpenRF) focused on RF/5G test and interoperability and publishes on semiconductor validation topics. Academic background includes multiple UC Berkeley degrees in EECS.
enrichment.investment_focus: Semiconductors and RF/5G validation; hardware & embedded systems; early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) angel investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Dr. Cheryl Martin is a Venture Partner at Colle Capital Partners and founder of consulting firm Harwich Partners. She is a former Acting Director and Deputy Director for Commercialization at the U.S. Department of Energy’s ARPA‑E and served on the Managing Board of the World Economic Forum. Martin holds a PhD in organic chemistry from MIT and frequently serves on corporate and nonprofit boards in energy, sustainability, and food/agriculture technology.
enrichment.career_background: PhD in organic chemistry (MIT); ~20 years at Rohm & Haas in R&D and business leadership; Executive in Residence at Kleiner Perkins; Deputy Director and then Acting Director at ARPA‑E where she led Technology‑to‑Market; member of the Managing Board at the World Economic Forum; founder of Harwich Partners; Venture Partner at Colle Capital Partners and active board member/advisor to startups and nonprofits.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage technology investments (software, logistics, healthcare, fintech) with a data‑driven approach; emphasis on sustainability and scalable commercialization.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and partner at Midnight Venture Partners, an Austin‑based VC focused on consumer brands. Background in mergers & acquisitions, corporate finance and strategy; previously held roles at Trinity Industries, Arcosa and Dell Technologies. Educated at Southern Methodist University.
enrichment.career_background: Chris Aydam co‑founded Midnight Venture Partners and serves as a partner/managing partner. Prior to venture work he held corporate development and finance roles—Senior Financial Analyst at Trinity Industries, Corporate Development Associate at Arcosa, and Advisor in Strategy & Analytics at Dell Technologies. He holds a BS from Southern Methodist University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage and growth consumer brands (CPG), especially wellness and DTC consumer products

enrichment.personal_bio: Associate at OpenView Venture Partners focused on finance & operations. Contributor to the OpenView blog (has authored/co‑authored posts on topics including DEI in VC). Works on finance- and operations-related support for the firm and its portfolio companies.
enrichment.career_background: Chris Jackson is listed on OpenView’s site as an Associate in the firm’s Finance & Operations category and has contributed to the firm’s blog. Public materials identify him as working on finance/operations themes and writing about DEI and fundraising dynamics for founders; there are no publicly linked, verifiable listings of deals personally led by him.
enrichment.investment_focus: Expansion-stage B2B software (SaaS); product-led growth; finance & operations support for portfolio companies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Chris Quaidoo is a venture investor and gaming industry operator. He has served as an investment partner at Dorm Room Fund and as a venture/associate partner at Griffin Gaming Partners, and he hosts the Venture Games podcast. He is an MBA candidate at UC Berkeley Haas and has worked in equity research and early-stage venture roles.
enrichment.career_background: Chris graduated from the University of Rochester and later enrolled in the UC Berkeley Haas MBA program. He worked in equity research covering technology, was an associate at Story Ventures, participated in and later led Dorm Room Fund’s Blueprint Investor Track as an investment partner, and has held roles at Griffin Gaming Partners; he is also Content Acquisition Lead at Carry1st and hosts the Venture Games podcast.
enrichment.investment_focus: Student-founded pre-seed/seed startups (technology and consumer) — writes standard DRF checks (~$40k); sector interests include SaaS, gaming, fintech, web3, and AR/VR.

enrichment.personal_bio: Christopher Gaeta is a venture capital associate at VU Venture Partners who focuses on healthcare and early-stage investing. He has founded and led campus-health companies (Grapefruit, InSite Health) and has been publicly noted for co-leading VU's healthcare investments such as X-Therma. He studied at Swarthmore College and pursued graduate work at the University of Pennsylvania School of Medicine.
enrichment.career_background: Joined VU Venture Partners as a venture capital associate (healthcare specialist) while an undergraduate; prior clinical research experience at The Children’s Hospital of Philadelphia. Founder/CEO of Grapefruit and later InSite Health, involved in COVID-19 testing/telehealth operations and campus wellness initiatives; publicly credited with co-leading VU’s Series A participation in X‑Therma.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage healthcare (digital health, medtech, biotech); pre-seed to Series A investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Christopher (Chris) J. Livingston is an investment professional who served as a venture and growth investor at Summit Partners (2014–2016). He subsequently held growth investing roles at Anthos Capital and joined Radian Capital as a partner. He holds a BS from Cornell University and focuses on technology and growth-stage investments.
enrichment.career_background: Venture and growth investor with experience at Summit Partners (venture & growth investor), Anthos Capital, and Radian Capital (partner). Earlier roles include private equity/venture at Partners Group and management consulting at Accenture. Education: BS, Cornell University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth equity; technology (B2B software/SaaS) and technology-enabled services

enrichment.personal_bio: Christopher R. Shepard, Ph.D., is a Venture Partner at Apollo Health Ventures. He holds a Ph.D. in Molecular and Cellular Pathology (University of Pittsburgh) and an MBA from Carnegie Mellon University. Shepard began his career at Genentech and has served as CEO of SmartZyme Biopharma and co‑founder of Avogadro Development Corp and Structured BioEquity.
enrichment.career_background: Experienced scientist-operator and investor with a technical Ph.D. and an MBA. Early career in R&D at Genentech, later roles in development and business at Structured BioEquity and SmartZyme Biopharma (Chief Development Officer / CEO), and current venture partner role at Apollo Health Ventures supporting company creation and portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage/transatlantic life-science venture building and seed/Series A investments in biotechnology, therapeutics, data platforms and health‑tech targeting age‑related diseases and healthy lifespan

enrichment.personal_bio: Institutional investor and fund builder focused on early-stage deep technology. Co‑founder and served as Managing Partner at Grit Ventures; previously worked in private equity and energy investment banking. Focus areas include AI, robotics, space and advanced energy; holds degrees from the University of Texas at Austin and is a CPA.
enrichment.career_background: Christy Cardenas is an institutional investor with experience across private equity, venture capital and investment banking. Her career includes roles at First Reserve (energy infrastructure), Arroyo Energy, Ecliptic Capital, advisory/strategy roles at Mercury Fund and leadership at Grit Ventures (co‑founder/Managing Partner). She has led fund strategy, structuring and fundraising and has worked on commercialization of university and government‑lab technologies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed to Seed (occasionally Series A) in deep technology: AI, robotics, space, and advanced/clean energy; lab‑to‑market university commercialization and hardware/software integration.

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and angel investor based in the San Francisco Bay Area. Member of the Donation Committee at Berkeley Frontier Fund and USA Partner at PreAngel. Co‑founder of Eureka Therapeutics and former finance executive with roles at PayPal; active in Berkeley alumni leadership (founder/president of BCAIA).
enrichment.career_background: Chuck Ng is an investor and entrepreneur with a background in finance and technology. He co‑founded Eureka Therapeutics, served in finance/strategy roles at PayPal, and is a USA partner at PreAngel. Ng is active in alumni and civic organizations (founder/president of Berkeley Chinese Alumni International Association, Asia Society Northern California) and serves on Berkeley Frontier Fund's Donation Committee.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early to growth‑stage startups from the UC Berkeley ecosystem; sectors include biotechnology, AI/deep tech, hardware, fintech and blockchain.

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal at Define Ventures focused on early-stage digital health. He has a background in healthcare investing and operations with prior roles at Bessemer Venture Partners, Evolent Health, and The Boston Consulting Group, and holds a B.A. in Neurobiology from Harvard and an MBA from The Wharton School. citeturn4view0turn2search1
enrichment.career_background: Previously worked in healthcare consulting and operations (The Boston Consulting Group; Evolent Health) and in venture (Bessemer Venture Partners) before joining Define Ventures; educated at Harvard (B.A., Neurobiology) and Wharton (MBA). citeturn4view0turn1search1
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage digital health (incubation, Seed, Series A/B); enterprise and consumer digital health, pharma tech, health-plan and provider solutions. citeturn5search1turn5search4

enrichment.personal_bio: Investment Partner at Bootstrap Venture Partners focused on early-stage investments. Listed on Bootstrap's team page; the firm notes he works at Sequoia Consulting Group as a Business Operations Analyst (a Bootstrap portfolio company). Engages with healthcare, life-sciences and enterprise software portfolio companies.
enrichment.career_background: Named an Investment Partner at Bootstrap Venture Partners (firm website). Bootstrap's team profile indicates CJ works (or has worked) at Sequoia Consulting Group in business operations roles and supports Bootstrap portfolio companies, with a focus on healthcare and technology investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments in healthcare & life sciences, health IT/digital health, enterprise software, analytics and data services

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at SpringTide Ventures focused on early-stage HealthTech and TechBio. Previously an investor at Meridian Street Capital and Anterra Capital and Chief of Staff at Crestovo (a microbiome therapeutics startup acquired by Finch Therapeutics). Holds bachelor’s degrees in biological engineering and management science from MIT.
interests: TechBio / deep tech at biology-technology intersection
enrichment.career_background: Claire began her career at ClearView Healthcare Partners advising pharma and biotech clients, moved into operator/leadership as Chief of Staff at Crestovo, then worked in early-stage investing at Anterra Capital and Meridian Street Capital before joining SpringTide Ventures as a partner. She focuses on seed and Series A investments at the intersection of technology and biology and holds undergraduate degrees from MIT.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage HealthTech, TechBio/deep tech at the intersection of biology and engineering, life sciences & biotech; seed and Series A investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and General Partner at TheVentureCity based in Miami. Longtime private-banking and multi-family office executive (Guggenheim/Alvarium) with active involvement in Web3, NFTs and gaming. Co‑founder of Ola Guild Games and board member/treasurer at the Bass Museum.
enrichment.career_background: Formerly managing partner for Guggenheim Partners Latin America / related multi‑family office businesses, Bullrich co‑founded TheVentureCity in 2017 and serves as a General Partner. She cofounded Ola Guild Games (2022), has participated in crypto/NFT and DeFi deals, and holds board roles including the Bass Museum.
enrichment.investment_focus: Stage: Seed & Series A. Sectors: Fintech, HealthTech, AI/ML, B2B SaaS, Web3/Blockchain, Gaming. Geography: U.S., Europe, Latin America.

enrichment.personal_bio: CEO and Managing Partner at The Equity Alliance; founder of media ventures TRACE and TRUE Africa; MIT Sloan MBA and visiting social innovator at Harvard Kennedy School. Leads a New York–based fund that invests in venture funds and startups led by women and people of color.
enrichment.career_background: Entrepreneur and media founder turned investor. Founded TRACE (magazine and TRACE TV) and TRUE Africa, served as chairman or president of multiple cultural and fintech initiatives, and in 2021 became CEO/Managing Partner of The Equity Alliance, which backs diverse VC managers and select direct startups; holds an MBA from MIT and has held visiting roles at Harvard Kennedy School and MIT programs.
enrichment.investment_focus: Fund-of-funds and select direct early-stage investments in VC fund managers and startups led by women and people of color, with thematic emphasis on Human Empowerment and Future Sustainability (sectors include fintech, healthtech, climate/transport, and media/consumer).

enrichment.personal_bio: Senior Associate at IVP focused on growth-stage enterprise software. Previously worked in principal investing and investment banking at Financial Technology Partners and was an associate at OpenView. Holds a BA in Economics from Tufts University and played varsity ice hockey.
enrichment.career_background: Started in investment banking and principal investing at Financial Technology Partners, joined OpenView as an investing associate (joined 2021), and later moved to IVP where he works with growth-stage SaaS and infrastructure companies. Educated at Tufts University (BA, Economics); served as captain of the men’s ice hockey team and graduated summa cum laude.
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise software; growth-stage / Series A-B investments; cybersecurity; developer tools; AI/ML; fintech

enrichment.personal_bio: Early-stage investor formerly on the investing team at Struck Capital (2020–2022). Focuses on seed/pre-seed opportunities across interactive media, games/AR‑VR, web3/blockchain and enterprise SaaS. Previously worked in product/growth and CIO/CTO advisory; Claremont McKenna College graduate.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in growth/product at Highspot, served in CIO/CTO advisory at Infosys Consulting, joined Struck Capital as an investor (circa 2020–2022), and joined Galaxy Interactive as VP, Investor & Chief of Staff (since 2022). Serves in advisory/board roles for CMC’s Center for Innovation & Entrepreneurship, LA‑Tech.org and Count On Me Family Foundation.
enrichment.hometown: Grew up in Seattle, Washington; born in New Orleans, Louisiana.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / pre‑seed; sectors: games & interactive media, AR/VR, web3/blockchain, AI, enterprise SaaS, marketplaces and e‑commerce

enrichment.personal_bio: Senior data science leader (Databricks) with an academic background in applied neuroscience (MSc, King’s College London). Former Chief Science Officer at Flow Research Collective and scientific advisor/founding limited partner at Lionheart Ventures. Works at the intersection of AI, neuroscience, and frontier mental health research.
enrichment.career_background: Conor B. Murphy has worked in data science and machine learning leadership roles at Databricks and served as Chief Science Officer at the Flow Research Collective. He is listed as a scientific advisor and founding limited partner at Lionheart Ventures and has taught distributed machine learning in academic and bootcamp settings. His background combines applied neuroscience, experimental research on flow/peak states, and applied ML engineering.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / pre-seed investments in artificial intelligence, neurotech, and frontier mental health technologies (psychedelics, neuromodulation); early-stage transformative technologies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner, Operations at TenOneTen Ventures; previously Principal at ff Venture Capital where he focused on early-stage enterprise software and fund operations. Holds a B.S. from Boston College and an MBA from The University of Texas at Austin. Based in Seattle.
enrichment.career_background: Started in investment roles at Park Street Capital, held investing and fund roles at Seven Peaks Ventures, then joined ff Venture Capital (associate → principal) focusing on early-stage enterprise software and fund operations; joined TenOneTen Ventures as Partner, Operations in 2024. Education: Boston College (BS), University of Texas at Austin (MBA).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed to Series A; enterprise software, AI/ML, robotics/computer vision, cybersecurity, logistics and automation

enrichment.personal_bio: Biomedical and electrical engineer, co‑founder and CEO/CTO of Bodyport (digital hemodynamic monitoring). Previously founded Atreo Medical (acquired by Medtronic). Serves as a Venture Partner at Pioneer Fund and holds multiple patents and peer‑reviewed publications in cardio/biomedical sensing.
enrichment.career_background: Corey Centen is an engineer‑entrepreneur focused on medical sensing and digital health. He co‑founded Bodyport (YC S15) developing a cardiac monitoring scale and led Atreo Medical through acquisition by Medtronic; after the acquisition he worked on TrueCPR device technology transfer. He has authored patents and academic publications on cardiovascular sensing and monitoring.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed/Series A); digital health, diagnostics, medical devices, biotechnology; enterprise & consumer software; leverages Y Combinator alumni network.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor at Alumni Seed Fund based in San Francisco. Former founding sales team member at Snapdocs and partner at Fractal Software. Active angel/seed investor with participation in a range of vertical SaaS, consumer and health startups.
enrichment.career_background: Coyne Lloyd was on the founding sales team at Snapdocs, later worked as a partner at Fractal Software and has incubated and operated early-stage startups. Since ~2016 he has been an active angel/seed investor and is listed as an investor with Alumni Seed Fund (based in San Francisco).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage checks into vertical SaaS and enterprise software, with interest in transportation/marketplace, climate/cleantech, healthtech and consumer internet.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at ALS Investment Fund, which focuses on investments in ALS and other neurodegenerative disease therapeutics. Former long-time Bain Capital private equity executive (Managing Director / Senior Advisor). Holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and advanced degrees in chemical engineering from MIT and Princeton.
enrichment.career_background: Spent ~18+ years at Bain Capital (roles through Managing Director and Senior Advisor) after beginning his career at Bain & Company. Since 2016–2017 he has been a Managing Partner at ALS Investment Fund, focusing the firm’s venture investments on ALS and neurodegeneration; has served on corporate boards including MYOB and Retail Zoo.
enrichment.investment_focus: Neurodegeneration-focused biotechnology (ALS primary), clinical-stage therapeutics; Series A–B life‑sciences investments in the US and Western Europe.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture partner and operator focused on climate and regenerative agriculture. Co‑founder of The Crop Project and founding CEO of the Climate Collective; has held leadership roles at NYU Tandon Future Labs and worked with Collaborative Fund. Based in Brooklyn, NY.
enrichment.career_background: Craig Wilson is an investor and operator who has served as a venture partner (Allegory, Collaborative Fund), led NYU Tandon Future Labs and its innovation programs, and founded climate‑focused initiatives including the Climate Collective and The Crop Project. He holds a BA from Middlebury College and an MBA from NYU Stern.
enrichment.investment_focus: Climate tech, regenerative agriculture/seaweed, Web3/blockchain applied to carbon/finance, early‑stage venture (seed–Series A)

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and CEO of Vana and former General Partner at Invariantes Fund (Funds I & II). Based in Guatemala City; studied at Universidad Francisco Marroquín.
enrichment.career_background: Entrepreneur and investor: co-founded Vana (digital lending) and Cognits (software/services). Served as General Partner at Invariantes Fund, helping build an early-stage portfolio across the U.S. and Latin America, and has held board/advisory roles in his ventures.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage VC (pre-seed to Series A) across the U.S. and Latin America; enterprise SaaS; hardware-with-data; fintech; deep tech; backing emerging fund managers.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Member of Clear Current Capital, an impact VC focused on sustainable food. Prior career in investment banking (decades) and a BS in Finance from Virginia Tech. Longstanding interest in animal welfare and alternative-protein investing.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in investment banking for multiple decades (including senior roles at Vining‑Sparks/VSIBG) before founding Clear Current Capital in 2017; leads the firm’s early‑stage, mission‑driven investing in plant‑based, cultivated and fermentation food companies. Holds a B.S. in Finance from Virginia Tech.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed / Series A) investments in sustainable food and foodtech: plant‑based products, cultivated meat, precision fermentation and mission‑aligned ventures addressing animal welfare, climate and health.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Pink Sky Capital, a Las Vegas–based investment firm focused on blockchain and cryptocurrency projects. Active in advising Web3 and crypto gaming projects (e.g., Dreamr, Host.Games). Listed as an executive/manager for Pink Sky Capital on regulatory filings.
enrichment.career_background: Cylus Watson is a managing partner at Pink Sky Capital and is named as an executive/manager on the firm’s SEC filings. Pink Sky Capital (firm filings traceable to 2017) invests in blockchain/Web3 projects and lists Watson among its leadership alongside other partners; Watson has advised projects in the crypto and gaming sectors.
enrichment.investment_focus: Blockchain/Crypto; Web3; Crypto gaming; FinTech; Early-stage (pre-seed/seed)

enrichment.personal_bio: Senior Investment Associate at Prosperity7 Ventures based in San Francisco. Focuses on early-stage investing (seed / pre-seed) across travel, hospitality and transportation tech as well as AI and enterprise infrastructure. Holds graduate study from Stockholm School of Economics and undergraduate degrees from UC Berkeley.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Prosperity7 Ventures in 2022 and is listed on the firm’s US investment team as a Senior Investment Associate. Previously worked at JetBlue Technology Ventures (Investment Analyst / Senior Investment Analyst) and held early-stage VC / operations roles in Europe; educational background includes degrees from UC Berkeley and the Stockholm School of Economics.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / Pre-seed; travel & hospitality; transportation/mobility; AI/ML; enterprise software, cloud & data infrastructure; cybersecurity

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner / Co‑Head of Portage Capital Solutions based in New York. Nearly 20 years of private equity, structured equity and special situations investing focused on financial services and fintech. Prior roles include Senior Portfolio Manager at PIMCO and investment roles at Bain Capital and Pine Brook Partners. Summa cum laude graduate of Emory University.
enrichment.career_background: Dan Ballen co‑leads Portage’s Portage Capital Solutions strategy, focusing on growth equity, structured equity and special situations for fintech and financial services companies. He spent nearly two decades in private equity and structured-equity roles, including Senior Portfolio Manager at PIMCO and earlier positions on the investment teams at Bain Capital and Pine Brook Partners; he began his career in investment banking at Bear Stearns.
enrichment.investment_focus: Fintech and financial services (insurance; consumer & SMB finance; wealth & asset management); payments and fintech enablers; staged investments from seed to Series C via Portage Ventures and late‑stage structured equity/special situations via Portage Capital Solutions.

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal at Work-Bench focused on early-stage enterprise software. Research-driven investor covering Machine Learning & AI, developer tools, and the future of work. Former Product Manager and GTM strategy lead at Hyperscience; author of the More Intelligent (formerly Startupon) newsletter.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Work-Bench in 2022 as an Associate and was promoted to Principal in 2024. Prior roles include Product Manager (Machine Learning) and Go-to-Market Strategy Lead at Hyperscience and strategy consulting at IBM. He authors the More Intelligent newsletter and helps run cofounders.nyc. Educated at Pennsylvania State University (BS).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed) enterprise software; Machine Learning & AI; Developer tools; Future of Work; Enterprise applications

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑Founder and Principal at Bridge Investments and co‑founder of Palo Santo. Based in Chicago, he has worked with Bridge for over two decades and frequently serves as a board director or advisor to portfolio companies. He holds a B.S. from the University of Michigan.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Bridge Investments (Bridge Venture Fund) and co‑founded Palo Santo (a mental‑health/psychedelic therapeutics investment fund). At Bridge he has focused on sourcing and executing growth and buyout investments, portfolio management, and serving on boards or as an advisor to portfolio companies. His experience includes growth equity, recapitalizations and corporate/asset acquisitions.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early to mid‑stage (Seed–Series A) investments in consumer brands and B2B software (SaaS, digital marketplaces); interest in legaltech, event tech and consumer product companies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor at Aurum Capital Ventures based in Cary, North Carolina. Focuses on Web3/blockchain and bitcoin-mining infrastructure and has spoken publicly about bitcoin and energy. Active in seed-stage crypto and mining-related investment activity (investor profile listings and podcast appearances).
enrichment.career_background: Works as an investor with Aurum Capital Ventures (listed on investor databases and featured on Aurum’s "Digital Gold" podcast). Public appearances and firm profiles indicate a focus on mining infrastructure, renewable energy integration for mining, and early-stage Web3 investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Web3 / Blockchain; Bitcoin mining and crypto infrastructure; Seed-stage venture investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture investor focused on the new space economy. Co‑founder/partner at Balerion Space Ventures and a founding principal at Explorer 1 Fund; serves on boards including Lunar Outpost and SkyFi. Prior roles include building an early‑stage VC strategy for a single‑family office. Based in Miami, FL.
enrichment.career_background: Daniel co‑founded Balerion Space Ventures (partner) and was a founding principal at Explorer 1 Fund (est. 2021). From 2018–2021 he built and managed an early‑stage venture investment strategy for a single‑family office (Adi family office). He holds MBA credentials from New York University and Tel Aviv University and an Honors BBA from Ivey Business School; he sits on the boards of Lunar Outpost and SkyFi.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed–Series A) investments in the new space economy and space‑enabled deep tech (satellites, launch/propulsion, in‑space manufacturing, robotics, space infrastructure), with additional interest in cybersecurity and related deep‑tech sectors.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Lead Edge Capital based in New York who leads investments in software, internet, and technology-enabled services. Previously on the investment team at Francisco Partners and held roles at Zuora and McKinsey; holds a B.A. (magna cum laude) from Columbia University.
enrichment.career_background: Dan Lynn is a Partner on Lead Edge Capital’s investment team (joined 2022), focusing on software, internet and tech-enabled services. Prior to Lead Edge he worked on the investment team at Francisco Partners and previously held positions at Zuora (chiefs of staff / operator-facing role) and McKinsey & Company. He earned a B.A., magna cum laude, from Columbia University and is based in Lead Edge’s New York office.
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth equity in software, internet, and technology-enabled services (enterprise SaaS focus)

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at LongJump VC and co‑founder & CEO of A.M. Money. Former U.S. Army reconnaissance team leader and Foreign Affairs Officer at the U.S. State Department. MBA (Analytical Finance & Entrepreneurship) from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business.
enrichment.career_background: Daniel Rogers is co‑founder and CEO of A.M. Money and serves as a General Partner at LongJump VC. His earlier career includes service as a U.S. Army reconnaissance team leader and as a Foreign Affairs Officer at the U.S. State Department; he has also held roles at Moneythink, Uber, and Deutsche Bank. He holds an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business and works on early‑stage investing and founder support in the Midwest.
enrichment.investment_focus: First‑check pre‑seed and seed investments; industry‑agnostic with frequent bets in SaaS, marketplaces, consumer, fintech and founders outside major coastal hubs.

enrichment.personal_bio: Angel investor and investor affiliated with Predictive VC. Former entrepreneur and music-industry executive; currently a wealth/advisory professional based in Nashville with a track record of early consumer-brand and entertainment investments.
enrichment.career_background: Daniel Weisman is a Vice President/Principal in wealth management and an active angel investor. Prior to his advisory role he co‑founded the luxury shoe brand Buscemi, managed artists at Roc Nation, and has participated in multiple consumer and entertainment investments and exits.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) startups focused on data-driven/predictive analytics, fintech, consumer and entertainment

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner and Global Head of Investments at QBE Ventures based in New York. Leads QBE Ventures’ investments in early‑to‑mid stage companies focused on insurance, data and AI. Previously held investment roles at ANZi Ventures, NAB Labs and AMP New Ventures.
enrichment.career_background: Joined QBE Ventures in 2020 as a founding member and global head of investments. Prior roles include Investment Director at ANZi Ventures (ANZ), incubation/innovation manager at NAB Labs and Investment Associate at AMP New Ventures; earlier experience includes VC associate roles and FX trading. Works across Series A–C investments with a focus on strategic partnerships between startups and QBE business units.
enrichment.investment_focus: Insurtech, Data & AI, Resilience and cyber; early‑to‑mid stage (Series A–C); geographic focus includes Australia/NZ, US and UK.

enrichment.personal_bio: Angel investor and fund manager based in Kentucky. Managing General Partner at Unbridled Ventures and listed as an angel affiliated with Alliance of Angels. Former CEO of Hosting.com and a former CPA with a background in finance and operating roles.
enrichment.career_background: Managing General Partner at Unbridled Ventures; prior CEO of Hosting.com (2000–2009). Background as a CFO/CPA and active angel investor and mentor in Kentucky and the region, with a reported track record of personal investments and participation in angel funds.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed / Series A); cloud infrastructure, SaaS and enterprise software; AI & data analytics; healthcare / digital health; digital media

She served as a Senior Associate at Propel Bio Partners, focusing on diligence and operations for therapeutics and biotech. She holds a B.S. and Ph.D. in Bioengineering from the University of Washington and previously worked in business development at Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center.
interests: Early-stage therapeutics and biotech investing (Seed–Series B)
Due diligence and translational R&D assessment
enrichment.career_background: PhD-trained bioengineer (University of Washington) whose research focused on cardiac regeneration. Worked as Business Development Manager at Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center, then joined Propel Bio Partners as the fund’s first hire and Senior Associate where she led due diligence on private therapeutics and biotech companies. In May 2025 she joined Juvena Therapeutics as Senior Corporate Development Manager.
enrichment.investment_focus: Life sciences — therapeutics, diagnostics and platform biotech; early-stage through Series B (Seed–Series B).

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor focused on crypto, fintech and frontier tech. Co‑founder and managing partner at 99 Capital; previously led crypto investments for the SoftBank Latin America Fund. Harvard BA in Statistics; active in AI/ML research and teaching roles.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder & managing partner at 99 Capital (digital assets / Web3 fund). Previously Head of Crypto Investments / Investment Director at SoftBank Latin America Fund and earlier worked in M&A and strategy at Morgan Stanley. Holds a BA in Statistics from Harvard and is an AI research fellow/lecturer at Harvard-affiliated programs.

enrichment.career_background: Managing Director, Originations at Lead Edge Capital, focused on sourcing investments and managing the firm’s intermediary relationships. enrichment.personal_bio: Associate at Casa Verde Capital since 2018. Prior to Casa Verde he worked on the General Catalyst finance team. He holds a B.S. in Business Administration (Finance & Entrepreneurship) from Northeastern University and collects vinyl records.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Casa Verde in 2018 and is an Associate focused on the firm’s cannabis and ancillary technology investments. Before Casa Verde he worked operationally on the General Catalyst finance team. He holds a B.S. in Business Administration from Northeastern University (Finance & Entrepreneurship).

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at GoodPaper Ventures (since 2021); former fund operations and legal executive with senior roles at SS&C, Citigroup and Monarch Funds. Holds a J.D. (Tulane) and a B.S. in Engineering (University of Michigan). Focuses on fund operations, compliance and early-stage investing at GoodPaper Ventures.
enrichment.career_background: David Goldstein is an attorney and operations executive with decades of experience in fund administration, product and operations leadership, and legal/compliance for investment managers. Prior roles include Managing Director at SS&C Technologies, senior operations and product roles at Citigroup and Forum Investment Advisors, and president of Monarch Funds; he joined GoodPaper Ventures as a partner/COO in 2021. Education includes a J.D. from Tulane Law School and a B.S. in Naval Architecture & Marine Engineering from the University of Michigan.
