enrichment.personal_bio: Product leader and early-stage angel investor. Former founder (Latent Space) and product manager at Google/YouTube; led AI product work at Coda and now leads AI product at Figma. Active in the South Park Commons community and serves as a scout/advisor for early-stage funds and startups.
enrichment.career_background: David Kossnick is a founder-turned-product-leader and angel investor. He founded Latent Space (2015–2020), held PM roles at Google and YouTube, led Coda’s AI product efforts, and moved to lead AI product at Figma. He is an alum/angel of South Park Commons, serves as a Greylock scout, and has advised startups (e.g., Skyryse).
enrichment.investment_focus: AI and generative AI; developer tools and prototyping; games and media/content; deep tech — primarily pre-seed/seed stage (typical angel checks ~$25K–$100K).

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner, Chief Operating Officer and Chief Compliance Officer at Quona Capital (joined 2022). Former senior executive at SEAF, Franklin Templeton/Darby Private Equity and Soros Fund Management; holds a BA from Stanford and a Master of Management from Kellogg (Northwestern).
interests: Emerging markets private equity and fund formation
enrichment.career_background: David Mathewson joined Quona Capital in 2022 as Partner, COO and CCO. He previously served as Senior Managing Director at SEAF, was Senior Managing Director (COO responsibilities) at Franklin Templeton/Darby Private Equity, and was a Managing Director at Soros Fund Management; earlier roles include deputy head of investment funds at OPIC and banking at Brown Brothers Harriman. He holds a BA from Stanford University and a Master of Management from Northwestern University (Kellogg).
enrichment.investment_focus: Inclusive fintech in emerging markets (Latin America, India & Southeast Asia, Africa, MENA); sectors include payments, lending, digital banking, embedded finance and fintech infrastructure; stages from early to growth.

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal, Science & Technology at Alexandria Venture Investments (the corporate venture arm of Alexandria Real Estate Equities). Focuses on early- to growth-stage life‑science and healthcare investing. Background spans business development in biotech and healthcare investment banking with technical training in chemical engineering.
enrichment.career_background: Currently Principal, Science & Technology at Alexandria Venture Investments. Previously held business development and corporate roles at Sangamo Therapeutics and worked in healthcare investment banking and biotechnology equity research (including Bank of America Merrill Lynch, Guggenheim, Stifel, Canaccord); earlier roles include research at Genentech and applications at Life Technologies. Holds graduate degrees in chemical engineering from the University of Michigan and undergraduate degrees from Johns Hopkins University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed through growth-stage investments in life science and healthcare (biopharma, medical devices, diagnostics, digital health; select agrifoodtech/technology opportunities).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and CEO of Tovala (smart oven + meal service) and active angel investor. Serves as a Venture Partner at Pioneer Fund. MBA, University of Chicago Booth; prior experience at Google, Foundation Capital, Veggie Grill and Groovy Spoon.
enrichment.career_background: David Rabie co‑founded Tovala and is its CEO; under his leadership the company completed YC, a Kickstarter and multiple VC rounds and acquired Radish in 2017. He has an MBA from Chicago Booth and has worked at Google and Foundation Capital and in operator roles at Veggie Grill and Groovy Spoon. He is also an angel investor and listed as a Venture Partner at Pioneer Fund.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early‑stage consumer startups (food & beverage, consumer hardware/IoT, DTC/subscription, SMB software)

enrichment.personal_bio: Tenured Professor of Genetics at Harvard Medical School and Co-Director of the Paul F. Glenn Center for Biology of Aging. Venture Partner at Catalio Capital Management. Author of the bestseller "Lifespan" and a researcher focused on the biology of aging, including sirtuins, NAD+ metabolism and epigenetic reprogramming.
enrichment.career_background: David A. Sinclair earned a B.S. and Ph.D. from the University of New South Wales, completed postdoctoral work at MIT, and joined Harvard Medical School in 1999. He served as founding director/co‑director of the Paul F. Glenn Center for Biology of Aging, has co‑founded multiple biotech and consumer companies, holds numerous patents, and serves as a venture partner/advisor to several investment firms including Catalio.
enrichment.hometown: St Ives, New South Wales, Australia
enrichment.investment_focus: Life sciences / biomedical technology (drugs, devices, diagnostics, tools); invests across stages from seed to growth and across private, public and credit strategies.

enrichment.personal_bio: David H. Whitley is an NC State alumnus and active member of the Wolfpack Investor Network. He is an Operating Product & Technology Director at Serent Capital and has served as CTO of Bullhorn and SVP of Product Development at Applied Systems. He serves on boards including Davisware, ManageAmerica and Dyad and advises early-stage software companies.
enrichment.career_background: Experienced software executive and board director with a B.S. in Electrical Engineering from NC State (1992). Roles include Chief Technology Officer at Bullhorn, Senior VP of Product Development at Applied Systems, Managing Director of DHW Ventures, and Operating Product & Technology Director at Serent Capital; currently serves on multiple boards and advises venture-backed companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and Series A investments in NC State-affiliated startups; sectors include healthcare/biotech, information technology, enterprise software/enterprise applications, and consumer internet.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Core Innovation Capital focused on early-stage fintech and financial inclusion. Former interest-rate trader on Wall Street with operating roles at an early-stage fintech in Nigeria and a marketplace startup in New York. Holds a BS in Management Science & Engineering from Stanford and an MBA from Harvard. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area.
enrichment.career_background: Started as an interest-rate trader (Morgan Stanley), held operating roles at an early-stage fintech in Nigeria and a marketplace startup in New York, joined Core Innovation Capital (joined Core in a VP role and is now listed as Partner). Education: BS in Management Science & Engineering (Stanford) and an MBA (Harvard).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage fintech (financial inclusion), insurtech, crypto/web3; Seed to Series A

enrichment.personal_bio: Marketing leader and advisor based in San Francisco. Head of Product/Customer Marketing at Writer (previously Stripe, Wealthfront, Dropbox) and a Limited Partner at MKT1 Capital. Advises early-stage B2B startups on product marketing, growth, and go-to-market.
enrichment.career_background: Deanna has held senior product and growth marketing roles at Dropbox, Wealthfront (VP of Marketing), Stripe, and Writer. She advises multiple startups and joined MKT1 Capital as a Limited Partner in 2022 to support early-stage B2B founders on marketing and GTM execution.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage B2B startups (pre-seed to Series A); marketing-led go-to-market, SaaS and enterprise applications

enrichment.personal_bio: Technology executive and enterprise CIO with senior IT leadership roles at Zebra Technologies, Cirrus Logic and Knowles. Serves as an Advisory Board Member / Advisor to GTM Capital (joined 2022). Based in Glenview, Illinois (professional location).
enrichment.career_background: Longtime technology leader focused on digital transformation, enterprise applications, and cybersecurity; held senior CIO/VP IT roles at Zebra Technologies and Cirrus Logic and joined Knowles as VP & CIO in 2024. Acts as an advisory board member to GTM Capital, working with early-stage enterprise IT and AI startups on GTM/customer access strategies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise IT startups (security, GenAI, networking & architecture, cloud & infrastructure, devops, SaaS); seed through Series A / A+; customer/CIO-led go-to-market focus.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor at MaC Venture Capital focusing on seed and early-stage companies. Previously worked at Village Capital and in marketing/growth at BEEPR. Holds a B.S. in Economics (minors: Political Science; Writing, Rhetoric & Technical Communication) from James Madison University. Based in Los Angeles and interests include music, travel, and conversations with diverse founders.
enrichment.career_background: Currently an investor at MaC Venture Capital. Prior roles include US Ventures at Village Capital and Marketing & Growth at BEEPR; earlier internships included the U.S. Embassy in Côte d'Ivoire and the Democratic Party of Virginia. Graduated from James Madison University where he served as Student Body President.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / early-stage startups; fintech; transportation tech; culture-driven consumer and enterprise technology; investments in Africa and international opportunities.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Vine Ventures (Head of West Coast), based in San Francisco. Joined Vine in 2021 and was promoted to partner in May 2024. Previously worked in private equity at Blackstone (2016–2021) and holds a bachelor's degree in Mathematics from Harvard University.
enrichment.career_background: Investor focused on seed and early-stage software investments. Joined Vine Ventures as the firm's first West Coast hire in 2021 and was promoted to partner in 2024. Prior to Vine, worked in private equity at Blackstone (2016–2021). Publishes commentary on AI, macro, and data/infrastructure topics.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / early-stage software: SMB SaaS, FinTech (including insurtech), data & infrastructure, AI; geographic focus: U.S., Israel, Latin America.

enrichment.personal_bio: Angel Partner at FirstHand Alliance based in Menlo Park, CA. Senior product and engineering leader for Google Experience Platform; previously held senior engineering leadership roles at Salesforce and Yahoo.
enrichment.career_background: Experienced engineering and product executive with senior leadership roles across large tech companies. At Google she serves as a senior director/head of product & engineering for the Google Experience Platform; prior roles include VP/Director engineering leadership at Salesforce (Lightning Platform) and senior engineering management at Yahoo.
enrichment.investment_focus: Stage: pre-seed / seed; Sectors: SaaS, AI, cybersecurity, sales & CRM, e-commerce

enrichment.personal_bio: Angel investor and Partner at the Wolfpack Investor Network (WIN), based in the Raleigh, NC area. NC State alumnus and technology sales leader who co-founded People First Professionals. Active in early-stage deal selection with WIN alongside a career in enterprise software sales and go-to-market leadership.
enrichment.career_background: Devin Williams is a sales and go-to-market leader with senior roles across enterprise software companies and founders-led ventures. He has held leadership positions at firms including LaunchDarkly, DataRobot and AppDynamics (as listed in public profiles), co-founded People First Professionals, and serves as an angel investor/partner with the Wolfpack Investor Network supporting NC State–affiliated startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: NC State–affiliated early-stage startups (seed to Series A); focus areas include enterprise software, health/biotech, pharmaceuticals, consumer internet, and food & beverage.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner & Head of Research at Catalio Capital Management; responsible for managing Catalio’s investment/research team and serving on the firmwide Investment and Management Committees. Trained as a medical doctor (MBBS, Imperial College), completed surgical residency at Johns Hopkins and a visiting research fellowship at Weill Cornell. Serves on or observes multiple portfolio company boards. citeturn1view0turn0search1turn2search7turn2search0turn0search4
enrichment.career_background: Completed two years of general surgery residency at Johns Hopkins Hospital and two years of postgraduate medical/surgical training in London; worked as a visiting research fellow at Weill Cornell investigating genetic drivers of bladder cancer. Joined Catalio as a senior research/investment professional and now serves as Partner & Head of Research, participating on the investment committee and holding multiple portfolio board seats. citeturn2search0turn1view0

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur-turned-investor focused on early-stage startups and building funds/networks for diverse founders. Founding/managing partner roles across FilKor Capital and Medingenii Capital; former Managing Director of the Rice Angel Network. Holds an MBA from Rice University and a BA from Baylor University.

Venture fund formation, angel networks, and accelerators
enrichment.career_background: Diane Yoo is a venture investor and founder who has launched and led multiple funds and investment networks (including FilKor Capital and Medingenii Capital) and served as Managing Director of the Rice Angel Network. She has organized national pitch competitions, advised university and accelerator programs, and founded media and networking initiatives (Identity Unveiled, Fenix Global) to advance AAPI and women founders. enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and managing partner at Opera Ventures, an early‑stage VC focused on Latin American tech. Previously an early employee and Head of Legal at Rappi; combines legal and operator experience with VC investing.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at Opera Ventures (founded 2021). Early employee and Head of Legal at Rappi; prior legal roles in professional services. Active angel/seed investor through Opera with a focus on LatAm technology companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) technology companies in Latin America; sectors include fintech, marketplaces and enterprise software; typical checks ~$100k–$1M.

enrichment.personal_bio: Former NFL defensive tackle and 2014 first-round pick who transitioned into entrepreneurship and investing after retiring. Active in real estate, licensed micro-cultivation (cannabis), fintech/edutech projects and athlete-focused ventures. Public speaker and mental-health advocate working on athlete wellness and addiction recovery initiatives.

Since retiring he has built businesses and investments spanning real estate, consumer retail (party/store operations), cannabis cultivation/licensing and athlete-focused platforms; he is listed as an investor/member at The Players' Impact and has publicly discussed founding/leading several ventures and a mental-health-focused foundation.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor at Salesforce Ventures focused on pre-seed to Series A startups in AI (applications & infrastructure) and developer experience. Prior to joining Salesforce Ventures he co‑founded the e‑commerce startup Charm (acquired 2024) and has experience in investment banking. Based in San Francisco; graduated from Santa Clara University.
enrichment.career_background: Dom Pusateri is a generalist investor on the Salesforce Ventures team, concentrating on early-stage AI and developer-focused companies. Before investing he co-founded Charm (acq. 2024) and previously worked in investment banking roles; he studied at Santa Clara University and spent time at Yonsei University. He is based in San Francisco.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed to Series A; AI (applications & infrastructure), developer experience, B2B SaaS / enterprise software

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Elevate Capital focused on healthcare and digital health. Former co‑founder of The KOR Physical Therapy and founder of Champion Solutions; trained as a physical therapist (MPT, Carroll University). President of TiE Oregon and active mentor/consultant for healthcare startups.
enrichment.career_background: Board‑certified physical therapist turned operator and investor. Co‑founded The KOR Physical Therapy (later acquired), founded Champion Solutions, held clinic leadership and director roles in outpatient physical therapy, and joined Elevate Capital as a Venture Partner (role listed since 2020). Serves as President of TiE Oregon; holds a BS in Biology and an MPT from Carroll University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Pre-seed–Series A); digital health, health IT, healthcare services; investing with emphasis on inclusive founders (women, BIPOC, veterans).

enrichment.personal_bio: Dr. Doug Kerr, M.D., Ph.D., MBA is a neurologist and biotech executive serving as Science Advisor at Exceptional Ventures and Chief Medical Officer at Dyne Therapeutics. He was a founding member and former CMO of Generation Bio and has held senior development roles at Biogen and Shire. He has academic experience as an associate professor at Johns Hopkins and has participated on multiple biotech boards and scientific advisory boards. Kerr led programs including the development of Spinraza for spinal muscular atrophy.
interests: Clinical drug development and translational neuroscience
enrichment.career_background: Trained in an MD/PhD program (Jefferson Medical College/Thomas Jefferson University) with neurology residency at Johns Hopkins, Dr. Kerr served on the Johns Hopkins faculty before moving into industry. He held senior R&D and neurology development roles at Biogen and Shire, co‑founded and led R&D and clinical development at Generation Bio, has served on multiple biotech boards/SABs, and joined Dyne Therapeutics as CMO in 2024 while advising venture firms including Atlas Venture and Exceptional Ventures.
enrichment.investment_focus: Biotechnology (gene therapy, rare-disease neurology), clinical development and translational neuroscience

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Scout at LvlUp Ventures, based in Boulder, Colorado. Active in the Colorado early-stage startup community (LinkedIn activity) and listed in the University of Colorado Boulder Leeds School directory. Focuses on sourcing early-stage deals across marketing technology, education, Web3/crypto and fintech.
enrichment.career_background: Listed as a Venture Scout with LvlUp Ventures (firm pages and investor directories). Appears in the University of Colorado Boulder Leeds School directory and is publicly active on LinkedIn around Colorado founder/investor events; public profiles identify him primarily in scout/investor-sourcing roles rather than as a lead GP.
enrichment.investment_focus: Sourcing and scouting for early-stage investments (pre-seed to Series A) with sector interests in MarketingTech, EdTech, Web3/Crypto, and FinTech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Head of Creator Partnerships & Investments (former) at Creative Juice with a background in content strategy and partnerships across media and creator-focused fintech. Previously held roles at NBCUniversal, Fox/Disney ad products, and MGM; founded Von Content. Education includes an MBA from Columbia Business School and a BA from the University of Pennsylvania.
enrichment.career_background: Experienced media and creator-economy operator who led creator partnerships and investing at Creative Juice (2021–2023), founded Von Content (2015), and held corporate strategy and content roles at NBCUniversal, Fox (advanced ad products) and MGM (Director, Global Content Strategy). Holds an MBA from Columbia Business School and a BA from the University of Pennsylvania.
enrichment.investment_focus: Creator economy, early-stage (seed) investments in social commerce and fintech for creators

enrichment.personal_bio: Investment professional who served as an Associate on life-sciences investing teams at Bain Capital Life Sciences. Previously worked in healthcare investment banking at MTS Health Partners. Later took an investing role at Blackstone focused on biotech/life-sciences investing (per public profiles).
enrichment.career_background: Worked as an investment banking analyst at MTS Health Partners, then as an Associate at Bain Capital (life-sciences investing); subsequent roles include vice president-level life-sciences/biotech investing at Blackstone according to public professional profiles. No public, verifiable record found of personal-led exits or a public portfolio list.
enrichment.investment_focus: Investing in life-sciences companies across biotechnology, pharmaceuticals, medical devices, diagnostics and life-science tools; focus on growth/inflection capital and later-stage life-sciences investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and early-stage investor. Founder of Cardinia Ventures (2016) and co‑founder of Omny Studio (acquired by Triton Digital). Investor/advisor in software and hardware startups across Australia, the US and Southeast Asia.
enrichment.career_background: Founded Cardinia Ventures in 2016 and has been investing in pre‑seed to Series A companies. Co‑founder and former CEO of Omny Studio (acquired 2019); first employee at Rome2rio; held roles at Funding Circle, Groupon, ANZ and Microsoft. Currently co‑founder/CEO at GXE and active as an investor and advisor to portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed to Series A investments in software and hardware companies across Australia, the United States and Southeast Asia.

enrichment.personal_bio: Associate Director, Impact Investments at Social Finance (2023–present). Former Senior Investment Associate on the TMT & Fintech team at IDB Invest, with experience in investment banking and early-stage scouting. Focuses on impact investing, fintech, climate-related strategies and women’s economic empowerment.
enrichment.career_background: Investment professional with an MBA from University of Virginia (Darden) and a BA from Dickinson College. Work history includes Senior Investment Associate (TMT & Fintech) at IDB Invest (2017–2020), investment banking roles at Seale & Associates and District Capital Partners, MBA internship/scout roles at Amazon and Dorm Room Fund, and public listings as a deal partner/venture scout for Ganas Ventures; currently Associate Director, Impact Investments at Social Finance.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed, community-driven startups in the US and Latin America; sectors include FinTech, consumer internet/e-commerce, enterprise applications; emphasis on impact and climate-related strategies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Sequoia Capital scout and senior machine learning engineer at Databricks. Co‑founder and former CEO of Bandit ML (YC S20), acquired by Silo. Prior engineering roles at Meta (Facebook) and Uber with a focus on applied ML and recommendation systems.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in consulting (Bain & Company), then as an ML engineer at Uber and Meta, co‑founded Bandit ML (YC S20) which was acquired by Silo; served as engineering manager at Silo and later joined Databricks as a senior ML engineer. Serves/served as a scout for Sequoia Capital. Education listed as a master’s degree from MIT and a bachelor’s degree from Rutgers University on public profiles.
enrichment.investment_focus: AI/ML, SaaS, early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed), applied machine learning

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Reinventure Capital and a veteran impact investor with over three decades of venture capital experience. Focuses on profitable investments that advance racial and gender equity and help overlooked founders scale. Graduate of Harvard College and Princeton University (MPA).
enrichment.career_background: Longtime venture investor who led UNC Partners/UNC Ventures funds, served on the board of the Federal Reserve Bank of Boston and other civic finance organizations, and later founded Reinventure Capital to deploy growth capital into underrepresented founders. Has held executive and board roles across venture-backed companies and community finance institutions and is widely cited for a contrarian, impact-driven investment approach.
enrichment.investment_focus: US-based, BIPOC- and women-led companies at breakeven / early-growth (post-seed to growth); industry-agnostic, impact-first strategy emphasizing profitable scaling and measurable social outcomes.

enrichment.personal_bio: Associate at Stratos responsible for deal sourcing, due diligence, and investment research. Prior research roles at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory and Oak Ridge National Laboratory. Holds a B.S. in Physics and an M.S. in Information Technology. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area (as listed on industry profiles).
enrichment.career_background: Joined Stratos in 2021 (analyst, later associate) focusing on early-stage crypto/Web3 investments. Earlier worked in physics research at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory and Oak Ridge National Laboratory and holds graduate training in information technology.
enrichment.investment_focus: Web3/Blockchain, DeFi and crypto infrastructure; seed and Series A stages; typical check size reported ~$100K–$5M (sweet spot ~$1.5M).

enrichment.personal_bio: Elizabeth (Liz) Leahy is the Founder & Managing Partner of Purple Sage Ventures and an early-stage investor and entrepreneur. She focuses on seed and early-stage investments in companies led by diverse founders and has a background as an operator and founder in digital platforms and marketing. She serves as Pitch Coach in Residence at Columbia Startup Lab and chairs the Georgetown Angel Investor Network.
enrichment.career_background: Leahy began her career at The Princeton Review and in management consulting, was on the founding team at Bigfoot Interactive, and co‑founded Section 101. She launched Purple Sage Ventures in 2021 to back early-stage, diverse founders and also serves in academic and ecosystem roles (Pitch Coach in Residence at Columbia Startup Lab; board roles at Columbia Business School Lang Center and Georgetown entrepreneurship groups). She holds a BA from Georgetown and an MBA from Columbia Business School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage startups; products/services that innovate supply chains, increase business and personal productivity, and reimagine wellness; focus on diverse/underrepresented founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner and Head of Investor Relations at Lead Edge Capital, based in San Francisco. Leads the firm’s investor relations function, communications, reporting and relationships with the firm’s LP network. Joined Lead Edge in 2011 after serving as Head of Investor Relations and Assistant COO at Eastern Advisors. Graduated from Baruch College.
enrichment.career_background: Emila joined Lead Edge Capital in 2011 and is a Partner who leads the Investor Relations team, overseeing communications, reporting and relationships with the firm’s network of limited partners. Prior to Lead Edge she was Head of Investor Relations and Assistant COO at Eastern Advisors (a Tiger Management‑backed hedge fund). She graduated from Baruch College and is based in San Francisco.
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth-stage growth equity in software, internet, and tech‑enabled services; minority and buyout investments; leverages LP network to support portfolio companies; typical check sizes in the growth‑equity range.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Chief Brand Officer of Red Antler and a Founding Partner at Habitat Partners. Author of "Obsessed: Building a Brand People Love From Day One." Known for leading brand strategy for consumer startups and participating in early‑stage investing through Habitat Partners.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Red Antler in 2007 and serves as its Chief Brand Officer; earlier worked in advertising and strategic planning (D'Arcy, Saatchi & Saatchi, JWT, Consortium). In 2021/2022 she became a Founding Partner at Habitat Partners, the venture arm associated with Red Antler.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage consumer and technology startups (DTC consumer brands, B2B software, frontier tech, fintech)

enrichment.personal_bio: Executive Investment Director at RA Capital Management who leads venture-stage investments and company formation through RA’s incubator programs. Previously served as Chief Business Officer at Prevail Therapeutics through its IPO and acquisition by Eli Lilly, and as Interim CEO of Stylus Medicine. Acted as Consulting Chief Business Officer for Aliada Therapeutics through its acquisition by AbbVie. Holds a BA from Princeton University and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Former Chief Business Officer at Prevail Therapeutics (gene therapy for neurodegenerative disease); held senior business development and marketing roles at Celgene; began her career in strategy consulting at Frankel Group. At RA she spent time as a Venture Partner in Raven (RA’s incubator) and has led and operated several early-stage biotech companies (e.g., Stylus Medicine, Aliada). Educated at Princeton University (BA) and Harvard Business School (MBA).
enrichment.investment_focus: Venture-stage life sciences (genetic medicine/gene therapy, rare disease/neurodegeneration, oncology, immunology); company formation/incubation

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner and Chief Operating Officer at Reshape Ventures, based in New York City. Works on sourcing and operating early-stage investments in proptech, retail & e-commerce, and healthcare. Previously held operations leadership roles including interim COO at Blank Street and Head of Operations at Alrai Capital.
enrichment.career_background: Emir Ildiz is Partner & COO at Reshape Ventures, where he supports deal sourcing, portfolio operations and firm operations for an early-stage VC focused on companies that require real estate to scale. Prior roles include interim Chief Operating Officer at Blank Street and Head of Operations at Alrai Capital; he is based in New York City.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed) startups in proptech/real-estate tech, retail & e-commerce, consumer brands and healthcare/digital health — particularly businesses that scale via physical locations or real-estate-enabled expansion.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder of Ozmen Ventures and chairwoman/majority owner of Sierra Nevada Corporation (SNC). Immigrant from Turkey who earned an MBA at the University of Nevada, Reno and helped grow SNC through strategic acquisitions. Launched Ozmen Ventures (seed/early-stage VC) to support Northern Nevada startups and the regional entrepreneurial ecosystem.
interests: Regional entrepreneurship and startup ecosystem development
STEM education and women in STEM
enrichment.career_background: Eren Ozmen came to the U.S. from Turkey to pursue an MBA (University of Nevada, Reno). She joined Sierra Nevada Corporation in the late 1980s and, with her husband Fatih, acquired the company in 1994; she serves as SNC’s chairwoman and has led its growth through multiple acquisitions. In 2017 the Ozmens launched Ozmen Ventures, a seed and early-stage fund focused on Northern Nevada and technology startups, and the family is active in related philanthropy and entrepreneurship initiatives.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage technology companies; emphasis on aerospace/space, defense, AI/advanced computing, fintech, healthcare, and regional (Northern Nevada) startup development.

enrichment.personal_bio: Senior associate at F‑Prime Capital Partners focused on healthcare and health‑tech investing. Previously worked in healthcare investment banking at Bank of America Merrill Lynch. Holds a BBA in Finance and International Business from Georgetown University.
enrichment.career_background: Senior associate on F‑Prime’s healthcare/health‑tech team, supporting sourcing, diligence and portfolio work. Prior roles include healthcare investment banking at Bank of America Merrill Lynch. Educated at Georgetown University (BBA, Finance & International Business).
enrichment.investment_focus: Healthcare and technology (health IT, digital health, health services, life sciences/medtech); venture investments across early to growth stages.

enrichment.personal_bio: B2B growth leader and investor based in the Washington, D.C. area. Former Microsoft and Google executive with experience advising CapitalG; active investor in free-from / allergy-focused food businesses and a Limited Partner in AllerFund. Educated at MIT Sloan (MBA), Brandeis (MS, Data Science) and American University (BS).
enrichment.career_background: 25+ years building and leading business development and partner teams in software and cloud (including long tenures at Microsoft and Google); served on GTM/advisory boards for CapitalG; Investor/Partner at Free From Ventures and Limited Partner in AllerFund, focused on accelerating treatments, diagnostics and consumer products for food allergies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Curing and managing food allergies: early‑stage (seed/Series A) therapeutics, diagnostics, medical devices, foodtech and consumer health products.

enrichment.personal_bio: Web3 founder and investor based in the Philippines; founder of Exnetwork Capital and CEO of Gamepad.co. Serves as an investor / limited partner associated with Woodstock Fund and advises multiple crypto projects. citeturn4search0turn1view1turn3search2
enrichment.career_background: Founded Exnetwork Capital (a crypto/community-focused fund/incubator) in 2018 and has led investments and advisory work across blockchain projects; serves as CEO of Gamepad.co (since 2021) and is listed as a limited partner / investor associated with Woodstock Fund. citeturn4search0turn4search6turn1view1
enrichment.investment_focus: Early and growth-stage investments in Web3 / blockchain, gaming (GameFi), DeFi, NFTs and tokenization. citeturn3search4turn0search4

enrichment.personal_bio: Erik Dietrich is CEO of Hit Subscribe and a limited partner at MKT1 Capital. He has a background in software engineering and developer-focused content marketing, and founded DaedTech LLC. He participates in early-stage, marketing-oriented investing through MKT1.
enrichment.career_background: Erik Dietrich is the founder of DaedTech LLC and has worked as a software engineer and IT leader (including serving as CIO at CHC Wellness). Since 2017 he has been CEO of Hit Subscribe, a content/marketing firm focused on reaching engineering audiences, and he joined MKT1 Capital as an LP/partner role in 2022.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage B2B (SaaS) startups, marketing/Go-to-market and MarTech; Seed through Series A.

enrichment.personal_bio: Software engineer and entrepreneur based in Mountain View, CA. Co‑founder of Veryfi (YC W17) and former CTO/co‑founder of Medlert (VectorCare); founder of Purpleblue Pty Ltd (web agency). Holds a B.Sc. in Computer Science and an Executive MBA (AGSM).
enrichment.career_background: Australian‑trained software engineer who founded Purpleblue Pty Ltd (web development/analytics), served as CTO at Couponstar (later part of Quotient/ Coupons.com) and Head of International Engineering at Coupons/Quotient, co‑founded Medlert (VectorCare) and co‑founded Veryfi (YC W17). Educated with a B.Sc. in Computer Science and an Executive MBA from AGSM (UNSW).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed / seed stage startups in AI/automation (document data), healthtech & hospital services, retail/fintech and consumer platforms

enrichment.personal_bio: Errol King is a technologist and angel investor affiliated with the Black Angel Group. He worked for years at Google (Creative Lab / related roles) and co‑founded Hidden Level Games. He is active in generative AI research and creative technology projects.
interests: Creative technology & game design for learning
Social simulation / identity applications of AI
enrichment.career_background: King co‑founded Hidden Level Games (an indie game studio focused on teaching coding through play) and spent multiple years at Google in creative‑technology and experience roles (including projects under Google’s Creative Lab and Code Next initiatives). In recent years he has focused on generative AI research and launched/joined ventures such as Innergalactic.xyz while participating in arts and research residencies related to AI.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed to Series A technology startups (consumer & enterprise software, AI/machine learning, data services, IoT)

enrichment.personal_bio: Los Angeles–based entrepreneur and investor focused on cannabis, hemp and consumer brands. Co‑founded Casa Verde Capital and later founded Sands Lane; previously led MGO | ELLO’s national cannabis practice and spent over a decade at PwC. Holds a B.S. in Economics from the Wharton School, University of Pennsylvania.
enrichment.career_background: Evan Eneman began his career at PricewaterhouseCoopers advising large and emerging companies. He co‑founded Casa Verde Capital (a cannabis-focused VC) and helped build ELLO (a professional services platform for cannabis). He later founded Sands Lane (holding company with venture, agency and investment arms) and has led brand and incubation efforts across cannabis, beverages and other emerging markets.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage investments in ancillary cannabis & hemp businesses, consumer and beverage brands, enablement software/services, and regulatory/compliance/professional services.

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal at Constellation Technology Ventures based in New York. Formerly worked in strategic partnerships and startup/VC roles after an MBA from Columbia Business School; focuses on early-stage energy and climate technologies.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Constellation Technology Ventures in 2023 and is listed as Principal (role updated on the firm site). Prior roles include strategic partnerships at Riskified (2019–2022), various MBA associate roles at Draper Associates and Bowery Capital during his MBA, investor/associate roles at StartFast Ventures, and growth-consulting for early-stage startups. Education listed as an MBA from Columbia Business School (exchange at London Business School) and a BS from Syracuse University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and growth-stage investments in energy technology, clean tech, electrification, emissions management, and digital energy/software (seed to growth).

enrichment.personal_bio: Investment professional who served as a Senior Associate at Summit Partners (2014–2018), focusing on tech-enabled services, industrial technology and consumer sectors. Previously worked in M&A at Lazard and as a policy analyst at the National Economic Council; holds a B.S. (honors) from the Kelley School of Business, Indiana University. Later joined KKR's Global Impact team in 2018.
enrichment.career_background: Evan Kaufman earned a B.S. from the Kelley School of Business (Indiana University). He worked at the National Economic Council (White House), then in M&A at Lazard Frères, joined Summit Partners as an investment professional (Senior Associate, 2014–2018) and subsequently moved to KKR (Global Impact) in 2018. He also serves on nonprofit boards (e.g., United Way of New York City).
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth equity in technology, healthcare & life sciences and growth products & services; focus areas include tech-enabled services, industrial technology, and consumer/business services.

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and founder of Kredit Academy (formerly Kiddie Kredit), focused on credit education and financial literacy for youth. Based in Miami, he serves as a Scout at Florida Funders and has acted as a mentor at Techstars and leader in Miami EdTech initiatives.
enrichment.career_background: Founded Kiddie Kredit (now Kredit Academy) in 2018 to teach credit and financial skills to young people. Active in the Miami startup ecosystem as Vice Chair of Miami EdTech, co‑founder of Black Men Talk Tech, a Techstars mentor, and (since 2021) a Scout for Florida Funders; has participated in accelerator and fundraising programs for Kredit Academy.
enrichment.investment_focus: FinTech and financial education; early-stage deals (seed–Series A); EdTech and consumer financial products

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner and Portfolio Manager for Lead Edge Capital’s public equity fund. Sits on the Board of Directors at Yext. Previously an investor at ValueAct Capital and held roles at Hellman & Friedman and Bain & Company. Holds an A.B. in Mathematics and Economics from Williams College.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Lead Edge in 2018 and serves as Partner and public portfolio manager; prior roles include investor at ValueAct Capital (2015–2018), associate at Hellman & Friedman (circa 2013–2015) and consultant at Bain & Company. Graduated from Williams College with a double major in Math and Economics.
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth-stage investments in software, internet and tech-enabled services (private and public); typical investment sizes in the ~$10M–$200M range; public-market focus on mid-cap growth companies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and former CTO of Teespring (founded 2011). Currently a venture partner at Pioneer Fund and a general partner at HF0 (startup residency/fund). Based in the San Francisco Bay Area; AB from Brown University.
enrichment.career_background: Evan co‑founded Teespring (also known as Spring) and served as its CTO through 2018. After leaving Teespring he transitioned to investor and operator roles, including general partner at HF0 (an AI residency/fund) and venture partner at Pioneer Fund, and has advised early‑stage startups. He is based in the San Francisco Bay Area and holds an undergraduate degree from Brown University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed / Series A); AI/ML; Enterprise SaaS; Consumer internet & marketplaces; creator economy

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at TMV and co‑founder & CEO of Mavely. Serial entrepreneur who co‑founded Swyft Media and a QSR roll‑up (Irish Beef); recognized on Forbes 30 Under 30. Holds a B.A. in Economics from the University of Notre Dame and is based in Chicago, IL.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and CEO of Mavely (acquired by Nu Skin in 2021), co‑founder of Swyft Media (acquired by Monotype in 2015), and founding partner of Irish Beef (acquired by Equicorp Partners). Serves as a Venture Partner at TMV, sits on advisory boards at the University of Notre Dame, and focuses on product‑market fit and scaling consumer businesses.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage consumer and services startups (social commerce, creator economy, DTC/retail, consumer tech); product‑market fit, growth & distribution

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner, COO, and General Counsel at AI Fund. Oversees finance, legal, HR, investor relations and fund operations. Former partner in the corporate practice at Fenwick & West, with a JD from New York University and a BA in economics and statistics from the University of Western Ontario.
interests: Corporate securities and legal support for technology startups
Venture studio company-building / co-founding AI startups
enrichment.career_background: Eva Wang was part of AI Fund’s founding team and serves as Partner, Chief Operating Officer and General Counsel, overseeing the fund’s finance, legal, HR and investor-relations functions. Prior to AI Fund she was a partner at Fenwick & West in Silicon Valley, has led openings of Shanghai offices for U.S. law firms, and holds a JD from New York University and a BA from the University of Western Ontario.
enrichment.investment_focus: Co-founding and building AI-first startups at seed/pre-seed and early stages; focuses across enterprise AI, developer infrastructure/tools, and vertical AI applications.

enrichment.personal_bio: Vice President at Brighton Park Capital focused on growth equity investing in software and tech-enabled companies. Responsible for deal sourcing, due diligence, and portfolio value creation. Joined BPC in August 2021 after working in M&A and restructuring advisory at Moelis & Company. Graduated from Yeshiva University (Sy Syms School of Business) with a BS in Business & Management (Finance).
enrichment.career_background: Worked at Moelis & Company in Mergers & Acquisitions and Restructuring Advisory prior to joining Brighton Park Capital in August 2021. At BPC he focuses on sourcing and diligence for growth-stage software and tech-enabled services investments and supports portfolio companies on value-creation initiatives. Educated at Yeshiva University (Sy Syms School of Business).
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth equity in software, information services and tech-enabled services; focus areas include vertical software, GRC, financial technology, the Israeli tech ecosystem, and growth buyouts.

enrichment.personal_bio: President of Night (Night Media) and General Partner at Night Ventures. Co-founder of Creative Juice. Veteran of the creator economy — founding CEO of Maker Studios and former president of Fullscreen and Rooster Teeth.
interests: Creator-driven consumer startups and acquisition strategies
enrichment.career_background: Ezra Cooperstein is President of Night (Night Media) and a General Partner at Night Ventures. He co-founded Creative Juice and previously served as founding CEO of Maker Studios and as President of Fullscreen and Rooster Teeth. Cooperstein has worked on early branded-content initiatives (Current TV, Initiative) and holds a B.A. from the University of California, Los Angeles.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage consumer startups (creator-driven customer acquisition); fintech; SaaS; crypto; health; commerce; media

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture partner / advisor associated with Lever VC and co‑founder & managing partner at Lifely VC. Focuses on alternative proteins, materials, and sustainable food systems. Formerly held research and corporate engagement roles at The Good Food Institute.
enrichment.career_background: Has worked in early‑stage investing and advisory roles (Lever VC, Lifely VC, Capital for Climate) and previously coordinated innovation and research at The Good Food Institute. Education includes a Bachelor of Technology from the Federal University of Technology – Paraná and coursework at the University of Toronto.
enrichment.investment_focus: Alternative proteins, Food & AgTech; early‑stage investments (seed, Series A)

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and operator focused on fintech and AI. Former Head of Fintech for SoftBank’s Latin America Fund; previously worked in investment banking and as a software engineer. Now builds AI workflows and startups at the intersection of finance and generative AI.
enrichment.career_background: Held Head of Fintech role at SoftBank Latin America Fund (worked on deploy­ment of capital into fintech/technology in LatAm). Earlier roles include investment banking at Goldman Sachs and Bank of America (Latin America coverage) and software engineering at Facebook; founder of a consumer fintech and a venture studio. Currently focused on AI products and automation for finance professionals.
enrichment.investment_focus: FinTech; Generative AI; Consumer Internet; SaaS; Crypto/Web3

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and former CEO of Set Protocol / Set Labs; active angel/investor listed with Turing Capital. Background spans crypto product and protocol work and prior engineering/operations roles. Educated at UC Berkeley (B.S.).
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and CEO of Set Protocol / Set Labs (focused on tokenized/strategy‑enabled crypto assets). Prior roles include software engineering at Radius and finance & operations at 21.co; currently active as an angel investor (associated with Turing Capital) and public writer on crypto topics.
enrichment.investment_focus: Web3 / Crypto, DeFi, tokenized asset management; early‑stage (seed / pre‑seed) investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Fernando Donayre is the founder and Managing Partner of INCA Ventures and a native Peruvian with 30+ years investing experience in Latin America. He founded INCA Investments (2004) and launched INCA Ventures in 2018 to back early-stage fintech founders in the Andean region. He is active across Peru, Colombia and neighboring markets.
enrichment.career_background: Founder and Managing Principal of INCA Investments (founded 2004) and founder/Managing Partner of INCA Ventures (founded 2018). Long career in Latin American equity and asset management (roles at Globalvest, Zephyr, etc.); credentials listed publicly include CFA and CPA and an MBA (University of Florida). He focuses on deploying catalytic capital and networks to fintech and related early-stage companies in the Andean region.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage fintech and financial inclusion in Peru and the Andean region (seed to pre-Series A); sectors include payments, lending, digital banking and insurtech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Austin-based growth and marketing executive and early-stage investor at Bridge Latam. Former CMO at Favor and Rev, and co‑founder/CEO of Luv.it; earlier roles include Director of Growth at eBay and product marketing at Microsoft. Holds an MBA from Duke University and an Industrial Engineering degree from Tecnológico de Monterrey.
enrichment.career_background: Over 20 years in marketing and product growth across consumer and technology companies. Worked in regional expansion and growth at eBay, held product marketing roles at Microsoft, led consumer brands at Johnson & Johnson and Red Bull, founded and led Luv.it (fashion marketplace), and served as CMO at Favor before moving into advisory and investor roles (including Bridge Latam). Active as an advisor and mentor to startups while serving operational marketing roles at later-stage companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage Latin America technology startups (seed/pre‑seed); emphasis on e‑commerce & marketplaces, fintech/payments, SaaS and consumer internet.

enrichment.personal_bio: Executive Vice President in Bain Capital’s North America Private Equity Portfolio Group. Joined Bain in 2021; prior roles include Vice President of Customer Care at IPSY and consultant at McKinsey & Company and Deloitte. Holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and a BA in mechanical engineering and materials science from Harvard College.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Bain Capital in 2021 and serves as an Executive Vice President in the Portfolio Group on the North America Private Equity team. Previously was Vice President of Customer Care at IPSY and earlier worked as a consultant at McKinsey & Company and Deloitte. Education includes an MBA from Harvard Business School and a BA in mechanical engineering and materials science from Harvard College.
enrichment.investment_focus: North America private equity; portfolio value-creation and operations; primary sector focus on consumer and industrials.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director at Omega Funds (promoted 2024). Focuses on early-stage life‑sciences investing, co‑leads fundraising, and participates on portfolio boards and direct secondary transactions. CFA, CAIA, Certified FRM; BBA (Isenberg School of Management, UMass Amherst).
enrichment.career_background: Began at Omega Funds as an Analyst (2008–2012), worked on investment teams at Commonfund Capital and Brookside Mezzanine Partners, rejoined Omega in 2016 in senior investing roles and was promoted to Managing Director in 2024. Serves on multiple portfolio boards and has held CFO responsibilities for Omega Alpha SPAC. Holds CFA, CAIA and FRM designations and a BBA from UMass Amherst (cum laude).
enrichment.investment_focus: Life‑sciences venture investing (early‑stage through clinical/commercial), therapeutics and medical technologies (oncology, immunology, rare diseases, precision medicine); company formation, direct secondaries; primary focus U.S. and Europe.

enrichment.personal_bio: Freda Lewis-Hall, M.D., is a Venture Partner at Catalio Capital and a physician-leader with four decades of experience in medicine and the biopharmaceutical industry. A trained psychiatrist, she served as Chief Medical Officer and later Chief Patient Officer at Pfizer and has held senior roles at Vertex, Bristol-Myers Squibb and Eli Lilly. She serves on multiple corporate and nonprofit boards and advocates for patient engagement and health equity.
enrichment.career_background: Trained at Johns Hopkins University (BA) and Howard University College of Medicine (MD), Lewis-Hall began in clinical psychiatry and academia (Howard University) before moving into industry leadership. She has held senior R&D and medical affairs roles at Eli Lilly, Pharmacia, Bristol-Myers Squibb and Vertex, served as Chief Medical Officer and Chief Patient Officer at Pfizer, and currently holds board and advisory positions across biopharma, diagnostics and health organizations while serving as a Venture Partner at Catalio.
enrichment.investment_focus: Biotechnology and life-sciences (therapeutics, diagnostics, devices and tools); stage-agnostic investing across seed to growth, plus related public-equity and credit strategies in healthcare.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and writer with technical training in aerospace engineering. Served as a Pre‑MBA Associate Intern at UP.Partners (2021–2022) and has worked in product and engineering roles at Boeing and Pavemint. MBA candidate at Harvard Business School and founder of the Founder to Founder newsletter.
enrichment.career_background: Frederick Daso holds a B.S. and M.S. in Aerospace Engineering from MIT and is an MBA candidate at Harvard Business School (class of 2025). He worked in Boeing’s Engineering Career Foundation Program, was a product manager at Pavemint, contributed to Forbes as a writer, founded the Founder to Founder newsletter, and served as a Pre‑MBA Associate Intern at UP.Partners where he supported diligence on mobility and logistics investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage investments in mobility and transportation technologies (air, land, sea, space), logistics and last‑mile delivery, autonomy and sensing hardware, and adjacent energy/manufacturing systems.

enrichment.personal_bio: Gabriela “Gaby” Isturiz is a serial entrepreneur and investor who co‑founded two legal‑tech/SaaS companies that were acquired by Fortune 500 buyers. She is a General Partner at The Fund XX (part of Everywhere Ventures), focused on pre‑seed and seed investing in women‑led startups. Gaby runs BUILD LEGAL TECH and advises founders on scaling, GTM, and product‑market fit.
enrichment.career_background: Gaby earned an MS in Information Sciences from the University of Pittsburgh and a BS in Computer Systems Engineering from Universidad Metropolitana (Caracas). She co‑founded eBillingHub (acquired by Thomson Reuters) and Bellefield Systems/iTimekeep (acquired by Aderant/Roper Technologies), has served as an advisor and board member (e.g., Ascender, Oddr), and joined The Fund XX as a General Partner in 2021 to back early‑stage women founders.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed-stage investments; women‑led startups; legal tech and enterprise SaaS; early-stage product/market and GTM support

enrichment.personal_bio: Director, Business Development at Lead Edge Capital based in New York. Focused on managing relationships with the firm’s limited partners to drive synergies between the Lead Edge network and portfolio companies. Joined Lead Edge in 2021 after working as an analyst at Volition Capital. Holds a B.B.A. in Finance and Entrepreneurship from the University of Michigan�'s Ross School of Business.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Lead Edge in 2021 and serves as Director of Business Development in the firm�'s New York office, responsible for LP relationships and business-development initiatives across the portfolio. Prior to Lead Edge, he worked as an analyst at Volition Capital, sourcing and evaluating opportunities in the software sector. He graduated with a B.B.A. in Finance and Entrepreneurship (with honors) from the University of Michigan's Stephen M. Ross School of Business.
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth equity in software, internet, consumer, and tech-enabled services (growth-stage; minority and buyout investments; LP-network-driven value creation).

enrichment.personal_bio: Garry Cooper Jr., Ph.D., is co‑founder and CEO of Rheaply and a founding General Partner at LongJump, a Chicago‑based pre‑seed fund. He is a climate‑tech and circular‑economy entrepreneur with an academic background in neuroscience and experience in supply‑chain consulting.
interests: circular economy / reuse and resource recovery
founder support & diversity in early‑stage investing
enrichment.career_background: Dr. Cooper co‑founded Rheaply (enterprise asset‑management for reuse) and serves as its CEO and board chair. He is a founding GP at LongJump, has been an adjunct assistant professor at Northwestern University, and earlier worked on supply‑chain and performance improvement at Ernst & Young. He holds a Ph.D. in neuroscience from Northwestern and undergraduate degrees from Indiana University, and he holds a U.S. patent from his academic research.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed / seed, first‑check founder‑led investments; industry‑agnostic with an intentional focus on underrepresented founders and startups outside traditional coastal hubs.

enrichment.personal_bio: Early-stage investor and former Vice President at PJC with a background in product and growth at Google. Holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and has worked on investments and sourcing across consumer, enterprise, and AI sectors. More recently affiliated with firms focused on immersive/web3 and AI investing.
enrichment.career_background: Gaurav Bhogale is an investor with prior product leadership at Google (mobile apps and growth) and venture roles including Vice President at PJC. He earned an MBA from Harvard Business School and has worked at sector-focused VC firms (including Galaxy Interactive and, per his public posts, later Mantis VC). His experience spans sourcing, product-led growth, and early-stage investing across AI, consumer, and enterprise verticals.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Pre-seed / Seed / Series A) — consumer, enterprise/SaaS, AI & infrastructure

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Advaita Capital, a Boston-based growth VC focused on deep tech and decarbonization. Former Federal Reserve Bank manager and technology/finance professional (HP, IBM, Goldman Sachs); founder of the She‑VC podcast. Based primarily in Massachusetts.
enrichment.career_background: Gayatri Sarkar founded Advaita Capital (2021) and serves as its CEO. She began her career as a database architect and later worked at Hewlett Packard, IBM and Goldman Sachs, and served as a manager at the Federal Reserve Bank overseeing US Treasury-related projects for military/navy accounts. She founded the She‑VC podcast, launched startups at the Harvard i‑lab while a student, and served on the Harvard Kennedy School New England Alumni Association board; she holds a Physics honors degree from University of Calcutta and completed graduate study at Harvard.
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth-stage (Series C/D+) deep tech and decarbonization; generative AI, semiconductors/chips, robotics, energy-storage and related infrastructure.

enrichment.personal_bio: Senior Managing Director and Chief Architect at TIAA and advisor to GTM Capital. Enterprise architect with 25+ years of experience across SaaS, data, cloud and regulated industries; advises startups and CIO/CTO communities on architecture, data strategy, and AI adoption.
enrichment.career_background: Geeta Pyne is a senior enterprise architect and technology leader who currently serves as Senior Managing Director & Chief Architect at TIAA. Her prior roles include senior architecture and engineering leadership at Intuit, Zuora, Veritas, VMware, BMC and Arrow Electronics; she began her career as a research scientist working on satellite image processing and India’s PARAM parallel computer. She is a founding member of Women in Architecture, involved with Evanta/Gartner CIO communities, and serves as an advisor to GTM Capital and several startups (e.g., Mirvie).
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise IT startups — security, GenAI/AI, networking & architecture, cloud & infrastructure, DevOps, and SaaS; typically seed to Series A / post-product, post-revenue stages.

enrichment.personal_bio: Technology executive and angel investor with 20+ years building engineering teams and consumer/enterprise products. Has held senior engineering roles at Yahoo!, AT&T Interactive/YellowPages, Chegg, Oversee.net and led engineering at P.volve and FloSports. Founder of CTO Slackers, mentor at Mucker Capital, board member of Innovate Pasadena, and a Limited Partner investor with Hyphen Capital. Born in Taiwan, grew up in California and holds a B.S. in Biochemistry from UCLA.
enrichment.career_background: Started as a software engineer and rose through engineering leadership at major internet companies (Overture/Yahoo, AT&T Interactive/YellowPages, Chegg, Oversee.net). Served as CTO/SVP of engineering at consumer and fitness tech firms (P.volve, Beachbody/Openfit, FloSports), runs the CTO Slackers community, and advises/angel-invests in early-stage startups; also serves as an LP at Hyphen Capital.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early- and growth-stage technology companies led by AAPI founders (consumer, enterprise, marketplaces)

enrichment.personal_bio: Author of Crossing the Chasm and several other books on technology markets. Venture Partner at Mohr Davidow Ventures who advises the firm’s portfolio companies; founder of The Chasm Group and managing director of Geoffrey Moore Consulting. Known for work on market development, technology adoption and go-to-market strategy for disruptive technologies.
enrichment.career_background: Geoffrey A. Moore holds a BA from Stanford and a PhD in English literature from the University of Washington. He began as an English professor, moved into sales and marketing roles in software companies, was a partner at Regis McKenna, founded The Chasm Group and TCG Advisors, and now runs Geoffrey Moore Consulting while serving as a Venture Partner at Mohr Davidow Ventures and Wildcat Venture Partners. He has advised and served on boards of multiple technology firms.
enrichment.investment_focus: Advising and investing in early-stage technology companies with emphasis on market development, go-to-market strategy, enterprise/software and disruptive technologies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Technologist and entrepreneur based in San Diego. Founder of BL3NDlabs and co‑founder/CTO of HOTELbeat; serves as a Venture Partner at Greatscale Ventures and has held CTO/CDO roles at several startups (EV AI, GoFor Delivers, etc.). Focuses on building scalable product and technology strategy for early‑stage companies.
enrichment.career_background: Over 20 years in technology and startups. Founded BL3NDlabs (2015) and previously founded/ran GJE Consulting; co‑founded HOTELbeat (CTO). Held senior technology roles at Agentology, Benefyts, MiaMia Beauty, GoFor Delivers and EV AI. Joined Greatscale Ventures as a Venture Partner in 2021; studied Computer Information Systems at San Diego State University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed–Series A) technology investments in FinTech, health & wellness, lodging/hospitality, climate/cleantech and gig‑economy / workforce platforms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and former CEO of Tutor.com (acquired by IAC in 2013). Venture Partner at Peak State Ventures and advisor/investor to multiple education and health-focused startups. Serves on boards and trustee roles (e.g., Teachers College, The Wild Center) and is President of Teach to One / New Classrooms.
enrichment.career_background: George Cigale founded Tutor.com (served as CEO until its 2013 acquisition by IAC) and has since worked as an investor, board director, and advisor across education, learning-technology, and health ventures. He is a Venture Partner at Peak State Ventures, has held leadership roles at Littera and New Classrooms (Teach to One), and serves on trusteeships and advisory councils including Teachers College, Columbia University and The Wild Center. He holds a BA from the State University of New York at Binghamton.
enrichment.investment_focus:
EdTech and learning technology; Future of Work / workforce tech; PropTech; Digital health (early-stage, Seed

nd Series A)

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal on the investment team at Optum Ventures based in Boston, focused on digital health and healthcare technology. Serves as a board observer for multiple Optum Ventures portfolio companies. Prior to Optum Ventures he worked in investment banking and middle‑market private equity and holds a B.A. in Economics from Tufts University, where he played four years of college hockey.
interests: Enterprise healthcare software and clinical workflow tools
enrichment.career_background: Began his career in private equity and investment banking (Capital Resource Partners; Covington Associates). Joined Optum Ventures in 2018 and has served in investment roles (associate → vice president → principal/partner), leading U.S. investments and acting as board observer for several portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Stage‑agnostic investments at the intersection of technology and healthcare (digital health, value‑based care delivery, enterprise healthcare software, enabling infrastructure and healthcare fintech).

enrichment.personal_bio: Chemical engineer (Ph.D., MIT) and former Senior Associate on MPM Capital's investment team. Co‑founder of Crossbow Therapeutics and serves as its Vice President, Head of Corporate Development & Operations. Background includes postdoctoral research at Harvard Medical School/The Broad and roles at The Engine.
enrichment.career_background: Geraldine Paulus trained in chemical engineering (M.S., KU Leuven; Ph.D., MIT), completed postdoctoral research at Harvard Medical School and The Broad Institute, then transitioned into venture creation and investing. She worked on research and analytics and venture diligence at The Engine and served as a Senior Associate on MPM Capital's investment team; while at MPM she co‑founded Crossbow Therapeutics and later joined Crossbow in corporate development and operations.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Interlock Capital and co‑founder & CEO of Origin 63 (a HubSpot services firm). Based in San Diego, CA, with a background founding 41 Orange and prior service in the U.S. Coast Guard. Active in early‑stage/angel investing and founder mentorship.
enrichment.career_background: Gregg Anderson is a Venture Partner at Interlock Capital and co‑founder & CEO of Origin 63, a HubSpot-focused services firm. He previously founded 41 Orange and has served in the U.S. Coast Guard; he is based in the San Diego area and is involved in early‑stage investing and advising founders.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed & seed) investments across SaaS, martech/CRM, consumer & enterprise internet, healthtech and fintech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Parkway VC. Serial entrepreneur and investor active in deep‑tech and real‑estate; co‑founder of H&S Capital and CEO of Hill Gray Seven. USC economics graduate and former top junior/college tennis recruit.
enrichment.career_background: Gregg Hill is co‑founder and General Partner of Parkway VC, a New York‑based venture firm focused on deep tech. Before Parkway he co‑founded H&S Capital and built Hill Gray Seven (HG7), a real‑estate development and investment company; he was an early, active investor in Frustum and has led or served on boards for multiple portfolio companies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner and Chief Data Officer at 10X Capital with a background in credit analytics, product and data. Co‑founder and former CEO of TheNumber; previously led product & data analytics at Opera Solutions (ElectrifAi) and held roles at DBRS, SecondMarket and Fannie Mae. Educated at Johns Hopkins (BA) and the University of Oxford (MBA).
enrichment.career_background: Over two decades in finance and technology: co‑founder & CEO of TheNumber (credit market analytics); global head of product & data analytics at Opera Solutions (now ElectrifAi); VP, US Structured Finance at DBRS; analyst roles at SecondMarket and credit policy work at Fannie Mae. Joined 10X Capital in a leadership role (investment committee/credit oversight) and serves as Partner/Chief Data Officer and CFO for certain 10X SPAC vehicles.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Hyphen Capital based in San Francisco. Previously held customer success and operations leadership roles at Canary Technologies and TINT and hosted The Autonomous Vehicles Podcast. Wharton MBA candidate (Class of 2025).
enrichment.career_background: Worked as an adaptive systems engineer early in his career, moved into customer success and operations (TINT → Sourceress → Canary Technologies), founded/hosted The Autonomous Vehicles Podcast, and serves as a partner at Hyphen Capital; listed as a Wharton MBA candidate (Class of 2025).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and multi-stage startups (seed to growth) with emphasis on companies led by AAPI founders; sector focus includes enterprise software/SaaS, adtech/social, and infrastructure for enterprises.

enrichment.personal_bio: Senior Associate at Type One Ventures focused on sourcing and diligence for early-stage deep‑tech and space investments. Graduated from the University of Southern California with a Bachelor in Business Administration (summa cum laude). Describes himself as passionate about frontier technologies and lifelong learning; personally interested in music.
enrichment.career_background: Senior Associate at Type One Ventures (investment sourcing, diligence, and research for space and deep‑tech deals). USC undergraduate (Business Administration, summa cum laude). Entered VC after multiple internships across industries and focuses on early‑stage companies that may disrupt large sectors.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage investments in space technologies, robotics, artificial intelligence & automation, future mobility, nanotechnology, and human longevity.

enrichment.personal_bio: Director of Life Science Investments & Data Science at Thiel Capital, based in the Los Angeles/West Hollywood area. Serves on the board of Peptilogics and works on biotech/drug‑discovery investments that use data science. Background includes research and data‑science roles tied to UC San Diego and neurotech companies.

enrichment.career_background: Hannes Holste is Director, Life Science Investments & Data Science at Thiel Capital. enrichment.personal_bio: Senior Associate at Lead Edge Capital based in the firm’s London office. Focuses on sourcing and evaluating investments in software, internet and technology-enabled services. enrichment.career_background: Senior Associate on Lead Edge’s investment team (joined 2020), based in London and focused on sourcing and evaluating growth-stage investments in software, internet and tech-enabled services. Hines, Jr. Professor of Medicine at Yale School of Medicine and Director of the Yale New Haven Hospital Center for Outcomes Research and Evaluation. He is a cardiologist and outcomes researcher, co‑founder of Hugo Health and Refactor Health and co‑founder of medRxiv, and serves as a Venture Partner at F‑Prime Capital Partners. He is Editor‑in‑Chief of the Journal of the American College of Cardiology (JACC).

Real‑world data, AI and healthcare analytics

Founded the Yale New Haven Hospital Center for Outcomes Research and Evaluation, co‑founded Hugo Health and Refactor Health, co‑founded medRxiv, has advised multiple health technology companies, and serves as a Venture Partner at F‑Prime Capital Partners.

enrichment.personal_bio: Vice President on WestRiver Group's investment team. Joined the firm in 2017 and supports portfolio management, underwriting and process management. Holds a B.A. in Economics from Western Washington University (2017).
enrichment.career_background: Joined WestRiver Group in 2017 and serves as a Vice President on the investment team, supporting portfolio management, underwriting and internal process management. enrichment.career_background: Background spans investment banking and strategy consulting, co‑founding Expertera (expert marketplace), and senior sales leadership at Salesforce. Education includes an MBA (NYU Stern) and a BA (Emory). Active as an angel/VC investor per public investor databases.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and fund partner at Winning Together Fund; co-founder of Onova and Inoki Bathhouse. MBA (Willamette University) with prior training in venture finance and experience at multiple VC and angel funds. Expanding founder access and economic equity for BIPOC & rural communities
Fund management, diligence, and investor education

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Vol. 1 Ventures and founder of Fintech Today. Former finance reporter (Quartz and others) and product manager at Acorns and Tasting Room/Lot18. Active in early‑stage fintech and crypto investing and involved with AI/compliance startups.
enrichment.career_background: Ian Kar began as a finance reporter covering fintech and crypto, then moved into product roles (notably at Acorns and Tasting Room). He also founded WorldQuant University and WorldQuant Predictive, and is the author of books on quantitative investing and prediction. enrichment.career_background: Tulchinsky began as a scientist at AT&T Bell Laboratories and worked as a trading strategist (Timber Hill) before spending 12 years as a statistical-arbitrage portfolio manager at Millennium Management. enrichment.career_background: Leads Closed Loop’s Private Equity team on deal origination, execution, due diligence, value creation, portfolio management and realizations. Morgan’s Financial Sponsors Group; participates in industry leadership (e‑Stewards) and board roles for portfolio companies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Index Ventures vice‑president who leads the firm’s global network of executives and entrepreneurs. Joined Index in 2015 after roles in Goldman Sachs’ technology investment banking and engineering/strategy teams. Holds a B.A. in Public Policy from Vanderbilt University.

enrichment.personal_bio: Licensed marriage & family therapist (LMFT) and writer based in Bakersfield, California. Listed in investor databases as a founding member / investor at Sweater Ventures.
enrichment.career_background: Jacob Kountz is a clinical therapist (LMFT) practicing in Bakersfield, CA with an active NPI and several published articles on mental health. enrichment.personal_bio: Serial entrepreneur turned VC investor based in the San Francisco Bay Area. enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Figment Capital, an early-stage fund focused on Web3 infrastructure. He invests in seed and pre-seed blockchain projects and works closely with protocol teams. Parillo previously worked in tax and asset-management advisory for financial services firms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner / General Partner active in early-stage consumer investing. enrichment.career_background: Private equity investor with experience at McCarthy Capital (Associate, 2021–2023), Endeavour (Senior Associate, 2023–2024) and Gallant Capital (Vice President, current). enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and CEO of Electives (enterprise live‑learning platform). enrichment.career_background: Partner at Bridge Investments (joined 2013). enrichment.career_background: Joined Western Technology Investment in 1999 and served as an investment partner focusing on debt and equity financings for private technology and life‑science companies (active through 2022). enrichment.personal_bio: Jenny Lane is an investor and operator active in the Columbus, Ohio venture ecosystem. Springhorn, PhD is a life‑science executive and company builder; he is CEO of Nido Biosciences and has held senior business roles at Syros Pharmaceuticals and Alexion. enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner and Chief Strategy Officer at Closed Loop Partners and head of Closed Loop Builders.
