She entered crypto investing in 2017, joined Youbi Capital full‑time around 2018, and serves as Managing Partner at Youbi while acting as a global investment advisor/venture partner to HashKey Capital. Her background includes work in the auto industry and roles focused on deal sourcing, fundraising and partnerships for blockchain startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage digital asset and web3 investments (blockchain protocols, infrastructure, DeFi, gaming/NFTs)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner at Kupanda Capital; serves as in-house counsel for Kupanda and its portfolio companies. Former Investment Officer in the African Development Bank’s Private Sector/Legal teams. Holds a JD from William & Mary and a BComm from the University of Manitoba; admitted to the New York bar.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and Founding Partner of Kupanda Capital (since 2012), where she helps incubate and scale pan‑African companies and provides legal counsel to portfolio firms. Prior roles include Investment Officer at the African Development Bank and corporate counsel at a boutique firm; serves on boards and as an advisor to several portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pan‑African early‑stage companies (pre‑seed to Series A); impact and mission‑driven businesses; energy/clean‑energy finance; data‑driven consumer and geospatial solutions; media/creative industries

enrichment.personal_bio: Biotechnology investor at Commodore Capital focused on identifying and evaluating therapeutic development opportunities. Previously worked on the Investments team at Roivant Sciences and as a management consultant at Bain & Company. Holds an AB in Molecular and Cellular Biology from Harvard University (Harvard College Scholar).
enrichment.career_background: Lisa Schechner is a biotechnology investor at Commodore Capital. At Roivant Sciences she worked on the Investments team evaluating, licensing, and acquiring therapeutic candidates; before that she was a management consultant at Bain & Company. She earned an A.B. in Molecular and Cellular Biology from Harvard University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Biopharmaceuticals and biotechnology (therapeutics/drug development); genetic & cellular therapies; small‑cap public and late‑stage private biopharma investing.

enrichment.personal_bio: Lisha Bell is a venture investor and co-founder of BLXVC, an angel syndicate that backs Black and Latinx women founders. She leads PayPal Ventures’ Economic Opportunity Fund and hosts the Sisters with Ventures podcast. Her background is in product and payments, including roles at Venmo/Braintree, Wells Fargo, Kohl’s, and Feedzai.
interests: Investing in Black & Latinx women founders
enrichment.career_background: Co-founder and CEO of BLXVC (angel syndicate); Manager/Head of the Economic Opportunity Fund at PayPal Ventures (manages PayPal’s $100M program for diverse emerging fund managers). Former product roles focused on payments and financial inclusion at Venmo/Braintree, Wells Fargo, Kohl’s, and Feedzai; prior deal-flow lead at Pipeline Angels and board chair at Black Girl Ventures.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments in consumer, fintech, digital health and beauty brands — specifically Black, Latinx, Indigenous and women-of-color founders seeking financial inclusion and family-focused solutions.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor at Bloomberg Beta (since 2022) focused on pre-seed/seed startups in the future of work. Former product manager at AppNexus/Xandr and MongoDB. NYU Stern undergraduate and active in NYU tech alumni community.
interests: Enterprise HR/people ops and learning & development
enrichment.career_background: Lori Berenberg earned a B.S. from NYU Stern and worked in product and technical roles at AppNexus (later Xandr) and MongoDB before joining Bloomberg Beta in 2022 as an investor. At Bloomberg Beta she focuses on early-stage investments (pre-seed/seed) in companies reshaping how work gets done.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed / seed) startups in the future of work, enterprise productivity/HR software, and applied machine intelligence

enrichment.personal_bio: Senior Vice President & General Manager (Commerce) at Toast and Managing Partner at Perkins Cove Partners. Product and go-to-market leader with prior GM/VP Product roles at HubSpot and product/commercial roles at LogMeIn and Localytics. Regular guest lecturer on product management at Harvard Business School and an active startup investor and advisor.
enrichment.career_background: 20+ years building and scaling product-led SaaS businesses: led HubSpot’s CRM/Sales/Commerce product lines as GM/VP Product, held product and commercial leadership roles at LogMeIn and Localytics, and currently leads Toast’s Restaurant & Commerce products while investing and advising early-stage companies through Perkins Cove Partners.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / early-stage B2B SaaS and commerce-adjacent startups; emphasis on product, go-to-market, and founder partnerships

enrichment.personal_bio: Luciana Borio, M.D., is a Venture Partner at ARCH Venture Partners advising on biologics manufacturing, clinical trials, novel therapies and other life‑science opportunities. She is a physician and public‑health specialist with extensive government and advisory experience in biodefense and emerging infectious diseases. She is an adjunct assistant professor at Johns Hopkins and a senior fellow for global health at the Council on Foreign Relations.
enrichment.career_background: Dr. Borio trained in medicine (M.D., George Washington University) and completed residency/fellowships at New York‑Presbyterian/Weill Cornell, Johns Hopkins and the NIH. She served in senior roles at the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (including Acting Chief Scientist and Assistant Commissioner for Counterterrorism Policy), was Director for Medical and Biodefense Preparedness at the National Security Council (2017–2019), and was a senior vice president at In‑Q‑Tel before joining ARCH. She continues part‑time clinical work and holds advisory and board roles in industry and non‑profits.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage life sciences (biotechnology/therapeutics), biologics manufacturing, clinical development and novel therapeutic platforms

enrichment.personal_bio: Lyle Berkowitz, MD, is a physician, informaticist and digital-health entrepreneur based in Chicago. He is founder & CEO of KeyCare and serves as a partner/general partner at 2Flo Ventures; he has founded and advised multiple health‑tech companies and holds academic and board roles in health IT and telehealth.
enrichment.career_background: MD-trained primary care physician and clinical informaticist. Longtime innovation leader at Northwestern Medicine; founder and chairman of Healthfinch (acquired); former Chief Medical Officer & EVP of Product at MDLIVE; founder & CEO of KeyCare; associate clinical professor at Northwestern Feinberg; partner/general partner at 2Flo Ventures and board member/advisor to multiple health‑tech companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage healthcare and life sciences (seed & Series A); digital health, virtual care, biotech and devices with emphasis on solutions addressing health disparities and system integration.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner & Chief Venture Builder at Factor[e] Ventures who leads the Delta40 Venture Studio. Former CEO of Fenix International, with two decades building and scaling clean-energy and climate-focused ventures across Africa. Serves on boards of several portfolio companies and focuses on venture building, post-investment operations, and climate-inclusive businesses.
enrichment.career_background: Lyndsay Holley Handler has ~20+ years building and operating climate and impact ventures in Africa. She was CEO of Fenix International (through its exit to ENGIE), then joined Factor[e] as Partner & Chief Venture Builder to lead the Delta40 Venture Studio and provide post-investment support. She holds board and advisor roles at several portfolio companies and has a BA from Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed) climate and impact ventures: energy access, mobility/e-mobility, sustainable agriculture (agritech), climate fintech; emphasis on Africa and other emerging markets; hands-on venture building and post-investment operational support.

enrichment.personal_bio: Technology executive and angel investor based in Austin, Texas. Vice‑President, Sustainability and Emerging Tech GTM at Tata Consultancy Services; co‑founder of BoardSeatMeet and Strides AI, and an advisory board member at GTM Capital. Focuses on AI/ML, sustainability, diversity and go‑to‑market strategy.
enrichment.career_background: Over three decades in technology with senior roles at Nortel and Tata Consultancy Services spanning product engineering, sales, business development and GTM. Co-founder of startups (Strides AI, BoardSeatMeet), advisor and board member for multiple early‑stage companies; holds an M.Sc. in Computer Science and an MBA (Telfer School of Management).
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise IT: security, GenAI, networking & architecture, cloud & infrastructure, DevOps and SaaS (seed/post-product/post-revenue to Series A)

enrichment.personal_bio: Vice President on CapitalG’s investment team focused on growth-stage enterprise software and AI/ML companies. Joined CapitalG in 2021 after roles in product marketing & operations at Tecton and consulting at Bain & Company. Graduated magna cum laude from Dartmouth College with a dual degree in Computer Science and Economics; originally from Albany, New York.
enrichment.career_background: Joined CapitalG in 2021 and works on investments in AI/ML, infrastructure and horizontal application software; promoted to Vice President in 2024. Previously worked in product marketing and operations at Tecton and as a consultant at Bain & Company. Holds an AB in Computer Science and Economics from Dartmouth College.
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth-stage investments in AI & machine learning, enterprise (B2B) application software, infrastructure/developer tools and open-source platforms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and (co-)Managing Director of Black Founders Matter, a Portland-based seed-stage fund focused on Black founders. Former founder of Werkhorse and an early participant in Portland startup programs (Techstars Startup Weekend, PIE). Prior to entrepreneurship he spent time in ministry and later worked with Rogue Venture Partners. Based in Portland, OR.
interests: Early-stage venture deals (pre-seed to Series A)
enrichment.career_background: Marceau Michel began his career in ministry, then founded Werkhorse (winning Techstars Startup Weekend and other local competitions). He served as an Entrepreneur in Residence at a Jaguar Land Rover incubator, participated in the Portland Incubator Experiment (PIE), worked with Rogue Venture Partners, and launched the Black Founders Matter brand which evolved into a venture fund and syndication vehicle.
enrichment.hometown: New York City, NY, United States
enrichment.investment_focus: Black-led, U.S.-headquartered startups; pre-seed to Series A; industry-agnostic with typical checks in the ~$50k–$150k range; follow-on reserve for portfolio companies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Portfolio manager at Luxor Group (Luxor Investimentos) focused on equities and deployed capital for the firm's investment activities. Previously worked in equity research and macro/economic roles at Opportunity and Gávea; also held a macro research role in New York prior to joining Luxor in 2021. Public profiles list him as part of Luxor's investment team; specific deal-level attributions are not publicly listed.
enrichment.career_background: Worked as an equity analyst at Opportunity Asset Management, served as a senior economist at Gávea Investimentos, held a macro research role in New York (KLS Diversified-related profiles), and joined Luxor Group as a portfolio manager/ investor in 2021.
enrichment.investment_focus: Equities (long-term fundamental), with participation in VC/venture allocations focused on consumer internet and enterprise software across early to Series B stages; geographic focus includes Developed Markets and Latin America.

enrichment.personal_bio: Operator, early-stage builder and former Partner & Head of Growth at Madrona Venture Labs who focuses on product-market fit, growth and go-to-market for studio-backed startups. Previously led marketing and revenue at PicMonkey and Likewise and held product roles at Google, Expedia and Amazon. Later served in startup-facing roles at Amazon Web Services.
enrichment.career_background: Partner and Head of Growth, Madrona Venture Labs (May 2019–Oct 2022), where she helped validate ideas, lead customer discovery and build GTM/playbooks for studio companies. Before MVL she was VP of Marketing at Likewise and Chief Revenue Officer at PicMonkey, and earlier held product/manager roles at Google, Expedia and Amazon. After MVL she moved to startup-facing roles at Amazon Web Services (Head of Startup Programs / Head of Venture Platform). Holds an MBA (UW Foster), an MS (American University) and a BA (Denison).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage / studio co-builds; AI/ML and intelligent applications; enterprise SaaS; product-led growth and GTM strategies; automation and future-of-work tooling

enrichment.personal_bio: Marilyn Waite is a climate finance investor, author and educator with experience across venture, modelling and energy project work. She has served as a Venture Partner / investor affiliated with Aera VC and leads the Climate Finance Fund; previously she led the energy/cleantech practice at Village Capital and was a senior research fellow at Project Drawdown. Waite is the author of Sustainability at Work and serves on multiple climate and clean‑energy boards and advisory groups.
enrichment.career_background: Waite has worked across four continents in renewable and nuclear energy, climate modelling, and investment. Roles include managing the climate and clean energy finance portfolio at the William and Flora Hewlett Foundation (Climate Finance Fund), leading Village Capital’s energy practice, senior research fellow at Project Drawdown, and technical/project roles at AREVA/Orano. She is an author, lecturer and serves on several boards and investment committees.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage climate and deep technology (cleantech, sustainable tech); pre‑seed to Series A; mobilizing private capital for low‑carbon systems.

enrichment.personal_bio: Argentine technologist and investor. Co‑founder of Alaya Capital and co‑founder/president of Vates (software services firm founded 1991). Systems engineer and university professor active in Córdoba’s tech ecosystem.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and long‑time president of Vates S.A. (software development and nearshore services). Co‑founder of Alaya Capital (VC focused on LatAm startups). Has served as a university professor in systems/entrepreneurship and holds roles in local tech organizations and foundations in Córdoba, Argentina.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (Seed / Series A) Latin American technology startups — fintech, SaaS/enterprise software, insurtech, proptech, logistics, agrifood/cleantech, healthtech and edtech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal and Vertical Software/AI lead at OMERS Ventures focused on data-rich verticals such as healthcare and industrial supply chain. Former managing analyst on CB Insights’ healthcare intelligence team with prior equity research and institutional sales experience; holds degrees from Princeton and Johns Hopkins and is a CFA charterholder.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in institutional equity sales at Barclays, followed by equity research at Melius Research and as a managing analyst on CB Insights’ healthcare intelligence team. Joined OMERS Ventures (based in the Bay Area office) to lead vertical software/AI investing; hosts The Green Room founder pitch program. Education: AB in Molecular Biology (Princeton) and MS + MBA (Johns Hopkins).
enrichment.hometown: South Shore of Boston, Massachusetts, USA
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Series A–C) investments in vertical B2B software and AI, with emphasis on healthcare / digital health, life sciences, industrial & supply-chain software; North America-focused.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at FusionX Ventures and long-time senior executive, board member and investor. Has led and chaired companies across energy, healthcare and real estate and has experience in private placements, recaps and M&A. Graduate of Stanford University, the London School of Economics and the University of Washington School of Law. Serves on the Fred Hutch Board of Trustees and is active in philanthropy related to biomedical research.
enrichment.career_background: Mark Fleischauer has served as a senior executive, CEO and chairman of multiple companies and investment vehicles. His roles have included Chairman of JH Kelly Holdings LLC, Executive Chairman at Imperium Renewables and Columbia Pacific Bio-Refinery, Senior Vice President & General Counsel at JH Kelly, and Managing Partner of Walden Ventures; he is a partner at FusionX Ventures and a member of the Fred Hutch Board of Trustees.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed–Series A) investments in hardware+software+cloud (IoT); energy/clean tech; medical/life-sciences and real estate/PropTech; emphasis on companies with recurring revenue models.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Cybernetix Ventures and former VP of Analog Devices’ Industrial Automation, Sensors & IoT division. 25+ years of executive leadership across industrial, healthcare, automotive and consumer technology. Holds a BS in Electrical Engineering from Cornell and an MS in Engineering Management from Tufts. Based in Greater Boston.
enrichment.career_background: Led a $1B+ business unit at Analog Devices, managed multiple acquisitions and strategic investments, and has served as investor, board member and advisor to early‑stage robotics and IoT startups. Co‑founded Cybernetix Ventures to invest in pre‑seed through Series A robotics, automation and industrial AI companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed, seed, Series A) robotics, automation and industrial AI; sectors include advanced manufacturing, logistics/warehousing, construction (AEC), healthcare/medical devices; enabling tech such as cloud for robotics, autonomy, sensors/edge computing and cybersecurity for robotics.

enrichment.personal_bio: Mark Springel, Ph.D., is a Principal at Vida Ventures. He earned a Ph.D. from Harvard Medical School and a B.A. from Williams College. His research background is in neuroscience, developmental biology, and stem cell biology; he also served as a Senior Business Development Fellow at the Harvard Office of Technology Development and co‑founded Activate Bio.
enrichment.career_background: Completed a Ph.D. in Biological and Biomedical Sciences at Harvard Medical School studying neural circuits. Served as a Senior Business Development Fellow at Harvard OTD, co‑founded Activate Bio, and joined Vida Ventures in 2021 (fellow → associate → senior associate → principal). Acts as a board observer for several Vida portfolio companies and focuses on evaluating translational biomedical opportunities.
enrichment.investment_focus: Therapeutics-focused life sciences (biotech, pharmaceuticals, medical devices); early-stage (seed–Series A) venture investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Associate at Lead Edge Capital based in New York. Prior to joining Lead Edge, worked at Pillar (YC S19). Graduated cum laude from Harvard College with a B.A. in History and Literature and served as Vice President of the Harvard Investment Association. citeturn3view0
enrichment.career_background: Marshall is an Associate at Lead Edge Capital; before joining Lead Edge he worked at Pillar (YC S19). He graduated cum laude from Harvard College (B.A., History & Literature) and was VP of the Harvard Investment Association. Based at Lead Edge’s New York office. citeturn3view0
enrichment.investment_focus: Growth equity in software, internet, consumer and tech-enabled services; late-stage/growth investments (typical check sizes in Lead Edge’s stated range). citeturn7search0

enrichment.personal_bio: Martin Hunt is a venture and private equity investor who joined SmartInvest Ventures as a partner/general partner in 2017. He has an MBA from Harvard Business School and a BA from Swarthmore College and has led private-equity and operating roles including founding HWI Search Fund and serving as CEO of Custom Cable Industries. He also leads Swanlaab USA Ventures and has worked in strategy and corporate roles at Prudential, Exelon/Unicom and Bank of America.
enrichment.career_background: Hunt began his career in the Prudential management development program, worked as a research associate for Michael Porter, and held strategy and corporate roles at AMS/CGI, Unicom/Exelon and MBNA/Bank of America. He founded HWI Search Fund/HWI Partners and led the acquisition and operation of Custom Cable Industries, has run Providence Friends Capital, and later joined SmartInvest Ventures as a partner; he is also CEO of Swanlaab USA Ventures and has been active in alumni and startup-acceleration programs.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and growth-stage technology (medtech, IoT, SaaS), startup acceleration and mentorship, and private equity/lower-middle-market transactions
